Tap @ Pllek. Vroeger witbier onder de witbiertjes. Maar er was toen ook weinig te kiezen. Ondanks dat stond het toen al bekend als het perfecte biertje voor een zinderende hete middag op het terras. Met mijn voorkeur een citroentje erin. Speciaal voor deze revieuw is het nu zonder die citroen en houdt het biertje naar decennia nog steeds stand. Geur heel lichte citroen geurtje maar vooral prettig geur van hop. Troebel lichtgeel wit bier precies hoe in mijn beleving witbier er uit moet zien. Schuimt mooi verdwijnt ook niet meteen. Licht zurig met een bittertje maar niet te zoet en smaakt gelukkig niet kunstmatig naar citroenen. Wat je beide tegenwoordig helaas vaak bij frisse zomer biertjes ziet en gewoon averechts werkt. Zou koriander en zelfs sinaasappelschil in zitten. Maar dan zeg ik zeer subtiel en versterkt dan alleen zijn perfecte smaak. Maar als je weet waar je om moet letten proef je zowaar een hint ervan. Kortom naar al die jaren en met alle concurrentie erbij blijft het in al zijn eenvoud gewoon nog steeds top. En maakt zijn naam en faam dan ook nog steeds meer dan waar. En nu die citroen erin dat maakt het voor mij helemaal af :-)

One of the best I ever tried! 
Perfect aroma and taste, perfect appearance...
Belgian magic - coriander and orange peel. Causes happiness in me. Realy.

Aroma: wheat, very spicy ( coriander ). Taste: wheat but not too sticky, coriander and just the right amount of oranges for me. Nothing spectacular in any way: no overabundance of tastes, just a very balanced, refreshing brew.
Butelka. Barwa słomkowa, zamglone. Piana drobna, obfita. Aromat goździkowy, lekko bananowy. W smaku lekko słodkie i kwaskowate, goryczka bardzo niska. Piwo wodniste, średnio nasycone, pijalne.
750ml bottle from Costcutter, Reading. Wheaty, coriander, sweet bready, citrus, orange peel, yeast
33cl bottle. pale yellow color. medium to big white head. orange peal, coriander, hint of citrus, malt, spices. low to med bitterness, medium carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow beer with small white head. Aroma of spices, coriander, wheat, citrus, lemon, light banana. Taste is light sweet, wheat, citrus, slightly tart lemon, coriander. Lemony and spicy finish. Light+ body, average to lively carbonation, thin texture. OK wit, quite crisp, but not enough (I would like more zesty, lemony tartness).

Aroma a Malta y frutas cítricas, color paja, turbio el color, en el retro gusto tiene una pequeños sabores a pan.
Sin duda una cerveza para refrescarse en días calurosos como hoy
Tretinkova flasa. Psenicne pivo s jemnych aroma po klinceku. Take cele vodovejsie, aj farba, aj pena, aj chut, aby neurazilo.
Bottle from SB. Pale, hazy yellow with a medium white head. Fruity and spicy tones. Fruit, spice and malt. Medium body with a fruity / spicy finish.

Aroma is citrusy: lemon, orange peel, coriander. Pours slightly hazy, bright yellow/gold with large head. In flavor intensely citrusy with wheaty backbone and a touch of yeasty & spicy flavors. Spice in the aftertaste. Light body, high carbonation, very drinkable. Crisp, decent.

Bottle. Pours hazy bright yellow with large foamy white head, citrus aroma, high carbonation, sweetish wheat taste with citrus flavor, hint of coriander, thin body, abrupt finish. Refreshing summer beer.
Aroma: dulce, frutas frescas. Aspecto: amarillo brumoso brumoso. Sabor: medio dulce. Paladar: ralladura de limón, trigo. Excelente Belga Blanca. Maravillosa.

Jasne, zamglone z bujną pianą. Aromat kolendry, cytrusów, słodu pszenicznego z lekkim goździkiem. W smaku gładkie, lekkie, delikatnie kwaskowe dzięki cytrusom. Pojawia się lekki banan przez co może przypominać hefeweizena. Poza tym bardzo pijalne, słodkawe, typowo pszeniczne. Niezły witbier
Best Belgian beer I’ve ever had. The spicy aroma is overwhelmingly pleasant.
A decent beer. Was expecting more than what was delivered. Not many choices in the cold beer section of the store!

280417. Bottle from Dan Murphy’s. I first rated this beer back in 2009 at the beginning of my craft beer journey. As part of my 50 beer challenges that I have set myself for 2017 I have deleted my previous rating and re-rated this beer. One of my challenges is to re-rate 10 out of the first 100 beers that I rated. While this beer is considered a classic and rejuvenated the style I found it a little underwhelming. Plenty of clove and banana in the aroma and also in the flavour and finshes with a peppery bite that is nice. I originally rated this beer at 3.5.

Pale orange, gold coudy color. Big fluffy white head. Tart citrus, bready wheat aroma. Flavor is effervescent and invigorating with yeasty, lemony wheat flavor. Spicy hops are subdued. Very refreshing and thirst quenching. Brief sour aftertaste leaves you wanting more.

Hazy golden color with thin white head.
Aroma: wheat, light banana
Taste: light sweet
Fun witbier. One I go back to again and again. Very refreshing. floral, banana, clove, pale, cloudy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, fizzy,
Není to sice úplně ta nejlepší pšenice na světě, rozhodně však je dobře, že tato značka dostává do českých hospod i něco jiného než pouze ležáky. Testováno v lahvové i čepované formě.
From the bottle poured into pint. Pours super hazy with low white head. Nose of wheat, grainy to yeasty. Taste is orange Peel and coriander. Decent carbonation. Finish is spicy to fruity...

Bottle. Pours a hazy straw colour with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon, wheat, coriander, some orange peel, slight pepper, a little clove and subtle spice. Taste of lemon, orange peel, wheat, some coriander, slight pepper, a hint of clove and subtle spice. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry and crisp, spicy bitterness in the finish. A crisp and refreshing witbier with a lot of yeast and spicy flavours. Good.

The recipe for this beer has changed since somewhere around 2016 and it is no longer like it was before, when it was made by a truly independent traditional brewer.
It was my favourite beer, but I have gradually stopped drinking it.

Barwa jasna, piana obfita, drobna. Piwo zamglone. Wysycenie wysokie.
W aromacie kolendra, skórka pomarańczy, nuty fenolowe (goździki) i słód.
W smaku to samo plus octan izoamylu, czyli banan, którego w witku być nie powinno. Piwo jest bardzo smaczne i jedyne do czego można się przyczepić to ten banan. Smakuje trochę tak, jakby do weizena ktoś dodał kolendrę i skórkę pomarańczy.

Swietne piwo! Piękna obfita piana, piękny kolor. Aromat bananów, drożdży, goździków, kolendry, intensywny, wzorcowy. Wysokie wysyczenie, gładkie, aksamitne, dużo ciała. W smaku dalej typowo przeniczne nuty bananowe, fenolowe, przypraw. Jak na 12zł z biedronki to,znakomite.

Butelka, mętne, barwa bardzo jasna, prawie biała, mętne. Piana utrzymuje się dosyć długo, i ładnie zdobi szkło. W aromacie trochę kolendry, trochę pszenicy. W smaku jest bardzo gładkie i zbalansowane, takie "śmietankowe". Delikatnie kwaśne, czuć trochę belgijskie drożdże. Niezłe

Barwa slomkowa, metna, srednie wysycenie, piana biala, puszysta, dosc szybko opada, chwilami probuje sie osadzac na sciankach, zapach pszeniczny, sporo kolendry, typowy dla stylu bialego, smak pszeniczny, kolendra, banan.
I was hoping a bit better from this beer. Recommended by a friend, the spice is not doing it for me.
White gently fizzy beer. Some floral notes but strong carbonation is what shows through most. Good summer beer.

5. 4. 2017, Ico's place, Ljubljana. Bottled. Wheat ale with a sour finishing twist to it. Served a bit to warm, so the taste was a bit blend and not well defined.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice floral fruity spicy smell, hazy body with good head retention.
Nice sweet opening with a refreshing tartness.
Body is medium+ with medium carbonation.
Slightly hazy light yellow with creamy, thin head. Heaps or wheat-y banana on the nose. Lots to taste too, cloves as well and some sour yeast. Very crispy and light. One of my go to wheats.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a white head. The aroma is wheat, coriander and orange zest. Light to medium body with a lively carbonation and a light sweetness. The flavor is balanced and lightly malty with faint citric fruits some coriander and spices in the finish. Overall refreshing.
Bottle, 0.33l. Pale blonde color, lemonade-like. Fizzy. Aroma: sour yeast, orange juice, banana, coriander. Taste is medium sweet and fresh. Banana, coriander, sour yeasts. Very good thirst-quencher.

Aroma: Refreshing floral and citrus notes.
Appearance: Pale golden color with sparkling cloudy liquid and a rocky white head.
Taste: Light/medium and sour notes.
Palate: Medium body with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Abrupt astringent finish.
Overall: Refreshing and fruity. Very soft but nice to have in summer.

Bottle. Aroma- good balance between an orange peel and coriander- neither of those dominates. On the other hand, it could be more intensive. White, cloudy, with a high, thick head and a great lacing. Taste- quite watery, with a low carbonation. Weak citrus notes and subtle coriander. It just feels dull. Witbiers from craft breweries are much more intensive and refreshing. I met a legend and I’m disappointed.

WYGLĄD: piana drobno-pęcherzykowa, szybko opadająca; piwo w kolorze cytrynki; średnio mętne. AROMAT: banany przy otwarciu, minimalna wanilia; po jakimś czasie banan pomieszany z wanilią, jakby lepiej zmieszany z nią jako całość; minimalna przyprawa. SMAK: głównie w smaku wanilia i banan, jednak w tle można wyczuć przyprawy, zwłaszcza przy przełknięciu jako after taste; momentami kwaskowe, jednak dobrze pijalne. Ogólnie ma raczej słodki smak z minimalną goryczką. OGÓLNIE: piwo nawet dobre i dobrze pijalne tylko jednak za bardzo bananowe w stronę Weizena.

Butelka. Kolor s?omkowy, bardzo jasne, lekko opalizuj?ce. Piana bia?a, niewielka, utrzymuje si? ?rednio d?ugo. Aromat delikatny: kolendra, guma balonowa, troch? biszkoptów i cytrusów. W smaku te? bardzo delikatnie, do gamy z aromatu dochodzi jeszcze myd?o. Bardzo wysokie, wr?cz szampa?skie wysycenie sprawia wra?enie, ?e piwo jest g?stsze ni? w rzeczywisto?ci. Goryczki brak. Bardzo orze?wiaj?ce. Ogólnie to pierwszy w ?yciu witbier, który nie odrzuci? mnie od siebie swoj? witbierowo?ci?.

Pours pale yellow colour, hazy, with a thick white head. The aroma is wheat, orange nad yeast (banana and bubble gum). It’s a bit sour, citrusy in the taste, there’s some malt sweetness and coriander too. The biterness is low, spicy. Very smooth and crisp on the palate. I love witbiers as light, refreshing and thirst-quenching beer and Hoegaarden is one of the best and most easily accesible in the style.

Muy limpia visualmente, espuma ultrablanca con néctar amarillo clarito. Buen encaje. Aroma potente a frutales cítricos y levadura. En boca es una cerveza dulce/ácida cn bastante esfervescencia. En líneas generales batante correcta aunque muy artificial.

Bue en pression à la Chelloise avec toute l’équipe pour le départ de Pills et Vivi en Suisse. Blonde, peu de carbo et presque sans bulle. Arôme citron. Final très fraîche, acidulée sur le citron. Bizarre qu’il n’y ait pas de mousse pour une blanche en pression...?
Aroma was awful, smells like sausage. pale, cloudy, frothy, medium body, average carbonation, abrupt finish,
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is wheat, spices and fresh yeast. Taste has wheat, yeast and hint of citrus, maybe orange. Refreshing and nice but a bit basic.

Bu en cours de zythologie .
Verre de 12,5cl.
Couleur : jaune pâle , forcément trouble .
Mousse présente reste bien fini sur un col plutôt simple.
Au nez : épicé et céréales, coriandre et écorce d’orange , froment et blé. 
En bouche : c’est effectivement épicé note de clou de girofle et coriandre, écorce d’orange donnant une amertume toute en longueur .
Corps acceptable et teneur également. 
Tout ce qu’on attend d’un blanche.
Sauf trop de girofle !

Aromat: niezbyt intensywny, biszkoptowy, kolendra, nieco cytrusów, świeży
Wygląd: obfita grubo pęcherzykowa piana, szybko się redukuje do małej obrączki, mocno zmętnione, słomkowo białawe
Smak: trochę biszkoptowy, słodowy, kolendra, cytrusy, trochę mydlin, brak goryczy
Podniebienie: wysoko nasycone, orzeźwiające, trochę szorstkie od wysycenia, średnio pełne, kremowe, przyjemny posmak: kolendrowo - mydlano - cytrusowy

Birra chiara e opalescente. Schiuma bianca, spumosa e persistente. Al naso sentori di agrumi, miele e pane. Al palato note di limone, pesca bianca con una gradevole acidità dovuta ai lieviti. Il corpo è leggero ma ha un qualcosa di farinoso dovuto ai lieviti in sospensione che intorbidiscono la birra. Una birra fresca, dissetante e beverina.
Some estery, bananasqeue notes, but really quaffable and quite watery. Fairly thin body and medium carbonation. No bitterness.

Ar: Wow, rasowo, nawet lekko pod gose, ziarniscie, pszeniczne, slodowo, bardzo intensywna kolendra, swietny, rasowy witbier, ale bardzo kolendrowy, doskonale. Wyg: Slomkowo-zoltawe, totalnie metne, swietna piana, gruba, zostaje, roznoziarniste, ladnie brudzi szklo. Sm: wysycenie srednio-niskie, slodowe, ziarniste, pszeniczne, baaardzo mocna kolendra, swietny witbier, ale kolendra dominuje. Doskonaly witbier. Pos: slodowosc, bardzo pszenicznosc, dobra zniarnistosc, kolendra.

Pours with good amount of light foam. Color is of cloudy apple juice (or typical wheat beer color). Aroma is fairly rich and has typical wheat beer aromas like banana, citrus, wheat, perfume. Palate balanced between oiliness and dryness and very light. Taste is very refreshing and light for a wheat beer. It’s a like typical good (german) wheat beer (Fransiskaner, Weihenstephaner, ...), but it’s less sweet and rich, which makes it more refreshing and easier to drink. Hoegaarden still has the good wheat beer taste though, so it’s not "watered down" in any sense. Certainly, a standard in wheat beers. Although it can be considered a "bulk" beer, it deserves the score of a high quality beer, since it’s a very enjoyable beer.
Banana colour, with ester aromas. Easy drink with a bit of a fruity finish. On tap with no head.
yellow with huge white head.yeasty, bready flavor. aroma: citrus. medium sourness and dryness.

On tap, gialla chiara opalescente, schiuma bianca di ottima persistenza e aderenza.
Coriandolo a fiumi, frumento, lievemente citrica.
Al palato frumento in primis misto a note citriche che si potrebbero accostare ad una limonata, finale sempre con frumento accompagnato da coriandolo e da una leggera nota pepata.
Retrogusto con note di arancia molto molto leggere, coriandolo e leggero frumento.
Texture acquosa, molto beverina, corpo poco piÃ¹ che leggero, mediamente carbonata.

(on tap)
Aroma: coriander,orange peel.
Appearance:hazy yellow color,medium-sized dense head.
Taste:semi-sweet,flavour of orange peel,sweet malt,lemon,sweet soapy finish.
Palate:medium body,medium carbonation.
Overall:Well-made decent brew.

Butelka do 10.12.2017. Wygląd - słomkowe, lekko zmętnione, z małą pianą, redukującą się szybko do zera. Aromat - banany, słodowość, kolendrę też dość wyraźnie czuć. Smak - fajne słodowe klimaty pszenicy, bananowść, przyprawowość, drożdżowy finisz, piwo ma fajna gładką teksturę, wysycenie średnie, goryczka znikoma. Poprawne piwo, choć niezbyt estetyczne pod względem wyglądu i dość daleko my choćby do takich podróży kormorana.

Klasyk belgijski! Hoegaarden ma żółto-złoty kolor i całkiem sporą, ale nieco dziurawą, białą pianę. W aromacie intensywnie banany i kolendra. W smaku również te nuty dominowały, do tego trochę zbóż, cytrusów i różnych przypraw. Wysycenie średnie. Piwo bardzo rześkie, lekkie. Przyjemnie!

0,75 ml bottle. Golden in the glass, full haze. Nice thick white foam with pretty lacing. Aroma of slight citrus, coliander, smooth wheat in the background. Taste is slightly sweet, very low bitterness. Flavors of wheat malt, slight citrus, slight coliander in the background. Medium to high body, slick texture, high carbonation. Flavors of wheat and very slight yeast in the finish. Very refreshing and fairly drinkable. Spices and the characteristic Belgian witbier-like flavors are rather slight, thus it reminds me more of a German-style wheat beer.

Aroma is mostly coriander with freshness of citrus and some spices. Hazy yellow in the glass with frothy (but thick) snow white head. Malty taste with hints of yeastiness. Spicy, yeasty in the background. I feel lack of Belgian punch even if it’s Witbier.
hazy , almost white colour, thin head, spicy aroma, tastes like bitter orange and spices.
Fresh witbier with nice balance of spices, light spicy phenols and wheat sweetness.

Buena Witbier. Un aroma afrutado no demasiado intenso pero agradable. Una apariencia amarillo pálido con una capa de espuma blanca que se mantiene constante. Un sabor suave y afrutado y un paladar intenso.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass.
Appearance: Cloudy pale yellow colour, creamy head with nice lacing. 
Aroma: Grains/wheat, fruits/citrus…
Palate: Light to medium body, medium to high carbonation.
Taste: Gentle citrus, wheat, cloves, yeast.
Overall impression: Very enjoyable.
Világos aranyszín óriási fehér habbal. Enyhe citrusos, búzás illat. Ez köszön vissza az ízében is némi banánnal a háttérben.
Cloudy pale yellow with decent white head. Aroma is fruity, white bread, a little citrus. Taste is white bread, a little sour, light orange and spice. Very nice smooth texture. A classic.
bread, dough, banana, lightly bitter, fizzy, full body, cloudy, white foam, citrus,

On tap at ChaIRSKI, Nis. Still trying to get rid of taste of Nikšičko. This one is classics. If you are unsure what beer to choose, this one is certain shot. Lovely, really lovely aroma. Stable appearance regardless it’s draft or bottle. Very refreshing taste. I can imagine drinking this anytime anywhere.
I enjoy this smooth citrus wheat taste of beer. Mind you over health good choice only 4.9% Abv... I wish this was distributed in all store in the USA. :)
Une blanche très rafraîchissante qui se boit facilement. une bière estivale
En fût à la p’tite grenouille à Trois-Rivières. Couleur paille avec un joli col blanc. Arôme de malt et d’agrumes. Goût rafraîchissant d’agrumes et de céréales. Ce boit facilement.
On tap golden color with big white head wheat and light citrus aroma soft bananna and clove flavor.

Medium white head, light yellow, cloudy. Aroma of citrus, coriander, spices. Refreshing. Taste is similar: citrus, coriander, spices, oranges. Watery. High carbonation. Refreshing and drinkable. Tasty beer.

Bottle. Very crisp, smooth, refreshing, unfiltered cloudy murky wheat beer. Pale yellow in colour. Very spicy (coriander, cloves) and yeasty. Very fruity; tangy, citrus-fruity (orange peel, grapefruit). Nice sweet & sour taste balance. Nice beer chilled on a hot summer’s day. (2011-02-27)

Piwo barwy jasno żółtej (barwa miodu rzepakowego), mętne.
Piana bardzo obfita, o drobnych i średnich oczkach, przez chwilę się utrzymuje, szkło delikatnie zdobi. 
W aromacie świeżo i rześko, kolendra, cytrusy, mokre zboże, białe winogrona. 
W smaku dominuje pszenica, lekki cytrus może troszkę kolendry i innych ziół w tle. ogólnie dość wodniste, goryczki brak. Wysycenie jest średnie idące w stronę wysokiego. 
Ogólnie Witbier poprawny ale trochę zbyt wodnisty raczej na gorące dni by się orzeźwić.

Light orange color with small sized off white head. Weak retention and no lacing.
Smell is orange, wheat and low coriander. Taste is very fruity. Slightly sweet and slightly sour. Orange, lemon, low wheat malts and some spices like coriander. Ultra light bodied, carbonation is moderate. Crisp and slightly watery feeling. Semi dry finish. Too easy to drink, not complex, but it's a refresher on very hot days.
0,75l bottle. Hazy golden color with big white head. Wheat and light citrus aroma. Light sweet taste of wheat. Very drinkable.
Hazy, straw colour typical to style. Big coriander and wheat nose, typical witbier spices in flavour and bite from the carbonation. Very refreshing on a warm day.
Aroma of coriander and wheat (unsurprisingly). Cloudy orange with small white head. Taste mainly of wheat with coriander and a smooth easy going finish. Great witbier.

Saw this at my local Sainsbury’s and bought it on a whim as I’ve never heard of it before and fancied trying something different. A very strong flavoured beer with a distinctive taste. Definitely a new favourite!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

The big bottle from Żabka or Biedronka. Aroma: Citrus, coriander, spice, fruit, nice and intensive. Appearance: Nice head - durable, leaves lacing, golden hazy body. Taste: A lot of coriander, citrus, fruit, spice, lightly sour, pretty ok. Palate: Semi-sweet finish, medium-low body, medium carbonation.

Kolor: Słomka, zamglony.
Piana: Obfita, sycząca, szybko opada do warstwy na powierzchni.
Zapach: Mokre zboże, kolendra, cytrusy. Rześki. 
Smak: Kwaśnawe. Pszenica, kolendra. Goryczki praktycznie brak.
Wysycenie: Średnie w stronę wysokiego, OK.
Opakowanie: Nudna etykieta, niedokładny skład.
Uwagi: Warka 28.11.17 Pite w niższej temperaturze, idealne do orzeźwienia, bez zbędnego rozkładania piwa na części pierwsze.

Dense, white head that leaves some lacing. Hazy yellow colour. Belgian spices in aroma, some coriander and parsley as well. Taste same as aroma, but with addition of slight sourness. Low bitterness. Medium body and carbonation makes it smooth and easy to drink. Good example of Witbier.

750ml bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a hazy mid-gold with a white head. Aroma of orange and herb. Flavour of coriander, orange, wheat. Nicely balanced.

A classic wheat beer and Hoegaarden’s reputation as a good, mass-produced, easily drinkable beer is well deserved.

From bottle in Belgian ale glass. Pours hazy golden with two finger frothy head that faded quickly. Aroma of orange peel, yeast, with only a hint of coriander but it provides a bit of spice on the palate. An old fav.
Media carbonatação, mas nem por isso deixa de ser refrescante, nítido aroma das especiarias ao olfato, Boa formação de espuma, corpo leve, alto drinkabikity, leve, amarela turva, cítrica e ácida.

Poured into appropriate glass, has a pretty big foamy white head. Has a cloudy golden/wheaty appearance. Good thick lacing. Somewhat excessive carbonation. Citrus hop aromas with hints of coriander and grainy malts. Strong orange peel flavours, the coriander is fairly abundant. Some sweetness. A little bit of herbs and hints of spices also noticeable. Mouthfeel is a bit prickly and gives a tingly sensation. Medium bodied. Not too bad, but not my fave kind of beer.

Color pálido y sin mucha espuma. Sabor herbaceo, floral, notas de especias y marcado sabor a levadura belga. Muy refrescante, una de las mejores cervezas que puedes encontrar por un euro en un supermercado.

33cl bottle val 19feb17 poured to a tumbler glass. Almost absent aroma, just a little lemonade-like thing. Dull yellow hazy liquid, white good head.
Taste is wheat, banana, citrus. Medium carbonation, medium mouthful, always sweet. Sweet finish, refreshing but tending to cloying.
Very pale light yellow and hazy, Looks great. It’s lacking some flavor and consistency, I was expecting a bit more. LOTS of aroma, you can really smell the spices
Pours hazy blonde with a decent white head. Nose is fairly weak with some citus spice and sweet malt. Flavor is wheat and a touch of lemon. Quick finish. Well balanced.
Una delle peggiori mai provate; deluso soprattutto dal sapore dolce ed aromatizzato che da un lato sembra lieve e non intenso, mentre dall’ altro le spezie rendono questa birra quasi imbevibile.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Am Flughafen in Brüssel. Gelb, trüb, viel Schaum. Aroma Zitrone und Weizen. Geschmack: Banane, Weizen, Hefe

looks fantastic, smells awesome, when you pour its electric yellow with nothing but perfectly formed clouds on top.

beautiful beer!

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow with medium fast diminishing head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, apple. Taste is weak, wheat, parfume, soapy ending with light bitterness. Easy drinkable beer and it has a good mouthfeel.

From tap in a pub in Prague. Bright appearance with lasting head. Aroma is appealing with hints of citrus. Taste is citrus and wheat, appealing but can be hard to get used to at first. Overall pretty good for a mainstream beer.
One of the greatest wheat brew, what i have ever tried. Taste is just nicely ballanced and aroma is good as well. Must try it!

Served on tap at Belushi's. Strong wheat aroma. Light wheat citrus flavor. Light sticky body.

De la cervecera Brouwerij van Hoegaarden(BEL) propiedad de AB in Bev(BEL) esta “Hoegaarden Blanche” que es una Witbier o Bier de Blanche con 4.9% ABV, este es la típica cerveza belga de trigo especiada habitualmente con cascara de naranja y coriandro entre algunos otros ingredientes para dar mas complejidad dependiendo la receta, en lo personal pienso que es una de las mejores cervezas que tiene el emporio AB in Bev.
En apariencia es una cerveza que da con todos los puntos estandarizados del estilo, una corona de espuma de mediana a amplia con excelente retención y de color blanca muy atractivo, es pajiza y muy turbia por los almidones del grano de trigo con destellos amarillos, cuerpo ligeramente mediano en las paredes del vaso.
El aroma es muy sutil en su intensidad, las primeras notas son a trigo, los cereales dominan en el balance de esta cerveza, es destacable tambien un dulzor a miel, nota acida presente aunque no molesta y es parte de el estilo por los ácidos lácticos que puede desarrollar la levadura con la cual se fermenta, carácter cítrico muy moderado.
En el paladar se muestra semi seca con ligero cuerpo, sabores a granos y algo de pan, el dulzor desarrolla carácter parecido a la miel, vainilla, ademas de un sabor cítrico a naranja aunque es muy liviano, la acidez tambien es presente en el sabor como en el aroma y dota de sequedad el final de la cerveza, muy rica, se pueden tomar varias sin que sature el paladar sin embargo no carece de sabor, es un estilo muy bien balanceado entre los cuatro elementos que componen la cerveza y cuando hay una buena interpretación es sabrosa y poco invasiva a el paladar.

Belle robe trouble blond pastel, blancheur verdâtre typique de la blanche. Mousse moyenne très crémeuse de bonne tenue. Bulles très fines. Nez de citron, zeste, légèrement épicé. Métal léger. Attaque sur le citron et le coriandre. Très rafraichissant, corps fin, très peu de sucre. Finale légèrement amère. Archétype de la blanche belge, particulièrement fraiche. Très stable, stabilisée dans l’équilibre des saveurs et la texture.

Appearance: cloudy opaque pale gold with one finger of fine off-white head diminishing rapidly to a thin cap, minimal patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: orange peel, coriander, yeasty wheat, floral. (8/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter, mild tart, light peppery spice. (8/10) Palate: medium-light body, moderate carbonation, short duration lightly tart and spicy finish. (4/5)

A classic that I’ve had many times, yet somehow never reviewed. And they served it in a bucket-sized glass so what’s not to like? (Honestly, it was a jug without a handle! It almost took two hands for me to drink from it when it was full! Ok, ok, I know it’s just thick glass - but it’s still impressive.) Serving size aside, it’s a pretty reliable mass-market standard. Light, easy to drink (though you might need to use both hands!) and probably the standard against which witbiers are measured. No complaints here. (16/20)
Bottle at Evernote in Redwood City, CA. Perfume, potpourri, and flower water. Not a fan.

Aromas a plátano
Aspecto dorado claro, turbia y con carbónatacion media-alta
En boca plátano, trigo y final especiado

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Kitty Kat Klub on the U of M campus before Frightened Rabbit show at Varsity. Cloudy yellow/orange appearance. Aroma has wheaty characteristics with some light coriander and citrus. Taste is pretty mild with a citrus quality running throughout. Refreshing in general. Bready characteristics and flavor present. Easy to drink. One of the first "go-to" beers I can remember and still tastes very approachable. People should steer towards this instead of Blue Moon for this style.
Bottle at kitty kat club. Hazy light orange yellow. Citrus nose. Sweet, orange, spicy. Spicy mouthfeel. Light and tasty, a great classic beer for the right moment.
Excelente wit beber. Aroma e gosto cítricos com um leve toque de laranja. Cerveja clara. Bem leve e com sabor suave.

4.9% Had at De la luz's with Tony and Tom. Great time. Good beer. Probably the first wit beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Servida en vaso Hoegaarden. APARIENCIA: de color pajizo, se observa ligeramente turbia y moderada actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma blanca de buena retención, de burbuja muy compacta.

AROMA: notas a pan y plátano del trigo es lo que predomina, además de ligeras notas cítricas y algo de dulzor.

SABOR: el paladar sigue al aroma; notas a pan y plátano del trigo, ligero dulzor atrás de eso, notas cítricas muy leves y cierto gusto a agua mineral; el retrogusto queda con un amargor muy ligero, seco y no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo ligero, carbonatación media alta y que se siente el crispar en lengua.
RESUMEN: una buena cerbeza refrescante y ligera de acuerdo al estilo.
750ml bottle from Asda, shared. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, lemon peel. Taste is similar, mildly sweet and sour with only a hint of bitterness,

750 ml bottle. Aroma of carnation (pol.goździki) and very weak of orange peel. Very nice, classical appearance, unfortunately head is impermanent. Good taste, very refreshing. Very fine bitterness (as for witbier). Nice but short aftertaste. Classical representative of a style, definitely must try for every beer-geek.

750ml pullo, BBE 20.09.2016. Massiivinen saippuamainen vaahto, kirkkaan kuulas lagerin väri. Pieneen lasiin kaadettuna ensin alkuun hyvin laimean haalea, raa’an vehnäinen maku. Lisää kaadettuna alkaa suutuntuma tasapainottumaan. Raikkaahko yläpää joskin hivenen tunkkainen alapää jälkifiiliksenä, Pientä mausteisuutta. Tasapainoinen ja maukas kokonaisuus.
its a nice wit beer. hazy with straw color. Small head and stays not for a long time. aroma: wheat, spices, orange peel, coriander. Taste more towards sweetish, nice refreshing, enjoyable.

Piwo barwy słomkowej, mętne. Piana biała, dość obfita, drobna, trochę się utrzymuje, lacing znikomy. W aromacie banan, goździki, coś jak kolendra, trochę cytrusów. Za to wychodzą one dużo lepiej w smaku, dochodzi do nich słodowość i ponownie lekka nuta kolendry. Nasycenie wysokie, co w połączeniu ze smakiem daje orzeźwiający efekt, dobry na cieplejsze dni.
Very refreshing & drinkable, very nicely balanced, a good dependable beer from the InBev.

In bottiglia. Colore giallo chiaro elettrico, mediamente torbido. Testa corta, fragile, abbastanza densa, soapy, di rapida dissolvenza. Fresco naso di coriandolo, vaniglia, banana, limone e arancia, lontanissima cannella, lievi note di spezie. Carbonazione soffice, abbastanza scarica. Aroma sostenuto, non molto ricco ma sufficientemente solido e discretamente succoso, di coriandolo e arancia, lievito e frumento. Finale pulito e asciutto. Corpo leggero, trama watery e appena succosa. Ottimo l’equilibrio, ma una birra poco incisiva nel complesso, comunque molto dissetante e di alta qualità (nonostante la dimensione del birrificio).

Light gold colour. Head quickly goes away. Smells yeast, flowers, vinegar, mandarine/orange peel. Watery body with nice yeasty finish. Balance on the sweet side. A bit lacks in palate, but overall good and quite drinkable.

Appearance: Hazy yellow color with a fine white head that stays there for a while. And gives a fine lacing. Looks great.
Aroma: Wheat, citric and coriander. Ok intensity.
Palate: Medium body. Mellow nice sweetness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Mellow balanced wheat, yeast, citric and coriander.
Overall impression: I never get tired of this beer. Probably my favourite wit.
Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Fredrikstad, Norway
What a treat. Refreshing with that beautiful citrusy touch. Appearance is top-notch too.
Bardzo przyjemny wit, wszystko w zgodzie ze stylem. Pięknie się prezentuje - słomkowa barwa i świetna piana. Bardzo pijalny i orzeźwiający. Zbożowo kwaskowy z przyjemną nutą przypraw.
W aromacie kolendra, przyprawy, skórka pomarańczy/cytryny. Barwa słomkowa, zamglona z dużą zbitą pianą. W smaku kolendra, bardzo gładkie, dość wytrawne, mocno pijalne i orzeźwiające.

Schöne trübe Farbe, feine Perligkeit, kein Schaum. In der Nase tolle Wit-Fruchtigkeit, Orange. Im Trunk setzt sich die Fruchtigkeit fort, feine Süße, ein Anflug Bitterkeit, nur ein wenig. Im Abgang bleibt noch etwas Frucht. Wenig komplex, aber hohe Drinkability, schönes Sommerbier.
Bardzo orzeźwiające piwo. Dużo cytrusów, kolendry, pszenica, mętne, niefiltrowane. Świetnie pijalne.

Aromat: cytryna i kolendra, delikatne nuty przyprawowe.
Piana obfita, biała, drobna, tworzy ładną koronkę.

W smaku słodko-kwaśno, choć bez przesady. finisz lekko wytrawny. W tle kolendra. Orzeźwia.
Pale yellow, hazy, very small head. Aroma: flowers, spices, especially coriander, citrous, yeast. Flavour: lots of spices and some yeast. Bit citrous, but overall too sweet.
Butelka; barwa cytrynowa, mętna. Piana bujna. Aromat cytrynowy, kwiatowy, fenolowy, kolendry, goździka, pszenicy. Smak kolendry, goździka, pszenicy, kwaskowy. Pijalne i orzeźwiające.
The finest beer I’ve ever had. Ever. This is the undisputed King of Euro wheat beer. Everything is in perfect balance. I say no more

First beer my old man handed to me when I landed in the sunshine state. I’ve drank buckets of this stuff in my salad days & it’s nice to revisit this. The weather is hot & sticky & this hit the spot. Light coriander, streams of wheat, brisk finish. Quenching.

Pours a hazy pale golden color with small white head. Very fruity and herbal smell with notes of coriander.

Medium body with somewhat watery texture. Very tingly carbonation. Taste is mostly sour with very subtle bitternes kicking in towards the finish. Aroma of malts, wheat, grass, herbs, spices and fruits; mostly pineapple, a bit banana.

Floral, herbal and very refreshing. Very nice brew, recommended.

Copenhagen 12/3 2016. 75 cl bottle from Fakta. The beginning of March should be the right time to drink the King of Belgian Wit. Spring awaits. Pours hazy pale yellow with white head. Settles as flimsy thin layer of foam. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Lemonadelike wheat with notes of oranges and banana. Some yeast in there as well. Medium carbonation and watery palate. Taste is rather sweet - close to sugary - followed by a more sour fruityness with citrus and a little banana. Aftertaste is mostly sweet. Overall a bit watery. Nice summerbeer. Easy to drink, extremely refreshing on the verge of reminding you of a shandy and utterly forgettable.
Some coriander in aroma, moreover lot of citrus. In taste citrus, very smooth, easy to drink. Well done.
Denne hvedeøl har et uklart gyldent udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en frisk og hvedet aroma og smager både af hvede, frisk og med en anelse bitterhed. Medium karbonering.
Bottle at home. Sweet, citrus nose and taste. Some citrus and spice, and a bit of banana. Easy to drink.

Hazy light yellow-white robe, soft delicate micro foam, but a little light in taste and taste a bit flat and short on the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

F: average, white, good retention.
C: yellowish to pale gold, hazy, opaque.
A: banana, coriander, spicy, light orange peels, grassy, citrus, wheat.
T: light body, good carbonation, wheat, coriander, light citrus, peppery, quite dry finish, yeast, classic for this style, great, worth to try, 0,33l can from Colruyt in Brussels.
Nice white head on a cloudy yellow body. Really nice citrus aroma. Easy drinking and gentle carbonation. Sweet and not bitter. Not terribly complex but really pleasant
Bottle. Aromas of banana wheat and malt. Taste the same. Not a bad beer. Will have this again.

bottle: pours a cloudy light straw colour with a smaller than expected head.....citrus (mostly lemony), banana, some clove, and wheat malt detectable in the aroma......slight sourness with a mild bitterness to the finish.....light body with lively carbonation.......refreshing
Pours a hazy blonde. Slightly intense citrus and spicy aroma with coriander notes. Dry taste is yeast, citrus, wheat. Mass market, but good for refreshment purpose.

LOVVVVVEEEE it !
It’s been my beer standard since I tried it.
I brought me into the beer world, so nice and so good.
This one and Sierra Nevada is two of my favourite out of hundreds.

Masse Banan, Bugg og en anelse Appelsin i aromaen. Smaken er også klassisk Belgisk. Men det enesten jeg finner kan trekke ned er litt lite karbonering og skumhodet som la seg veldig fort. Men kjøper jeg denne igjen; Ja gjerne.
Hazy yellow pour with thin white head, soft carbonation , taste slightly sour and bitter , grassy with wheat,it has spicy, fruit, citrus aroma , it is light and silky.
Ljus blond vetedimmig öl. Doft av koriander och apelsin. Smak av vete och koriander och citrus. Lätt syrlig. God.
Thin head, malt and citrus aroma, low bitter taste with a little bit spicy aftertaste...
Aroma of coriander, citrus and spices. Taste is slightly sour with coriander and orange.
Cerveja deliciosa e refrescante. Amarela, levemente turva, espuma cremosa, branca, pouco persistente. Aroma leve, tons cítricos sobre trigo e leveduras. Suave, ótima drikabilidade, final adocicado
0,33 bottle. Pours hazy yellow color with medium white head. Light body. Aroma of herbs and grass. Taste of wheat and some citrus. Low carbonation.
Floral, citrus, banana, frothy, light sweetness, full body, fizzy, notes of spices and citrus. A blanche that i recommend to anyone who like this style.
Pours hazy straw color with 1 finger tall head, decreasing fast. The smell is it’s highlight. There are spices, banana and fresh bread. But the taste is very faint. It’s medium-bodied and crispy.

33cl bottle chilled and poured in tumbler
A: pale hazy yellow, thin fine lacy white head that falls away quickly
A: coriander, fruit, orange
T: bright, light/Med sweet, light bitter, no sour
P: light body, tin, low carbonation, smooth light finish
O: wonderfully easy summer beer, refreshing, light
Boa cerveja, leve, com bom corpo, final pouco persistente. Alcool bem inserido. Prefiro a Vedett.

Aroma: coriander, citrus, banana, herbal, grain
Taste: light sweet, light bitter, coriander, banana, grainy,
Hazy pale, small head. Fruity wheat malt aroma. Wheat malt sweet, very light bitter. Light to medium body, not long finish.
On tap. Nice hazy, pale golden color with a white thin head. Citrus, lemon and hops in the aroma and a refreshing, light sour taste with a long lasting finish. Highly recommended.

Nice wheat and citrus taste. Sweet, smooth and weak alcohol. Can get this in almost every commercial stores in Malaysia.

Althought Weihenstephaner is the better choice but it also cost twice the price here. Which makes this the choice for most ppl here.

500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy pale golden colour with one finger white head. Aroma is just pleasant: sweet coriander, zest, bubblegum, banana. Taste: wheat, spices, orange zest. Semidry wheaty aftertaste. Well, that’s a good refreshing easy-drinking beer.
Cloudy golden pour with large quick white foamy head. Hay, clove and coriander aroma. Wheat and citrus taste. Light body and higher carbonation. Short semi sweet aftertaste.

On tap. Il gusto al naso riporta sentori di frumento. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello a bollicine medie e carbonazione abbondante di schiuma compatta, cremosa e aderente persiste in un bel pizzo finale. La consistenza del liquido è giallo dorato. Il corpo è pieno. L’amaro è moderato. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è lungo, pulito e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L’aroma in bocca rimanda a pane, frumento, fiori e pasta.
Barwa złota, mętne, piana biała, obfita, drobne pęcherzyki. W aromacie banany, kolendra, cytrusy, goździki. A smaku aksamitne, malutka goryczka, słodowe z nutami owocowymi, bananowymi.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a light gold color with a quick white head Pleasant aroma of wheat, banana and clove. Medium body, taste taste has that classic Wit flavor. Clean finish, slightly tart. Excellent!
Mild flavour and fresh but not tasteless, a smooth beer even for those who have the palate habituated to intense tastes such as IPA style
Extremely fresh and smooth. Very pleasant taste, easily enjoyable in the sun during summertime.
Hazy yellow, aroma of citrus, coriander and yeast. Medium sweetnest and low bitterness. Pretty good and refreshing beeer.
Pivo malo krásnu farbu, pripomínajúcu Radler, vóňa jemne kvasnicová, tóny pomaranču, koriandru, chutné

Pours hazy golden with a massive and aggressive white head. Aroma is strongly yeast, some citrus notes can be felt. Taste is very pale at first, with pronounced carbonation, which prepares your tasting buds for a very nice and soft sweet-sour taste. Not much body, but very drinkable.

Farbe: trübes Schlammgelb.
Schaum:fein, eher wenig.
Nase: Dezent, frisch, leicht säuerlich. 
Geschmack: sehr angenehm im Mund: sehr feine Kohlensäure, rund, mild und voll (durch die Hefe, nicht Alkohol oder Röstung). Im Abgang: eine milde Getreide, Mandarine, Citrus Mischung. Kaum Bitteres in diesem Bier.
Sehr gut, sehr angenehm mild und unspektakulär zu trinken.

Aroma wheaty bready, light coriander, some spicy esters. Golden with lots of haze, some suspended yeast. Large head with big bubbles. Slight bitterness with a bit of sweetness to balance. Great moussey mouth feel. Finish crisp and dry.

Had many times, this time poured from a can. A hazy pale yellow, big pillowy white head. The nose displays standard wit chars - banana, coriander spice, some citrus. All nice. The taste follows well, a little thinner in flavour than I recall, but you do get a decent creamy and lightly fizzy feel, fluffy in the feel. It’s so easy to drink. The flavours linger on the palate as it goes on.
Bij E&W in Willemstad. Lang geleden. Nog altijd een zeer prima witbier. Backlog from 2015/10/04.
Even though Hoegaarden nowadays is a broadly distributed industry-beer, it still is a crisp fresh witbeer with its distinct fruity-sour components. Nice.
Cloudy light yellow color, a little bit like lemonjuice, thick white head, smells of yeast and orange, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, fruity taste, creamy feel with average carbonation

0,33l bottle or tap. Hazy light yellow colour with small white head. Aroma: Banana, citrus, herbs. Taste: Sweet. The banana falvour is rule with a little sourness. Small/medium body, average carbonation, creamy texture. Refreshing witbier, I like it.
From a bottle. You know what it’s like, we all do, it depends if you like it. I think it’s ok, especially on tap.
Here’s a good Belgian wheat beer smooth easy to drink lower abv makes a nice session beer.
Bottle. Pale gold with a nice white head. The aroma had bread yeast and banana with coriander spice flavoring. The taste was slightly tart with a minimally dry finish.
Flaske. Farven er uklar, gylden lysgul. Skumkronen er OK. Aromaen og smagen er citron, appelsin og koriander. Smagen er let syrlig.

I don’t like Witbier, so that’s why my rating is low. The smell is horrible, it serious smells like puke. Thick white head on a not clear bear. Tasts of citrus and coriander. Used to be very popular in Holland. You can drink it with a slice of lemmon or citrus. I do not feel well after drinking this, sleepy and lazy.

Dourada com turbidez considerável pela não filtragem, espuma generosa e estável. Aroma levemente cítrico, com paladar muito bem equilibrado e refrescante, sem exagero de especiarias. Final seco, pede mais um gole. Excelente wit beer!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Van Mildert College Bar, Durham, £2.20. 

Pours hazy yello-amber with a thin, white head and soft carbonation. There’s sweet banana esters in the nose as well as distinct herbal character. The taste is quite sweet, even sugary but not overpoweringly so, particularly as complex banana, clove and citrus flavours add welcome depth. Good.

Di colore giallo paglierino tenue e un pò torbido.Ha una soffice e densa schiuma, ed un aroma speziato nel quale si percepiscono la scorza d’arancia e il coriandolo. Leggera e con un perfetto equilibrio tra il dolce e l'acidulo del frumento, si lascia bere con estrema facilità.

Bottle @ HQ, Aarhus. Aroma of banana yeast, wheat, fruit esters. Hazy golden amber with white mostly lasting head. Taste is light sweetness. Light to medium body, watery feel, avg. carb., short sweet finish.

From the six pack for OSU beating Michigan... Again!!! Thanks Rick 😉🏉😎. Hazy yellow with two finger white head and ample carbonation. Wheat, orange zest and Belgian yeast... A light refreshing brew... Go Bucks!!!
Aroma and taste is citrus (orange) and coriander. The taste is also light sour. A nice wit.

Flasche 0,33l: Helles Gelb, kräftige Trübung mit festem feinporigen Schaum; sehr frische, leicht süße Nase mit Zitrusnoten, grünen Früchten, Bananen, leicht malzige Noten; im Körper sehr frisch mit grünen Früchten, Zitrusnoten, Sternfrucht; leicht trocken-malziger Nachgang
Cloudy gold color, nice lacing. Aroma of oranges, some bananas and flowers (?) . Good, light beer for summer days.

Hazy peach and golden colors. White creamy 2 finger head, lasting 2 minutes, with average legs and tons of activity.

Aromas and flavors of lemony citrus, clove, and herbal spices. Faint sharp and crisp sour fruity and grainy taste. The citrus feel is too extreme.

Light body with excessive prickly carbonation, nice finish ending with well intensified sour fruity mouth coat.

Overall : An average white beer that is too bland and missing a little freshness.
13.8.2015.tap@Maria Eetcafe. strohgelb, leicht trüb, weisse Krone, stilgerecht stark karbonisiert. Citrus, Gewürznoten. Toll erfrischend an einem warmen Tag.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours a cloudy and light golden color with a fluffy white head and lacing. The aroma was a bit skunky with hints of lemon and bread. The taste was lemon, orange, Belgian yeast, and wheat. It’s light and refreshing. This is a quality beer. It’s drinkable, flavorful, and simple.
Can at Brussels airport. Pours pale cloudy yellow. Wheat, lemon, orange nose. Some spice. Flavour is bittersweet banana, lemon. Bit of carb in it. Okay.

Cloudy milky gold color with a thick white head and pleasant lacing. aroma is of citrus bananas and spice. Flavor is somewhat sweet, reminiscent of oranges and bananas, with a trace of coriander. finishes quickly and dry.
Birra saporita e dissetante. Biondo molto chiaro e torbido, dai sentori speziati, freschi e di limone, questa birra scivola che è un piacere. Fino ad ora la migliore blanche che ho assaggiato.

Flasche (33 cl) von Jenny Lou’s, Peking (2.11.2015). - Hellgelb und milchig trüb; schöner weißer Schaum. - In der Nase schöne fruchtig-erfrischende, milde Zitronenschale, etwas Koriander, Weizenbiersüße. - Antrunk erfrischend leicht mit sehr milder Zitronenschale, ein klein wenig Herbe und einem Hauch von Rhabarber. Schlanker Weizenbiercharakter. Gut rezent, schaumig, vom Mundgefühl her eher ein Erfrischungsgetränk als ein Bier. Im Abgang ganz schwach krautige Herbe, etwas Gemüse. Leicht schaler Nachtrunk. - Ein süffiges, angenehmes aber aromatisch eher anspruchsloses Witbier. Es gibt weitaus charaktervollere.
Pours a cloudy yellow, with a white cap, smells of corrander and orange, tastes like it smells. A tasty and well rounded beer. I highly recommend.
Metnozolte z obfita biala piana. W smaku dominuja owoce -posmak bananow ale taze nutka koleandru z pomaranczowym finiszem .dobre
pours a milky honey colour with a big frothy white head and a nice lacing. aroma of coriander, flowers, smoke, a hint of banana. flavour of orange jam, coriander, cracker. slightly sour dry finish.

Bottle - big foamy head, hazy pale straw/yellow color, good size wheat, banana and spice aroma and flavor, nice yeasty spice finish, good and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at some random bar in Nice. It pours cloudy pale gold with a decent white head. The nose is bready, cracker, wheat, preserved lemon, candied peel, pepper and touch of ginger. The taste is smooth, quite bready, wheat, cracker, light cracker, mild bitterness and some lemon with a short finish. Light - medium body and soft, massaging carbonation. Simple and easy-drinking. Actually not bad.
Una cerveza que entra muy bien. Amarilla limón, suave. Aroma muy rico. Recomendable.

Bottle. Pours hazy(cloudy) yellow with small white head.Aroma is malty, wheaty, slight citrus, coriander, yeasty. Taste is sweet with some citric sourness, wheaty,yeasty, coriander. Up to medium body. Well balanced.

A solid, albeit way too common wit bier. A million peeps drinking it, and not because its good, but rather it is one of the most unbeer beers available. Light citrus nose and decent balance means it enters the throat virtually undetected...like a porn star with a kielbasa.

1 ounce from wife’s glass. Aroma: orange peel, light coriander, lots of wheat. App: hazy pale / straw, minimal white head and lots of bubbles throughout like a soda. Taste and palate: light body, light sweetness, sweet finish. Overall: not as bad as I could remember. Would like it less sweet but the amount of wheat sounds about right even though it’s kinda intense.
Heavy wheat malt aroma, slightly herbal and floral. A bit hazy golden appearance. Long lasting white head. Medium sweet and light bitter taste. Of course taste of wheat. Average carbonation.

33 cl bottle from City Center One, served in a snifter. Pale yellow to light tan, unfiltered, with medium white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is grainy, yeasty, slightly coriander, spice. Medium body, light carbonation. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness, balanced. Texture is oily.

Another one of the classics. Today it is the definition of a style. Do not let the service ruin the beer by putting disgusting lemon slices inside. The beer is good to go as is, by itself. Very easily drinkable, with a delicately balanced spice additions - they do not get annoying yet there is a definite presence. Highly carbonated, very refreshing with a touch of sourness, sessionable. Hazy pale yellow colour with a long lasting huge white head.
The name is inviting, but what a God awful beer. Spices do not belong in MY beer. The style is that of the familiar Blue Moon. In a certain mood I could drink this, but that mood is an uncommon one.

Una delle mie preferite, provata in bottiglia e alla spina. Bel colore giallo, schiuma bianca e abbastanza corposa. Gusto piacevolmente acidulo e poco amaro, note marcate di agrumi, principalmente limone. Limone che permane piacevolmente sul palato come retrogusto.
definitiv eines meiner lieblingsbiere, sehr genialer geschmack und ich kann es sehr guten gewissens jedem empfehlen
Mild yeasty aroma with light wheat notes. Pours a very pale very cloudy yellow with a tight big white head. Subtle sour notes with light wit beer flavors. Very drinkable. I like it.
Trübes helles gelb mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Fruchtig, Orange, Kräuter, leicht würzig, sehr süffig.

Re-rate 07/08/2016: 330ml bottle. Cloudy yellow colour with a one-finger creamy smooth white head, retained for the duration of the drink. Aroma: citrus, orange peel, herbal, coriander, wheat. Taste: citrus fruit, orange, banana, coriander, wheat, yeast. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy smooth mouthfeel. Refreshingly good in summer, first time drinking this in over 3 years and it remains my favourite Wit. Same rating.



24/04/2013: 330ml bottle. Pale cloudy yellow colour with a big white head. Lovely spicy citrus aroma with coriander and wheat. Taste is smooth, citric (orange?), wheat, and mildly spicy with coriander, maybe a hint of banana. Smooth and refreshing. First Witbier I ever tried, it remains one of my favourites.

Light yellow color, medium to strong head. Notes of banana, citrus, and flower in aroma. Tastes of banana, biscuits, and the slight note of bitter orange peel and coriander as per the style. Not the most interesting, but a refreshing intoduction ot belgian wit.

Hoegaarden is a classic Witbier, defining the style. The pour is very translucent, pale yellow, and slightly cloudy. A neat white head forms with a pleasant effervescence, carrying aromas of light but fragrant spice. The taste is light, crisp, mild, tangy, slightly floral, and gently spiced. The finish carries the spice into the palate and thoroughly refreshes. An excellent session brew.
Pours hazy golden with lots of yeasty spices in the air. Starts off with a light mouthfeel followed by different spicy notes. Ends dry with sweet oranges notes. To me a classical and tasty Witbier.

Pours flat with milky light yellow with small white head. Aroma is fresh straw, banana, cilantro, orange, grass, dough and bit of basement. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, light sour. Body is light, palate is watery, carbonation is average.
Bubblegum, light aniseed, medicine aromas. Mild taste, low bitterness, easy to drink but too complex to session.

Aroma: bread, bubblegum. Appearance: golden, cloudy, white persistent foam. medium sweetness, taste as it.smells. lightly bitter end. medium body, good carbonation. Overall a good beer, . Didn’t find the orange peel aroma and taste.
S?odki, owocowy zapach. Nie przepadam za pszeniczniakami, tak to jestem w stanie wypi?. Dosy? orze?wiaj?ce
Aroma maravilhoso de laranja e especiarias, porém no sabor é um pouco seca demais. Refrescante.
330 ml bottle - Very pleasant if very mainstream interpretation of a Witbier from a global corporation.

Bottle. Pours very cloudy, pale and with a somewhat high carbonation, with a very white head of small bubbles. The aromas are stronger than its taste, rich in hay-like notes and barley. The flavours are notably soft and mild, mainly citrus and maybe sweet to spicy. Extremely drinkable and refreshing, but I expected a bit more.
Aromat cytrusowy, kolendra, ziołowy. W smaku przyprawowe, ziołowe, cytrusy, banany. Orzeźwiające, ale lekko pustawe.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Tumbler. Supplier: Le Grande Café (Fabrezan). Citrus hit with wheaty overtones.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Lasting white head. Aroma of wheat, spices, coriander. Taste sweet, coriander, clove and some orange.
Bottle and tap. A bit tart and very refreshing. Orange, coriander, bit spice. It is a really well crafted one. To refresh, enjoy or even pair with light meals

A su garder son caractère. Très agréable en apéritif, ou dans l’après-midi, quand il fait chaud. Parfumée derrière son amertume.

From tap. Light hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is malty grainy, citrusy hoppy and spicy yeasty. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Kolor żółty, mętne. Piana drobna, utrzymuje się kożuszek, słabo oblepia szkło. Zapach słodki, bananowo-chlebowo-cytrusowy. W smaku słodkie, nuty pomarańczy, płatków zbożowych, lekko cytrusowa kwaśność. Brakuje goryczki. Dość wysokie nasycenie.
Bottle in Brussels. Hazy body with white head. Nose is fruits, bananas, sweets. Taste too of bananas, fruits and tart. Very good.
Straw with a medium white head. Aroma is orange, lemons, light coriander, floral notes, passion fruit. Taste is wheat, lemon, orange, coriander, lemongrass. Light bitter aftertaste.
Tåkete lys gulmed tett hvitt skum. klar lukt av krydder, banan og hjemmebakt brød. Smaker koriander, mandarin og et fint gjærpreg. Fyldig avslutning. Gammel helt som fortsatt holder stand.

Pours cloudy yellow with thin white head. Citric aroma, some coriander and yeast too. Taste is light sour. Refreshing.
Pours golden hazy with white foam. Very good retention. Nose - yeast, banana and cloves. Taste is the same with a little tart and fine balanced co2. Still one of the best Belgian. Wit beers.

Bottle 0,33l. Hazy yellow body, medium white head. Nice aroma of wheat, coriander, yeasts. First taste is sour, than sourish sweet with some bitterness. Yeasty, very grainy on the bottom of bottle. Fermented wheat malt and touch of cloves. Medium body and carbonation. 
Really not bad, especially for commercial wit.

This is my first time to drink craft beer if we can say like that, really amazing! I had to say, it shock me since in China, industry larger are overwhelming! Very good tast and light yellow, nice foam head, extremely fit the summer!
Really nice and refreshing beer nice small head very light with clemantine and orange peel taste refreshing peppery finish

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of 2nd March 2016 and poured into a Hoegaarden pint glass. The beer poured a hazy straw yellow with a one finger white head that dissipates slowly into a thin creamy layer with nice curtain like lacing. Starts with wheat bready malt aromas before leading into some banana, honey, spice and bubblegum. Taste is bready at the beginning followed by banana, honey sweetness and a tinge or citrus orange and clove to finish. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Overall a good beer that is refreshing and quite tasty. In Hong Kong its price is very competitive as most good craft is at least double the price.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, mętne. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości.

AROMAT: Dosyć intensywny. Dużo kolendry. Pomarańcze raczej schowane. 

SMAK: Zbożowe, ze sporą dawką kolendry nadającej przyjemny posmak. Goryczka niska, krótka. Nasycenie średnie.

Brewed at SAN InBev, Klin Russia.
Beer is very weak. The aroma is practically absent. Color - straw, a little muddy. Foam-existent. Taste - a weak wheat. Few cloves. Coriander, banana is not noticeable.
In general, the 2 are not comparable with the original Hoegaarden.

Hoegaardens wit beer has always been trend-setting, and might be considered the best known of all Belgian wit. It has beautiful white dense foam and smells like a classic wheat of freshly grain, coriander and citrus. The taste is a bit conservative, but with pleasant notes of coriander / citrus. A fine choice for a hot summer day.

Cerveja deliciosa. Sabor único. Quanto à aparência, parece um suco de laranja fraco, pela sua cor. No gosto, temos o abacaxi bem evidente e depois a laranja, temos também um toque apimentado que quebra pouco o doce cítrico, dando um certo amargor no final. Ótima drinkability, muito boa carbonatação também. Faz Jus à fama de uma das tops da Bélgica.
A traditional wheat beer with dry mouth, minimal white head and nice aroma. Medium bitter and dry taste, Not my favorite kind of beer.

Citrus aroma with notes of orange and grapefruit. Cloudy straw colour. Front has notes of grapefruit, banana, and spice and finishes clean. Light body with lively carbonation. Quite a nice beer.

Tasted on tap, with a somewhat tired palate, so take the rating with a grain of salt. 
Pours light hazy yellow with green tint, short white head. Texture is oily, body light and carbonation is soft. Tastes slight sweet with overly strong lemony hop sourness. Flavors of orange peel, lemony, light spice and clove notes, wheat, mild hop, slight banana. Too thin, slightly boring...

Drobna wysoka piana, jasno żółta i mętna barwa. W aromacie kwaskowo-pszeniczne nuty, świeży chleb, kolendra, owoce typu pomelo, agrest - przyjemnie i orzeźwiająco. Smak podobnie, bardzo rześki, lekki, kwaskowość limonkowo-drożdżowa miesza się ze słodkimi owocami (jest pomarańcz, ananas, banan), są delikatne przyprawy, nieco kwiatów. Wszystko to świetnie zbalansowane, zaczyna się od kwaśnych nut, szybko przechodzi do słodko-mącznych, by na końcu pozostać w postaci pieprzno-kwiatowego afterteasu. Nagazowanie bardzo drobne, średnie do niskiego, odczucie w ustach nie jest wodniste, raczej troszkę poniżej półpełnego.

Botella. Color pomelo totalmente turbio. Muchísima espuma de color blanco. Aroma a plátano, lúpulo y cítricos.
En boca predomina el plátano. Entra muy refrescante con una carbonatación media. Tira un poco a acuosa, pero es bastante agradable.

the aroma is fruity and spicy with hints of citrus, yeast, clove and coriander... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of orange, lemon, candy, yeast and some spices... sweet, a little bit, bitter and dry aftertaste...
Opálos narancssárga szín fehér habbal. Illata buzamalátás narancsos és korianderes. Íze kellemesen búzás és éleszt?s és korianderes.így 33 fokba nagyon jól esik.

Alla spina. Colore giallo paglierino velato con una schiuma bianca e fine, aroma di banana, limone e una leggera speziatura, al palato impressiona per la facilità di bevuta, qui il limone si fa sentire un po di più insieme a una buona nota dolce. Birra ideale per combattere il caldo e la sete.

From 12oz bottle, purchased at Trader Joe’s about $1.25 for bottle



Aroma: sweet, oranges, banana



Appearance: golden, cloudy, white head



Taste: light sweet, light bitter



Palate: light, thin, average carbonation



Overall: Feels very thin/watery to very light bodied to me. Definitely easy to drink. The orange is present, but I can’t taste or smell the coriander. Nice dry finish, really like the dry finish. A little more banana aroma than I thought it should have. Looking for a bit more body. Not tasting the ’sour’ taste, but the body/thin is throwing me off quite a bit.
From bottle. Pours orange and cloudy with medium white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, touch of orange. Taste refreshing, fruity, smooth. High carbonation.
Dobry witbier. W tym piwie podoba mi się to, że słodowość pszeniczna jest dobrze wyczuwalna. Wiele witów jej nie ma - dla mnie duży plus dla tego piwa właśnie za to.

750ml bottle pours a hazy light yellow with a good, white, lasting head. Nose is mild yeast, fresh citrus and zingy, gingery spice.taste follows, mild oranges, slight lemon kick and a bit of rounded, mild spice. Mouth feel is great, quite watery but really refreshing and the flavours carry all the way through. Long fruity finish with a nice touch of spicey warmth. Wow, not had this in a while and it is better than I remember.

Pours straw colour with no head. Hazy stucture, fast rising bubbles-high carbonation. Aroma without presence of alcohol, only fruity-floral aroma, with notes of bread and pine. Similar is taste: without presence of alcohol, little citrusy, tropical...hop bitterness is medium. Hop bitterness is well balanced with malt sweetness; malt sweetness, with notes of wheat, is medium. Body is dry, bitterness is low-medium, also bitterness in finish. Drinkable and appropriate beer for its style.

A class act. Looks great - cloudy with a snowy white head. Low carbonation, easy to drink and very smooth. As easy to session as it is to savour the flavour. A hit of fruit, then some bitterness. Although fruity, it’s not overpowering and delivered it in an almonst mellow way. Very well balanced between fruitiness and bitterness. Almost a smoky taste to it too. I much prefer this to English type ales. If you don’t really like English type ales, don’t be put off trying this, as it’s very different.
Served in a Thai restaurant, this is the perfect beer to drink with Thai food.

6 flessen gekocht bij AH, uitgeschonken in origineel zeshoekig Hoegaarden glas. Fraai lichtgeel troebel bier met compacte witte schuimkraag die zich vrij snel terugtrekt. Aroma's van Belgische gist, graan, citrus en koriander. De smaak volgt de geur precies, frisse mouten, Belgische gist, sinaasappel en koriander. De afdronk is meer kruidig dan hoppig. Ook weer zo'n klassiek Belgisch bier, dat ik al jaren drink. Voor mij is de Hoegaarden wit nog steeds het beste witbier wat ik tot nu toe heb geproefd, zeer geschikt voor een warme zomerdag. Dorstlessend, licht fris kruidig en perfect gebalanceerd. Wel koud drinken, rond de 3 graden, drinkt dan extreem makkelijk weg.
Bowling alley in Sussex for the 8th grader’s promotion. Light, lemony fruit, tasty. Decent. 13.4
Cloudy yellow pour, fluffy white head. Nose is spice and yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is soft wheat, muted citrus and coriander. Finish is slightly dry, little more citrus kick.

0,33 l Flasche aus der Bierothek in Nürnberg. Hat mich nach dem eingießen, von der Sämigkeit und Farbe sehr an ein bayerisches Hefe-Weizen erinnert. Leicht fruchtiger Geschmack. Gesamt sehr gelungenes Bier

Aromat: Dobrze wyczuwalne przyprawy - głównie kolendra. W tle charakterystyczny zapach pszenicy.

Smak: Niska słodycz uzupełniona jest niską goryczką. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie dobrze wyczuwalne są przyprawy.

Odczucie: Silnie nasycenie dwutlenkiem węgla. Jest to wodnisty lekki Witbier.

Has a nice yeasty aroma. It is cloudy from not being filteret. If poured right it has a very nice head - but most often is poured like a pilsener and then it ends up without any head. It has a nice refreshing yeast and fruit flavor. A great beer on a hot summer day for quencing your thirst.
Halmgul öl med stort vitt skum som dock försvinner ganska snabbt. Doft och smak av citrus, jäst och koriander. , Något tunn kropp. En trevlig sommaröl.

Pours the expected cloudy yellow with a white head that leaves lacing. Nose is witbier yeast with slight cereal notes. Body is medium. Taste is yeast and wheat and wheat and - Bitterness is extremely light - good.  11.2 oz bottle in variety case. Can’t stand the 11.2 bottling. Those Europeans.

Upgraded score from 4.1 to 4.3adding a point each to taste and overall. This is the beer that started the revival of Belgian witbier.

0,33 l bottle. Pours hazy yellowish white, with abundant white head. Aroma is banana, lemon. Fresh, with a full body and metallic taste. Creamy, structured, long finish. Very nice beer :)

Muy turbia, opaco casi blanquecina. Tupida espuma., muy bonita. Aroma seco y cítrico. En boca predominio claro de cítricos, limón. Seca, muy ligera y refrescante. La más comercial y famosa de las wit no deja de ser una referencia del estilo, aunque no esté entre las mejores del mismo.
Bottle 0.33l. Great beer with a taste of lemon. Easy to drink. I recommend to drink it from cup. Has a better taste that way

Aroma: citrus and sweetness. 
Flavour: fruity sweetness with notes of lemon and banana. A somewhat creamy mouthfeel and a lasting fruity aftertaste.

330 ml bottle. Pear colour, short-life small off-white head, ripe pear and tart aroma, light body, soft carbonation, sweet malty and sour fruity (apple, pear) taste, tart wheaty palate with slight lime and orange notes. Well-balanced and smooth.
Cerveja com aroma adistrigente deixando uma sensação muito refrescante. Aparência turva, amarela e espuma branca. Bem refrescante, ótima para se tomar em grande quantidade.

Pour: cloudy golden straw color w/ medium white, foamy head. Smell: banana, coriander, clove, wheat, light orange peel, light alcohol. Taste: wheat, banana, coriander, orange peel. Smooth, light, creamy mouthfeel. Very nice Blegian Wit!! :)

Shared 660ml bottle. Pours cloudy, pale yellow with a thin but lingering white head. Grassy, coriander aroma, taste is mild with citrus and coriander notes. Good beer, can’t believe I haven’t rated this before

The beer has a typical witbier appearance. It is light yellow with a greenish glow. There is some rough foam right after pouring the beer, but it doesn’t last. After seconds the foam collapses to leave just a very thin drape of witness on top of the brew. The smell is not very strong, but nice. There is a gentle refreshing sweetness, orange zest I think. The orange aroma is nice and gives this beer something special. The taste has a nice bitternes and a spicy sensation. The beer is not like other witbieren. It is more robust, i think because of the coriander. It is a nice drink against the thirst on a hot summery day like today.

Nice Belgian beer. Flowery aroma to begin with, beautiful light blonde coloration. Head is off white and stays for a good few minutes. Taste is a little on the bland side, but not offensive in the slightest. Great beer to have after a long day.

Golden Haze, awesome head, aromas of bread and some orange, in the mouth it starts sweet and evolve too some acidity.

Lemony gold with foamy white head. Smells of banana, coriander, citrus, stonefruit, grass and earth. Tastes of banana, apricot, lime, mandarin, coriander. So good for 3 bucks a stubby.

Not everyone will like this as it is not what you expect a beer to taste like. But once you get past that initial surprise it is magnificent.
Last year I held a beer tasting night and this was the number one pick getting at least 4 out of 5 from everyone. I constantly keep some of this in my fridge and both my brother in law and son choose this over anything else I have. It is a light tasting beer and goes particularly well with light and delicate seafood as it neither overwhelms the food nor vice versa. Goes especially well with smoked salmon with cream cheese and chives on crackers. 
Great carbonation makes for an excellent feel. And be prepared for a little bit of sediment. Worth gently rocking the bottle a few times before pouring to have an even, cloudy brew. 
With the different herbal flavours, Hoegaarden is to beer what Bombay Sapphire and Hendricks are to Gin.
Bottle. Pours is cloudy light yellow with persistent whote head, big one. Aroma of spices, coriander, banana, wheat. Taste is fruity, light sweet, wheat, with touch of spices. My all time favourite.

(330cc bottle) Aroma: Sweet, bubble gum. some yeast, touch of banana and ginger/tobacco. 

Appearance: medium-light yellow/straw color, mildly cloudy, white foam, not too much of a head and it goes away pretty quick. 

Taste: Very unique flavor. Some sweetness, but more on the tart side, citrus, maybe some herbal/ginger notes, nutmeg, grass. 

Palate: quite fizzy on the palate at first, a bit oily/creamy but not much fullness, but very crisp, with bitter follow-thru. 

Overall: one of my favorite beers, always enjoyable. Goes with hot or cold weather, and various foods.

Wonderful fruity and yeasty smell. Reminds me of fresh bread dough. Best when really cold.

Pours cloudy golden with a big puffy white head, excellent retention. Aromas of biscuit, coriander, pepper, banana. Light body, lively, crisp. Gently sweet, a little citrus tartness, and a light bitter finish. Very satisfying and drinkable.

A hazy light straw color with a foamy white head. Sweet light malt with a little orange and lemon and a hint of pepper. Taste is pleasant sweet malt with the same orange and lemon with a little coriander coming through. Totally refreshing and imminently drinkable. A nice soft medium body with plenty of carbonation.
Aparência muito bonita....boa....levemente salgada....gostei muito....bem refrescante e aromática. No aroma casca de laranja e coentro. Paladar cítrico e especiarias.

This is one of those beers I’ve had tons of times never really though anything of it other than it’s refreshing, cheap and tastes good. Well I grabbed a pint can of it in France for the exact same reason but this time around I actually was kind of blown away at how good it it. For a macro beer, this one actually can stand up to many beers of the style. Aroma is peppery, spicy sweetness with a subtle sweet fruit aroma. Taste is spectacular. I had it out of the can and in a glass and honestly, the can was even better. Nice peppery spiciness followed by a bubblegum sweetness. Lots of fresh fruit followed by a nice refreshing wheat beer finish. Don’t really know what else to call it. I don’t usually get all charged up about macro beers or imports but this one is really good. I don’t know if theres a difference in the European cans and the ones we get stateside but it was delicious and I definitely had my share while I was in Europe. Cheers

2015 bottle. A hazy light straw color with a foamy white head. Sweet light malt with a little orange and lemon and a hint of pepper. Taste is pleasant sweet malt with the same orange and lemon with a little coriander coming through. Totally refreshing and imminently drinkable. A nice soft medium body with plenty of carbonation.

Old rating. Pours hazy, very light yellow, with a finger thick creamy head. Aroma is Belgian yeast and sweet citrus with orange peel, as well as bubblegum and coriander. Full body, with quite fizzy carbonation. Flavour is sweet fruity yeast, as well as some light, grainy malts.

Aroma is full of the coriander spice. Spice spice baby!!...Appearance, I love unfiltered beers! This one is pretty. It pours an applesauce color, and being cloudy like it is, it looks like applesauce. Pours a super foamy head, wouldn’t call it thick though. It didn’t last long...Taste is not so good. The description above calls it "sweet and sour" and my thought is it leans more toward the sour. After the head goes away it’s better, I’m still not impressed. The orange peel comes through more so now....Mouthfeel, it’s quite carbonated, and it’s soft, and still sour....Overall, at first I thought I had a skunk, it was very sour. But my thoughts changed a little after the head went away, but my ratings reflect my average reaction to it. EXPIRATION DATE IS 20 MONTHS AWAY!! What’s up with that?

330ml Dose. Golden und naturtrüb. Grosse Schaumkrone. Volles, angenehmes Weizenaroma. Milder Abgang.

Cloudy straw-orange body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Orange zest, light coriander, soft wheat, light cracker. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, gentle sweetness through, clean, refreshing finish. Not overly complex, but well executed and enjoyable.
An unfiltered, pale, cloudy Wit beer with high white head. Aroma is fresh fruit, citrus, banana, yeast, malt, spices. Taste is sweet, light bitter, light tart. Very pearly.

Bottle @ Lõunakeskus, Tartu.
Fruity aroma, coriander, cloves. Sour with sweet finish. Well balanced and refreshing.

Cloudy straw colored beer with a thick foamy bright white head that lasts. Nose of orange, coriander, and pepper. Bracing citrus flavor hits immediately before subsiding into layers of spice and sugar with virtually no bitterness at all--it comes across as a really good shandy with some added spice. Crisp and refreshing, this is pretty delicious and about the easiest drinking beer out there (I finished the whole glass while writing this), but I’m not in the mood for another.

Dark Bottle, Tesco, Edinburgh City. Pours light amber with a thick, foamy head, subsiding slowly. Scent is medium wheat, but simple. Taste is a dense wheat and weizen yeast with a little hint of citrus, maybe coriander. Palette is light and simple, but not detracting. A good beer.

Zapach z butelki to przede wszystkim słód pszeniczny i drożdże. Kolor piwa to ciemna słomka, jest ono całkowicie mętne. Piana wysoka, idealnie biała, w miarę drobna, powoli opada do niskiej. Aromat ze szkła niby jest dosyć „witowy”, bo są drożdże, jest słód, ale ze skórką pomarańczy jest już tam gorzej, nie mówiąc już o kolendrze, której nie wyczuwam prawie w ogóle. W smaku ponownie w miarę wyraźnie czuć skórkę pomarańczy. Kolendra jest, ale bardzo nikła. W samym piwnym ciele nie ma niczego ciekawego – wygląda na to, że jest ono dosyć wysoko odfermentowane, a przez to puste i nieco wodniste. Wysycenie wysokie, ale typowe dla stylu. Trudno się zachwycić tym piwem, choć nie jest ono złe. Biorąc pod uwagę, że jest ono koncerniakiem, to można się wręcz pokusić o stwierdzenie, że jest wybitne. Uważa się je za ikonę stylu, niemniej jak to w koncerniakach, zostało mocno uładzone na potrzeby masowego odbiorcy.
Absolutely love this beer. Drink it all the time at home whenever I feel like it. Refreshing. Not too strong. Great for almost any occasion.
Coriander aroma. Cloudy. Crisp Coriander flavor. Sweet with a spiced aftertaste. A great wit.
Bottle Pour citrus light taste, hazy straw color, nice head, can taste the spicyness of coriander, nice carbonation not to fizzy,

More of a refreshing summer cooler than for a winter evening, and clearly a macro product, but a good one.

Poured from a 12 oz into a tumbler in late 2013.

A: Yellow/white with no head. See through.

S: Banana, citrus, chemicals.

T: Follows the nose.

M: Crisp. Very light in the mouth.

O: This was one that I had wanted to try as I was making my way through other wits. The story and tradition of the beer was appealing too, so I gave it a shot. The reviews that I read at the time described a beer that was different from what I had. It was ruined by a terrible chemical flavor. I didn’t trust my palate, so I tried to find other mentions of the chemical taste. Someone (I can’t find who now, unfortunately) mentioned that the beer had changed since the AB InBev takeover. That launched my search into the conglomerate and opened my eyes quite a bit about macro brewers.

Pours a lemonade colored foggy robe having some vivid effervescence. The head is at first foamy and then stays like a thin creamy barrier. You can get the orange zest from the nose that makes it fresh and surprising and wheat of course adding some corpus. I couldn’t really find the coriander that I think gets lost in all that powerful bitterness leaving the back of the tongue overwhelmed. The malt and orange zest are very refreshing but I was dissapointed by its lack of spice to balance out the acidic sour side of that ale. Not a real fan of whites and from my point of view, this one won’t make me become one.

Fluorescent cloudy pale yellow; wheat, citrus mandarine. Best Belgian touch in wheat beer. That is why this is probably one of the best widely known wheat beers in the world. Ideal for hot summer days, but now on my hemisphere is cold winter weather – but I can drink it without problems.
3 bottles, great wheat beer pours hazy straw sweet citrus malty aroma crisp fruity spicy taste

coriander, and orange aromas, with a light banana aroma. appear unclear pale, with a fine white head taste light bitter. lively carbonation, short aftertaste.

Aromatique plutôt sucrée et levures. Puis orange et citron un peu acide. Epicé coriandre. Houblonnage pas perceptible.
En bouche relativement sucrée avec levures bien présentes. Le côté citrus-orange moins perceptible qu’au nez, petite acidité. Pas ou peu d’amertume. Fin plutôt sucrée. Bonne carbonatation.

Strokleurig troebel bier met witte schuimkraag.
