Mild zoet in de mond, laag bitterig en zoetig in de afdronk.

11.2 oz bottle, poured into a tulip glass at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Pours a pale straw, and is amazingly cloudy, to the point that I can scarcely see the shadow of my fingers on the opposite side of the glass. Formed an immense head of white foam, that quickly fell away to a ring and several patchy islands of cap. No lacing to speak of, alas.

S: Fruit and wheat spring out of the glass at first whiff, laden with nigh hefeweizen levels of banana and coriander spice. There’s a tang of citrus underlying the primary aromas, and an overall sweetness that beckons to my hop-averse palate.

T: The flavor profile has a definite core of sweet wheat, around which the fruit and spice notes are wrapped. Citrus notes abound through the beer, ranging from orange to mandarin and clementine, and the spice tones include coriander and just a hint of clove. Tinges of white pepper waft through the background, and a faint whisper of banana skulks about the shadows of the ester flavors.

M: Rather thin and watery, moreso than expected for the level of cloudiness in the glass. While I’d expect most any wheat beer to be light-bodied, this beer lends itself to a quick flash of flavor across the palate, and then a lingering watery aftertime.

O: For a witbier available at my local grocery store for a reasonable price, this is quite tasty. A little more strength in the body, and I’d call it a regular.

Une bière neutre ou l’on sent des tonalités épicées en arrière-goût. Une pointe de citron et de gingembre.
Bière rafraichissante.

Poured from bottle. Cloudy pale yellow. Nice head. Yeasty wheat aroma. A very nice refreshing Belgian style beer with subtle coriander hints. A little watery. More wheaty and less sweet and fruity than a Blue Moon.
Very good blend of wheat and hops with a fruity hint. A nice amount of spice added to accent the wheat flavor.

Overpriced 12 oz bottle at some pub across the street from Nagasaki Station. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of wheat, citrus, herbs, light banana. Tastes of citrus, lemon, herbs, light yeast and banana. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
have had this a few times not a massive fan of belgian beers but this one is ok its very easy to get hold of you get a taste of orange through the beer

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 16A). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 02222:1319 AROMA: orange and citrusy aromas mixed with coriander. mdoerate sweet wheat background. hop aromas not discernible. APPEARANCE: pale straw color and hazy. average moussy white head with below average retention. TASTE: mild sweetness with a wheat component that persists. the coriander and citrus flavours are less stronger than the aromas. low bitterness with a semi-sweet finish. PALATE: medium-low body with average carbonation. OVERALL: the traditional wit with more subtle flavours than the aromas.
Easy drinkable white beer. Cloudy yellow with white foam. Nose of citrus and coriander.

Diminishing white head, quite yellow’ish body, near-clear. Laceless.

The famous Hoegaarden Witbier, created by the late Pierre Celis in the late sixties as Oud Hoegaards, then sold to then-Interbrew and nowadays still one of AB InBev’s great marketing successes. Time for an objective analysis, poured from a 25 cl can. Shows the typical moussy, dense and stable, creamy, off-white head leaving good lacing; colour is a pale lemony yellow blonde with a somewhat greenish hue, equally cloudy from the start. Aroma immediately recognizable as the thirst-quencher I had dozens of times from tap and from bottles: soap, coriander seed, raw white cabbage, sourish wheat, white bread, lime zest, fresh orange peel, white candi sugar, starch, ’industrial’ apple cake, vanilla pudding, allspice, moscadet wine, sweetened yoghurt but very clear iron as well; strangely for an AB InBev beer, I can detect no sign of pasteurization, so I assume it is a ’living’ beer. Taste starts with a sweetish, applish fruitiness, hint of apricot, minerally carbo, the sourishness of which is further enhanced by the wheat and a dried lemon peel effect, mellow and gentle, smooth mouthfeel, starch again as in potato mash, something sugary lingering on, thinnish and a bit metallic, finishing in a bready malt sweetness and lightly sourish ’wheatiness’, drying coriander and low but noticeable grassy hoppiness, leafy and lingering at the back of the tongue longer than expected. Anyone who knows me is familiar with my aversion against AB InBev, but I have to admit this is one of their better products; once again I would wish for a time machine to taste this back in the seventies, but in its current form, it is still very acceptable as the archetype of the witbier style. When InBev intended to move production of this from their Hoegaarden plant to Jupille for economical reasons, a storm of protest arose in Belgium, aptly illustrating the Belgians’ loyalty to their national brands; I was given the opportunity to taste two experimental preproduction brews of it made in Jupille and liked the spicier version of the two better, but eventually InBev had to give in and bring this iconic beer back to Hoegaarden. I have the impression they are ’afraid’ to tinker with it any further: this is a beacon of Belgian brewing art, something one does not compromize. A side-by-side tasting of this grandfather of witbiers and its many clones would prove interesting, I think. But no matter how loyal this is to its style: it still has a slight metallic, common, impersonal, industrial feel to it and to my taste, it is too sweet for the style. Still: AB InBev seems to keep a remarkably good quality standard towards this, so let’s argue it still remains the ultimate witbier, setting a standard of its own. I hate to admit it, but there is not much wrong with this - if seen in its context of style, of course. But let’s not compare with the dozens of artisanal, ’deviating’ takes on the style (especially Wallonian), though: that would be an unfair comparison...

330ml bottle served in its own tumbler glass. 
A: Pours a completely cloudy pale yellow color forming a huge and creamy white head. Great retention with tons of soapy lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Smell is a must! Complex and very spicy. Coriander, orange zest, vanilla, Belgium bready yeasts, sweet pale grains, wheat, fruity esters and flowery hops. 
T: Complex as the nose. Very spicy beer. Wheat backbone. Notes of pale malts, coriander, pepper, orange zest, vanilla and sweet bread. Light bitterness. Citrus hops and earth notes in the end. 
M: Medium body. Smooth and creamy. Medium carbonation. Citrus and bready aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. Classic Belgian Witbier. Malty, spicy, fruity and VERY refreshing.
[ BA Review @ 9/3/2010 ]

Transfer from BA review on 5-17-13-

 Served on tap in a pint glass

 Appearance – Served a hazy straw colored brew with a two finger white head. The head had a moderately good level of retention, fading over time to give decent lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma is heaviest of wheat and citrus with the citrus being of lemon and grapefruit. Mixed with these aromas are some lighter spicier aromas of a coriander and some lemongrass, producing overall a classic wit aroma

 Taste –The taste begins with a wheaty and lemon flavor upfront. The taste sweetens quickly as flavors of tangerine and banana come to the tongue. Along with these sweeter flavors, so to comes a light spice flavor of coriander. These tastes take the taste to its end, leaving a sweet citrus flavor of orange and sweet white grapefruit as well as some wheat flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the slightly lighter side with a carbonation level that is a tad on the higher side. The overall feel is rather nice of the style as it makes it quite easy to drink and suits the sweeter and citrus flavors quite well.

 Overall – Quite an easy drinking and refreshing wheat and sweet citrus brew.

Tego słynnego wita szukałem nawet dłuższy czas w warszawskich sklepach - w sumie zaskoczyło mnie, że nie jest wcale taki łatwy do kupienia. Kiedy już wpadł w moje ręce, oczekiwałem wiele. Może zbyt wiele, bo pośladków mi nie urwał. Aromat bardziej przypominał mi weizena, a nie tego oczekiwałem. W smaku już było lepiej - uderza cytrusowe orzeźwienie, jednak piwo jest zbyt przyprawowe w aromacie, by piło się lekko i przyjemnie. Bukiet fenoli jednak skłania do refleksji, a nie do żłopania - a mając w ręku wita nastawiam się na sporą pijalność. Niemniej cieszę się, że spróbowałem legendy - chociaż wątpię, żebym do tego piwa powrócił - no chyba, że nie będzie wyboru. Piwo nabyłem w jednym z warszawskich delikatesów Alma za około 6,50 zł.

Bon, accrochons-nous … Puisque cette bière est mondialement connue, il faudra bien
en faire la critique !!!!!
Couleur paille claire (minimum syndical pour une blanche …).
Apparence troublée comme un brouillard d’octobre (c’est bizarre pour une bière d’été,
à boire en terrasse … mais c’est aussi le minimum syndical …)
Bulles grosses et peu nombreuses. Mousse ridicule.
Arômes (si l’on peut dire) de petites épices, agrumes et camomille.
1ère bouche pâteuse sur de la paille et un citron très léger.
Arrière-bouche on ne peut plus courte.
2ème avec un zeste d’orange (ou plutôt orangina..). Très très limitée.
3ème au faible goût de froment.
Longueur d’agrumes mais très faibles, avec une pointe de tabac blond à un moment.
Levure douce mais extrêmement banale.
Alcool pour fillettes à l’école.
Finale qui sent même un peu la pharmacie !!!!
CONCLUSION : je préfère rester poli … (mais c’est bien signé Inbev ...)

Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, orange peel, light banana, coriander, clove, wheat, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon zest, pear, orange peel, light banana, coriander, clove, wheat, bread, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt notes; with good robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with no warming present after the finish as expected of 4.9%, Overall this is a damn nice witbier. All around well balanced and robust flavors of fruity/earthy yeast, spice, and pale malt; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

750ml bottle from Tesco - Cloudy, pale yellow body, white medium-sized head, that slowly fades away. Nose of white bread, a lot of fruit, banana, orange and coriander. Very sweet and fruity taste with banana, some coriander and some orange peel. This is decent enough for a mass produced witbier. and great for the summer.

From a can. The classic. A rather milky looking pale yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is a lively mix of citrus, banana, coriander, yeast, wheat. The flavour is lemon, lightly sour, wheat. I left this in the freezer for a while so it’s ice cold. It is very refreshing. A friend told me today that "witbier’s are a mistake".
Ljusgul grumlig med stort vit skum. Inte mycket doft eller smak men weissbier karaktär
Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Smells wheaty with a hint of bubblegum. Taste is sweet, but of banana with a wheat finish.
Tiene un sabor muy particular que la diferencia de las demas cervezas que e tomado. Muy buena

Just perfect! Best wheat beer.
Strong taste.
Heavy to drink too much, but very good taste.

Can. Pours hazy light yellow, dense fluffy two finger head. Aroma is a bit bubblegum, some pepper end citrusy. Taste is medium sweet, oranges. Bit parfume. Finish with notes of coriander and then nothing. Shame there’s nothing in the finish and feel.

Bottle. One finger fast white head, minimal lacing. Hazy yellow. Floral aroma. Crispy palate. Well balaced, delicious taste with citrus, spicies, tropical fruits and nice hops. My favourite for hot summer days.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy beer. Aroma of orange, coriander and citrus. Taste is citrus an spice. Thin body. Refreshing but not special
Bottle 750ml. Hazy beige yellow with medium creamy white head. Fresh aroma of apricots, floral, honey. Sweet floral flavor, citrus, a bit earthy. Lively carbonation. Light body.

i don’t even know where to begin just amazing, the aroma is completely heavenly along to go with the lucidity of the beer itself. palate is real sensual actually provides a drinking experience, real slick and the finish is absolutely abrupt a beer that makes you wanna go for more for sure.
Heavier white with smooth citrus and clove hints and a sweet finish. Thick head, flowery aroma.
Drank from the bottle. Aroma is wheat, yeast, and orange. Taste is coriander, orange, dough, and wheat. Crisp beer with a medium body and moderate carbonation.
golden, cloudy, white foam, dough, herbs, hay, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Trapped in the airport at Brussels? Grab a beer. Why not rate one of the big ones you haven’t rated yet. The context behind this beer made it taste better since it was to calm my nerves but regardless...pours a hazy hay colored yellow with a full white head. Aromas of coriander spice, slight orange, yeast. The taste is slightly tangy. Medium body and high carb.

Cloudy, pale light yellow color. Small white head. Aroma of wheat. Not that much taste. Wheat. Light body. Soft.
A 330 ml from a Sofia supermarket. Very light but hazy in colour with big and steady head and well carbonated. The aroma is citrus-y. The taste is sweet and refreshing with a bit of an exotic nuance.

A very enjoyable Belgian witbier, fresh and flavorful, a little on the lighter side but I suppose that makes it more quaffable. Pours a lighter golden orange hazy color with good proportional head and lacing. Aroma is clean banana and yeast, some wheat and grain. Taste is the same, a little light on the flavor intensity but sufficient. Mouthfeel is thinner than I would prefer but is ok, finishes smooth and clean. A good average white beer, also seems to be in a decent price range, and better than the macro alternatives. Recommended overall, but weheinstephaner hefeweiss is the finest in this category, and is essentially similar to this but with amplified intensity.

Keg at the estcourt arms. Revisiting an old staple. Clouded bright yellow straw coloured pour with a steadfast white head. Aroma is lemon citrus, wheat grains and some lavender floral notes in the nose as well. Flavour is wheat, citrus lemon, chalk and semi sweet in the finish. Palate is loose, grainy and thin. Decent enough although I remember it being better.

33cl. Can. 

Pours hazy yellow with white head. 

Aroma banana, coriander, orange, yeast. 

Taste sweet, sour. 

Mouthfeel creamy, medium carbo. 

Nice Wit.
På flaska från systemet. Ljusgul grumlig vätska. Doftar syrlig sött. Smakar citrus och vete.

330ml bottle from Carrefour, Xintiandi, Changchun. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of yeast and spice. Initial taste is of a German weiss with a lemon edge. Refreshing on a hot evening.

Alright, I guess I’ll finally do this.
This was poured into a mug for review but have had in mainly pint glasses over the years.
The appearance was a really nice looking hazy pale yellow to orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds. There’s some light lacing.
The smell was fairly yeasty with a semi-tough sour note coming through in a sharp citrusy of sorts.
The taste was mainly sweet yeasty and sour with a light backing from the citrus notes.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium with a fairly decent sessionable quality about it. The carbonation seemed fairly subdued with nothing really over the top to suggest this was a very good mouthfeel.
Overall, honestly, as many times as I have had this, I will say, and I know this is true to its style but really, this is just an average beer to me and that I’m not really into it.

Pours hazy pale yellow with a big but quickly disappearing head. Sweet and sour aroma with citrus, malts and some spices. Taste is slightly malty with sweetish citrus and some spices too. Slightly sour but very short finish. Mild and watery. A typical Belgian witbier; a good thirst quencher but rather tasteless. (0,33 l bottle, best before 04.04.2015)

33cl bottle. Drunk many times over the years. This is a rating from bottle at the White Horse, Parson Green. Pours unfiltered, hazy pale yellow with big creamy head. Classic wit aroma, lots of spice and coriander. Taste is vibrant and floral with spice, coriander and orange rind, and its possibly a little sweeter than i remember. A classic without a doubt.

Meglehetősen fakó, citromlé színű főzet szerény méretű habbal a tetején, mely amilyen gyorsan képződött, olyan hamar el is tűnt. Aromája enyhén komlós, fűszeres, íze kezdetben eléggé homogén, majd egyre határozottabban különülnek el az egyes ízjegyek. Élénk jellege miatt kissé éles benyomást keltve korianderes, citrusos, enyhén csípős zamatok kezdenek kibontakozni, melyek mögött egy meglehetősen vékony test húzódik, leginkább frissítő, élénkítő hatást váltva ki kortyolása során. A búzasöröknek tehát azt a típusát adja, melyben elsősorban a sör szomjoltó tulajdonsága érvényesül, mindez természetesen prémium minőségben.
On tap at PH. Cloud yellow colour with a good frothy white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and orange peel.
Faint coriander and citrus aroma. Pours cloudy gold with awesome head that stays forever. Carbonic bite. Wheat taste but less than expected. Dry finish.
355ml bottle. Had always mistakenly believed this was standard macro-swill. It’s not; it’s a light, balanced, flavourful, refreshing Wit. Who knew?
Preço acessível. Encontra se nos mercados pão de açúcar. Leve refrescante e com sabor marcante. Amargos baixo para o estilo o que torna facil o consumo de grandes quantidades.
Very hazy yellow with white head. Nice aroma with citrus and spices. Flavor of citrus, spices, and a little banana. Very drinkable and refreshing.
Hazy gold thin rimmi g white head; aroma is bananna Nd slight grain; feels light soft semi fizz; finishes dry grainy yeasty

Pours golden with thin white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, orange peel. Tastes of bananas, orange peel is prominent (perhaps a little too prominent),aalong with cloves, yeast and citrus. Nice beer, though maybe a little watery.
the classic of classics, if i need a delicious easy-to-find beer, it’s the beer of choice

Surprised to find I had not rated this faded beauty. Nose is banana, coriander, a little pepper a little orange. Taste is coriander, wheat, banana, dough and a little almond. The finish is too short. It?s a decent supermarket beer, and often the saviour in a provincial bar. Edit: I think this is getting worse. Now thinner and increasingly soapy

12oz bottle. Can’t believe it’s been this long and I haven’t rated this iconic beer, it’s about time! I honestly don’t really see the point in bothering to rate all the taste and aroma characteristics of this beer -- the bottom line is you should drink try this beer, period. It’s the phoenix of beer - risen from the ashes and more popular than ever. Delightful in spring/summer/fall weather. A classic.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Bottle pours lively, hazy and as you’d expect a very pale lemony colour. There’s a lot going on in the aroma and I can’t pick it all out but I think there’s citrus and banana. It’s nice and mellow. There’s plenty of banana in the flavour as well with a sharper hop edge and a light, lemony twist to it. The aftertaste is quite airy and floral. Very nice indeed.

I’ve drink only one time this wit beer, but, the first approach was good, pale light white color, aroma and taste of wheat with coriander notes, lightly acid, refreshing sure at low temperatur, unfortunately my bottle was not really fresh... But, not bad...
Nice biscuit aroma. Cloudy yellow, pouring a nice head with some lacing. Coriander, slight orange. Refreshing on the back of the throat. Excellent summer refresher!
Very thin, smooth. Orange peel taste with a hint of spicy tart (like Goose Sofie).

Very nice beer. Spicy taste with citrus feel. Medium body and head. Light color and aromas of coriander, orange and a little bit of cinnamon i think. Yeast is coming to complete the experience leaving you with a long aftertaste. I recommend it especially in summer evenings.
660ml bottle, pours hazy light golden brown with a foamy white head. Aroma is straw, hay and biscuit malt, coriander with orange peel. Finish has bitterness coming through and is balanced.
Nice color and taste. Flavor has a citric taste and and complex aroma. The head is large and long lasting.

Spicy, but not too spicy aroma: smells a bit like a gingerbread, albeit less invasive, perhaps because of the wheat. Tastes of banana, with very gentle hops hint, and a generous dose of dough-like flavors. Very refreshing, everything that wheat beer should be in its traditional rendition.

Aroma holds many spices....not overwhelming, but you definitely can't miss it. Initial taste is a high acidity laced with spices. On the palate, the spices really come to life and a hint of orange steps in. If in the mood for a Belgian, this could be your buddy through the night.

Hazy lemon colour with fair white head. Coriander seed and orange on the nose. Light sweet and bitter, trace of sour on the tongue. Negligible hops. Thin and light finish.
Ordered it on O’learys with a slice of lemon (!) in the glass. The beer tastes good, but nevertheless it seems that it’s far too characterless and thin for me.

Classic Belgian Wheat.

Bottle fro sainsburys. Pale misty gold with a creamy head. Wheaty aroma with banana. Same taste but with a hit of citrus. Lovely palate, really nice.

Pronounced wheat aroma, strong white head. Light yellow-ish colour, sediment in the glass. Subtle coriander on the nose, hint of orange. Medium taste, very light finish. No hop in sight, as is to be expected. It’s Hoegaarden, what do you expect.

DATE REVIEWED: May 22, 2014... GLASSWARE: Hoegaarden tumbler... OCCASION: freshman baseball--officially over, and marking the day with the official wit... APPEARANCE: pours a pale, golden yellow, unfiltered and misty with bubbles; white uneven head rings the glass; attractive... AROMA: profound yeast and lemon zest; a suggestion of citrus, but not enough to overpower... PALATE: bubbly, refreshing almost medium-bodied; a bit fizzy too; unlike most wits, it supplies a lingering aftertaste... TASTE: tart--banana! lemon is secondary, and some citric, slightly acidic elements in the aftertaste--this is what warm nights were made for...OVERALLL: I recall being really turned on to this beer in 20003,, when traveling through Europe in record-breaking heat drove Shan and I toward sidewalk cafes and alcohol that refreshed; cutting through the sentiment, Hoegaarden does indeed refresh with enough character to be sought after among the myriad of summer ales....
Light yellow towards white, nice white head. Mild sour aroma with a hint of mandarine. Mild sour taste with hint of dry candy. Mild bitterness in the aftertaste. High in carbon.
Pale cloudy yellow color. Coriander and orange on the aroma, also hops. Orange and a little spicy taste with refreshing floral hop ending.
Wonderful bitter aroma, long lasting taste, smells nice, I wish I could buy 50 cl bottles

Butelka 0.33L.


Wygląd: Cytrynowo-białe, mocno zmętnione. Piana bardzo obfita, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa z kożuchem, lekko pofalowana. 


Aromat: Cytryna, albedo cytryny, kolendra, drożdże. Zielona herbata, ice tea cytrynowa. Bardzo rześki.


Smak: Skórka cytrynowa, cytryna, skórka pomarańczowa, pomarańcza, kolendra, słoma, drożdże. Lekka owocowa goryczka.


Odczucie: Ciało lekko powyżej niskiego. Wysycenie średnie, perliste. Faktura kremowo-pudrowa dość gładka.


Całość: Świetny WIT. Bardzo orzeźwiający, niesamowicie pijalny. Na gorące dni idealny.
330 ml bottle. Hazy light yellow with big white head. Smell is banana and herbs. Taste is sweet with banana and grass and herbs. Some orange. Very drinkable.

Cloud yellow colour with a good frothy white head. The aroma is a citrus, banana, wheat malt and dough yeast. Taste is similar with accentuated banana and yeast and a hint orange peel to give the very slightest bitter finish. Average carbonation with a light to medium refreshing body.

Poured and from bottle. Very pale color and pillowy head. Clean crisp beer with spice and citrus flavors.
Bland white beer. I had it straight from the bottle so maybe I didn’t get the full effect.

Pours a cloudy straw colour, with a pillowy white head. Aroma notes include coriander, citrus, peppery, and yeasty. Tasting notes include coriander, orange peel, Belgian yeast, and a peppery finish. The palate is light, and refreshing. A classic, and a bench mark for the Belgian Wit style.

Bottle. I love the smell of this, bubblegum and grapefruit. It tastes of the coriander and orange, and other spices as well, you feel it in your mouth, but it is all good. Has a nice dry and refreshing finish. Probably one of my more favourite with beers.

Bouteille de 330 ml (5% ABV) achetée dans un IGA local. Dégustée en novembre 2002. Bière blonde voilée (non filtrée). Mousse très très peu, absence de col. Assez effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur de levure, de blé/banane prononcée. Très douce, assez sucrée, un peu amère en finale. Arrière-goût présent mais pas marqué. Très bonne, rafraichissante, mais manque un peu de caractère.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow colour with a huge white head. Aroma is citrus, yeast, spices, coriander and wheat. Sweet and spicy flavour with notes of coriander, citrus and wheat. Very refreshing beer for summer.

This whitey got me into the style and is still a favourite. Big shiny golden wheat colour adorned with a big frothy foam. Scent of coriander, tangerine and frying bacon. Taste is the same, throw some fresh whole wheat bread in there and some light grapefruit. Nice rollicking feel, easily enjoyed but thick enough to be satisfying. The finish lasts a long time. I always love how it tastes a bit baconish, like the grease drippings.
Trübe Optik, perlig. In der Nase Zitrus, Gras, leichte Hefenoten. Geschmack: Etwas Banane, schöne Säure, leichte Hefe. Insgesamt weich, etwas wässrig, gut trinkbar.

Aroma- tart, some spices, orange,
Appearance- pale yellow with a big white head, very carbonated.

Bottle, 750 ml. Pours cloudy yellow with a fair amount of soapy white head, though this does dissipate quickly. Strongly malty aroma with notes of biscuit and creamier varieties of rice pudding. No hops. Tastes of shortbread biscuits, butter, and small amount of some fruit, perhaps orange? Again no detectable hops or bitterness. Pleasant drinking, (usually) low cost and wide distribution makes this a good staple beer for me.

Appearance - light off yellow. Decent foam. Good amount of Belgium yeast gives this one a great taste- some lemon too. A great introduction to the style and ver affordable.

25 FL. OZ ($4.59) This beer is a fairly common beer in european restaurants. Its light and fairly light on flavor too. not hoppy in the slightest.
Muy grande esta cerveza belga. Un sabor muy sólido y consistente. Suave pero con mucho mucho paladar.

It was poured into its signature tumbler glass. Color was light yellow and hazy with a tall foamy white head. The head holds on well and makes some nice lacing on the glass. It has a very inviting aroma of wheat, citrus, and spice. The flavor is much the same with a wonderful balance of wheaty malts, Belgian yeast, dried orange peel and coriander. Nice sweet/tart finish with good carbonation and a medium to light body. This is a great summer time beer and one of my favorite wheat beers.
Bottle. Cloudy light yellow with thick white head. Sweet coriander aroma. Taste is smooth, fresh, fruity. Orange, coriander. Great refresher
Lekko metne, jasno-?ó?te piwo o obfitej bia?ej pianie. W aromacie zbo?owego z wyra?na nut? pomara?czy. W smaku delikatne, slodkawe z delikatn? cytrusowa nut?.

33 cl  glass bottle. Pours quite large nice looking frothy pearl head, which dissolves average rapidly. Extremly pale golden, almost white looking, "giallo paglierino" (strawy yellow) as we would say in Italian. Nice floreal wheat, alomst CORN, aroma. Sweet floreal, quite pleasent taste, well balanced; delicate. Very light fruity, almost watery palate, with soft carbonation, and very little spices at the end. Actually astonoshing high price/value in my opinion; one of the best commercial beers you can find out there (at least here in europe/Italy). Costs the same of others crappier beers.
Highly sessionable classic blanche, almost ideal for any moment, from the meals to the casual sofa beer.

From 0,33l bottle. BBD: 18.10.14. Pours nice cloudy pale straw to orange liquid, nice medium frothy white head. Aroma: wheat, bubblegum, banana, lemon, Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, medium sour, lemon, bubblegum, light banana. Palate: light body, thin texture, lively carbonation, abrupt lemon aftertaste. Overall: drinkable, refreshing, but taste too lemony and bubblegum. Would appreciate more banana and malt.

On tap at Budweiser Fort Collins. Appearance: two fingers white head, cloudy straw yellow color, good lacing. Aroma: earthy yeasty, coriander, fruity. Palate: light body, lively carbonation, dry finish. Taste: light sweeness to light tartness and slightest bitter. Overall, super drinkable, very simple, great balance.
The best of the white beers going around. Great taste. Only problem with the hoeys is they can be hard work after 6 of em if your planning a big night

Bottle 330ml.
Pours hazy pale blond/whitish with high white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of wheat, citrus, coriander, oranges. Taste is of wheat, citrus, corainder, some acidity, sweetness. Palate: Light body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good. Refreshing. Tasty.
On tap. Cloudy yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are wheat, orange peel, lemon, hay and coriander. Light body, moderate carbonation, watery texture.

On tap poured into a hefeweizen glass. The aroma is mostly citrus, with a bit of a toast and spice aroma as well. It pours a hazy orange yellow with a puffy white head that has an ample retention, but no lace. It’s an overall very mellow drink, with a zesty sweet kick - medium levels of sweet, with a low bitter, and a touch of sour citrus. It’s dry, crisp, and refreshing. with a medium body, creamy texture, and a good amount of soft carbonation. It finishes with a citrus sweet, and very light pine and spice bitterness. It’s clean, leaving only light traces of toast and citrus jelly.

pours a hazy lemon yellow with a thick white foamy head. Aroma is light hay/grass with just a hint of citrus. Tastes crisp, with wheat and a hint of coriander. fairly dry slightly bittersweet finish. Not bad at all. Good beer!
500ml on tap. Aroma is citrus, light hops and wheat. Appearance is cloudy orange with a nice white foam. Taste is light sour, light bitter. A soft carbonation, medium dryness. Cool and refreshing.

Taste is fresh Weissen style, develops a lemon/lime undertone. Great thirst quencher, particularly during summer. Always get it without a slice of lemon, it spoils the natural citric flavor and overwhelms the beer&rsquo;s wheaty undertone. Occasionally, I do enjoy to drink it from a slightly frozen Hoegaarden glass, although this makes the taste fade somewhat.
Straw yellow cloudy beer with hefty white foam head. Aroma of coriander and citrus-like hop aroma. Taste is fresh and spicy.

Bière blanche sans intérêt à part s’il en reste dans la glacière du pique-nique et qu’il fait encore 30°C à 18H...
My favourite summertime beer. Light aromatic with a nice after taste. I buy this whenever I see it.

I definitely have a more feminine pallet, or as some say I don’t like beer. I went to The Pub with my husband and let my waiter pick beers for me. I loved Hoegaarden. I was pleasantly surprised and am now planning our next trip to The Pub and also looking for Hoegaarden in bottles.
Cerveja leve e suave. Toques cítricos no nariz que chegam firmes no sabor. Este é apimentado e bem balanceado. Final claro.
this is a tasty brew!! really a winner the slight fruity tast is not a overkill and still stays true to its beer flavor!!

For a Witbier, this one is pretty much a standard. Aroma is citrus, coriander, faint banana. The taste is citrus, wheaty, somewhat spicy with coriander. Finish is sweet like you’d expect with a citrus burp.
One of my favorites. Very glad the recipe was not lost forever. Love the style but always laugh to myself when I make eye contact with a bartender and say HOE... garden
Backlog. Tried on tap and bottled a number of times. Wheat (Obviously) with a good dose of citrus, apricots and herbs. Slightly light-bodied.
I’m kind of disappointed that one of my favorite beers is a mainstream import, but when a beer is good a beer is good.
Hazy light yellow in colour. Very carbonated, slight belgium soureness, a little clove, tangy. Very refreshing
En internationell storsäljare. Ganska mesig och lite småtrist. Sommaröl, men det finns bättre.
La référence des bière blanche abordable il faut forcément commencé par la hoegaarden pour pouvoir comparer les autres blanches ensemble

Sweet wheaty nose, pours nice and cloudy, deliciously balanced spicy Belgian taste, refreshing natural carbonation and a clean finish. So damn good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy and the color of light straw. When held to the light in the room it’s a lemony yellow. head is fat white and lasts. Nose was mild. Lemon a bit of pepper and some wheat like a light cracker. Taste follows the nose all the way. Lemon on light cracker with a bit of tartness on the back end. Watery and thin body. It finishes very dry and leaves a light sweetness in the aftertaste. Refreshing and very mild.

Aroma: coriander, orange, wheat, light sourness, 
Appearance: Hazy yellow body. Large white head.
Flavour: Spicy, corriander, sweet, orange zest. bread. crisp, refreshing, light sourness, wheaty, tart, 
Palate: medium-light body, high carbonation.
Overall: PERFECTION! Beautiful. 

750 ml bottle, poured.
16A. Witbier
Flaska från Systembolaget. Grumlig Ljusgul vätska med stort vitt skum. Doftar sur Jästig malt. Smakar svagt maltigt utan någon direkt beska. Små livliga bubblor. God.
Birthday present bottle; cloudy straw yellow pour, spice and citrus aroma, taste is phenolic cloves, some banana, quite smooth mouthfeel, quite clearly a classic that’s not been messed up by a macro.
Hoegaarden white is good but the wheat and spices could be more strong. I even found it a little flat and I am surprised of the rating assigned to it.

Pours in with light colored straw and a huge foamy white head. The head has good retention. Smooth and pleasant carbonation. Perfect blend of orange peel and coriander. Taste of spices, malts with hints of lemon / citrus nicely balanced with bitter taste at the end. One of my all time favourite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tåkete gulfarge med kremete høyt hvitt skum. Sitron korn og bananlukt. Syrlig og søt sitrussmak, medium kullsyre. Kort ettersmak
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlichem Schaum. Geruch leicht hefig, leicht fruchtig, Gewürze. Geschmack hefig würzig, leicht fruchtig.

Pours in with light colored straw and a huge foamy white head. The head has good retention. Smooth and pleasant carbonation.
Perfect blend of orange peel and coriander. Taste of spices, malts with hints of lemon / citrus nicely balanced with bitter taste at the end. One of my all time favourite.

Delicious beer. Sure, it isn’t a fancy craft beer, but I keep coming back to it as my most-drunk beer. Underrated and a fantastic, if not the best, example of its style. Citrus, banana, and spice predominate.
Big 750ml bottle from Sainsburys. A cloudy Light golden colour, a white small but lasting head. Some floral and spicy notes, with fresh clean taste.
Yellow and hazy beer with big white head. Citrus is dominant, coriander is present but not in the front. Light body, maybe too much carbonation. Very refreshing beer.
A very good Witbier. Good but somewhat subtle citrus flavor. Very refreshing.
Pours a hazy straw yellow. Aroma is of citrus fruits. Taste is sweet with lots of carbonation.

Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Not too strong on the nose. Taste is dominated by citrus, with wheat and floral notes. Faint coriander. Witbier not my prefered beerstyle, but this is not bad, refreshing and a pleasing sourness to it. Taste and smell fades rather quickly in the glass...

Dit was vroeger één van mijn lievelingsbiertjes (toen ik nog jong en onervaren was). Drinkt lekker weg en is heerlijk ijskoud op een warme zomerdag als dorstlesser. Maar sinds ik de zwaardere bieren heb leren kennen (nu ook al ettelijke jaren) heb ik deze niet meer gedronken. Smaak zal in al die jaren niet veel veranderd zijn veronderstel ik, daarom deze review op basis van mijn bevindingen van toen. Eén van de betere, zoniet het beste, witbier die er is.
Two finger head. Lots of citrus on the nose, coriander. Slightly metallic finish, but crisp and pale. Not bad at all

Been a while since the last time I had this and I’m feeling kinda dumb for slacking on Belgian wit beers. Perfect for beating the heat. Lots of sweet lemon on the nose. Taste is crisp sweet wheat similar to a kristal weizen. Not much spice like some other wits. Finish doesn’t last very long, but still a great summer brew.

Hazy light colored straw pour with a huge foamy white head. The head has good retention, and leaves a fine lacing on the glass. Spicy aromas of citrus fruits, ripe bananas, bread, clove, bubblegum and coriander. Taste is heavy on the sweet side, and has medium to low in bitterness and sourness. Smooth and pleasant carbonation.
Pale yellow colour with big white head. Strong coriander aroma, also wheat and citrus fruits. Flavor matches the aroma. Refreshing.

Pours a cloudy orangish gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, orange and spices... Nice aromatics. Taste is citrus, coriander and some wheat... Taste is a bit thin but a nice crisp and refreshing wit.
Smell is a little spicy. Has a hint of lemongrass I think. The color is high yellow. Taste is more lemongrass.
Cloudy appearance. Yellow in color. Not pleasing to the nose, not as bad as it smells. Tried this at park lane as part of a sampler.
Hazy straw color, white head. Fruity nose, sour/unripe berries, banana and citrus, belgian yeast, wheat notes. Wheat taste, herbs, citrus. Light and refreshing. Prickly mouthfeel.
Classique belge. Légèrement fruitée et épicée. Bière désaltérante, idéal par journée de chaleur.
Amazing light wheat beer. A truly enjoyable experience. Great pair with heavy foods

One of the lightest colored beers I've seen. Not a great smell or head. Good lacing. Sour without much flavor and no hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I personally love the coriander and orange notes throughout this beer. It is a great stand-by beer, with simple flavors done right.

Hoegaarden is great because it?s a beer unto itself. There?s little else like it. A cloudy, light gold wheat beer with a ferocious head. Tastes sweet, packed with light orange but there?s some satisfying creaminess there too. It doesn?t rate as an all time great, and here in the U.K it can be overpriced on tap, but it?s complex, refreshing and never disappointing.

Bottle. Notes from 9.03.2013. Pours cloudy yellow with white, long-lasting creamy head. Aroma of orange peel, coriander, mint and herbs. Taste of orange, lemon, banana with herbal background. Rather dry. Low body. Not bad, but a bit boring, one-dimensional beer.

Bu en bouteille de 25cl, une couleur blanche troublée et une mousse très aérée, en bouche elle a les caractéristiques de la blanche, on ressent beaucoup le côté fleur d’oranger en début de bouche et après on ressent les céréales. A boire très frais et en petite quantité car écoeurant.
Cloudy straw coloured beer with a thick creamy head. Aroma of flowers and cloves and a strong taste of cloves with a slightly oily palate.
Klassiker... Fuld af frugt og hvede. Lys, mælket, tæt hvidt skum. Læskende, top-drikkelig.

Shared 750 ml. bottle(Wit/Blanche), poured to snifters with a hazed, straw/light gold color, a white, bubbly layer of head foam, and light spots & strands of lacing. The nose was soft grain, with a touch of honey sweetness, more of a light, apple tartness than citrus, and light spice as coriander. The taste was similar, with a light body, and softer spritziness than past encounters, so the texture seemed a bit thin & watery this time around. A tasty, refreshing, benchmark Witbier, nonetheless.
Classic Belgian white. I like it. Not overly sweet with nice citrus and coriander in the flavor. Good.

Bière blanche (de froment) belge. De fermentation haute, légère en alcool, non filtrée, cette bière développe au nez des notes terreuse (levure), d’agrumes, de citron vert, de biscuit au beurre, d’épices, de basilic frais et autres herbes. Mais pas cet arôme de banane typique dans les blanches allemandes. Très pétillante, au corps fin et léger, elle est plutôt crémeuse et douce. C’est le malt et les levures qui dominent ici. De couleur jaune clair, trouble, et à la mousse très généreuse et persistante, elle est pour moi plus belle à regarder qu’à boire. Mais, à l’apéro, elle reste tout de même très agréable et légère.
bread, floral, banana, pale, cloudy, white foam, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lively, oily feel, light body,
4.9% alcohol. Terrific aroma. Pleasant tasting........................................

Hazy pale yellow with medium plus head. Medium nose of citrus and fruity yeast, whiff of perfumed spice. Medium lively on the palate, light bodied, dry and some citrus freshness, semi-sweet creamy midpalate and short finish. Can’t get around that it is one-dimensional and dull, doesn’t inspire to finish the bottle. I feel certain I’m done buying this one even when the only alternatives in a pub are all InBev.
Bottle, 330 ml. from supermarket. Pours yellow cloudy color, coriander and citrus aroma. Spicy and fruity aroma. Refreshing.

Honestly I don’t drink beer regularly, and I don’t like the taste of darker, bitter, heavier beers. But this one tastes like a cold tea. I don’t know how to describe it since I’m not so hot on the jargon, It’s incredibly refreshing with just the right balance of beer-ness and enough fruity freshness to elevate it. Best beer I’ve had to date (granted I haven’t had many), it’s pretty darn awesome. The packaging could use a bit more sleekness, but as long as the contents are good I don’t really care.
Nice color but weak head. Smell of fruits and yeast and clear coriander smell. Fruity aroma. Nice hop aroma. Sweet in the beginning, no bitterness. Nice.

330ml bottle, chalice glass. Aromas of bananas and citrous fruits, Clouded appearance, White head, Delicious citrous taste, light-medium body, creamy, medium carbonation.
Great for a hot summers day, very refreshing :)
Uma ótima cerveja para se tomar durante o dia. Ótimo frescor, com lembranças de cravo e banana no sabor.
Botella 33cl. Posiblemente la mejor witbier en relación calidad-precio y en facilidad de encontrar. Ligera, un poco dulzona y muy, muy refrescante. Invita a tomarse varias seguidas.
Pretty good. Floral notes. Not much finish while drinking it. An ok wit beer

0,3l Flasche. Sehr helles Weizen mit kleiner beständiger Schaumkrone.
Erfrischender Antrunk, es kommt das typische Bananenaroma durch zum Abschluss kommt noch eine Zitrusnote durch. Extrem süffig!

Bottle 25cl. Light golden color, slightly hazy. Quite vivid carbonation but comparably small head. Some floral notes, lightly sour, fresh taste. Nearly no finish. Quite refreshing summer drink, reminds me of a German Kristallweizen.
Bubble gummy yeast with a little sour funk balanced with a touch of sweetness this beer is the inspiration for many an American Wit.
Une trÃ¨s bonne biÃ¨re blanche; belle couleur; arÃ´mes Ã©picÃ©s; un peu dâ€™amertume.

A marvelous example of the Belgian White. Plenty of earthy yeast taste mixed with some bittersweet citrus and spice. Expect some banana flavor and a smooth, light texture. It’s hard to beat a wheat ale that’s as quaff-able as this one.

First tried this years ago and hated it but as my palate has matured I’m finding that I like this type of beer more and more. Pours very pale yellow with nice white head. Aroma of coriander, orange and spice, mostly clove. Tastes primarily of clove, then banana, sweet citrus, bread, coriander and other herb/spice. Carbonation is perfect for this style and is very easy on the palate. Quite a creamy feel as well. Poured from a 500ml bottle into tulip glass with slice of orange.

33cl can @ home. Hazy nearly white color, strong white head. Aroma citrus, cereal, slithtly bread. Light sweetness, very lightly sour, no bitterness. Light body, lively carbon, watery, very short bitter-sweet finish. Very refreshing, but not my style at all.
Very good for a macro brew in my opinion. Have drunk a lot of this in my time, not complex at all, but you don't always need complex. Backlog.

Bottle. Pale, hazy yellow pour with a fizzy white head. Tons of carbonation. Orange, lemon and coriander in the aroma, also surprising alcohol warmth for the low ABV. Flavour is orange and lemon, yeast, light citrusy hops and coriander. Not overly sweet, and very refreshing. Surprisingly tasty, especially for a macrobrew.

Pours hazy golden orange with a nice fluffy head. Aroma of wheat and citrus maybe orange. Slightly sweet with a long bitter finish. You can taste the wheat and citrus throughout. Easy to drink and nice Belgian wheat beer.

Bottle.

A- Orange, herbs, coriander.

A- Golden color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Slight sweetness, slight bitterness, and slight sourness. Subtle orange tones and prominent coriander and spice tones. 

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, refreshing finish.

O- A very good Belgian white. One of the best. Well balanced and refreshing.

The beer pours a very pale cloudy yellow with a massive frothy head which soon settles. On the nose there is wheat, banana, mild citrus and yeast. These are also the flavours that come through mainly, there is very little in the way of bitterness. It has a refreshing and easy going feel in the mouth and it’s very quaffable. Definitely above average and it has it’s time and place.

A: Pours a light hazy bronze ale with as many fingers of head as you will allow, just take the time to pour and it won’t overcome the ledge. A white head forms and falls back to a sheet of the same. Loose lacing.

S: Coriander, cloves, orange peel, sweet wheat. Really can’t see past the beer as it is the standard. Not gold standard, but standard.

T: See above. add plastics.

M: Medium body, medium carb for the genre. Leaves the palate watering.

O: The most average witbier available. the most widely available witbier (okay, maybe blue moon wins).

Serving type: bottle

04-13-2011

24.12, 0,33, butelka
Potężna, biała piana- długo się utrzymuje i całkiem przyzwoicie oblepia szkło. Rozczarował mnie zapach, który był mało intensywny, za to ostry i kwaskowy. W smaku dominuje pszeniczna kwaśność. Piwo jest troszeczkę za wodniste, jednak bardzo sycące. Pijalne, wchodzi jak woda, pozostawia po sobie dobre wrażenie.
Definitely falls into the category of Meets Expectations.. Plus extra comments to make the seventy five minimum -- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

33cL can. Home. Pale hazy yellow beer with a white persistant head. Few bubbles. Aroma of coriander, citrus and orange peel. Nice touch. Sweet taste, light bitter. Refreshing : medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation. Short finish. I think carbonation is better in bottle than can. Fair lacing.

Draught, but i drank bottled also. Nice tasty foam with tiny bubbles, typical weissbier colour and odour. You can eat it, with the foam and the medium body, there aren’t sidetaste, nor very tropical aroma, too much citrus. Perfect and not too costly.
A la pression avec une rondelle de citron, assez fruite, tres douce (trop douce ??). Pour une biere "grand public" elle reste assez bonne et tres rafraichissante.

Pours pale, hazy straw blond with a foamy white head. Lacing is a nice bubbled coat. Aroma is wheat, orange and some yeast. Taste is sparkling lemon and cereal. Just a touch of bitterness. A wee bit thin. Very sessionable and a template for a wit. At one time, this was my favorite beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a big bleached white head with decent retention and lacing. Aroma is on the light side with mostly wheat, some coriander and faint apple and citrus. Taste has a light wheat twang with some sweetness, coriander and light fruit along with a hint of bubble gum. All the flavors are pretty much in balance and subdued. Finishes dry and clean. Has a crisp mouthfeel with a light medium body and plenty of carbonation. A thirst quenching and easy drinking beer that is just average. Nothing to offend but nothing to make it stand out either.

I really enjoyed the bottles I tried although the could do with a bit more of a flavor punch. Their website says ‘…there’s the soft taste, light and slightly sweet and sour with subtle citrus notes…’ my biggest complaint about the beer is the citrus is too subtle, you can only just, with concentration, pick it up. On the positive side it is still a nice summer beer with a taste that is going to appeal to a large audience.

DWF; Tap. Pours wheat beer, with lacing white head. Wheat, coriander, spice aroma and taste. Medium mouth and creamy mouth. Medium sweet, banana, sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught. Pours hazy light golden with a lacy white head. Aroma is coriander, citrus and some yeast. Taste is light to moderate sweet. Light to medium body with average carbonation. Used to be better before the macro’s showed up, but still not too bad of a thirst quencher.

There's a reason why this is so popular and a yardstick for the wit style. Great aromas of orange peel, lemon and coriander. Taste is similar to the smell, but with banana as well. Could drink this all day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The aroma is fresh and sweet with hints of citrus. Pours golden and cloudy with a white fluffy head. A nice sweet taste of fruits like banana, apples, sweet citrusfruits and some honey.
Aroma: sweet, fresh fruits. Appearance: hazy whitish yellow. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: lemon zest, wheat. Overall: excellent Belgium White. Pint at The Champion, London.

La meilleure blanche commercial selon moi! De couleur jaune pale légèrement trouble avec un léger col mousseux teinté blanc. Nez fruité et épicé de coriandre. En bouche c’est très doux et très rafraîchissant, agrumes coriandre peu amer.

Aroma muito agradável (leve lembrança de weiss com especiarias, entre zimbro e coentro). Coloração amarelo turvo com ótima carbonatação e excelente retenção de espuma. Cerveja seca e levemente cremosa. Saborosa, levemente citrada com lembranças/retrogosto amargo/azedo lembrando o zimbro e coentro. Excelente witbier, sendo uma ótima representante do estilo. Altamente recomendável para quem não conhece o tipo witbier.
Pour une blanche belge, elle est moyenne. Nez citronné. Peu de corps et gout tres doux et legerement épicé .
Next witbier that i enjoy. My top 3 WIT. It contains all needed aromas, balanced between wheat and citrus peel aromas .

Bottle: pale straw, nearly clear with a light murkiness about it; wispy white head forms quickly, then dissipates just as fast. Aroma includes notes of apple skins, wheat, light white pepper, very mild kitchen spice (I almost get oregano?) & clove, pear, faint lemon, & some musty, earthy notes. Taste has heavier notes of clove, banana, & some spicy white pepper. Mid-palate picks up some notes of apple, lemon zest, & dry, musty wheat. It’s kind of watery, but it goes down like a champ. Crisp, clean finish.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je velmi lahodné banánové s nádechem citrusů. Pěna je jasně bílá, vysoká, jemná a držící. Barva samotného piva je žlutá a kalná. Chuť je slabší smetanově sladová s jemným banánovým nádechem, finiš je téměř neznatelně hořký, příjemný. Vcelku je toto pivo velmi jemné, dobře pitelné a výborně zahánějící žízeň.
Pale yellow color with a strong citrus aroma. Flavor matches the smell and is full of lemon and orange citrus goodness. Excellent beer for a hot summer day when you need something refreshing.

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy pale straw color with a fizzy white head. Aroma of coriander, citrus, and wheat. Crisp and refreshing. Lite citrus, coriander, wheat, and sweet malts. Has a tiny pepper tingle as well. One of the better wits I’ve had.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours yellow with a white head. Taste orange, light, sweet. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pale yellow color with big white head. Strong coriander aroma, also wheat and citrus fruits. Flavor matches the aroma + you get some banana sweetnes. Refreshing, but it feels bit watery afterwards. For beer this famous, it’s great.

Hazy yellow color with nice white head. Fresh aroma of citrus , coriander and clove. Taste is same. Light body , easy to drink. Dry finish with spices notes. Very good refreshing beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Für ein belgisches Weissbier nicht schlecht, allerdings kommt es bei weitem nicht an bayrische ran, daher eher unterdurchschnittlich.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bière désaltérante, très agréable directement sortie du frigo avec une rondelle de citron. Goût appréciable, entrée de bouche tout en douceur et très faible amertume.
Bottle 33cl. Hazy light golden/yellow liquid, frothy head. Aroma: orange, yeast, banana. Sour & bitter taste, wheat, citrus. Fizzy carbonation, medium body. Just lovely.

Bottle shared by father in law. Pours a hazy light golden color with a large white head. The aroma and flavor had coriander and wheat, mild citrus, with a hint of pepper. Not bad, just not something I would seek out.

Bottle: Pale gold. Slight haze. Good light white head. Citrus, spice, yeast, blossom. Clear aromas. Off dry. Soft and not bitter. Not sour. Rich. lovely bright flavors. Long. Mid weight. Huge bright spice flavors. Balance on this beer is great. Just a classic.
Lemon banana nose. Banana cream flavor, bread, tart, sour finish. A tad too heavy for me but a great classic for sure.
This is my first white beer. It was very soft and I liked the fruity taste and citrus-like flavor.

Muy pálida y translúcida, ligeramente turbia. Espuma muy blanca, generosa y persistente. Tiene un aroma ligeramente cítrico y a harina cruda. Sabor muy muy fresco, cítrico, muy refrescante. Ligera y fácil de beber pero con cuerpo y personalidad, buena, bonita y barata.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
Jaune voilée, effervescence forte à fines bulles de visu, légère au palais, col blanc abondant. Céréales bien en avant avec un léger citronné et un rien d’épices. Une blanche plutôt moyenne.

75cl bottle. Cloudy/hazy golden colored, with big all white long lasting head. Refreshing aroma of yeast, banana, wheat and citrus fruits. Flavor as expected by the type; wheat, yeast, citrus and oranges ends with medium-sour, slight salty finish. Very little hobs bitterness. Light body and medium carbonation. Real refresher, lacks some excitement to be truly brilliant.

Typical arome for witbier, sweet and fruity. The aroma is quite strong. Look: hazy golden yellow with big head that stays for couple minutes. Taste sour, some bitterness in the middle with some sweetness and finishes sour-bitter. Also some hints of salt in the ending and bit watery side taste in the middle. Aftertaste is very subtle bitter and it’s also little watery. Medium carbonation, light body.

Good light beer, nicely refreshing. I would call this nice summer beer, altough it looks and smells a lot better than actually tastes.
Delicious and refreshing hef...pours light golden clear with heavy citrus and sweeter wheat notes.

It has a citric aroma, with some pineapple notes, and barely a malt perception. In glass it pours a cloudy pale yellow beer with a nice and persistent foam head. When it’s tasted it has a refreshing malt flavor, and almost perceived hops.

12 oz bottle poured as expected for style. I really had my hopes up for this beer and was very disappointed. It has a very off putting rotten orange flavor that corrupted my palette for the rest of the day. After one drink even a cream stout had that terrible orange essence to the flavor. I have had other beers of this style and not experienced this so maybe the beer was old or some other issue with the bottle I tried.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of citrus and sweet wheat. Nice pale cloud appearance. Rich sweetness first taste. Hints of orange, spices and finishes with a nice iven bitterness.
Sample @ Føtex. Murky yellow. Aroma and taste is orange and some yeast. Quite ok.

Simple wheat beer. Good clove, banana, yeast taste. Sour notes in the beginning. Very short finish. Decent refreshing wheat beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Belgians really know how to make beers. This type of Hoegaarden is my favorite so far. I like its brown-cloudy color, very fuzzy too. It has also a strong citrus smell, almost like made of oranje juice. The flavor is influenced by wheat, oranje peel and cereal (my perfect combination). One of my most favourites.

Bottle from regular supermarket. Aroma is very spicy-ish and citrusy. Taste is the perfect Wheat beer plus hints of orange and spice combination. Very easy to drink and very distinct taste. Recommended
Hazy, yellow color. Very frothy and long lasting white head. Aroma of citrus and peach. Light bitterness, taste is fruity, very refreshing. Average carbonation.

Hazy hay on the pour. Sweet and inviting nose, taste records the notes line for line. Sweet, satisfying and easy, just like your mom. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale, hazy. Mildly spicy with some sweetfruit in aroma. Refreshing! But didn’t it used to be more to this beer?

Pale yellow, snow white head. Faint nose, fresh malty taste, only slight hints of summer fruits and apples. Good acidity and carbonation. Refreshing but otherwise average aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance with pale golden color, cloudy liquid and average head.
Complex aroma: Citrus, coriander and banana.
Acid and fruity (citrus) flavor. On the palate, a good freshness.
One of my favorite beers.
I recommend it!

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow body, with a small white head that leaves almost no lace. Faint yeasty aroma. Very fruity and light taste. Thin bodied, watery texture, average carbonation. Too light and too thin for me.
Bottle, drank multiple times. Hazy pale white-yellow color, small white head. Aroma and taste of wheat, yeast and citrus.

Lively blonde liquid with lots of head that flattens fast, Hoegaarden is a very refreshing and easy to drink wheat beer. The taste is fruity, smell citric. It leaves a very very subtle bitter aftertaste.
Pours to a off lemon hazey color leaving a quick white head. Smells like a basement and herbs leaving behind a skunky taste with a hint of hay. Aftertaste lingers
Tasting with a lemon. Really complement s flavor. Nice yeasty floral flavor. Good carbonation, not sparkly, but bubbly.

33cl bottle. Pours very pale hazy golden with medium white frothy head (lasting). The aroma is banana, yeast and coriander. The flavour has a lot of wheat character, fruits and hints of yeast. Spicy palate, dry notes. Medium body, perfect carbonation. Pleasant and refreshing.
I love it! The only problem is that I live in Thailand and it is so expensive here... :s
Lemon-colored with a foamy white head. Has a lemon aroma and a hint of a lemon flavor mixed with the sweet wheat taste.
Sweet bready, wheat aroma. Sweet and sour flavor. Draft at Epcot Food & Wine Fest.
Tap @ Inn Side Out, Hong Kong. Pale yellow, hazy beer with a thick head. Aroma of wheat, yeast with coriander. A little sweet, mild bitterness in the finish. Nice medium body. Good.

Crisp, but a bit too acidic. Mine was served with a lemon wedge, so I don’t know how much of the citris flavor was from the beer and how much from the garnish. Like Stella, but lighter (in color as well as taste) and more lemony.

Bottle, brewed in Belgium. Light amber color. A bit hazy. Head is light colored and fast to dissipate. Somewhat over-carbonated for my liking. Light body. Yeasty aroma. Light sourness. OK beer, but nothing amazing.
Sulfuric aroma. Nice wit taste with some Belgian sourness. Hazy cream aroma. Weak head. Nice but overrated.
Spettacolare birra bianca, leggera, rinfrescante, assolutamente perfetta in una calda giornata assolata.
Pours a cloudy hazzy golden yellow with nice white head and lacing. Taste of coriander throughout wich gives it a nice spice flavor and feel.

Draft at Camden Yards. Pours opaque yellow gold with a small frothy white head. Tastes smooth, creamy, like very mild lemon and wheat. Pleasant. Smells bready, musky, grassy. Medium body and low/medium carbonation.

Tap. Pours cloudy pale gold with creamy white head. Aroma is bananas, herbs, floral hops citrus fruit, and faint spice. Flavor is wheat, bready malts, faint hops, and light fruit; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.
Classical witbier. Wheat aroma and taste. Also some bananas, orange, coriander and some spices.
33cl bottle. Small white layer. Light yellow hazy color, quite full body. Aroma is yeast, apples and melted pear ice cream. Taste is yeast, flour and honey.

Najbardziej znany wit na świecie. I jaki smaczny! Pszenica posiadająca klasyczne, cytrusowo-bananowe nuty skontrastowana kolendrą. Niby nic, ale wszystko idealnie zgrane. Czuć lata praktyki. Must-have dla kogoś, kto zaczyna przygodę z belgijskim piwem.

Btl pours hazy,milky, glowing,dull yellow color. Huge head with compact tiny bubbles. Nice lacing on glass head stays up for a while. Smells of sweet bubblegum,wheatbread,citrus, spice and grass. Taste is sweet malt,light doughy yeast, oranges and a crisp sour tartness. Very smooth texture with a light body that leaves a bubbly tingling on the tongue. Loads of carbonation that is fizzy and lively. Very nice complex beer that goes down smooth and easy. Definitely sets the standard for wit beers.
Poured cloudy light orange with a dense white head. Aroma of yeasty spice and citrus. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, bitter sweet.
Crisp and refreshing. Got to try this from the barrel too which was nice. One of my favourite beers!
pours a yellow with white head. aroma of citrus, doughy yeasts. tastes of orange, sweet corn, white bread, hay. palate is thin and crisp.
Like an orange juice... Great taste and light bitterness.. Brunch and beach beer.

Bottle at hotel bar. Pours hazy yellow with a good white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, orange and spice. Taste has a good light bitterness, some sweet malt, orange coming through more as it opens up. Clean finish. Nice beer.

Not bad for orange coriander wheat beer. But has nothing on bud light wheat.

Mild aroma... Set honey appearance. Sweet honey taste, oranges, lemon, mild... Barley water taste. Nice and refreshing.

Witbier refrescante, nota-se o aroma cítrico da casca da laranja além da semente de coentro, os mesmos são percebidos no sabor. Aparência com uma espuma de boa formação, e cerveja num tom amarelo bem claro. Paladar levemente seco e rápido.

50cl on tap at some random bar in Helsinki. Hazy pale yellow with a white head. Wheaty aroma with coriander and citrus. Moderate sweet with mildy spicy, fruity and wheaty flavours and a nice and light sourness. Mild in flavour and quite lightbodied, but nice and refreshing. (2013-08-16)

white, medium, creamy, below avg. retention. Colour: a dirty grayish-straw and opaque. Aroma: strong fresh orange, coriander, Taste: wheaty sourness, coriander, slight fruitiness. A very good thirst quencher with a very strong orange aroma and a body dominated by coriander.

(Back log) On tap @ Shawnee Mountain. Pours a hazy straw yellow color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, lemon, and some breadyness. Taste is tart lemon, wheat, clove, black pepper, and coriander.

Cloudy, fruity, refreshing and easily drinkable witbier. Great beer often served with a lemon slice which is nice but not necessary at all as Hoegaarden has plenty of it’s own flavour.

Bière jaune pâle, voilée, effervescence soutenue, bon col blanc immaculé et mousseux. Au nez, la levure est dominante, arômes également d’agrumes (surtout citron, présence d’acidité), de coriandre, de clou de girofle et de blé. En bouche, c’est pétillant et mousseux, mais tout de même assez mince au palais. Saveurs d’agrume (orange et citron), coriandre, clou de girofle, levure, pain (blé). Présence d’un certain sucré qui vient bien équilibrer l’acidité. L’amertume et le houblon sont à peine perceptibles. À la fois légère et goûteuse, la bière qui a donné naissance au style, une référence en la matière.

Wheat beer with almost no aroma. Easy to drink light tasting beer with base notes of wheat and some faint banana flavor.

Hadn’t had this in over a decade, picked it up on election night (spoiler alert:we won!) at the Oak Bay Hotel as they only sell macros... Pours pale yellow, extremely hazy, white lasting head. Compared to typical wits it’s a bit thinner, medium carbonation, heaps of coriander, yeast giving very dry notes. Better than most  "craft" wits; then again it’s a tough style to win me over.

One of the first "different" beers I got into, and look at me now! A good white beer with a very floral/sweet flavour. Pours a pale yellow colour--very light on the palate and in taste. Certainly not going to knock your socks off, but the citrus and floral flavours are nice enough.
Yellow coloured, medium white head, citrus sharp aroma, medium to high carbonation, soft bitter, creamy citrus taste.

Pretty good for what is developing as  the leader in the field for this style. Pale and cloudy golden in color with spare head, slight citrusy hints on top of wheat characteristics. Overall light on the palate and in mouthfeel, but the norm for the style.

bottle.a great wheat beer.nice appearance with a hazy yellow color and white head.a hint of banana in it’s aroma.coriander and other citrusy fruits in it’s taste.
Bottle and Draught.  This is a classic and a good go to beer at bars that have limited selection.

Draught. Pale yellow, billowing clouds of froth. Light, spicy, citrusy, refreshing. Not muh depth, but it does exactly what it should. I’ve had it a few times before but this one seemed a little flat and lifeless. A great starter before lunch on a hot sunny day.

On tap at the Funky Monkey, Brussels.  This is the first ever wheat beer I had many years ago.  At the time it seemed great - now it seems quite ordinary when compared with its stronger Belgian relatives.  Mildy citrus aroma.  Obviously cloudy blonde but weak taste mixed with water.  Still it looks and feels good.

This the beer that brought back wheat beers.  Its perfect, it’s whitish yellow, with orange and coriander, tastes like sour dough and with very floral hops.  I’d like to try a stronger version if they made one, but its basically perfect.
Aroma of citrus.  Pale, hast liquid, with a White head.  Taste mostly light sour.  Light Bodied. With a software carbonation.

THE ubiquitous white beer in Flanders/Belgium, and for a good reason. Who would settle for an average lager when this is available?
Lemon zest, mildly spicy, the coriander present, but you need to search a bit for it. That famous hazed over sunshine, under a billowing pure white cloud. Served in its proper glass, this is what your everyday beer should be like.
Santé!
Bottle; Color: Cloudy champagne Aroma: Grapefruit/ Citrus/ Spices. Flavor: This beer most certainly packs a punch, tarty and flavorful, with elements of citrus and nutmeg.

Exquicita deliciosa de color casi blanco sin filtrar poca espuma pero suficiente. Se siente el sabor a trigo y malta piel de naranja y la cantidad suficiente de coriander
30cl bottle. Hazy yellow with a nice white head. High carbonation. Nice combination of citrus, grass and hints of orange. Great beer for the summer!

Bought a 330ml bottle at the supermarket. Aroma of citrus fruits, herbs and grass. Has a hazy, light golden color and a white head and is highly carbonated. Taste of bananas, citrus fruits and herbs. Is light to medium bitter and has a sour and a light bitter aftertaste. Overall one of the best Belgian White in my opinion.

Draught. Yellow hazy. A very pleasant and balanced mix of malts, raw wheat, coriander and yeastyness on nose. Very mellow and unoffending. Body is light, refreshing. Wheat, spices, a bit of yeast. Very nice and all, but I can’t help feeling that this is massproduced and lacks character. I shouid blind taste this. But overall a very nice, available, easy wit.

Multiple times at home or at cafe, Hazy white beer with a white head, aroma is citrus, one of the better (Belgian)white beers for a hot summers day.
Absolutely fabulous beer. Extremely refreshing with lovely hint of coriander. Perfect for a sunny day.

Banana, tangerine pulp, and clove aromas.  Hazy yellow, with a fully lasting, white head.  Dry, bready, slightly fruity, and with some subtle floral notes.  Light body, smooth, refreshing, and clean throughout.
hazy, pale yellow with a tall fine head. aroma of hay, orange and banana. not a bad taste, but a bit too sour for my taste. very nice carbonation and good mouthfeel.

On tap @ De Poortwachter, Culemborg. Hazy light golden white a white head. Aroma of koriander and citrusfruit. One of the better Belgian whites which isn’t strange being the first one ever in modern times. Perfect for a hot day in the sun but leave the lemon out of it, it doesn’t need it.

White-yellow, hazy, good head.
Aroma has floral, almost parfumy notes. Not spicy,  yeasty as i excpected.
Taste is very wheaty, just a little peppery, floral.
Light and carbonated.

Hooooooooooooooooooooooooooogarden.  That is how your pronounce it, morons.  It used to have the pronunciation on the handle of the 6 pack, not sure if they still do.  This is probably the beer I think of first when I hear "Belgian white" although my conditioned ass also thinks of Blue moon, but then I immediately think, shit.  pun intended.  Okay, these days, I probably prefer allagash white actually as i find this one a little watery these days but that could be a good thing on a hot day outside.
Honestly is like drinking potpourri. You can taste the lavender and orange peels. However these tastes overpower the toasted wheats. Cheers.
Syrlig och söt. En uppfriskande törstsläckare. Smak och doft av citrus, humle, belgisk jäst och toner av banan. Funka enbart sommartid.
Cerveza excesivamente suave para mi gusto. Tiene algo de aroma a cítricos y parece una Fanta de limón. El sabor es tan suave que cuesta distinguir algo.
Väldigt ljus, grumlig med vitt högt skum. Jästig aroma. Tydlig syrlig smak. Faktiskt bättre när den var kall.

Aroma sutil de trigo. Visualmente bela com a cor branca. Sabor leve e refrescante. Suave ao ingerir. Cerveja boa para todas as ocasiões.

750ml bottle. Aroma is light with wheat and maybe apple. This beer has great head retention with a cloudy opaque yellow appearance. It is highly carbonated and perhaps a little thin in terms of mouthfeel. The flavour is better though. Full flavoured with sweet, sour and spice noticeable. For such a mass produced beer this is more than decent but really nothing special at the price it retails for. Slightly overrated on ratebeer for me.
Classic Belgian White.  Lemony aroma.  Pours hazy banana color with a good 2 finger head.  Full bodied with hints of pepper.  A good session beer

Pours cloudy pale straw with big white foamy head and great lace. Aromas of light sweet pilsner malt, grains, bread, orange peel, cloves, dust and flour. Light body, medium carbonation and near creamy mouthfeel, finishing refreshing, lightly tart and lightly sweet.
I think some of the wonderful beers ive drank have made other beers appear to lack any oomph.  The flavour and aroma is nice just not the same as a product froma smaller brewer such as Nogne o.

For the style, a classic. The first half of the bottle was a clear yellow, the second cloudy with a big white head. Lemony yeast aroma. Some spice. Watery palate with some thickness due to being unfiltered. Yeast, lemon, wheat, citrus sour. Balanced. This is one of the cleanest drinking beers I’ve had.
Had  a number of times.  June 2012 bottle - tastes like very diluted orange juice, not great, slight smell apple sauce and a bit floral.

Pint at Reidy’s bar. Pours a delicious cloudy whitish yellow with a thick pillowy head that lasts the duration of the drink. Nice aroma of citrus, pine, wheat, freshly cut grass and herbs. Taste is a complex mixture of bittersweet and sour - more wheat, lemon, bit of coriander and a nice citrus hop finish. The downfall of this beer is its incredibly watery mouthfeel, which doesn’t make sense given the complexity of the rest of the drink. Great summer beer, with a great taste (one of the best macros imo) but it just falls down at the final hurdle.
Cloudy, pale yellow-gold color with lingering head.  Smooth beer with a citrus-orange flavor.  Not bad.
Koriander är det ju naturligtvis man känner om man anstränger sig en aning. Frisk, med belgiska toner och karaktär. En flaska till gravad lax sitter dom en smäck
Decent beer nothing special. Use to think it was better when I was a younger man.

Scent has citrus and wheat, nice head that stays after every sip. High carbonated, refreshing citrus flavor, aftertaste brings this wheat and citrus combo which is really good! Now all I need is this, summer and a slice of lemon.

25 cl bottle
Nose of Herbs, coriander, summerfruit, grass, straw.

Tastes fresh, herbal, coriander, thyme, lemon, hay.
Fizzy mouthfeel, watery finish, soda.

Hoegaarden doesn’t please my inner beer snob with InBev behind it, but I can’t deny this very drinkable Belgian White its due.  Not much aroma, but a nice cloudy yellowish orange color with a light foamy head.  The flavor is that of fresh oranges with maybe a hint of spice.  HoeGaarden is not particularly unique but a very good everyday drinking beer.
