0,33l bottle. Color is light yellow, aroma is coriander, wheat, some citrus notes and yeast. Taste is very good, mostly the same as aroma (wheat, coriander, citrus and a little bit of yeast). Overall, this is fantastic beer, very drinkable, and i would like to drink it again.
On tap, rated from old tasting notes. Aroma has citrus, some coriander, orange peel and wheat. Flavour a bit more spicy than the aroma, citrus, peppery notes, coriander, some orange peel. Refreshing!

Flaska från Systembolaget. Kraftigt högt skum som stannar kvar. Ljus grumlig vätska, nästan lite skiftningar av i färgen. Påtaglig doft av gröna örter. Liten antydan av kokta grönsaker. Perfekt balans av beska och sötma. Torr eftersmak. Törstsläckare.

THOUGHTS: A true classic. The inspiration for countless beers. A wonderful thirst quencher. Lots of flavor in a little beer. Nice session beer from long before the term was popular.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a murky, light, milky yellow with an average, white head that kept a nice sheet and left fair lacing. The aroma contained moderate wheat; plenty of coriander; lemon and oranges. The initial flavor was slightly sweet and moderately acidic; while the finish was lightly sweet, slightly sour, and heavily acidic. There was wheat, oranges, and coriander. The light to medium body was creamy with rather fizzy carbonation and dry and lightly astringent finish.

33 cl bottle @ Ravintola Roast, Tampere. Rated on 30.04.2011

Aroma has soapy citrus, some coriander, orange peel and hints of wheat. Flavour has soapy citrus, peppery spices, coriander, some orange peel a, wheaty and yrasty notes. Refreshing, but failed to match my chili burger.
Greatest beer yeah, any one would love this beer yeah the best , once u try it u won’t stop u won’t stop buying it yeah .

I’m reading the reviews and feel I’m missing something. There’s a lot of love for sure. I discussed with Bish and Dan the importance of setting, etc, and this may be the case here. My team are getting battered, I’m tired and grouchy and wishing I was watching The Bronx again tonight. So I may be a little harsh. The first time I drank this was about 10 years ago in a pub in a village in Northamptonshire, sun shining with the promise of a hot tub later on. It was the first time I had tapas in a UK pub. In a game of lawn cricket that day I fielded like Jonty Rhodes. It was a perfect day. If I dabbled in historical ratings then I’m sure it would be higher. As it is, the only classy Belgian around here is Jan Vertonghen. Update, 20 minutes late - Moussa Dembélé is also a classy Belgian.

A - Pours a cloudy pale straw. A rich foamy 1 inch head that retains well. Slight lacing.

S - Belgian yeast-banana , herbal bouquet, wet straw, vanilla orange, a faint wet honey oat.

T/M - Belgian yeast with coriander, tart apples, sweet perfect wheat, spiced pears, dry Belgian yeast finish.

This beer is a leader in this style. It’s unmatched in balance and spice. Don’t pass this beer up. I’ve had this beer in Europe (not Belgium) and it’s just as good as I tasted it it in America. I drank alot of Hoegaarden in Europe. The beer that I did this review with is from a Oklahoma Liquor store. It’s just as good as the beer I had in Europe.

Serving type: bottle

07-28-2010

Ar: citric, spicy, yeasty, floral, herbs, hay, wheat and grains.
Ap: hazy golden colour, big creamy white head.
F: wheat, sour yeastiness, herbs, spices, citric, hay, lively, acidic and very refreshing. 
P: crisp mouthfeel
T: a truly great wit.
Enjoyed this for the first time with my brother and I in Missouri.  I was extremely happy with what I experienced.  Let my ratings speak for me.
Aroma is of wheat and a bit boozy.  The Orange flavour comes out nice at the front of the pallet.  Not much of an aftertaste with just a slight sourness/bitterness.  Nice beer.
A beer for people who love cloves! Light and yellow color mild carbonation thin head. Very light feeling beer
Definitive cloviness, though not overpowering. Hazy and extremely light in color - almost looks watered down.  Nice flavor but overall it strikes me as too thin.

This beer is a cloudy light yellow with a quickly fading head, and the aroma is mildly wheaty and slightly skunky. The flavor is slightly sweet and even less bitter, but the average carbonation, light body, a thin texture, and an abrupt finish combine on the tongue nicely.

300 ml bottle at home. ABV 4.9%. Poured into a weizen glass.
Colour is pale, chamomile like, only very hazy. Huge head of three fingers, creamy and white in colour. Average activity in the glass. The foam very slowly dissipates to one finger.
Strong aroma of citrus fruits and bubblegum..
Taste is sweet and fruity, the taste of koriander very discreet but much more obvious on the aftertaste.
Thick and full on the body. Carbonatiion is average.
Overall good and very refreshing.
I must say that this was a great surprise for me. I had it in the airport, but from the appearance of it I was not expecting such a good beer.

Aroma. Very weak aroma, of flowers and bubblegum of what is there is pleasent however as mentioned it is very faint.

Appearance. Poured from bottle, pours a cloudy off yellow colour.

Taste. Has a palate dominated by banana, with also flavours of sweet flowers, bubblegum and a slight herby Taste.

Palate. This beer is very thin in the mouth, which is appropriate for this style of beer.

Overall. This Beer is very refreshing and goes down a treat.
Got a bit of floral banana aroma but not big banana flavour.  A nice head and very effervescent quality throughout.  Didn’t seem to be any hop quality.  Enjoyable.

Aroma: Coriander, sugar cane, banana, orange and a bit of lemon. A good powerful but not exaggerated complex nose.
Visual: Very white, slightly hazy, with a marvelous white, creamy and thick head lasting very long. Lacing doesn’t hold much on glass.
Taste: Attack is smooth, all banana, with notes of coriander and oranges mixed with a light acidity as finish. Yeast accents with a bit of hops and cereal. Body is light to medium and its texture is watery but typical to wittbeers. A traditional Belgium white the way it should be. Delicious and slightly acid. Very refreshing. A reference beer for style.

ブリュッセルのブラッセリーでオーダー。香りも味も独特のクセがあるので好みによって評価が分かれそう。夏の陽射しが強い日に外でグイッと飲むと気持ちが良い。残念ながら冬場には合わないと思う。

Pint. Colour is hazy yellow with large thick white head that dissipates at a steady pace. Aromas and flavours are yeast, citrus, wheat. Vety fresh. Summer or after sports beer. Glass is really nice. A classic
330ml bottle. Cloudy yellow body, with a thick white head. White bread, citrus, cloves, white pepper, herbs and a dash of honey. Watery aftertaste with a herbal touch. Light body, fizzy carbonation.

Tap beer at Belge, Helsinki. Very nice appearance and it did not disappointed at all. They served it in nice thick glasses which nicely invited you for a drink and quite cold, which cut tastes a bit. Great taste. Kind of reminds of bubble gum. The aroma is sour and unpleasant. Overall a good beer.
Very good.Cannot disagree with previous posts. For some reason the bottle reminds me of a thick Belgian barmaid. Unusual pouring instructions on back label.

Liquide jaune trouble, belle mousse. Verre classique que tout collectionneur de verres doit détenir. Belles arômes de coriandre, de zeste d’orange et de poivre. Cette blanche belge est une des meilleures que je connaisse. Excellent goût de levure et d’agrumes, ce que je souhaite d’une blanche. Rafraîchissante, légère, cette bière qui marie à merveille les agrumes et le malt est à découvrir est à redécouvrir. Valeur sûre, La Hoegaarden plaira autant aux dégustateurs qu’aux initiés. Dans mes bières usuelles et mon top 5 des blanches, assurément, et ce, nonobstant son côté commercial. Cheers!

Troublée aux allures d’un «sirop de bananes» (si ça se peut). De l’or sans brillance, stagnante et sincère. Parfum matinal qui frôle le jus d’orange. Effluves de blé et de forêt humide (respectez ma prose!). En bouche, on se retrouve avec une bière aqueuse qui offre quand même une certaine rondeur avec son goût riche qui chavire entre l’amertume d’un pamplemousse frais et l’herbe. Les saveurs s’estompent ensuite et laissent une touche tantôt boisée, tantôt fruitée. Voilà une grande blanche de renommée internationale qui marque des points à chaque gorgée. Bon goût et fraîcheur.

Aroma di frutta gialla, colore oro opalescente, schiuma  bianca ma evanescente, dolce dolce, banana e frutta gialla, corpo lieve forse d'estate può essere dissetante ma bevuta d'inverno.... non tra il mio genere di birra.

La blanche belge typique, elle semble devenir un peu plus fade à mesure que les années passent, mais demeure l’une des très bonnes représentantes belges. Odeurs de banane, de céréales, de fruits tropicaux. Effervescence contenue. Un peu aqueuse, légèrement trouble, couleur paille ensoleillée. Très mince. Cette bière est toujours un délice.
fat foam, not clear. not so much coriander, more fruit, banana flavours. tastes bitter, sweet. A classic, but victim of mass-production.
Colour is hazy yellow with large thick white head that dissipates at a steady pace. Aromas and flavours are yeast, citrus, wheat. Vety fresh. It´s a summer beer.

Pours a cloudy light yellow color with a fluffy white head. Malts and wheat tickle the nose with some hints of citrus. There is a good taste to the beer with nice blend of wheat, malts, and lemon zest that it’s difficult to pick out certain elements as they blend so nicely together. A little too watery but nothing to fuss about. A nice smooth easy drinking beer especially for those hot summer days.
Hazy yellow with white head. Obvious wheat beer with aroma of orange and lemon. Citrus comes through at first taste. Bitter quickly fades. Nice wit.

AN easy blanche to find, but very good, I love it in summer.
Nice hazy golden colour with a big nice creamy head.
It smells very good, with strong notes of orange and coriander. The taste is the same notes, but less strong, even a bit bitter at the beginning.Very refreshing, one of my favourite summer beers.
Very lighjt clousdy yellow. Foamy head needing no coaxing. Fair amount of beading too all things considered. Quenching and refreshing but oh so thin.Distant fizziness. Pretty skinny and starved.

[Bottle on Beer Academy course] Quite astonished to discover that I hadn’t actually rated this yet.  I remember discovering it and loving it when in the Netherlands 20 years ago; then within a couple of years seeing it flood hte UK market at ridiculously high prices.  It has, however, been some time since I had it, andin the meantime I’ve gone off wheat beers rather.  It’s a pallid hazy gold with a thin white head and a rather aggressive fizz.  Banana is the most obvious flavour, with some lemon, clove and pear drop.  It’s slightly creamy in the mouth at first, but eventually rather on the thin side.  Overall there’s too much banana and it’s too sweet for my liking.  Did not live up to my fond memories at all, but perhaps it’s just that my tastes have changed.

Pours hazy spraw color with small white head. Aroma is quite strong coriander with hint of orange. Taste is fresh with coriander and orange too. Very freshness beer. I think that is especially prefered to drink in summer.
Pours light hazy straw color with a white head. Smells of coriander, light lemon, and bready malt. Tastes similar to smell.

12oz Bottle A - Pours a hazy light straw. Nice white head that dissipates at a steady pace. Lots of bubbles. S - Coriander, sweet banana bread , & yeast. S - Citrus maybe lemon, banana, coriander. M - Light/medium bodied, fizzy, mildly sweet/slightly bitter finish. O - Extremely refreshing. Would be a excellent summertime brew.

Draught. A classic Belgian witbier. One of the first Belgian beers I tried many years ago which was responsible for getting me into Belgian beers.  Pours classic hazy straw yellow color with a good sized foamy white head. Aroma and tasty is citrusy, wheaty and spicy with notes of coriander.  Notes of both light sweetness and tartness.

Bready citrus notes right up front.  Hazy pale yellow with a big white foam.  Balanced bready notes with tart citrus aspects.  Not a lot of spice character, but just enough to let you know if is there.  Crisp and refreshing with a snap finish.

330ml bottle served in branded glass. Cloudy tan yellow colour, foamy white head and aroma of yeast & lemon. Taste is citrusy, lemon & orange rind, with a slight bitterness and yeasty notes. Smooth bodied, dry finish. Quite drinkable.

33 cl bottle. Straw color, cloudy liquid and beautiful white head. This beer has a wonderful aroma and  taste. Citrus, coriander, hop and wheat notes. The sweet and sour taste is perfectly achieved, very balanced and smooth. However, this beer has its weakness on the palate. The texture is creamy, but I think that the body is too light and watery. The carbonation is lively and the finish is smooth and tasteful. A very good beer, great drinkability, although a little watery.
A good cloudy weiss beer in straw color with mild hops and good flavor and very drinkable.

the mix between sweet and sour fits good, great Belgian white beer, with a smooth finish.

Draught. Pours cloudy pale golden with big frothy white head. Orange and bubblegum aroma, bitter, a little yeasty and very citrusy taste. Full body, chewy, orange zest finish.

The original and still one of the best.  When I drink a wit, I invariably compare it to Hoegaarden.  Sweet, citrus and coriander, with a light hazy yellow color. Medium bodied and acidic.  Delish.
Bouteille et fût, robe blonde opaque, arôme de levure et d’agrumes, goût d’orange et de coriandre.

Perfect look - slightly cloudy off-white with big foamy head. Aroma is lemon and spice (and all things....). Taste is very light with almost insignificant spice. Perfect for a hot summer day. Slight yeastiness at end. Doesn’t stick much on the palate with just a touch of bitterness. One of my favourite beers to drink on draught. Sub-par out of the bottle.
Light golden color with a hazy look to it. Small foamy head with sour spices on the palate.

Single bottle.  Cloudy straw pour with moderate head.  Nose is wheat and citrus.  Taste is the same but with some spice.  Nice components, but doesn’t come together real well for me.  Not a big fan of Belgian Whites and this did nothing to change my mind.

12oz bottle to pint glass.  Very light colored.  Only slightly cloudy.  Smells like beer.  Definitely some sweet and sour tastes.  Highly carbonated.  Definitely not my favorite style but it’s a good brew.
Draught at St Michael, Oulu. Colour is deep yellow with large thick white head. Aromas and flavours are yeast, fruits, citrus, wheat and banana. Vety fresh.

Cloudy, unfiltered pale yellow color. Mellow, citrus, spice. Grass aroma. Fantastic beer. Great session beer at 4.9% ABV. One of my favorites.
Various bottles and taps in various places. Thick head and nice hazy pale colour. Taste of citrus. This is very refreshing and goes well with any food, but especially well with seafood.

250 ml bottle. Poors a very pale yellow and hazy color with a white head. Notable lacing.

Refreshing and light beer, to be drinked very cold.
The body and texture could have been stronger, but it’s not the intend of this Witbier (Belgian Wheat Beer).

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy straw color with thin white head and some grainy residue. Aroma of wheat, bread, orange, citrus and coriander. Taste starts with sweet frutiness of banana and citrus, then followed rich grainy, refreshing spicy and rounded with light bitterness. Medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Original Rating on 24/12/2012:



Cloudy pale gold with grainly sediment; Minimal head and foam with pretty good lacing; Light body, with faint smell of orange and coriander; zero hop bitterness, instead it has some faint but lingering taste of citrus and orange peel; sweetness and tartness is also quite minimal. Kind of like champagne with no taste.



Comments: typical Belgian witbeer style shared with Bocq’s Blanche de Namur - appearance, smell and taste are pleasing and inoffensive. The local Hong Kong consumers are currently getting heads over heels with Hoegaarden (more like a fad), but I am not impressed as it’s so light in every aspect. I am, however, much more happy with its cask / draft version I shared with friends at a local bar about 6 months ago, as it was more carbonated and taste was more intense. Oh well.

caramel, spruce, citrus, herbs, grass, banana, bubblegum, clove, licorice, woody, pale, hazy, frothy, white foam, lightly bitter, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, slick feel, lively, bitter
Pale and hazy pour with ample white foam. Bombarded with so many different aromas - the best part of this beer as dominant aromas change over the course of finishing the glass. Definite citrus flavour with spices of licorice and clove which lend an earthy background. Carbonation is quite lively but a thinner mouth feel than I like. Finishes dry with a hint of bitter/sweet. Love the 1L glass size!

12 oz, right out of the bottle: Aroma was kind of hard to judge but had some nice bready malts and herbal hops with a bit of doughy yeast. Appearance was not judged so a 3 was given. Taste was a nice citrus and coriander with a bit of belgian yeast on the backside. Much better than most wits I have tried. Smooth, refreshing, good summer drink.
I’m a fan of  Belgian whites, but this is not something I don’t go out of my way to buy all too often.

Il colore è di un bel giallo paglierino sbiadito, quasi di un verde molto opaco, con un leggero grado di torbidezza riconducibile alla presenza di lievito e alla sua non filtrazione. Per rendere l’idea, è quasi netta la visibilità da una parte all’altra del bicchiere. Attraverso il bicchiere è inoltre possibile notare un’elevata effervescenza interna, indice del processo di rifermentazione in bottiglia.
La schiuma si presenta alta e densa nella fase di spillamento, mentre si riduce notevolmente durante la fase di riposo in bicchiere, rimanendo sottile ma comunque cremosa, in particolare lungo i bordi.
L’aroma è assolutamente fresco, quasi basterebbe quest’ultimo a ripagare delle fatiche quotidiane. All’olfatto risaltano l’odore misto dolce-pungente del coriandolo e delle bucce d’arancia, che si presentano anche a livello di gusto. Ciascun sorso regala un pizzico di frizzantezza, alternando una prima percezione agra ma lieve, ad un sentore dolciastro e leggermente luppolato, chiudendo il cerchio con una nuova e questa volta più intensa, seppur leggermente, nota aspra. La persistenza amarostica è invece di bassa intensità, lasciando la gola fresca e dissetata.
Una mia personale raccomandazione è quella di conservare il fondo della birra per un sorso indipendente: la presenza del lievito che si deposita sul fondo altera la percezione degli altri sapori, esulando dal resto del corpo. Nel mio caso, l’ultimo sorso è stato un elogio alla naturalezza e alla nota rotonda e dolciastra che riempie la bocca e sazia la gola.
A great tasting and very refreshing beer. Light enough to be an everyday beer. Highly recommend!
Color is hazy yellow, with a nice white head. I smell citrus, wheat, vanilla and light flowers. I taste orange, malt, grass, and light spice. Just wonderful.....

330ml bottle. Pours cloudy yelly with frothy head. Aroma of cut grass and citrus. Flavours of straw and gentle spice with a little malt. The wheat really comes through. A mild finish with a lingering citric grassiness. Very easy drinking.
Draft->Hoegaarden glass.  Hazy straw with fluffy white head.  Aroma is citrus, herbs, wheat.  Flavor is lemony with some spice.  Very enjoyable, my favorite witbier.
La + celebre delle blanche...ed ormai anche la + commerciale. Classica speziatura con coriandolo ed arancia amara percettibile, di facile bevuta come vuole lo stile...
Palackban utóerjesztett, jellegénél fogva élesztőtől opálos. Különleges, frissítő ízében harmonikusan elegyednek a gyümölcsös és fűszeresen egzotikus aromák.

One of those beers that just seems odd to put a number on.  11.2oz bottle.  Hazy yellow-tan body with a massive white head.  Lemon tinged wheat aroma.  Light on the palate, hyper sessionable...this seems to get more watery every year.  The spices are mild and don’t detract from the simplicity of the style.  Creamy vanilla, faint orange.  Benchmark for the style, even though there are countless better examples.

Mouthfilling sweetness which is followed by sourness makes it feel funny and totally refreshing. Nice aromas of fruits and spices,cant say which spices or fruits. All in all great brew! Will def. buy again.

Classic Belgian wit beer flavors. Nice coriander. Spice us very balanced with the orange peel and grains.   This will be one of my permanant "go to" beers for everyday use.

Color: very pale - almost sand like - brown
Nose: floral coriander and wheat with a hint of fertilizer
Taste: Initially taste wheat with a light spice and acidity, on the mid-palate the coriander comes out and balances with the wheat, on the finish the wheat fades and a slightly chemical like acidity accents the coriander
Mouthfeel: Very smooth and yet not too light - it is very close to earning the velvety description that wines get lol, it walks the fine line between having substance yet not being too heavy
Comments: Very good and complex light beer, integrates well and flows smoothly from start to finish on palette, also common and accesible at most quality places, well worth the money by far and would also be good for the women (and not so manly men :p) who don’t drink heavy beers

Pours a nice hazy yellow with a fluffy white head; Hoegaarden has become one of the "go to" witbiers in many places (obviously excepting "Belgian" whites like Blue Moon or other BMC iterations).  This is very representative of the style: wheat and yeast dominate with clove, citrus (mainly lemon), and a touch of banana in the background.  Solid carbonation make this "feel" a little sweeter than it actually is, but that isn’t a bad thing.  This is my girlfriend’s favorite beer, and while I know that that isn’t necessarily a "good" comment, I don’t mind picking up a 12 pack of these from time to time and drinking them with her (although I skip the lemon wedge).

Cerveja de trigo muito refrescante e um dos melhores custo benefício aqui da região, depois da chegada das novas marcas. Creme pequeno e de textura cremosa, assim como o líquido, bem cremoso. O líquido é meio turvo, opaco, característico das cervejas de trigo, com algumas partículas suspensas, algumas escuras. A coloração é um amarelado vibrante. O cheiro é bem cítrico com notas de pão. E o sabor também é cítrico, com doce, azedo, amargo e ácido moderados e harmonizados. Ao final, o gosto é cítrico, puxado para laranja. Certamente será uma cerveja que não faltará na minha geladeira enquanto tiver na área.

Aroma: Banana and citrus fruits. Some white pepper.



Appearance: Pale yellow, milky body with a white frothy head. Lots of carbonation. Decent lacing. 



Taste: Sharp taste of orange rind, unripe banana and coriander. Slight white pepper spiciness. Could become cloying after a couple. Nice bitter finish. 



Palate: Medium body with a stick mouthfeel. Fizzy carbonation. 



Overall: A very unusual beer, so I’m surprised at how mainstream it has become. The bitterness verges on being sour, but overall, this is really nicely balanced and flavoursome.

Coriander is the devil’s weed. It tastes like vomit-scented soap.There are serious questions to be asked if anyone mixes it with beer. I was expecting an abomination with Hoegarden, and I got it. Great appearance, full bodied, but nauseous smell, putrid flavour, with overtones of battery acid and just a hint of beer. It has a particularly sickening aftertaste. 
Gave it for my son to try, without warning him of the coriander. He took a sip and thought the whole thing was a prank, that the beer had been tampered with something foul. 
That unfortunate encounter will keep me away from other "witbiers."

Poured from a bottle into a Belgium "satan" glass. It almost looked white during the pour, but then as it settled down it became a light yellow color but still not transparent. An inch and a half head of bigger foam bubbles formed. After a couple minutes the head broke down to just some lace around the edge.

12 ounce bottle.  In all, it’s a "B" grade beer - good, but not extraordinary. Appearance: gray-yellow, large amount of white foam on top.  Aroma: faint overall with citrus and floral notes. Taste: Yeast, bread, and citrus. Low level of hops and bitterness, as is typical of wits following a tradition of shunning much use of hops.  Mouthfeel: light and smooth, with a balanced amount of carbonation. Witbiers often have higher-than-average carbonation levels in order to balance out the malt-sweetness. Overall: It’s a solid Belgian White/Witbier and probably a good baseline marking the threshold of what’s above and below average for the style.  There’s nothing adventurous here, but it’s still enjoyable and great for the summertime.  Plus, it’s readily available and usually pretty cheap at about $1.25/bottle.  Trivia (adding to the recognition of certain ingredients and taste aspects): Witbiers stem from the beers of the middle ages in the Netherlands, and instead of using hops for preservation and flavor, they used a blend of spices called "gruit."  The orange peels and coriander spices used in Hoegaarden are a remnant of that gruit tradition, although nowadays most witbiers also incorporate some hops into the mix. Witbier, which is Dutch for "white beer"  is in the same family as weissbier, which is German for "white beer."  Witbier and  weissbiers are white because they’re unfiltered and have a hazy appearance due to the type of yeast they contain.  Whites also make use of unmalted wheat, as opposed to malted wheat.  In northern Germany, a similar beer would be termed a hefe-weizen, "yeast-wheat."  In France, it’s "la bier-blanche."
Poured from bottle into a Guinness pint glass. Really refreshing. Little bit of spice, little bit of lemon, nice dry finish. It’s everything it’s supposed to be. Very enjoyable.

Bottle- Pours a hazy pale golden color with a nice head that fades to some lacing. Aroma of citrus, lemon zest with some spice and grain. Taste has a mild malt sweetness with a sort of peppery flavor. The bitterness has a sort of sour nip with a fairly clean finish. Fairly moderate body, quite smooth and somewhat refreshing. Very drinkable. Can’t really argue with a classic Witbier.
Like an alcoholc ice cream float! Best on tap. Avoid the faffing around with lemons as there is enough of a citrus flavour without that.

Que dire de cette bière? Une de mes premières percées dans le style blanche. Au final et avec les années, le tout reste buvable, mais supplantée par de bien nombreuses autres bières du même style qui se valent nettement mieux, et encore plus depuis que la Hoeggarden est passée sous controle InBev.
Dorée comme la paille, assez trouble, col blanc.
Arôme de froment, grains, laissant une pointe d’épice et agrumes.
En bouche, le tout reste très léger, ressent encore le palais grains/froment avec ce léger côté citronné, pelure orange avec en retrait une pointe épicée de coriandre. 
A l’époque j’aurai donné un score plus haut, avec le recule et les années, cette bière est trop mondaine, et ne présente plus les qualités d’antan.

On tap, into a Lager glass. Pour is a light yellow with a fine head. Taste is of co2 and malt. Finish is of co2 and grass. Very good white.

Pours hazy yellow with thick white head.  Aroma is orange peel and hay.  Tastes very doughy with a little citrus character.  Acidic on the palate with some lingering wheat.  I imagine it would be good on a hot day, but I will pass on this one in the future.

Bottle served in a tulip. Hazy straw in color with a medium sized fluffy white head. Good retention and lace. Bright aroma of esters, orange peel, and coriander. Medium sweet flavor that quickly dries. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation, and a crisp, dry finish. Very refreshing.

This is my favourite beer ever. Has a nice fresh weath aroma, with a citrus touch. Hazy pale yellow color, with a small creamy white head. Begins malty and small bitter, then the orange and spices comes, and lastly finishes with the malt. Excelent.
A nice beer for the sunny days. Lots of citrus smell and taste. Good wheat aftertaste with hints of the citrus fruits. Best on tap though.

I have always enjoyed this beer. Pours surprisingly pale - white and cloudy. Aromas are cloves, yeast and citrus. In taste this starts slightly bitter becoming dry on the aftertaste. Excellent especially for a mass market beer.
It was the firs Witbier i ever tasted and I reached Nirvana... Recommendable ad maximum.
Bottle. A tried and true bottle of wheat. It’s cloudy and citrusy all the way from the appearance to the sour aroma and through the orangy, doughy taste. Not bad.

Orange, coriander and flower on the nose. Light, cream white in color with a small foam. Taste is crisp orange and coriander flavors with tons of drinkability. Overall, a very solid beer with big flavor. I’d give this an A rating.
Pale golden white opaque color; heavy scent of wheat and some hints coriander; smooth yeast foamy taste with nice crispness and sweetness balance; smooth finish. One of my all time favorites.
Better than blue moon because it has more coriander and orange peel flavor. Blue moon is more mainstream and subtle.

330ml bottle poured into frosted glass. Loosely foaming head quickly expands but dissipates in minutes. Only the thinnest of lace! Colour is very murky yellow (Lovibond 2) - hate to say it, but reminds me of a urine sample. At least a pleasant odour of oranges and flowery hand soap wafts up. 
Tastes slightly sweet but turns pungently acidic soon after swallowed. Also, coats the tongue and mouth with a chalky finish. Carbonation is very low. Very disappointing after seeing such good reviews here on it.

Buona blanche che si presenta con eccelenza. Colore pallido (tipico), e schiuma molto cremosa e densa! al naso è delicata e in bocca si conferma tutto.. il coriandolo e le scorze d’arancia sono parecchio percepibili, soprattutto nel finale.

March 11 2012. Poured from bottle into hoegaarden frosted glass. The glass helps hide the cloudy blonde appearance that is typical of wheat ales and not overly attractive. The thick white head and lacing that lasts through to the end is compensation for the ugly cloudiness. Strong yeast aroma with sweet hints of coriander and citrus. Watery palate makes very easy to drink. Tastes light, watery, sweet banana with citrus aftertaste and slight spicy finish. I like to keep a six pack in my fridge but it just does not last. Biggest downfall is how easy it is to drink. I can drink 6 of them before the alcohol sinks in.
Pours cloudy yellow... Nice citrus arouma.... Excelllent clean orange spice citrus taste....love this stuff. ?. Could drink all day...but they catch up with ya.. In my top 10for sure
This is my absolute favorite beer I have had ever.  Tastes just like the bottle reads and does not disappoint.

Bottle 0.33 L.
Pale yellow, muddy body with a huge, creamy white head, fully lasting with a good lacing.
Harsh yeasty aroma (citrus) with some spicy notes, maybe with sugar hints.
Moderate sweet flavour with a sour character and a bitter note in the finish.
Light-to-medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation; light astringency in the finish.

Surprisingly good for such a common brew. Clean and refreshing, well-balanced blend strongly influenced by citrus tones, and entirely drinkable. Excellent head with some persistence, lively carbonation to bring out the more subtle flavors, a strong mouth feel and a smooth finish. Certainly a beer I could drink all night.
Absolutely amazing wheat beer. The beer drinkers wheat beer. Smooth, refreshing with a distinct taste that can’t help but make you happy. Life is good when you know beer like this exists!
I still think this beer is delicious.  I don’t feel like I need to give the nitty gritty.  Easy drinker that opened my eyes to this style years ago.
Average foam in head with a pale yellow color.  Light sweet taste with an uninspiring finish.

Pours nicely with an excellent head.  It smells citrusy, it’s very cloudy.  It delivers an amazing taste of orange peel and coriander.  Truly the standard has been set for witbiers.  (Not to mention a staple in my diet.).

AROMA: citrus followed by coriander
APPEARANCE: pale, hazy, frothy
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness
PALATE: medium body, creamy, lively, long aftertaste
OVERALL: one of, if not the, best wit beers around.
very good aroma, very light in color with a very good head. very good balance of flavors with a citrusy taste

a: pale yellow color with foamy 1/4" head, noticable carbonation. Not as hazy as other witbiers.

s: citrus and yeast, very appealing

t: similar to smell, notes of carriander added and sweat malt
A very good beer to break into the darker beers. good golden color and smooth dringking. Nice beer to have on hand for guest.

Very drinkable beer. Poured from 11.2 oz bottle into glass. A nice golden cloudy appearance, with a large white head. Smells very bready. Very smooth mouthfeel, but doesn’t linger long. Very well balanced taste with points of light bitterness, sweetness, and a little sour in there as well. Overall a very enjoyable beer.

330ml bottle poured into a pint glass.

Appearance is a hazy light yellow with a thick, billowy head. No lacing.

Smells of coriander and orange along with some bready yeast. There is also a slightly sour note to the smell.

The flavor starts off orangey with coriander following close behind. There is not much sourness in the flavor but the bready yeast is there. Mouthfeel is creamy and coats the mouth.

Overall, this is a decent beer but not the best wit out there. Pretty run of the mill.
Smooth and rich taste. Floral and fruity aroma, with a subtle hint of banana. Very pale golden, cloudy. light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Overall, quite enjoyable.

This is truly a one of a kind Belgium white ale having a sound golden complexiox (proven its a beer suitable for a honerable man). This beer comes  with the absolute perfect blend of orange peel and coriander. Thee orange peel flavor makes a great combination to this delightful yeast wheat beer. As for the spices, malts, hints of lemon and citrus blend, and crisp bitter taste at the end i simply fell in love and tasted heaven. This is Blue Moon meeting its father!
Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a huge white head. Smells fruity, abit apricot. Tastes creamy fruity and bitter with a similar finish.
Cloudy pale yellow colour. Citrusy aroma. Citrus flavour. A very refreshing beer, great for the summer!

poured from a bottle.p the appearance is a very hazy/foggy lemon color. the aroma is very fruity, with a bit of yeast. the taste is like a sweet fruit yet also some citrus. the after taste is slightly bready.overall, a great beer!

Pours a light hazy yellow. Aroma is of orange peel and other citrus fruits. Taste is watery with hint of citrus and very slight alcohol taste. After taste is strong coriander. Overall not my favorite pick.

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Das belgische Weissbier schaut aus wie naturtrüber Apfelsaft, aber der Geschmack is verdammt geil. Spritzig frisch, leicht säuerlich, ein absolutes Sommerbier!!! Aber nicht zu vergleichen mit den deutschen Weizen. Beim Hoegaarden is kaum Hefe zu schmecken.
light golden haze, aroma of bitter orange and other citrus fruits with a light pine potpourri, flavor of citrus and other bitter fruits, some yeasty esters, clean and light, very drinkable

100 cl on tap. pale yellow colour with dense white creamy foam. citrusy aromas notes and a very small note of oranges. the taste is very flowery, like cologne, a lot of citrusy notes, but also some notes of malts, even though its light bodied. a very complete and great beer.

I don’t understand this.  How could I not have rated this before.  This is one of the beers that made me realize that I really like beer and that there’s a world out there beyond OV, Labatt Ice and Molson XXX.  This has been a favourite of mine for years.  Usually I drink it during the Summer.  It’s one of my favourite summer, by the pool beers.  Well I got a bottle for Xmas and just happened to check here and noticed I hadn’t rated this fine beer...

Hazy light yellow pour with lots of frothy white head.  Just a slight bit of hops mixed with lots of citrus in the nose.  Warming sweet and tart taste.  No bitterness at all.  Lots of citrus and coriander.  Very refreshing.  To me homey as it’s a beer I’ve been drinking for over 15 years.  Very clean finish, maybe a touch too much coriander in the after-taste.  I find it hard to fault this beer.  It has been and probably always will be a favourite.

Pour something like cat piss, with a big foamy head. 
Aroma is of bready yeast, some weird fruit and soy. 
Taste is quite sweet, with a lots of bitter tones. 
Watery body, with a lot of lively carb.

Pours cloudy yellow with some nice frothy white head. Aroma is slightly sour citrus with a bit of yeasty esters. Flavor is slightly spicy with some of the orange peel flavor peeking through. Very mellow and rounded flavor that rolls off the back of the palate. Classic belgian wit that is not too spicy and not to citrusy. Very easy to drink.
Bottle at Dublin Airport. Pale lemon with a thin white head. Aroma is perfumed wheat. Flavour is light fruity wheat with a sweet base. Finish is dry sweet. Watery texture

Frothy white head with a hazy light yellow body.  Head dissipates after a minute or so.  Wonderful nose of fruit and spices, with that immediately recognizable Belgian yeast smell.  Taste is nice and fruity with a soft lingering aftertaste.  Extremely smooth and easy to drink, this would be excellent on a hot summer day.
Anar vetebullar och citrus. Att det är en belgare råder det inget tvivel om. Tycker den smakar OK men eftersmaken påminner lite om gräddfil. Slutsats: OK.

La Hoegaarden, souvent imité cette Witbier Belge douce et rafraichissante, est la parfaite équilibre des épices et du zeste d’orange. Le tout dans une bière aux allures trouble. Le houblonnage délicat peu amer mais très gouteux en finale. Bref, la référence en Witbier.
citrus, pale, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly sour, thin feel, light body, average carbonation,
(ON TAP) I was at the Thirsty Lion in Portland, OR. This was a very weak beer. Just a notch or two under the average Wit. There is a watery taste to this beer with a light flavor of coriander
Pours a cloudy yellow colour, long-lasting white head. Its aroma is citrusy, its taste is medium sour and a little bit bitter. Very easy to drink.

330 ml bottle bought @ systembolaget and consumed on January 22. Pours hazy yellow with a big fizzy white head that leaves some lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is rather sweet and spicy with lemon zest and coriander. Taste is malty, slightly sweet and rather perfume-like with citrus, allspice and coriander. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly acidic with some lemon zest.

Cette blanche compte parmi les plus douces et les plus fruitées que j’ai bu à ce jour : son bouquet printanier amène des effluves de banane et autres retours de levure, tandis que ses saveurs restent dominées par le froment de blé et les épices douces. Une bière faite pour le plaisir et accessible à tous les palais.

bottle. hazy straw colour .Attractive pure white thick head . aroma is citrus , spices , cloves , grass  yeast .  taste is spicy and citrus   , grassy hops  .aromatic on the palate  . refreshing   - a good summer session beer  or with spicy food . Decent version of the wit bier style
Good Belgian beer, but a little too sweet for my taste.  I would rather have a Boulevard.

Pours hazy straw colour, white head. Aroma is yeast, orange, cloves and straw. Light bready malts, big orange, grassy hops and a little herbal note. Clean finish, delicate balance. This is the world’s wheat beer. Not the best but a good refreshing beer that is easily sessionable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

one of my favorite day starters on a weekend. pours hazy pale straw, fluffy white head. coriander, Belgian yeast, orange citrus, clove on the nose. hay and bread malts, grass hops pleasant and herbal flavors with balance of hop bitterness and subtle sourness. just a great session beer.

Pours a cloud, hazy straw yellow with a quickly fading head. I’m getting heavy clove in the aroma, followed by yeasty notes and wheat. Taste is very spicy yet refreshing.  Beautiful. This is a world class beer. Know that.

Bottle, pours hazy straw yellow with a thick white head into a branded glass. Aroma of citrus wheat, coriander and yeast.  Pretty good. Was the first beer I ever bought back on my 18th birthday in Montreal. Have had it often since however in later years it seems that the flavour is not as pronounced as it used to be? Shame really.

Had it at Ruby Foo’s in NYC after a Brooklyn Brown. Probably the wrong sequence. No head to speak of. Light on the palate. Pleasant enough. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A light hazy lemon coloured wit bier. Little vanilla banana in the taste citrus. Strong pleasynt citrusy middle. Crispy foam and body. It is a solid beer. No tone of bitter of  German wheat so rather mild with some sourness.  Great beer to just drink on a anyday and suits well dirrefernt meals with a freshing quality, be it sauerkraut, or fish ans so on.

Bottle at home. Hazy strawcoloured with a frothy white head. Aromas are dominated by spices and citrus. More spices and sweet citrus in the mouth as well, and with coriander. A light beer and not much aftertaste. Watery mouthfeel and some slick. A easy-drinking and good classic. Would be perfect as a refresher in the summertime.

Sit on the deck, crack open a nice cold Hoeg, and enjoy.  A real summer beer that refreshes.  

Love the colour of this beer as it looks exactly like it say it should.
J’aime beaucoup.  Une odeur un peu citronné, super robe jaune brumeuse avec mousse très généreuse.  Un goût un peu sûr et acide, coriandre et orange.  Excellent, rafraichissant.

Quite possibly the benchmark Belgian wheat beer as it is widely available and not a bad drop. Pours cloudy yellow with a big fluffy white head. Aromas of light banana and clove and flavours of bubblegum also. Used as a stepping stone into other wheat beers, this is an important beer in the world market.
On tap at Dublin. Square served  with a lemon.  Very light wheat beer...easy to drink many, but I?ppl just have one and then on to something better.  Katie Truk thinks it tastes like bologna/baloney.

Dessvärre så serverades ölen i ett överproportionerat fånigt glas med en alldeles för stor kant. Men annars fungerar denna ölen bra som strupnollställare, som de flesta andra weissbieren, och smaken präglas främst av jäst och citrus. Slutsats: gott.

Bottle. Pours very light hazy yellow medium white head. Aroma of orange, wheat, sweet bread. Medium sweet taste, medium body, lively carbonation. Sweet orange flavor finish. Overall good flavor and refreshing.
The only InBev product I will drink.  All around wonderful bouquet, yeasty sweet taste .
This is a very nice sweet beer. Kind of yeasty and flavourful. I really enjoy this Belgian beverage.

16oz draft from Old Chicago. Pours a cloudy yellow with a small bit of white head. Aroma of lots of coriander and a little orange zest. Taste is lightly sweet. Lots of coriander and orange zest. Light bodied with a thin texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, not bad. I’ve had this a lot mixed with a dry cider. Always pleasant.

Light yellow with a nice thin yet fluffy head which stays around for a while. Extremely refreshing citrus nose. The taste follows the nose starting with deliciously creamy and delicate citrus flavors which prelude delicious spice in the form of cloves.Very light and  refreshing yet with enough character to maintain interest.

Bottle.  Pours a pale yellow color with a thick billowing head.  Lots of carbonation.  Aroma is citrus and yeast.  Peppery beginning with a ting of metallic flavor along with more citrus flavor.  Its very crisp and light and finishes dry with a hint of hop bitterness.  Body is very light.  Not my favorite style but appears to be well built.
Really nice Belgian white. Some citrus aroma’s - nice white head. Very palatable - Great on a hot day in the backyard with friends. Very solid Belgian white.

Bottle. Well, i’ve expected a lot more from this one. Aroma is okay, a little fruity, loads of coriander. Taste is very light, traces of coriander and some hops. It was forgettable for me.   It’s hungarian relative, the Borsodi Búza (both factories were owned then by the same company), invented a few years ago by the Borsodi Brewery, was not a great success in Hungary. But I think, it was a lot more better than Hoegaarden - no offense!

Hazy, yellow and light brown body with a thick white head that lasts for a while. Aroma is very nice with coriander and orange as promised. Taste is a bit yeasty with some fruit. Taste has light bitterness but I feel the flavour could be stronger. Mouthfeel is nothing special, light carbonation with a watery feel to it. Aftertaste goes away quickly. I think this beer could be a nice refreshment for hot summer days but for some reason it doesn’t feel like that much of a beer to me. I’d take any lager over it any day but I understand this beer has its crowd also. I imagine this is a nice beer for someone who might prefer cider or something similar over beer.
Nice clean aroma. Smells of slight citrus cleaner (in a good way).  Very crisp. Pours wonderfully hazy pale, with big marshmellow head. Taste is crisp clean, with hint of citrus. Refreshing.
Pours a pale lemonade color with a bright white great head that dissipated quickly; somewhat sweet aroma; taste of fruit & coriander, refreshing and very light with good carbonation.

Una gran cerveza, la probe porprimera vez en Holanda y me enamoro, suave pero con un sabor persistente, ese toque de naranja en la elaboracion hace que sea muy refrescante, ideal para iniciarse en el mundo cervecero. el unico fallo que veo es que el vaso es demasiado pequeño para la botella y que en el caso de tomarte algunade mas acabaras derramando parte de ella. tremendamente recomendable

Bit of a Marmite beer this; you either love it or hate it. Overall as a refreshing summer beer to cool you off with an easy and oh so tasty finish can it be bettered? I think not. Better served with the lemons.

Draft.  Cloudy yellow pour.  Flowery sweet aroma.  Taste is sweet citrus.  Easy drinking.

5/28/12
Bottle.  Aroma of coriander, lemon and banana.  Flavor is banana and some orange.  Nice fine carbonation.
A lot better than the first time I rated this.  I think the first time I rated this beer it was a little past its prime.

on draft and it’s a hazy yellow with a white head that lingered. the aroma of spicy wheat is what you get and with the flavor its what you get. not a bad beer pretty smooth mild orange tinge to the wheat flavor..easy drinking.
Lots of nice fruit flavor, with a bit of good corriander as well. Great summer beer.

Pours a cloudy light yellow with a neon white fizzy head.The aroma was of sweet bananas with a citrus background.The brew tasted like a fizzy fruit smoothie that went heavy on the bananas which I didn’t like.The body was rather thin for me and it had a nasty funky aftertaste.Overall didn’t like it.

Cloudy egg yolk color with a big, billowing white head. The nose is sweet, of orange, bananas, grass, and coriander. The taste is moderately sweet and refreshing, if a little metallic. The body’s light, the carbonation lively.

From 750ml bottle. Lemony misty yellow with a white pillowy head. Fresh taste, very mild hints of the coriander and zest. Mild banana & wheats. A dry (slight salt) wheaty finish, and would be pleasant on a warm day. Not my favourite style, but nice for what it is.
weath aroma,pale yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice soft finish.
5.0% good head,slight citrus aroma, nice citrusy though quite a thin tasting Witbier but very enjoyable, I like it a lot and it is usually reasonably priced.  One of the best, even in cans.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow colour with scents of orange zest and undertones of corriander.  Taste is crisp with a grapefruit and banana finsh.  Mouthfeel is thick and creamy.  The hops really kick in after the first sip.  One of the best wheat beers around.

330 mL bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Hazy yellowish-orange pour with a bright white head.  Aroma of ripe banana, coriander, and light lemon zest.  The flavor is really nice; hints of orange peel and spice with a refreshing wheat flavor.  Easy to drink lots of these.  Often overlooked because of the broad availability, this should be the standard to which all witbiers are judged.
bottle.  pours hazy light orange with decent head. taste of fresh orange and clove
On tap and in weizen glass. Citrus and spice aroma and flavour. Light and refreshing, really drinkable.

bottle from lidl milford.fruity taste & cloudy. not my cup of tea. like dishwater. never again

had a pint in derrys xmas market. different yeast then a hefe . I know this is a good example. but not my style at all.
One of my favorite beers to drink. Cloudy and pale gold in color. Can definitely taste the coriander and a bit of orange. Great wittbier

I’m long overdue rating this beer. Beer pours an extremely light blond/white with a nice white rocky head, and smells like a wonderful summer/spring day. Taste of coriander and the esters from the yeast stand out immediately. Although were heading out of season for this type of beer it provides a nice summer getaway during the long cold months ahead.

On tap in a weizen glass.  Pours cloudy, light golden with a thick, white head.  Aroma of light malts, wheat, some spices, and floral hops.  The flavor is the same, but it’s perfect for a witbier.  Smooth and refreshing.  A great beer.
Cloudy white beer with a fruity taste.  Very drinkable on the deck on cool summer evenings.

750 ml bottle into a hoegaarden glass. Can be quite volatile, the white head must be tamed with a slow, controlled pour. The beer is a light golden/straw colour; cloudy, but still possible to see straight through. Aroma of citrus lemon and earthy herbs. Taste is pleasantly sweet, with a mild bitter edge. It is quite tingly on the palate with carbonation being plentiful. Very refreshing and widely available.
Clear golden beer, almost white. Very nice white head very long. Citric flavour with lots of notes. Very refreshing beer. Perfect for summer time. Long and fine finish.
Bottle to pint glass. Pours a weak pale yellow with a white head. has a slight citrusy aromal. Taste is a bit watery with a hint of lemon. A decent witbier
Easy to drink. Light but very tasteful... Great aroma too....!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Bottle (not 5, but 4.9%). I bought in Hungary, Budapest (Spar). If I taste it well, it’s a nice mix of the wheat beer and a typical belgian beers’s yeast. At first I smelled the yeast, and when I tasted it, I sensed this mixed flavour. I felt it for a long time in my nose.
Hazy pale yellow. Grainy nose. The taste is citrus, some grain in the background, coriander and some vague sweetness. Mild hops in the finish. Very refreshing and crisp.
Not a huge fan of wheat beers but this one has me thinking differently. Wonderfully awesome. Better when temps are above 40 degrees out. =)
12 ounce bottle that poured a cloudy yellow with aromas of light fruit, hops, coriander and some citrus.  Flavors are much the same, was a crisp and refreshing beer.

Una de las mas reconocidas cervezas blancas que se pueden encontrar en el mercado. De aroma ligero, con acentos citricos a sumo de naranja, asi como especias. Color turbio con sedimentación, con luces en color oro palido. Buena cabeza de espuma. Sabor refrescante, algo citrico, con sabor a grano.  En resúmen una sabrosa y refrescante "Witbier".

0,33l bottle bought in a Hungarian supermarket, in Budapest. Greenish yellow with a small head. I like the taste and the aroma of the coriander. It dominates.  It’s fresh and fruity.It’s a bit watery. I think, it should have more extract. It’s a good beer.
Hazy light yellow beer it had a fruity aroma. Very smooth with a silky texture. Citrus dominates the flavor. nice finish.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly. Smells of sweet fruit and bread. Tastes light, refreshing, yet distinctively belgian. A good one.
Bottiglia,spina.Dieci anni fa era tutta un altra cosa ora può andar bene solo per dissetarsi nelle estati davvero calde.
07.11.2011 - bottle @ caffé ’het zwarte gat’ in Gent - easy-drinking beer, flavors of citrus/fruit, maybe a little bit too sweet
It’s just not very good. Really light cloudy yellowish color, almost no head, smells kind of funky and is quite watery. I can drink it, I just don’t care for it.
Such a cool beer, tingles the tongue but slips down effortlessly. Shame the bottle isn’t any bigger!
One of my favorite summer time beers.  Pours cloudy with little to no head.  Best served chilled.  A very good Belgian white beer!

Very nice beer, one of the best of this style, critics: a little green colour.
Incredible aroma and taste, oily palate, very recomendable.

0.75 bottle. Opaque, faded gold color and creamy, white head. Fruity aroma with typical banana scent, though somewhat faint, some citruses and wheat. Delicate sour taste, just slightly sweet, archetypal banana and citrus. Light to medium body, marginally creamy texture, soft carbonation and quite average finish, both in terms of length and satisfaction, it can be said that banana saves the day here. All in all it is a softer version of a typical wheat beer, naturally banana and citrus are present, it is refreshing and brisk, but lacks strength in taste.
Served chilled. Hazy off white body, white head. Fruity and spicy, but not overpoweringly so. 70 cl bottle saw me through cooking a chilli very well. Will probably buy again.
From bottle.  Pours cloudy yellow with thick foamy white head.  Strong aroma and sweet ctirus taste.
Pours pale off yellow and cloudy with a foamy white head. Sweet aromas of bugglegum noticed. The flavour is sweetish/sour with a notable citrus tang. The beer is rather thin but overall good quality.

I love a nice wheat beer, but Hoegaarden just seems a little off to me. I don’t like the sour touch which gets in the way of the typical wheaty cereal flavour of a regular wheat beer. A lot of my mates will drink it but I’ll take most other wheat beers ahead of Hoegaarden anyday.

330ml bottle. Had this ages ago and thought it was pretty good. The one I had today didn’t really do much for me. Aroma was wheat, coriander and citrus sour. Appearance was an unfiltered, dish soap yellow with a large foamy white head. Taste was ho-hum, floral grains and coriander with some sourness. Body was medium. Overall, I just don’t like coriander that much.
Pours a  hazy yellow. Mellow zesty feel. Like it advertises it has a sweet but sour taste that is well balanced. Has a sour but dry finish.  Very nice brew I’ll definitely be getting this one again.

Keg @ No.27 Inverness.

Straw white, very hazy, rocky white dissipated to a very thin covering.

Aroma of spicy hops, cereal, cloves, perfumy hops, some orange zest.

Taste of perfumy hops, wheat, spicy hop lemon, orange zest, coriander.

Palate - very low carb...dryish finish with citrus, spices and cloves....powdery smoothness but thin.

Beer not great condition here, rather flat. To be honest, I’m not all that keen on this.

Served in a ridiculously huge stein type of glass. Pours a hazy white with a thick head. Smells of wheat and hops. A thicker, almost frothy mouthfeel and was sweet to my tongue. Also tasted of hops, malt and wheat and a bit of spice. Surprisingly complex and strange mix of sweet and sour.

14-OCT-2011, draft @Sundby Sejl, served in the real 0,5 glass that is almost too heavy, but really cool.
Unclear, milky light yellow with lasting white low head.
Citric, yeasty nose with banana and apricots?
Taste is much the same with an added hoppy bitterness. 
Body is a bit thin but still somewhat creamy. Carbonation feels on the low side, mostly due to the very small bubbles.
Lovely refreshing drink.

Light cloudy yellow in appearance (not particularly attractive in my eyes). Clear thick head. Aroma is all citrus, yeast and flowers (slightly metallic strangely). Taste is light, hoppy, and not as sweet as expected. High carbonation, but very smooth. Leaves a sticky palate, but quite acidic on the finish. Cold, refreshing, and nice in the summer, but a little disappointing.

Bottle 33 cl. A cloudy, pale yellow colour with a high, frothy, white head. An aroma of wheat, spice and citrus. The taste is medium sweet. A medium body, oily texture, average carbonation and a long finish.

Bottle 33cl. Pale and murky golden beer with a creamy and persistent head os good lacing. Aroma to citrus, fruits, coriander, fresh malts. Medium sweetness taste, citrus with some hints of coriander. On palate results a beer with creamy texture, carbonation is lively, refreshing final.

Tasted bottle from Trader Joe’s into nucleated tulip glass. Pours a very light straw color with yeast haze and tall white foam which immediately subsides, leaving no lace. Aromas of grass, faint citrus, clove and coriander but no late hops. Malt flavor is nonexistent, completely cancelled out by bittering hops and attenuative yeast. All that’s left is a neutral, highly carbonated wash. Light body. Soft, mellow, wheat bread aftertaste. It causes instant dry-mouth. People who say Belgian Witbier is refreshing must simply keep pouring ’em back without taking a break. Slightly more sour and peppery as it warms, but fewer yeast phenols overall than I expected. This is an ale, right? I’ve tasted plenty of unfiltered lagers with more character than this. None of this is bad, per se. Hoegaarden is the original beloved Belgian Wit. And it IS very good; I guess this just proves I prefer some of the Americanized interpretations with more complex grainbills, more malty-sweetness, more color, more body, and more aggressive yeast profiles. Now I know; it’s good to go back to the source on occasion. See how your own tastes have changed over time.

I like this even though it pains a little - spicing is good, wheat is good, life is good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. pours cloudy pale yellow. The distinctive yeast makes for an appealing citrus and spice nose. Tastes refreshing. Citrus. Smooth with a mild CO2 sharpness. A fine beer. This was the first premium European beer to be available in Edinburgh. It holds fond memories.

One of the nicest beers I’ve ever tasted. This is one cool beer. Everything from it’s mysterious cloudy colour, to the speciality glass encompasses it. Aorma may be a slight let down, it’s complex but to me, as I spend alot of time around bacterial culture, the smell of yeast was odd, but not detering. The meat of this beer is in the taste. It glides smoothly, holding it’s medium/full body well with it’s abv which doesn’t overwhelm at all, letting those sweet citrus notes shine, along with the classic wtibier taste. A must try.
From bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nice fresh lemon aroma. Lemon taste with peppery spicy yeast. Refreshing palate. A nice beer

Bouteille de 25cl. Couleur jaune très pale, léger trouble, mousse moyenne et de tenue moyenne. Un classique parmi les classiques mais son statut est justifié par ses ârômes épicés et d’agrumes et sa capacité désaltérante. Je la trouve juste un peu faible niveau carbonnation même si c’est souvent le cas des blanches. Trouvée à Intermarché - Montigny en Gohelle.

Pours a hazy lemonade yellow with small white beaded head.  Aroma is wheat, orange peel, coriander, and belgian yeast.   Taste is coriander and citrus with a very clean wheat/malt finish.  Pretty good witbier.

Pense em uma cerveja capaz de te introduzir um mundo novo. A Hoegaarden é um excelente primeiro passo para quem espera tirar mais proveito da sua relação com a cerveja. Novos integrantes da tribo da cerveja que comecem a sua experimentação com essa cerveja, estão em boas mãos. Excelente aroma cítrico, é possível perceber todos os aromas do processo produtivo. Uma cerveja que pode ser servida bem gelada, recomendação do Xavier Depuydt. Lembrando que o bem gelada significa no mínimo 3 graus. O sabor é impactante. Não é tão complexo como cervejas de abadia. É um sabor mais estabelecido no ambito perceptivel. Fica evidente os toques de baunilha.

Looks almost like lemonade in the glass with a decent white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and some citrus. Tastes pretty refreshing, but it doesn’t have alot of depth. I’ve tasted the orange in this more in the past, but this one doesn’t pack as much of a punch, and the coriander is there but not prominent. I would give this a sub 3 if I knew it wasn’t this bland, but I’ve had fresher bottles than this, so I’ll give it the benefit of the doubt.

Considered by many to be the bench-mark for a witbier, this brew certainly does not disappoint!! Truly a great brew made for these hot Texas summers! The contrast of sweet and sour flavors pleases well on many levels – smell, taste, and quenching one’s thirst! Would definitely love to go to Belgium and try this brew there at its freshest.

Draught at various places. Very pale yellow, almost opaque with a small creamy white head. Nice cloves and yeast on the nose. Really nice actually. Palate treads the fine line between clean and boring but finishes smoothly, hint of bready sweetness. Surprisingly decent.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange and yellow with a medium white head.  Aromas of clove, wheat, and citrus, somewhat spicy.  The flavor is sweet yeast and wheat, orangepeel, slightly tangy.  Medium carbonation.  Good.  [801]

White head that disappears very quickly.   Unfiltered yellow-white color.  Very aromatic herbal essences, citric notes and fresh wheat.
Refreshing sweet wheat and malt.   Hard to perceive the hops.
Some sweeteness of aftertaste but not much.
bottle and tap. Probably the best wit beer i’ve tasted yet. Lovely texture and color. Try the draft one.

Slightly cloudy pale yellow pour with a pleasing white head that quickly fades.  Aroma of soft banana esters and slight orange notes with a hint of DMS upon warming.  Sweet start to the flavor with banana and pear notes followed by pepper and spice and a very mild bitterness in the finish.  Medium bodied, highly carbonated small bubble mouthfeel.  Very nice classic witbier.

Massive seller at work. Figured I’d try it. As far as wheat beers go (and me not being to fond of them), this one isn’t too bad. Orange spices and cloves are prominent on the nose. Orange peel and spices in the taste. Very easy and sessionable

Sampled in various places, both tap and bottle. Dirty cloudy appearance, spicy and orangey to drink. Given the distribution I guess it defines the Witbier category - but for me it’s thirst quenching and a nice change from other beer styles.

75 cl. bottle, shared. Hazy, yellow colour with a thin, bubbly white head. Aroma of orange peel and slight coriander. Medium carbonation. Taste is very light with soursweet notes. I get orange peel, coriander, spices and a touch of wheat in the finish. Very refreshing beer for the summer and a true classic.
Easy drinkable witbier with fine fruity flavors. Good for a warm summer day. Good balance.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Summit Scandia Witbier glass (RIP Scandia)

Appearance: Very pale cloudy yellow with nice stark white head and bubbly legs that rise and fall.

Aroma: Orange peel, coriander, banana and cloves are all in full force. Wheat malt aroma is minimal.

Taste: Mostly orange peel and slightly sour wheat malt. There is just a touch of coriander before it turns more clove-like on the finish. While well made, a little more bland than other Witbiers I have had.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation, medium body, dry tart finish.

Overall: Extremely refreshing Witbier that defines the style for me. Very balanced overall, which means that it has no aberrations, but also means that it does not quite reach the heights of which the style is capable. Once again, RIP Summit Scandia.

Considering the large distribution of this beer, this should be the Witbier that mainstream drinkers choose, not the sub-standard Blue Moon.
Bottle at The White Horse, London august 2011. Pale, hazy with a nice small head. Citrus, banana and some herb aromas. Refreshing nice beer.

Bottle. Light aroma of grass and wheat...bit of a hoppy smell. Pours a dirty, mixed color. Light and kind of looks like a wheat/lime drink. Has a slightly sweet and sour taste to it, crisp with grassy flavors and a nice finish.  Caught off guard by this beer, pretty much is always in the local section with a bunch of subpar selections (Peroni, I’m looking at you!) so pleasantly surprised! 5% alcohol.

Cloudy pale yellow, huge tight white head. Aroma is spicy, yeast, juicy orange, and wheat. Light bodied and spritzy. Flavors are banana, bubblegum, white pepper, wheat. Medicinal. Slightly sweet finish. Refreshing and delicious.

This Belgian Wheat beer has a nice simple flavor with an easy palate there after. It appears a light clear brown with a small white head. It has a simple wheat aroma and is a refreshing beer for the summer.

En urtvättad wit som det väl egentligen inte finns många skäl att köpa. La trappes wit är flera vetestrån vassare och det finns ofta ickebelgiska varianter som är stilen trognare. Men den är en väldigt bra törstsläckare varma sommardagar och det är inte alltid man vill ha sitt veteöl så jästigt eller kryddat. Så en svag trea är den väl i a f värd.

citrus, herbs, coriander, pale, white foam, light sweetness, fizzy, 
Bottled. Very refreshing, with taste of citrus and coriander really present. The good end of a warm summer day.

Poured from a tap into a pintish-type glass at Rí Rá in Las Vegas, Nev. Just a touch of head. Color had a lemon look. Slight film/lacing. 

First smell was banana. Also some other fruits - lemon mainly - and some cloves? Very refreshing smell.

Refreshing first sip with lots of flavors. Wheat and grain seemed to dominate. Also a light spice of something. Maybe pepper? Could have been the cloves. Ending taste had some kind of blood taste. But I like my blood, so it worked out.

Really great mouthfeel. It stayed good throughout and was much better out of the tap then out of the bottle (like I’ve had before). Average carbonation. 

I’ve had this before, but I really enjoy this beer. It was even better out of the tap. Perfect for the summer.
On tap at Overdraught.  Pours a hazy pale straw yellow with moderate-sized white head.  Aroma is fairly mild with clove and banana. Taste is clove, banana and a bit of citrus.  Fair.
Citrus tasting, light soda light taste with a nice texture on the tongue.  Other than that, not a huge fan of this belgian,
From a can. Pours a hazy pale-gold with a medium head. Aroma of orange, herbs and a light citrus-touch.
Much better in Europe than America. This is an extremely rich and refreshing beer. Quite lemony and wheaty but not without some hops.
12oz bottle thanks to my uncle Goerge. Mildly pale yellow color, BIG poofy head. Hefe-like banana aroma. Good crisp carbonation. Sour/sweet taste. Lives up to the rep.

Pale yellow with a large head that dissipates quickly, but not completely. Aroma is citrus, vanilla and yeast. Taste is lemon and wheat. Not overly complex, but a great casual summer drinking beer and definitely one of the better widely available beers.
Almost a fluffy texture in the mouth. Murky blonde color - very sexy. Has just enough taste to be delicious but not enough that drinking their big bottles becomes burdensome. Great.

Very strong smell of vanilla and citrus but it’s taste is not as heavy and a bit more watery. Nice thick yellow colour with a strong white foam. Very acceptable white beer but far from as powerful as it’s german brothers.

If heaven had a beer, this would be what the angels drank.  Purity, lightness and beauty in a glass.  The lower ABV guarantees you can have several if you desire, and what better replacement for your average adjunct lager? The best thing to drink on a warm summer’s day, and wonderfully refreshing with Chinese or Indian food.  I like to have one of these after having a particularly strong wicked Russian Imperial Stout, just for the contrast -- Hell and Heaven.
Godlike. When one is thirsty, this one is "old trusty". Brown-greyish colour. Aroma of citrus and yeast. Sweet taste.
Bottle@Caen. Thin head. Haze white-yellow. Citrus floral fresh grass aromas. Taste of citrus-sour notes. No bitter sweetness. Gentle Weiss bier inspite of its commercial relationship.
Spicy sweet aroma. Cloudy yellow lemon colour with white head. Taste is sweet, citrus, wheat, malts. Tasty. One of the best macrobrews.

Hazy light yellow, with a decent head that unfortunately doesn’t last terribly long.  Smells of crisp wheat, coriander and the standard wit orange peel.  Not very different or assertive.  Flavor was spot on, hitting every necessary Wit mark; Orange peel, slightly spicy and zesty yeast notes, light crisp wheat, with some light citric rind.  Great Wit, probably deserving of its high praise.  But it’s so by-the-book that I’m not sure if I can dig it.  Would probably pair excellently with a lemon-filled doughnut.

Pours hazy golden with a large white head. Smells like wheat and coriander. Tastes like mild spice and wheat, following the nose. Light-bodied with a smooth texture and active mouth-carbonation, Hoegaarden finishes strongly and crisp, with hints of pine.

Tap @ Golden Rule. Pours cloudy lemon with a good head. The nose is floral with oranges and other zesty citrus fruit. The taste has apricots and oranges with a creamy yoghurt end. The palate is medium in structure with a creamy texture and the end is dry and thin, so a bit lacking on the finish. Overall, it fell away and to think I used to drink it all the time before I became a beer nerd!

A pale golden yellow (think grapefruit juice) with a thick white head and plenty of haze from the wheat and yeast combine. Corriander and yeasty spices on the nose, maybe nutmeg? Initial flavour of orange and gentle wheat character, with the corriander following behind. Medium bodied with gentle carbonation and a fairly brief finish.

Pours a cloudy yellow with tall white head.  Fruity and hoppy aroma.  Ahh, Hoegaarden, what a distinctive taste.  Fruity, creamy, spicy.  Notes of banana, clove, orange, honey & corriander.  I’ve always liked this one.

Bottle. Straw yellow with a frothy head. Faint aroma of coriander and citrus. Taste also very faint and weak, citrusy and spicy. It’s not bad but definitely too watery and thus disappointing. Curiously though, there may be scores of better witbiers out there but this one has a remarkable drinkability.
Draught @ Gloria, Kuopio. Originally rated on 2.7.2009. Nice, refreshing and tasty witbier.

Appearance: The head is a beautiful frothy white head but it disappears fairly quickly.  The body is a nice cloudy lemon-aid color.
Nose: strong lemon notes; slight hefe-weizen yeast/banana notes; 
Taste: lemony and hops; mild banana and hefe-weizen yeast notes; carbonated bite; Finishes with a creamy balance of bitterness and lemon and hefe-weizen yeast.  
Mouthfeel:  carbonated, creamy.
Overall:  It may not have the prominent delicious flavors of certain other wheat beers, but it is still very refreshing, a great summer beer, and one of my favorite go-to session beers because it is cheap, delicious, and widely available.  It goes down incredibly fast and I often drink 4-5 bottles without even realizing it.

On draught at The Cuckoo’s Nest. A cloudy very pale straw colour with a thin white head. Aroma of pear, lemongrass, coriander and Belgian candi sugar. Thick mouthfeel. Flavours of coriander, wheat, berries with a lemon twist. Not the best I’ve had, usually it is more carbonated and pours with a thick white head. Over-rated nonetheless!

Pours a hazy straw color with a warm white glow and a moderate white head.  Aroma is mellow, but there’s coriander, hay, dust, light orange, slight yeast funk, and an overall sense of harmony.  Flavor is bright and tart with coriander and citrus taking center stage with hay, bread and grass not far behind.  The yeast is drying and slightly funky.  Finishes clean and mellow with sourdough toast and a hint of spice and citrus.  Nice and dry.  Where this beer shines the most is the mouthfeel.  It’s lighter than a lot of witbiers, but the flavors are better held together, and the finish is amazingly effortless.  It’s as easy to drink several of these in a session as it is to analyze the craft that went into making it.  A classic with good reason.
33cl bottle. Superpale yellow with a foamy white head. Citrus aroma and taste of coriadel and lemon. A dry beer, but refreshing.

A classic of the style. Pours pineapple yellow with a lot of foam. Has the prerequisite orange peel and coriander on the nose. Lots of carbonation. The taste is dry without being astringent. The orange flavor follows throughout the swallow. Very nice.

Belle bière de couleur jaune pâle d’apparence trouble. Elle dégage des odeurs assez prononcées d’agrumes et de façon plus discrète, de levure et de blé. Elle a un goût légèrement épicé, acidulé, avec des notes de blé qui lui confèrent un équilibre parfait. Une excellente bière qui est probablement la référence en matière de blanche.
simply a brilliant beer great smell and taste somthing to really  look forward to.

Hmmmm....who let the Ho’s in my garden????  This beer may attract garden beasts, but if you want the dirty Ho’s rooting around in your "business" I humbly suggest you lay in a supply of Milwaukees’ finest: BLATZ!!  That’s how I roll.
I really like this beer its great in the summer its perfect for cooling u down really nice taste look and smell

A friend of mine labels this his favorite summer beer. I have to agree - it’s great on a warm summer day! Light yellow, hazy with a moderate white head. Aroma is citrus, wheat, yeast, taste likewise, a bit sweet with a slight bitterness at the end. Just right for the type of beer. I can’t really pick out the coriander but I guess if it’s there it doesn’t harm the beer - on the contrary.

Bottle looks very simple. Beer in the glass light, small head. Fruity aroma like lemon. Starts very mild, gets more and more fruity, a bit sourish. Prickly finish, a bit washy. The aromes promises something that the beer cant keep.

Had my first Hoegaarden on tap at a PF Chang’s.   By far the best beer in their selection.   I’d not tried Hoegaarden before, as I usually prefer the heavier maltier beers over hoppy beers, but this one was an excellent summer beer, and I was really taken with how well it went with the Chinese food, even the hot and sour soup.   But the beer seemed to have a bit of sweet and sour mix itself.   The first thing I did was pitch the orange slice they put in it.  This isn’t Corona, it doesn’t need any help.

I was taken right away with how light a yellow this beer was with a very nice white head, but this is my first time trying a Witbier.  It was a touch cloudy and produced a nice lace.

It was hard to get much of a read on aroma, as it was served up in a pilsner glass, but I primarily got fruit and corriander.

The taste was similar to the smell, but I got more hops at the midway point of the drink.  The citrusy taste along with the spice and hops made a nice combo.

I’d always avoided the white beers, assuming the would be too light to intrigue me, but Hoegaarden opened my eyes and leaves me willing to try some more Witbiers.
Bottle, pours hazy, light golden with large white head..... aroma is nice coriander, citrus,spicy..... the flavor is sooo nice ! coriander, citrus, grass some hay.... very nice Belgian beer! .....
Not as good from a bottle as on tap in Brussels but then, what is? Pours pale cloudy gold with a finger or two of white head. Lemon, coriander, banana, yeast and wheaty goodness.

Well-carbonated, refreshing, and citrusy wheat beer that lacks the creamy body of the top exemplars of the style. The orange and coriander aftertaste is satisfying enough. If the palate were a bit creamier this would go from very good to great.
Overall still one of the best whitebeers I’ve tasted so far, though it’s quite an average taste. Very nice smell and good color for a white.

Bottle.  Pours a weak pale cloudy yellow  with a white head.  Aroma is of lemon peel, some spice and a litlte banana.  Taste is light and refreshing and of light lemon and faint spice with a bit of a yeast characteristic.  Middle of the ground summer brew for me.

Enjoyed on tap at Lincoln Hall in Chicago, IL while seeing the band Jeff the Brotherhood.  I’ve had Hoegaarden numerous times before and it really is delicious.  Appearance very light yellow with rich white head.  Aroma of coriander, Belgian yeast, bananas.  Taste similar to the aroma.  Really solid beer that I should drink more often!

Whitish pale yellow opaque body, it looks like somebody has spilled milk in my beer! I’m probably a victim of my poor pouring skills again, but I didn’t mange to get a very big head, and the white, fizzy head that was created reduces to a filmy layer pretty fast. The aroma is intense and very pleasant: spices, banana, yeast, citrus and perfume. The taste is quite sweet but also acidic. A sweet honey flavour that I didn’t notice in the flavours balances the citric acidity and spices very well. The body is a bit too thin, but the fitting lively carbonation and the nice dry finish saves the palate rating. Extremely refreshing and crisp and perfect for a sunny afternoon in the garden! 

[33 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet, Vika, Oslo]

Bottle. Pours yellow hazy in the glas with a big white head. Typical wheat nose with coriander. Nice body, which often is under estimated by making wheat beer. Regardless of this is one of the most commercial brews, I think it belong in the top. Really nice
a cloudy yellow colour, nice size head that fades over time.  Bananas, orange and spice, clove and coriander, up front with more subtle characteristics behind. Some fruity sweetness.

Easy to drink witbier that comes with a strong, heavy looking glass. Not really special, but it’s very much in balance and very easy to drink. Just couldn’t blow me away. Mouthfeel is a bit flat, lacking in body.
A great beer that is not too heavy.  It reminds me a lot of Blue Moon, but is much better quality.

33cl bottle
don’t understand why this beer gets such good ratings.  KORENWOLF IS WAY BETTER.  sorry for the caps.  This is a mediocre wit beer
Bottle pours hazy light honey with rich white foam. Sweet and light to the taste. Aroma is citrus and wheat. Overall, a refreshing drink but overhyped.
Cloudy hay blond beer with a good head. Citrus aroma and taste. THE traditional witbier.
