this beer has cloudy yellow colour with smooth white head & aroma after citrus fruits, with small portion of citron juice this beer is a great drink for summer days.

75cL bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a fizzy-to-foamy white head. Smells strongly of spice, yeast, and coriander. Flavor is very crisp, fresh, and palate-cleansing. Feels very light. Tastes of coriander spice, yeast, some sweetness, and some citrus. Also a few floral notes toward the end. Very well balanced. Initially feels foamy in the mouth, then very smooth and creamy into a light and dry finish. Very fine carbonation adds to the feeling of lightness. Very good.

Bottle @ Hästöskatan in Kronoby. Golden and "thin" colour, white head on top. Fresh aroma with a little citrus, lemon and other spices. Just a little sweet, you get a refreshing feeling from this beer. REALLY NICE

aroma of citrus (lemon in particular) and yeast, very funky.  attractive pale straw color with a large foamy head.  a lot of citrus flavor with some bread, coriander, and some herbal/grassy and floral notes.   crisp and refreshing.

Bottle @ Bierologie in Gent. Hazy golden colour with a nice firm white head on top. Aroma has citrus, fresh coriander, lemon peel and mowed grass. Flavour has some sweetness in it, paired with the spiceness of the aroma. Really refreshing witbier.

Ohh, i just love this, it’s one of the beers i would be happy dying sinking in a pool of it! Very Pale straw body, hazy, generous white creamy head. Floral aroma, spices, coriander, citrus. Some yeast and grains. Light mouthfeel, also if quite carbonated goes down superbly, refreshing. Lemon-sourish finish. OK!

Pours an amazing hazy faint yellow, with a big ole head. The scent is amazing, very thick and mellow with notes of bread, sweet yeast and a hint of vanilla. Flavor is amazing as well, full of bready notes and citrusy tang. The balancing undertones of sweet malts and a bitter wheat finish make this quite enjoyable. A very complex and drinkable beer - I am impressed!

4.9 % acl. vol. Bottled, 33 cl. Pours gold bubling beer with a white head. Aroma: Mild fruits, citrus. Taste: Medium sweetness. Pineapple. Hints of sourness. Palate: Soft bodied, thin. High carbonation.
bottle. Pours pale cloudy yellow. Aroma of citrus, yeast, bubblegum. Taste is light, but with a tangy bite. Classic example of the style.

Das Hoegaarden Biere blanche wird mit Koriander und Curacao-Orangenschalen gewürzt. Das merkt man diesem belgischen Weizenbier in der Tat an. 
Würzige Blume, ein fruchtig-rezenter Geschmack mit wenig Herbe und ein milder Abgang machen es zu einem Klassiker. 
Endlich mal wieder ein Bier zum Reinbeißen!Test vom 20.10.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Pours a light, cloudy yellow with light white head.  Nose is bready.  Thin-medium on the tongue with nice yeast and ester taste.  Flat finish, but satisfying overall and great on a hot day.

I’m really not a huge Witbier fan but this one is really decent and drinkable. Aroma is a not overpowering orange, wheat, and spice. The taste has everything a typical Witbier should have, citrus, wheat and coriander, this has a great balance, not one element is overpowering, and it’s not overly sweet or spiced. Refreshing and sessionable.

Pretty brew, gold with a huge white head.  The smell is classic Witbier, spicy and wheaty with hints of yeast.  Tastes like a great Wit should, bananas mixing with a tart sweetness that is good enough without the orange the tattooed bartender keeps putting on my glass.  Great step up from Blue Moon.  (4//18/07)
(bottle) A nice easily found Witte to call for all summer instead of Corona.

Bottle. Beautiful pale yellow color, hazy, nice cmall creamy head. Floral aroma with citrus and coriander. Great flavor in the same landscape as the aroma. A tiny hint of Belgian yeasty banana flavors. A hint of grains and bread. Slightly sweet, slightly sour, dry finish. A bit thin, but very easy to drink.

0.33l bottle. Pours a hazy lemonade-yellow body with a nice creamy white head leaving big lacing down the glass. Aroma is nice citrus, strong hay, coriander, orange zest and a bit spicy. Lively carbonated, medium bodied and has a nice oily to watery texture. Perhaps a bit watery compared to some others wit, but still really nice. Flavors are yeasty, some hay, wheat, coriander, and a nice lemon sourness. Ends with a mild peppery finish and a long lasting refreshing wit aftertaste. A true classic and a great reference beer in the genre. Actually believe this was the first wit I’ve ever tasted and therefore also my first Belgian beer.

Hazy yellow-grey with bleached white head. Citrus/orange, basement and white sugar. Quite mellow. Taste is more pronounced, with acidic fresh body and slightly dry aftertaste, and typical Belgian white. I’d like more spices in here, but it sure is refreshing. (On tap in Antwerpen)
Pours pale yellow with a large white head. Aroma is wheat, coriander and orange peal. Flavour follows the nose.

Fruchtig-hefiger, recht milder Antrunk mit verhaltener und trockener Kräuternote, die eher nebensächlich erscheint. Das Ganze wird trockener, das Level wird milder und ist gerade noch so stark, das es nicht als wässrig einzustufen ist. Herber Ausklang, in dem die Kröuternote nicht mehr erkennbar ist. 8/7/8/7/8/8

Overall not a bad beer, but nothing great either.  Another beer that got a “hip” brand name, and become one that everyone seems to want to drink.  I think that it is over rated, but, it is a decent beer, Aroma is spicy with a hint of orange, Sweet taste, smooth middle, but funky off taste at the finish.

33cl bottle from a local supermarket. It pours a hazy light yellow liquid with a good-looking high white head that lasts throughout the beer, leaving little lacing. The aroma is citrus hops (mostly lemon), mild spices, wheat and a good deal of yeast. It tastes likewise, but citron is more orange-like in the mouth. A perfect thirst-quencher, it has small but lively carbonation, which turns out to be pleasant and add refreshingness to the brew. It feels lightly sweet and sour, light-medium bodied and it ends not very dry. Pleasant mild orangy and spicy aftertaste. A classic, a very good beer with a very nice presentation.

Tap @ Gyngen, Århus. Pours hazy light yellow, no head. Aroma of yeast, lemon and spices. Taste is much like aroma, orangepeel, coriands. Thin to medium body, medium carbonation wich keeps it refreshing. Easy drinking and refreshing, good session beer. 120511

Finer head, cloudy, yellov.
orange, lemon,wheat - fresh nose,
Medium body, some length, 
Lemon, grape, some hay.

pallida imitazione di quello che bevevo anni fa!il solita presenza giallo scarico lattiginoso con bella schiuma morbida !aroma citrico !
però è in bocca che rende molto meno di ciò che era!acquosa scarsa di gusto e soprattutto di retrogusto!

Cloudy pale yellow with a nice bright white head and moderate lacing. Lemon and pepper aromas with a hint of barnyard. Citrusy hops flavor leads the way with the lemon and pepper coming close behind, supported by a wheat backbone. Chewy mouthfeel, light body, nice carbonation, and a crisply bitter finish. Better than expected.

33cL bottle from Tesco poured into a Hoegaarden glass.  Finally got around to rating this after appreciating it for many years.  Apparently this was actually brewed in Belgium, unlike the stuff that was being sold in the UK recently which was brewed for rather than by Inbev Belgium.  Typical wheaty yellow appearance with the big head.

Delicious wheaty and citrus aroma, zesty.  Great tasty beer that is a lovely blend but also delightfully easy to drink.  Excellent session beer.

22oz draught.  The beer smells of lemons and grains, very lightly sweet.  The beer is a cloudy light yellow with a white head.  Taste is very light, sweet and not much malt noticed, nor hops.  A good example of a light Belgian White, perfect for summer.  Overall very enjoyable.

Bottle. Extreme pale yellow, thick white head. Smells of citrus, coriander and orange peel. Taste is same, not very malty. Good acids and sweetness. Very balanced. Some bitter hops but not very dominant. Very refreshing summer beer and a very good example of the style
Nice wheaty, yeasty, citrusty smell and flavor. Light and easy to drink, but with flavor, good beer.

Light transparent with huge white head. Aroma of sweet bananas, Belgian yeast, wheat bread, citrus fruits. There is more banana in the taste, as well as a tart tone (from wheat) and a mouth-cleansing fizzy carbonation. Very typical Belgian wheat beer - a little industrial in its appearance. When Hoegaarden is cold and the sun is warm, it’s a refreshing drink. But it seems dull and simple before you reach the bottom of the first (small) bottle.

Pours a pale yellow hazy color.  Aromas of yeast.  Body is lighter than expected.  A little too light.  Fruit flavors are what I get initially but there is definite yeast and wheat which finishes long.
Pours a dirty yellow with a light white head. Has strong scent of coriander and has a nice pleasant Belgian yeast taste.
On tap at local pub, pours a pale yellow with a decent white head, aroma and flavor is of light spices with some lemon and grass in the finish, light and refreshing, not bad.
Classic wit, but too watery for my taste. Cloves, spices aroma. light malt, abit biscuity, cloves again, light peppery bitterness, slightly tart refreshing finish. Ok
Hazy light yellow, medium white head.  Wheat flavor with some spice.  A little citrus on the nose.  A good refreshing summer beer.

I poured an 11.2 oz bottle into a glass tulip...

The beer was a light hazy yellow with a bubbly white head that receded quickly. The smell has banana/ bubblegum aroma, with lemon and wheat. The taste is similar with the banana and bubblegum, I also tasted orange peel, wheat and grassy hops. The feel is light with soft carbonation and a dry finish. I really enjoyed this beer, I could drink this on any occasion.
Pale straw, lemonade color with a huge creamy white head.  Citrus, lemonade, and coriander notes.  Light bodied with a high level of carbonation.  Refreshing on a hot day.

Vade retro, Satana!

Worse than this blanche, just Heineken’s Wieckse Witte.

So I feel I have to rate Hoegaarden today, in memory of Pierre Celis. He has done a lot of good for the Belgian beer world imho.
Hoegaarden is pale straw coloured, almost milky, with a yeast and wheat haze. Strong fluffy white head.
Nice yeasty aroma. Nose of citrus and coriander seeds. Taste bit sweet, typical wheat malts flavour. Fruity. Orange and coriander come out nicely.
Fresh, typical Belgian white. Refreshing. Ideal for warm summer days.
(From tap)

Draft from Ramshead Tavern (in Savage).  Very light yellow, no head or aroma to speak of.  Good light flavor, but very little to it; touch of malt and a hint of citrus.  Would be great as a refreshing cold beer right after mowing the lawn.

Found another beer I’ve had several times and forgot to rate. So here goes. From a 12 oz bottle. Pours cloudy grayish-yellow with white head. The aroma is fairly herbal with notes of coriander, lemon balm, wild mint, sweet yeast bread, and grass. The flavor is slightly tart at first sip (very slightly), then fades quickly to a dull lemony sweetness. It has a bit of an herbal tea undertone to it. The finish is like chamomile, licorice, and orange with a little bit of crackery malt. Refreshing if nothing else.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. Hazy lemonade yellow, thin bubbly white head. Aroma of orange peel and slight coriander. Medium carbonation. Taste is very light and sweet. I taste orange peel, coriander, spices and a touch of wheat. The finish is slightly tart. It’s yummy. It was worth the $9 for a 6 pack. I would buy again!

Pours cloudy amber with a foaming white head. Looks pretty refreshing. Aroma is orangey, lemon citrous. taste is spicy coriander, orange peel, lemon zest and a creaminess. Palate is refreshing and it’s medium bodied in the mouth. Still one of the best whitbiers.
The worst beer I had drunk in my life! Has a strange smell, a medicine taste and who sad that you could put coriander seeds in a beer?

The most noticeable thing about Hoegaarden is the amazingly pale lemon color of the beer.  It has an aroma of clove and banana which are also present in the taste, with the spice flavor being more intense and the fruit flavors being more mellowed.  A nice bit of carbonation and head, and a reliable beer to come back to.

Tap @ O2 Taphouse & Grill in Edmonton. I asked for craft beer and was greeted with "what is that?" so you can take that for a review of this place. 

Served in the classic Hoegaarden tumbler with a about an inch and a half of head. The head was slow to recede with little lacing. The color is about the palest yellow I have seen in a beer.

The aroma was a bit of wheat with some citrus - mainly oranges. You can also pick out some spice. Fairly faint aroma.

The taste is more light citrusy wheat. The orange is apparent again and the spice you pick up on is coriander. There is a touch of sweetness to the beer.

The mouthfeel is thin and watery. I’d venture as far as to say a bit creamy. It is has low to medium carbonation which works well for the style.

This is a decent summer beer but it is now a bit light on flavor. I seem to remember more character before it was bought out by the big guys. Still decent when you are at a place that only serves Labatt’s products.
great overall easy to find beer. one for someone who is starting to experience actual wheat beers.

draft@bar: citrus, bitterness with light wheat  underneath, coriander very noticeable in aftertaste, very smooth + refreshing, nice everyday beer, love it when it is in a big glass, those are nice /// bottle@bar: not that different from draft really, draft is a bit smoother & bit more balanced, goes down easier /// tried a 1979 bottle - basically slightly sweet (candy sugar) water by this point, way, way beyond prime ///// Tried a couple of more times draft in Brussels with & without lemon (they serve dit like that). This wheat body, heavy on coriander & lemon, feels weird, artificial & soda-like to me. Should re-rate properly at some point. No proper notes taken, early note still remains. When rated again will prob. fall in score.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a very cloudy yellow color with a nice white head and quite a bit of lacing. Nose brings forward some citrus and a bit of wheat. The taste is orange, citrus, slight spice, wheat, and a bit of grain. Definitely a fairly light mouthfeel with a bit of creaminess. Drinks fairly well, although not super flavorful.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-20-2010
Absolutely delicious! Love this belgian wheatbeer. Fruity, unclear and liht yellow colour.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. It poured a very pale, almost transparent colour with a medium big head. Some carbonation. Aroma is laden with yeast, wheat, bread, but also notes of grass and coriander. Flavour is both bitter and sweet at the same time. The coriander is a lot more present in the flavour than the aroma. Notes of dough and coriander or orange peel. Short aftertaste. A highly drinkable beer and considering how broad the distribution of this beer is I’m amazed I haven’t rated it before.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a white, lasting head, over a hazy yellow (SRM 3) body.....nose is light citrus, bit of coriander, cereal...taste is light citrus, then light sourness, balanced by cereal, finishing light bitterness, with a touch of coriander....mouth feel is light, carbonation high. Light, moderately flavored with spice and citrus, it all makes for a wonderful refreshing summer beer. BJCP 7/3/14/4/7
great aroma, drank from 11.2 fl. oz. Glass bottle with a lemon in it, very good for it’s beer category, rich carbonation
Bottle. From notes. Hazy pale with a large foamy white head. Spicy, yeasty, citrus, wheat. Not a favourite. But it tastes great in Greece after a day at the beach.

12 oz. bottle from HyVee Marion Ar: The aroma is a bit spicy, and the coriander comes through nicely. However, I find it to be somewhat metallic. Ap: Pours a pale pale straw with a frothy white head that dissipates quickly. T: Tangy, sweet/tart flavor to this one makes it highly refreshing. Spicyness follows through to the finish. P: Thin, fizzy body. O: Surely my favorite Belgian wheat.

The beer pours a nice cloudy (the beer is not filtered) golden yellow colour with a large thick, creamy white head. Scent; citrus, spices, wheat (grainy) and yeast Taste, similar to the scent, although the nose is slightly stronger than the taste. Tastes like sweet citrus, more wheat and it has a light spicy aftertaste.  Light and drinkable, very refreshing, a bit high carbonation

12 oz. bottle from HyVee Marion

Ar: The aroma is a bit spicy, and the coriander comes through nicely.  However, I find it to be somewhat metallic.
Ap: Pours a pale pale straw with a frothy white head that dissipates quickly.
T:  Tangy, sweet/tart flavor to this one makes it highly refreshing.  Spicyness follows through to the finish.
P: Thin, fizzy body.

O: Surely my favorite Belgian wheat.
Very good Belgian white beer. Probably the standard by which all other whites are measured.
Son aspect est parfait pour une bière blanche. mais pourle reste je ne trouve pas qu’elle soit exceptionelle, mais elle reste dans la moyenne.
This one is alright, as far as easy drinking goes its one of the best, the few flavors in it are bold and bright, not complex though. Good "gateway" beer...
Cloudy pale colour with a thick white head. Citric aroma. Little bitterness with some hint of citrus. A very good beer.
Very surprising stuff! the texture looks great and the taste follows, and its coriander touch made it very original
Blonde, delicious, looker, just awesome! Especially as beer no. 7.  Tasted in bottle.
2011 - 02 - 11 300ml light yellow hazy colour.small whiet head. sweet citric taste. tasted nice besides my chilli ☺
Great beer, widely available, one of the best "common" wheat beers out there. Nice head, light yellow in color, good carbonation.
Extremely pale hazy yellow in the glass (almost white, hence the name of the style).  Pure white head.  Aroma of citrus fruit and spice.  Vibrant, fine carbonation.  Refreshing.
Hoegaarden, you can find it in bottles or on tap anywhere now. It is a light, light whiteish colored beer that is lightly spicy with an infusion of citrus.
Pours Hazy light yellow with a white head. Aroma of popcorn, yeast, light fruit and grainy stuff. Taste add some more fruit. Too poor maaayyyyn :)

Purchased as a single to try.



AROMA: Nice clean citrus-y scent, with some lemon, orange, and a little bit of clove thrown in. Very pleasant, very clean.



APPEARANCE: Hazy golden pour with a solid 2-finger head that dissipates quickly, leaving a little bit of lacing on the surface. Strangely opaque look - can’t see my fingers on the other side of the glass at all.



TASTE: Nice. Clean and straightforward. Flavors of orange, a little clove and vanilla, and a soft wheat background make for a wonderfully easy-drinking beer. Good stuff.



PALATE: A little astringent, and acidic. Really did a good job of clearing my palate without feeling like it had been stripped bare. Very smooth.



OVERALL: Odd that this stuff is made by a macro subsidiary, but it’s very good, and surprisingly affordable. I’d buy it again and drink it again. Nice stuff.

Bottle:
White head on top of a hazy yellow colored beer.
Smell wheat, spices, yellow fruit and a hint of yeast and citric.
Taste wheat, spices, yellow fruit, light citric and sweet a hint of yeast and hops.
Very light watery with a nice tingly mouthfeel, medium carbo and body.
A good one to clench your thirst  during the summer!
The perfect example of a Belgian Witbier.  Great yeast/clove scent, with a rich silky mouthfeel due to the wheat.  Great finish, and entirely enjoyable.

On draft in the proper glass. Beautiful hazy light yellow. Nuts and floral aroma with some douhgy sage too.  Light sweet flavor with just a little bitter on the finish. Light and crisp with some nice acidity.

12oz Bottle. Pours a light hazy yellow, slightly cloudy with ample white head. Aroma is slightly sweet citrus. Taste is definitely citrus with yeasty undertones, oranges, slight coriander. A nice light taste, would be great for summer sampling.

Hazy pale yellow with a big white head. Beautiful when poured into the proper glass. Aroma is sweet fruity, yeasty, citrus and coriander. Flavor is moderate sweet. The finish is light acidic and sweet. Very refreshing and fantastic on a hot summer day. 060211
Beautiful! Just can´t get enough of these Belgians. Good drinking as it is, even better to the meal (rice and a hot chicken stew). Got to buy some more soon.
Bottle at Dæmningen - Thanks. Cloudy yellow - white head. Wheaty, citrus, spicy, coriander, fruity, light light hoppy, yeasty notes, orange, freshness, light sweetness.
delicious beer, really nice to drink during a meal, not too strong but with enough character..

Draft.  Pours a pale hazy yellow with a large white head.  Aroma and flavor are fresh, earthy, slightly tart malt and yeast with some citrus and coriander notes.  I squeezed in a bit of lemon to further brighten the flavor.  Light, tangy, and refreshing.

Happy and can’t complain. It is always nice having a Witbier every once in awhile. I generally have this one at the beginning of football season. Medium a little sour but fun to stare at cause it’s WHITE! Finish is staying with you for minute.

Light golden color with a medium white head. Smells earthy, hoppy, with a hint of citrus and herbs. Taste is smooth with a clean mouth feel. Tastes of citrus and coriander but not overwhelmingly so. Nice beer to have  on a hot day. Very refreshing and clean.

Bevuta qualche tempo fa in un pub a Campo de’ Fiori. Bel colore giallo paglierino chiaro, discreto aroma, forte e deciso, seppur con preoccupanti sentori di acido fenico. In bocca acida da fare schifo e stucchevole, quasi insopportabile. Uno stura-lavandini. Non è il mio genere di birra.

Very good thirst quencher but still very good flavor.  The spices do not overwhelm the beer and it doesn’t taste too much of orange, so it is much better than most American interpretations of it.  The only InBev beer I can think off hand, other than Goose Island, that is great.

Pours a hazy yellow color with fizzy and quickly dissipating 2 finger head. Excellent lacing. Smells of light hops and citrus. Pleasant light taste that’s refreshing and finishes with a good clean citrus note without being too overpowering. Clean  mouth feel and no aftertaste. Overall this is a great summer beer and would compliment lightly spiced meats and fish meals.

Egyszerűen hatalmas kedvenc. Magával ragad halvány, világító sárga színe és pezsgő, hófehér habja. Illata citrusos és fűszeres, akárcsak az íze. Annyira könnyű, száraz, szénsavassága is pont el van találva. Fanyar, citrusos utóíze hosszan tart. Fantasztikus belga búza, minden nyarat megszépít.
One of the best beers. Its aroma and taste is very fruity, drinkable and light. First fruit which came on my mind is quince (this is fruit from which is Becherovka made of)

Cloudy pale yellow colour with a big white head. Citric, floral aroma with a hint of orange. Fizzy and light body. A spicy refreshing flavour. Great beer overall. (6/3/7/4/17)
Pale yellow colour with a big white head. Citric, yeasty aroma with orange, lemon, spices. Medium, heavily carbonated palate. Spicy and yeasty flavour with lemon. A great classic.
great beer with a great taste, very soft taste, not over powering, great match for sea food

Cloudy off yellow in colour with a lively white head that doesn’t too long. Noticeably orange and citrus aroma. Taste is also citrusy and extremely light and refreshing. Feels very sparkly in the mouth. A fantasic beer for a hot summer day.

Cloudy light yellow pour with a big white head.  Faded to a nice collar.  Aroma was yeast and subtle bits of citrus.  Flavors were light citrus, fruity yeast, smooth light bitterness.  Dry and nicely carbonated.  Refreshing for damn sure.

on tap. pours hazy pale yellow with thick head, good lacing. wheat, orange, coriander is what it tastes - basically what is inside! hoegaarden’s special yeast adds tangy, citrusy taste. smooth finish, slightly hopped. fine on a summer day in a regular pub.

Pour is very pale gold with a bone white head. Nose is citrusy, dominately lemon with some yeast notes. Taste is much of the same with some wheaty notes at the end. At the bottom of your glass will be a little yeast staring back at you.

Poured into a pint Hoegaarden glass.

3.0 A: Cloudy whitish yellow. Aggressive pour gave one finger of head that doesn’t retain all that well. Leaves a bit of lacing.

3.5 S: Citrus, peppermint, some banana.

3.5 T: Not bad, but rather weak. Citrus, bananas, and a decent amount of spice. Ramp up the flavor and then we’d have something good. No astrigency at all.

4.0 M: Medium body, really smooth, good amount of carbonation.

4.0 D: Not bad at all, but not all that exciting. No off-taste is a big turn-on though.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-11-2008 00:29:42
One of the best out there. It is hard to find a better tasting beer . Lovely cloudy beer and really refreshing almost citrus flavour.
Nice offering, beer tastes of normal belgian style beer and pretty easy to drink, Cloudy in colour

Color paglierino con fine schiuma bianca. Aroma speziato e fruttato, in bocca è molto di frumento e un pò speziata, certo non irresistibile ma comunque grazie a questa birra in Italia abbiamo scoperto lo stile.

Serving Size: 12oz Bottle poured into a pint glass

Appearance: Nice white head with a little staying power and little lacing. Very hazy, very light yellow almost white in color, like a banana creamcicle.

Aroma: Strong wheat scent with some orange and honey. Smells very refreshing.

Taste: Very crisp with good carbonation. Nice earthy taste that isn’t overpowering but rather smooth. Finishes with a nice citrus flavor and a little honey.

Feel: Carbonation that tingles in my mouth with a  medium body.

Overall: A really nice beer, goes down very smooth and refreshing, like a nice summer afternoon. Definitely would recommend this and will pick it up again sometime.

As a reformed beer-hater, a result of realizing there’s more than the mainstream gag-worthy carbonated-pee out there, this is only the second lager I’ve ever reviewed. Probably a good reference point for me, in venturing past my "safe zone" of dark craft beers.  While there were no dominant flavours of citrus and or coriander, this subtle, refreshing, yet creamy beer is the smoothest and most drinkable of its type that I know of.  Perfectly  balanced.  Not even a hint of sourness as many other white/pale/wheat ales go.  The aroma was cologne-grade pretty, of subtle citrus, with no metallic or glassy smell.  Cute, innocuous-looking label perfectly reflects the contents.  Surprisingly filling!  A must-try.

Tap in Boulder. Hazy light yellow appearance, poured with a light head.  Yeast, a bit of citrus, and a light wheat malt aroma. Flavor is the epitomy of Witbiers. Light wheat, yeast, some lemon, and incredibly smooth. Easily one of the world’s best Witbiers.

Aroma is lemon, orange, Belgian yeast. Appearance is hazy yellow with medium white head. Taste is lemon, orange, Belgian yeast, hint of clove banana, subtle sweet and citrus. Palate is light, crisp and refreshing. Overall a very delicate enjoyable beer. A great drinker.

Flaske  33 cl. Diset lysegul øl med en stor, skummende varig hvide hoved. Aromaen er let maltet med noter af koriander og citron. Smagen er moderat sød, forfriskende og godt afbalanceret med noter af krydderi. 
Forfriskende mundfornemmelse, med en fin lys bitterhed i afslutningen.

Draught sample. Pours an cloudy golden yellow, with a great pillowy white head. Aroma is of citrus particularly orange and lemon. Taste is of citrus as well as a little clove. A very light and delectable brew. Very refreshing.
Draft. Cloudy yellow, white frothy head. Aroma is lemon, yeast, spice. Taste is citrus, malt, some hop action, some spice. Easy but quite refreshing. Light body.
Perhaps the worst beer ever drunk. Terrible taste, incredibly disgusting. I definitely realize that I don’t like wit.
Available on tap at The Pub in Crestview Hills, KY.  If you like Blue Moon, you will find this to be a couple of steps better; less cloying sweetness, more balanced dryness at the finish.
Yummy :). It is mainstream of whitebeers, but i love it. There are more exclusive beers, but this is good for daily drinking ;)

Appearance:  light, cloudy straw with a big fluffy head.  Aroma:  wheaty, light and crisp with orange and coriander.  Taste:  clean, light and crisp, with wheat, citrus, coriander and clove.  Finish:  medium, clean, crisp and short, with slightly lingering spices.  Notes:  Perfectly drinkable Belgian.

(Draught at a smoky pub close to Liedkerke railway station - stopped here to wait for train) The beer poured pale yellow and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had coriander and fruitiness. Palate was quite light bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, coriander, mildly malts, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter.
Good refreshing witbier. Fruity and quite dry fruity taste. Well balanced, excellent for a hot sunny day.
Bottle 33 cl. Pours hazy light golden orange colour with white head. Aroma is citrus and spices. Flavour is lemon and citrus with spices. Crisp and refreshing.

Hazy straw, dense white head, very effervescent, creamy full body, high but soft carbonation.



Aroma: lots of wheat, tangy earthy coriander, and some dank minerality. A pleasant note of sweet fresh malt emerges as it warms.



Taste: lots of tart wheat, a zing of coriander, subtle lingering dark sweet orange, a hint of stale noble hops, a floral note similar to roses, and a bit of something that reminds me of the sun block my wife puts on the kids.



Okay, so my description is a little odd, but that’s what i taste. It all works well together though, and is balanced, quaffable, and subtly complex. More dry and bitter than most american attempts, and to me, better.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy pale gold.  Thick white head with lots of carbonation in it.  Smells of cirtus, especially lemon and orange with a small hint of spice.  The dominant flavors are orange and lemon, with a bit of clove, also a mix of sweet and sour.  Finishes sour and stays with you.    Body to me is light but creamy.  Average carbonation.  Very good.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours hazy pale golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of wheat and floral hops. Taste is little sweet, bitter and sour. light body, soft carbonation.

bottle, served into glass.

hints of lemon citrus or vanilla against a background of cereal, pleasant bitterness.

pale yellow, slightly cloudy. white head, which quickly diminishes.

slightly sweet, with a little bit of bitterness.

medium body, with soft carbonation.
Nice citrus notes but they taste flat.  Almost tasted dirty to me. Not a good mouth feel.  I doubt I’ll drink another.
Sweet aroma of fruit and citrus.  Taste is of wheat malt, with orange and coriander.  A smooth and flavorful beer.  Very well done.
(bottle) hazy pale yellow with small white head; aromas are floral, citrus; clean flavour
Pours a cloudy light yellow, with a thin white head. Aroma of coriander and lemon present. Taste of wheat, orange, and a touch of coriander.
12 oz. bottle.  Light wheat color.  Medium/large white head.  Delicious wheaty citrus flavors.  Milder than a hefe, but still full of sweet flavors.  Classis Belgian white

Pale yellow color with an effervescent foamy head. Aromas of banana and orange. Very bubbly, refreshing palate. Nice wheat beer.

Rerated: 4.1==>3.7 due to increased beer tastings

Aroma - An unusual smell with coriander, orange, citrus & various other furity type smells coming through.

App - A rather hazy yellow colour with a very large, white, foamy head that goes down but doesn’t disappear.

T - Coriander, clove & orange seem to be the strongest flavours along with various herbs

M - Very easy to drink & smooth. It has a lot of carbonation.

D- A fantastic beer overall, one of the nicest I think I have ever tasted.
Smells great, tastes great, is great. The quintessential belgian white that you can find in more places than most other belgian whites.
Both spicy and fruity. Very tasty and tangy, but not too much bitterness. This is a pale, straw color with a decent head. Definitely stronger and more spicy than most American wheat beers.

Aroma strong citrus and floral.  Pours a beautiful golden haze with a light foamy head.  Taste is light orange/grapefruit with a fantastic finish.  Head looks thick initially, then fades.  Very light and smooth on the palate.  Great, light Belgian.  Easily drinkable, definitely in the warm weather.
light and refreshing when thirsty. But heavy on the palette and filling when not.

Aroma was nice, but very mellow with just a hint of either citrus or floral.  Hazy in the glass, and the head was minimal, but it could have been my pour.  Taste was slightly sweet with some citrus coming out.  Pretty light body, a little creamy, and  fizzy on the tongue.  Overall, pretty good, but a little too light for my liking.
Bottled. Yellow color with thick white head. Aromas, wheat, lemon and hints of coriander. Taste,  lemon, coriander, starts sweet, ends bittersweet. Drinkable.
my go to hot weather beer, can smell the orange and coriander, just a well done lighter beer

10-nov-2010
30cl bottle in restaurant. Hazy light color with a big white head. Very refreshing, thought quite sweet, taste. Good beer.

35cl bottle. You know it looks just great with the hazy golden color and a big nice head.
Aroma consists of spices and orange, hops are kind of flowerish. Kind of a sweet taste in a good way, with a nice bitterness as well. Can’t go wrong with this one, but don’t expect too much of it either

Looks just great in their big thick glasses they’re normally served in, too bad I don’t have one of those here :)

This is the lighest in apperanace and taste. Gave a nice foam head and did not leave any after taste or bitterness. Very easy to swallow and could easily drink more than one because it is refreshing and light. One of my Favorites for Wheat Beers.

This is a very drinkable and enjoyable beer. Pale yellow with a thumb thick white head. Strong citrus aroma some hay. yeasty citrus taste. maybe a tad of cough drop. Good palate with some thickness but a refreshing smoothness.
Pale, hazy yellow colour. Not much head. Citrus and coriander on the nose. Citrus flavoured. A little bit of yeast too. Quite a lot of carbonation.

Bottle pours hazy pale yellow with a fizzy white head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, grass, and light yeast.  Flavor shows the same with tart lemon and coriander.  Overall body is light, somewhat acidic, and finishes dry.
AWFUL This was the first time that I dind’t finish my beer. eeeooooeeeoooeee

Bottle. Pale, hazy with big white foam that disappears quickly. Aroma iscitrus, herbs and leaves. Lightly sour with light body thin feel, average carbonation and a finish of that sour banana typical of wheat beers. Utterly average. But works great with food especially fish. Easy drinkin´, a beer to get drunk on and skip the worst hangovers.

12oz on tap poured clear yellow with frothy white head.  Aroma of wheat and little bread cut by slight citrus.  Flavor is a watered down wheat with a bit of peppery orange peel.  Body was weak and watery and all flavor seemed muted.

A unclear, pale lemon with a foamy head.
Aroma; Some spices and citrus.
Flavour; Same as nose, a thin body, very short aftertaste and no hopflavours or bitternes
By far, still my favorite beer of all times.  Is especially great with oranges!  Have to thank my boyfriend for getting me hooked on hoegaarden.  Goes down easy, and I love the citrus taste.

Was skeptical merely because its everywhere and my budlite loving friends like it, but I was pleasantly suprised!  Doesn’t look like much though - half decent head sits atop is sickly pale yellow - looks like watered-down apple juice.  But the taste is everything you’d expect from a witbier - bright, lively, acidic, yeasty aromas, big citrus, coriander backup, dry, sour, refreshing.  Would not hesitate to recommend it!

Tap to Hoegaarden .33L octogaon glass. 2 inch white head. Med hazy Pale Yellow. Smells of orange zest and coriander, a bit of malt sweetness. Tastes or orange zest and coriander, malt sweetness notes and some bitterness. Lite on the palate, medium carbonation, very little alcohol presence. A decent Wheat beer that would drink easily on warm summer days.

A: The pour is an extremely pale yellow color with an intense haze to it. The head is medium in size and white in color.

S: Big time coriander aroma to this beer. The wheat and other malts provide a moderate amount of sweetness to the nose, and there is a minimal citrus note.

T: Again, a heavy hand on the spice component. Lots of coriander and wheat with a distinct lemony tartness. Where am I, BJ’s?

M: The body is quite light and the carbonation is quite high and lively.

D: Another one of those really well known beers that everybody sort of has to try somewhere along the way. I haven’t had this beer for a long time, but I did not find it did much for me on this occasion.
this is the most undrinkable beer i’ve ever hadm even the color is sickening. too acid for me.

Cloudy light yellow colour with a decent white head. Fresh citrus, herbs and spices in the aroma. Very refreshing, presence of citrus and light sweetness in the taste, a bit spiced. But it gets watery after a second or so. Soft carbonation, light bitter finish. Ok.

Light yellow - almost white, - fluffy head.  Aroma is spices and citrus.  Taste is very tangy and citrus with remnants of hefeweizen back there.  Finish is a bit bitter and tangy.  Pretty good for an InBev owned company.
Small bottle. I’m not sure why is this sitting high at the top 5% in overall. Very pale in looks and average tasting. It even leans on the watery and weak side. Overrated and overpriced.

Looks just like in the image, hazy yellow with nice head. Look of this beer is it’s best side. As a wheat beer this is not too awesome. Mostly watery, even thou there is that citrus one always expects with wheats, but just barely.

Pours a lightly hazed yellow with a soft, tight white head.  The nose is of yeast and lemon, with perhaps a note of white pepper.  The taste is crisp and light.  Lemon and faint spices are first, then comes a certain damp bread flavour.  The body is thin with a mild carbonation.  There’s a short finish with that lemon and yeast.  It’s refreshing but carries as much flavour as water.  At least it’s not offensive.

Decent beer with a distinct taste. Appears banana yellow in color with a two finger head. Smells of spice and clove. Taste is unique with clove and spice, crisp and easy on the palate. Not the best of its kind, but a good showing. Would drink as a session or with a meal.

330 ml bottle. Rated @ 12.3.2009.

Pours pale yellow colour with a big creamy head. Wheaty aroma with citrus and grass. Same elements on the flavour too. Medium bodied with a slicky mouthfeel and decent carbonation. Classic witbier.
Favourite beer! This beer alone got me into wheat beers!!!

For the eyes: pale yellow colour; the head is average sized; frothy, white; fair lacing; hazy, heavily particulate body. For the nose: straw malts and herb hops; notes of banana and pineapple. For the mouth: ligh body; thin texture; average carbonation; metallic finish. For the tongue: sweet, but with an acidity that brings a refreshing sensation. For me: refreshing and very decent.

hazy yellow.small head.No strong flavors.But this beer is very complex and refreshing.Citrus, orange ,lemon,banana.,pepper, coriander, sprint flowers.finish little dry and bitter.One of the most refreshing beer out there.
Bottle from a friend. Sour banana aroma. Very anaemic cloudy pale yellow brown colour. Flavour dry sour banana and citrus fruits with a hint of spice. Smooth but not great.

Unpalatable. I didn’t want it to go to waste since it was the only 6-pack I had in the house on a Saturday night, so I had to chug it like medicine. If I would have had ANY other options that night, it would have been poured out.
Hazy with a nice foam head. Nice aroma and a pleasant taste with the orange peel. A very good beer.
Pours a hazy straw yellow, nose is heavy on orange peel, taste is too sweet and somewhat modly

I heard this was the original begian wheat beer (blue moon and shock top are spin offs from this beer).  This beer tastes great, the blend of wheat and its belgian style balance well together.  The murky pale yellow color itself is another reason to try this beer.
Nice white beer with a flower and hop aroma whitch reminds a bit of lavender. The taste is somewhat more watery but with a good hop taste.
Pours a hazy unfiltered yellow with a large white head. Aroma is coriander, wheat, esthers. Flavor is wheat, orange peel, coriander, extremely easy to drink and refreshing and great on a hot day.

Sweet and smooth with a frothy eggshell head. Creates a fruit party in your mouth with hints of banana and slightly bitter orange. A beer that most people will fall in love with.

K- 4.6/5
S-4.4/5
Quite flavoursome, hazy thin pale yellow witbier. Floral fruit (banana) coriander, clove & spice aromas.
Pours a gold with a small head. Aroma is very light, bubblegum and citrus. Light sweet flavor.
300 ml bottle a hazy light yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat spices coriander bitterness and hops taste wheat spices coriander and hops
pours pale hazy yellow with fluffy white head, aroma of coriander, taste has coriander and nuts and finishes bitter, slightly dry, overall a very drinkable beer.
750ml bottle.  Pours a hazy lemon with a large head.  Aroma is yeast, lemon and coriander.  Slightly nutty.  Starts with some yeast and nuts, then some orange and spice.  Dry, bitter finish.

Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma: Coriander is very present, wheat, yeast and a little orange. Taste: Orange and coriander, sugar, and some bitterness in the background. Better on tap if you get a chance, garnish with a lemon.

Bottle; Pours a nice Pale Yellow with a  super fluffy white head into a weizen. Smells like spices, straw, yeast on the head. Lightly carbonated, slightly bitter, a little sour even, I would call the flavors first spicy, though i wouldnt have known it was coriander, with a hint of citrus, lemon, yeast, wheat, with a bit of bitterness on the end. Nice.
this has got to be the best beer i have ever had the chance to drink.......
A classic of it’s style. Almost always more flavorful than attempts to copy it. Refreshing. Serving: Bottle and tap

Poured into a Hoegaarden hexagonal tumbler glass

A: Pours hazy pale yellow with a frothy white head that stays for a while thanks to carbonation forming a white foamy lace.

S: Lemon, banana and spices (later described by my wife as clove?).

T: Citrusy, fruity, lemon, banana, apples and some spice like clove with no bitterness at all in the way down.

Overall: Very nice beer for a hot summer afternoon very fruity in flavor that goes down very smooth and allow multiples intakes, the go to beer of my wife; a little watery for my taste. Will have again with no problem.
12 oz.  This is your classic not over the top set the standard white beer.  Very good crisp and refreshing.

Bottle- Poured a milky golden color,  and smelled of coriander and bubble gum. Although I am a fan of the style, I am no fan of Hoegaarden. There just isn’t enough "kick" to it. The taste is sour, and is also reminiscent of bubble gum. Pleasant finish though....

Bottle. Poured pale yellow and a white lacing foam. Slightly metallic taste, not sure why, but otherwise citrus, malts, coriander, cirtus and yeast in the aroma. Light body with high carbonation, somewhat soury aftertaste. Nothing too exciting for me.

11.2 oz. bottle from the Nacoochee Pizzaria. Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a massive pillowy white head. Once the head dies down and you can smell it, the aroma is faint lemony citrus and spices, specifically coriander and cloves. The flavor is a sweet complemented with a little sour. The mouthfeel is watery and acidic, with light carbonation. Overall, the flavors are weak and the palate is too light, but not a bad example of a witbier.

Pour was a very light yellow color with a medium white head. Aroma consisted of orange and yeast. Taste was a medium clove/banana/orange/yeast. Not too complex as can be a problem with the style. This is a exceptionally smooth beer and would be not problem to drink a whole six pack and be ready for another six pack. Damn this is good beer.

Served from bottle into Lindemans pilsner.  Pours an opaque pale pale yellow with a three finger pure white head that subsides to none quickly.  There was no apparent lacing present.  The aroma was comprised of malt, fruit, citrus, wheat, and grains.  The flavor was of wheat, bananas, malt, and grain.  It was light on the palate with low carbonation.  Overall it goes down very smooth.  This might have been due to the lackluster intensity of the flavors and aroma present.  I have had this brew quite awhile back when I first started into craft beer and have just now gotten a chance to have it again for a review.  This is a good starter beer for people just getting into craft brew, but not overly good for its style.  Just needs a little more ’oomph’.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow, white head that disappeared quickly. Banana, yeasty, citrus aroma. Flavor in keeping with aroma, great fruity/banana, yeasty/wheat, and tart citrus. Light carbonated body. Perfect for a hot summer day. I’d like to rate it again later as my palate becomes more experienced to see if I can pick up the spice flavors.
Poured cloudy golden with a nice head that dissapeared quickly tasted like belgian whit one of my fav whits
On draught at Tom Tom’s in Adam’s Morgan. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Corriander, banana, spice, and wheat malt. Surprised I’ve never rated this, you can find it just about everywhere now.

Poured into my New Belgium Globe Glass. Best before 6-12-09.

Color is a really hazy dull yellow. Thin white head that fizzles down quickly. Little lace observed.

Smell is very fruit. Main smell is bananas. Taste is similiar, but there is more of a hoppy taste involved.

Mouthfeel isn’t very pleasent. Starts out bitter and then eventually ends smooth after a while.

Overall, it is a decent brew for something so popular. I could probably enjoy this at a bar or have this for a session beer.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-24-2008 08:15:10
Pours a pale yellow color with a white foam head.  Has an aroma of coriander, spice, and yeast.  Decent carbonation level.  Has a sweet clove taste with some spice.  Very light and frothy.

I got to taste this one unexpectedly.  I was feeling pretty good by the time I got to this one so my rating may be a little skewed.  For some reason I got a pepper taste out of this one.  Followed by a sweet taste to finish.  I thought it had a good taste, but nothing to fansy
Pours a hazy light yellow, with a nice white head that quickly leaves, a nice smooth blend of spicy and sweet that’s very refreshing a good wheat beer
Trop épicé à mon goût...papilles qui pique...j’ai acheté un 6-pack et je pense pas le finir!
as wits go, this one is pretty thin and watery. still, its pretty refreshing.

12oz bottle at The Green Pig 

Appearance: Pours hazy straw with a nice white head and some lacing 

Aroma: Coriander, spices, orange peel 

Taste: Coriander, orange peel and spices 

A decent Witbier, nice.

Bottle (4,9% ABV). A hazy pale yellow beer with a large, frothy, fizzy, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty and lightly yeasty, with notes of coriander, orange peel, lemon. The flavour is moderately sweet, moderately sour, lightly bitter. Quite well balanced. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, long finish with light bitterness. Surprisingly good and easy drinkable. Also quenching, with a good spiciness. Nice beer.

Aroma is spicy with a hint of orange. Pours a hazy, cloudy light orange/yellow color. Frothy white head. Light on the palate. Heard many great things about this beer, some said its the best they’ve ever had. The beer didn’t meet my high expectations. You can taste a slight bit of orange while spices, possibly nutmeg, were the overpowering taste. Don’t get me wrong, this is a very good beer, but it wasn’t as amazing as people told me. Enjoy it, but don’t be fooled by those who say this is the best beer they’ve had. 12/20

12 oz bottle, pours a light yellow with a fluffy white head.  In many ways, this is the Budweiser of Belgian Whites.  Wide distribution, easy to drink, good flavor but not too challenging, great for a session beer and perfect for a hot summer day.  Flavors of lemon and orange, banana, cloves - everything one would expect from a traditional witbier.  While there are definitely better witbiers out there (compare this against Jolly Pumpkin’s offering), this is an excellent beer.
cloudy pale orange colour, big head, slightly spicy, cron aroma, smooth, touch of acidity, easy and not very complex.
Clear yellow pour. Smells bready and yeasty. Tastes like artificial banana flavorings. It tries hard to impressed, but I’m not impressed.

On tap at Pete’s in SF. Clear, light yellow.  A very unique looking beer.  Taste and smell kinda reminds me of a mimosa.  Be careful with this one, the light fruity taste will make it go down like water.  A pitcher can disappear in a few minutes.

The aroma is full of cereal maltiness an bread. The appearance of this beer is one of it’s best qualities. It has a ghostly, hazily pale color. The head is gorgeous and full of beautiful belgian lace, and takes up a fourth of the glass. I am normally not a wheat beer fan, but the sour/sweet taste is wonderful. The body is light but satisfying, with a moderately thick texture, and highly effervescent carbonation. Utterly delicous.

Incredibly sippable belgian white with a prominent note of orange peel. Great introductory wheat beer for those who have yet to experience the smooth drinkability but full-bodied flavor of the style. Hoegaarden’s sweetness spreads across the palate like silk, and the citrus note is prominent without being ostentatious or domineering, sometimes a hazard with wheat beers. Basically, it is an excellent upper-midrange wheat beer that is completely accessible, easy to come across, and fairly priced. If you can’t enjoy one of these I don’t think we’ll be able to hang out.

La robe est blanche paille et le col mousseux laisse des traces derrière lui.  Au nez, blé, levure, coriandre et pointe d’orange.  Au goût, rien de très différent sinon un équilibre intéressant entre de petites notes aigres et des notes plus douces.  En bouche, le liquide se comporte légèrement et laisse une bonne impression de fraîcheur.  En résumé, toujours étonnante.

One of my favorites. Excellent mouthfeel. Great array of spices on the palate. I correctly pronounced it when ordering the other day and was cut short but the server who said "oooh, you mean ’ho garden!’" No, I mean get me out of oklahoma.
Pours hazy straw color with thick white head and foamy lacing.  Notes of citrus and spice typical of this style.  Same with taste.  Good witbier.

Cloudy yellow pour from bottle.  Nose and taste are of lemon peel, spice and light sugar.  Very smooth finish.  A nice beer to have on a day you don’t feel like drinking anything heavy or high abv.  Also mixes well with a raspberry lambic (my wife does this; she says it is called "hummingbird water").

Bottle from my local supermarket. Had this many many times over the years, surprised I haven’t rated it before. A hazy yellow pour with a healthy white head on top. Bready, banana aroma. Tastes of lemon, banana, coriander, spice, quite sweet, acidic. Quite pleasant on a hot day in the garden.

On tap at Wolfgang Puck’s in the Borgata casino in Atlantic City. Surprisingly spicy. Coupled with the citrus flavors it was both thirst-quenching and -inducing. Will try it again from a bottle when the mood strikes for a light summer beer.

On tap at South Park Tavern, Dayton, OH.  Poured an almost eerie white color but clearly with yellow/gold to it.  Aroma of spice and lemon.  Very easy to drink.   A unique style for me.  I liked the spice flavor.  I couldn’t tell much of the lemon flavor that everyone else has stated.  Not my fav style probably but certainly good beer on a hot summer night.

On tap at connelly’s pour is a bright yellow with bleach white head.  tastes is of wheat and lemon, be careful or bartender will put lemon in your beer which you don’t need.  Not my favorite style but nice and light for friday at noon.
tap at Belgian Bier Cafe. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a large white head. Strong wheat flavour with a hint of lemon and orange

This has got to be one of the world most popular witbier. Very easy to get anywhere. While most people started with this one for the style, I started with Unibroue’s Blanche de Chambly. That beer actually got me into real beers. Anyways, this one pours a cloudy white-pale yellow colour with some beige in it. Very nice frothy white head with good retention and lacing. The nose is mild with yeast and spices, like corriander and ginger. Mouthfeel is kind of watery though. The taste is also quite mild, with citrus and vanilla. Remember being much better on tap, but still a decent witbier.
As others say it pours cloudy. Pretty much as the bottle says: strong wheat taste with a hint of orange and spice.

Sour aroma, golden appearance with small white head. Taste is of coriander and a hint of orange among other spices. Slightly bubbly on the palate. Overall a decent wheat beer. Not my favorite type of beer but this is drinkable.
Bottled. Pours hazy yellow with abundant white head that dissappears fairly quickly. Taste is acidic with a light, bubbly mouthfeel. Aromas have herbs, hint of coriander.

Bottle poured into a weizen glass. Best by date is 23/03/11. One and a half inches of frothy, white head initially forms but quickly settles. No lacing. Color is cloudy, pale yellow, like lemonade almost. Wheat, yeast and notes of citrus and honey on the nose. Sweet floral characteristics as well. The palate shows the same, but with a hint of coriander and a light yeasty finish. Very light bodied with nice carbonation. Very easy to drink. A great session/summer beer.
Pours pale blond with white head. Fairly weak belgian yeast aromas with some moderate sweetness. Better than I expected it to be, but a little bland for my tastes.

Hazy, light-straw colored pour, nice full white head that stays around to the bottom, leaves lacing.  Smells of lemon & grass, some sour, wheat aroma.  Flavor is more sweet than sour, but there is a nice balance.  Very light and refreshing with high carbonation and a clean finish, no significant hop aroma or flavor.  Very nice, consistent to style, it’s just a bit too light bodied for me but a nice summer beer.

(12 ounce bottle - tumbler glass)  Pours a 2 finger sized white head.  Cloudy yellow appperance with good head retention.  Aroma is of bannana, cloves, bubblegum and wheat malt.  Taste has heavy sweetness and virtually no bitterness.  Light body, thin texture, lively carbonation and sweet, short finish.

Light yellow, hazy pour from a 12oz bottle. Aroma dominated by wheat, yeast, and some citrus / spice. Dry wheat and yeast flavor with a bitter  slightly hoppy finish. Light body with active carbonation compliments the crisp taste. Very nice.

One of my regular beers here in Singapore, I absolutely love this stuff. Aroma : Usually very citrusy, with herbal, coriander overtones, but I’ve had the misfortune of running into a few skunked or old beers whcih had an awful sour aroma. Appearance : This is one of those beers that nearly always looks inviting, particularly as I live in tropical climes, where the sight of a cloudy, frothy, billowy head on a light aromatic beer is enough to drive one crazy ! Taste : Mildly spicy. with lemony citrus notes. Texture is creamy yet thin, very light bodied. A good batch will always be nicely carbonated.

Appearance: Mostly yellow with a brownish hue and white cloudy unfiltered appearance.
Aroma: Nice banana and spice smell, could be stronger.
Palate: Medium texture, not a soft as others in this style.
Flavor: More spicy (cloves or coriander) that fruity. The fruit flavor that is present tastes more like orange than banana. Not much malt or hops aftertaste.
Overall:  Hoegaarden is one of my favorite beers and it really got me hooked on the Witbier style. I’m biased, but after trying others I being to notice that the malt and hop flavors are lacking. If you, or someone you know, hate the bitter hops flavor in beer, then go straight out and try this beer.
This beer always reminds me on a roasted marshmallow.  Good for enjoying on its own - might be a little competitive with dinner.

Hoegaarden wit is the most popular white beer available in the Netherlands, and maybe even worldwide. 33 cl bottle bought at the local supermarket. The beer should be served cold, preferably on a warm summer day, with or without a piece of lemon. Poured into a Hoegaarden glass. The beer pours a nice cloudy (the beer is not filtered) golden yellow colour with a large thick, creamy white head. 

Scent; citrus, spices, wheat (grainy) and yeast 

The taste is good, similar to the scent, although the nose is slightly stronger than the taste. Tastes like sweet citrus, more wheat and it has a light spicy aftertaste. Not too deep. This white beer is one of the more sweeter ones currently available.

Mouthfeel: Light and drinkable, very refreshing, a bit high carbonation

In general, a nice and refreshing beer for a hot summer day. A bit sweet, a classic, but still one of the better white beers out there.

25cl bottle

The appearance is cloudy white to light yellow with a big creamy white head.
 The nose  is creamy, has lots of wheat, spices, citrus, corriander, sweet orange peel. The taste is creamy with wheat, slight citrus taste, spices and a slight bitterness.
 A great refreshing and good tasting beer for a good time with friends.

Blanche belga commerciale, opalescente, leggermente agrumata ma tutto sommato con pochissimo gusto.
E’ comunque una delle mie birre da supermercato preferite, soprattutto per l’estate. In effetti sembra più una bibita, da bere ghiacciata.

A- Cloudy light yellow body with a frothy  white head .

S- Smell of wheat , banana and a little citrus zest. Just a touch of pepper.

T- Nice blend of  wheat, spice and citrus zest.

M- Light body with a refreshing, crisp feel. A little thin.

D- A really refreshing beer,  a great summer time beer. I would not turn this one down on a hot day.
I’ve had this beer a billion times, whether on tap in my locale brasserie in Paris, out of a bottle, or in pitchers at Zeitgeist in San Francisco. It’s my definition of a summertime beer.
Pale golden with nice head. Aroma yeast, citrus. Taste yeast, wheat, fruity. Light body, text smooth, carb lively. Summer beer.

11.2 ounce bottle from Total Wine in Tustin ($1.19).  Pours a murky yellow-peach color with three fingers of fine white foam.  Aroma of yeast, bright citrus (lemon, orange), and some spices, namely pepper.  Taste is lightly sour wheat along with more sweet fruity tones and some light tangy spiciness.  Very light mouthfeel but quite refreshing.  Certainly not one of my very favorite styles, but this is a great representative of what the style can be.  (2422, 308)
Bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow colored with a small bubbly egg white head. Aromas of wheat, citrus and coriander. Flavors of lemons and wheat. Easy drinkable just like i witbier should be..
This is my favorite (reasonably) priced beer. I love it. Awesome. A little weak I suppose but whites often are. Great texture on tap.

I must of originally had a bad Vegas sun-burned re-re-fridgerated 6-pack, tried it again, as it looks like everyone loves this stuff.... and this stuff is really, really pretty sweet, ginger-bread house taste and all... seriously, if want something completely different... this is it.
It’s my favorite witbier with a nice color and a very citrus aroma. Fresh beer for a hot day.
This beer has a delightful golden haze. It has a good sweet wheat smell. And it has a great traditional wheat taste.

drunk a bottle @ kulminator of hoegaarden made with the ol recipe of 1979 !!


head: none

colour: clear , blonde 

smell: peach,sour,acidic

taste: starts soft and slightly alcohol taste underneath , emiditaly follows into a sour/acidic taste and ends earthy ad watery , beter than a modern hoegaarden eventough it’s age of 31 years !!

Draft pint glass served in Hoegaarden glassware. Cloudy yellow with a thin creamy head that sticks around a bit.  Lemony wheat, grass and hay aromas. Citrus lemon flavors with some spices -- coriander, pepper, cloves. Crisp, clean light bodied, good carbonation, dry lemon yeasty finish.
Easy to drink, good summer session beer, although it wasn’t as good as I remembered. Pair well with a lite summer dish on the patio.

I’ve been drinking this beer a long time now and it tastes a lot different to me now than it did eight to ten years ago. It was about the same time that they changed the label from a square yellow to the newer metallic circle that I noticed the change. I’m not sure if that’s psychological or if there was a real recipe change, but I like the older beer significantly more. I’d probably rate it closer to a 3.8 today. This rating is the older beer. 

Pours light yellow with a nice fully aromatic citrus head. Taste is lemon citrus, light wheats, coriander lemon and orange zest and light spices. Rated 2/2/2000

That cloudy blonde color and head are unmistakable Hoegaarden. Thirst-quenching. 

Light banana/orange scent. Citrusy and perfect for summer. 

The bits of coriander add a kick to this otherwise very smooth beer. Goes down so easy and light, almost like lemonade. But has a surprisingly thick presence on the tongue. Definitely a fruit-flavored wheat. Very "wet" compared to some other witbiers (Victory Whirlwind, Middle Ages Swallow Wit, e.g.). 

Slightly fizzy feel on the way down. But I could drink these all day, though it’s so mild that I might need to have something strong to mix it up. Also a very good "initiation" beer to those not so inclined toward malt and hops.

The appearance was very cloudy and looked like a mixture of pear and pineapple juice.  Poured a very white 1 1/2 finger head that dissipates very quickly to leave a thin ring.  The smell was very sweet, fruity with citrus and slight lemon and wheat notes.  The taste was not real strong and slightly fruity and almost tasted like flat lemonade.  The mouthfeel was medium/thin, smooth and somewhat watery.  I could see myself enjoying this beer more in the summer, obviously, but probably wouldn’t be my first choice when choosing a wheat beer.
This beer came with a lot of hype.  I found it very bitter and lacking in flavor.  Very dissapointed.

This is another absolute favourite of mine. A quite obvious citrus flavour makes this a perfect summer beer. The aroma experienced as the glass approaches your mouth is simply refreshing and is half the experience. The appearance is light and cloudy with a pure white head. The taste is nothing complex, quite apparent really. I suggest pouring this into a freezer chilled glass for those of you who live in the warmer climates.

Pours a lemony yellow with a citrus aroma.  Specific smell of lemons with a hint of spice.  Taste of sweet and sour lemons, very distinct lemon taste, almost too much.  A refreshing summer drink, a true Witbier, with an overall lemony explosion.

Bottle. Poured a hazy pale yellow with an average sized white fizzy head that was mostly diminishing and had good lacing. The aroma was heavy with a leathery yeast scent, light flowery hops with notes of orange and allspice. It tasted quite yeasty with a mild acidic flavor at first and finished about the same except for the hints of orange on the tongue left , to linger for a nice while. Mouthfeel was light to medium in body and was suprisingly very creamy in texture. Overall a very tasty wheat beer, definitley worth drinking a few.

Pours very pale yellowy...almost white, with significant white, foamy head that lingers for a long time. Nose is very sweet with notes of bitter orange and spices, like most good witbiers. The taste is very well-balanced, with the usual spiciness, citrus, and sweet malt expected with a white and all are exceptionally good in this beer. Finish is sweet with a touch of alcohol. Probably the best witbier I’ve had.

Pours hazy yellow with rich white long lasting head. Aroma of fruits, citrus, yeast and some malts. Well carbonated with small bubbles. Fresh fruity, slightly sweet, a hint of grass and sour flavor. Crisp and a bit sour and hoppy on palate. Finish is quite short with a weak aftertaste of hops.

Sweet and bready with a slight nose of spices. Slight bite of coriander and orange peel but not noticeable unless you are looking for it. Overall a very well rounded good example of a traditional Belgian wit.

Pale blonde pour into thick frothy white head that quickly dissipates into a swirl of foam and minimal melting lacing as carbonated bubbles rise through the hazy golden hue from the bottom of the glass. Aroma of yeasty sweet bread,  malted wheat, and sweet citrus. Initial flavor of yeasty biscuits, spicy citrus and lemon zest fading to a crisp light finish.

33 cl bottle. Pours pale, cloudy yellow in color with a crisp, white head. Aroma of wheat and grass. Flavor of citrus, orange and maybe lemon, with a hint of melon. Smooth, moist, and frothy finish that is refreshing, with a slight carbonation.
Aromas of orange and spice. Flavor has too much orange, I didn’t care for this beer much. White beers aren’t high on my list.
Had on tap several times. Pours light hazy pale yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma of orange peels and wheat. Flavors of wheat and mostly orange. Kind of tastes like Tang. Not a bad wit.

Very bready aroma, with spicy notes and a slight vegetal/asparagus background.  Fluffy white head which thins but persists along with nice lacing.  Cloudy straw yellow in color.  Yeast, clove and light citrus in the mouth.  A bit thin and watery however.  Not markedly bitter or sweet.  Quick finish.  I had higher hopes.
On tap. Great beer with unique style and image. Great smell and taste and with the citrus piece this beer is the top!

Bottle, home.  Extremely ho-hum.  The beer pours a pale shade of yellow with a tinge of orange.  The head is large and pillowy, though it dissipates a bit quickly.  The aroma is muted with a sour grain off note, citric acidity, light wheat spice and some spicing.  The flavor is quite boring.  It’s a bit too acidic and the grain doesn’t have a good flavor.  Some grassiness and spice.  There’s just not a ton going on.  Mouthfeel is fine.  Not bad but not something that I’d care to order again.

Fell in love with this while visiting Amsterdam, best wheat beer that I have ever had.  It pours a cloudy almost white golden look with a thick white head. It’s sweet with a dominant flavour of roses with an herbal aftertaste. Toss a slice of orange in your pint glass & it tastes even nicer.

I sampled a 12 oz. bottle, which fills a glass with a traditional unfiltered, hazy, pale yellow beer and a generous, long-lived snow white head.  Some excellent lacing remained in the glass.  Bready wheat and citrus aromas dominate the nose.  Palate entry is semi-sweet, with mid-palate flavors of the advertised coriander and orange peel, but also banana.  There’s little hop flavor, as expected, yet this beer is well balanced with the gruit spice adjuncts and some sour lactic acid in the finish.  A very refreshing beer.

appearance is a cloudy pale yellow collow with white head.
a citrus smell dominates but there is also banana and wheat to the smell
Wheat, Citrus, and Banana are the main flavors here. Nothing is strong or overpowering in the taste.
This is a very drinkable beer. It’s light and goes down easy.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 03-04-2007 23:49:55
Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head.  Juicy aroma with orange peel and yeast.  Semi sweet flavor with more orange peel and yeast.  Finish is mild but satisfying.  A very refreshing beer.

Delicious white beer. Pours an extremely light yellow or even a white yellow with a nice thick white head that clings to the glass. Aroma is great with a nice wheat and hay. Taste is of wheat and extremely smooth. Delicious!
Smells like some sort of cleaning agent. Tastes like an orange peel. This is what Blue Moon is supposed to taste like.
Very refreshing; light but interesting; orange peel with clean finish. Bottle conditioned, unfiltered, benefits from pour into a glass. Very nice wit.
Bottle- Lovely golden haze. Aroma of citrus and coriander. A deliciously hazy shade of witbier

Pours a very hazy light yellow, almost white. Lively palate, fresh and drinkable. Not much of a nose to it, but this is wit so all is forgiven. :-) Pretty standard in the ways of the style, but then again it is such a classic that the taste has become a reference point for other wits. I think Hoegaarden does, however, lack some of the refreshing sourness otherwise abundant in the genre (which I like) but still retains a very nice blend of citrus tones and wheaty, grassy flavor. A light beer for quaffing in the sun, no doubt, and a good alternative to the traditional "summer lager".

Bottle. Pours a light straw colour with a large very dense white head. Huge cirtus aromas followed by plenty of wheat malt and bready yeast. Spices come through as the beer warms with coriander and perhaps a little cinamon. Flavours are slightly tart thanks once again to the citrus and wheat malt.  Plenty of spices coming through near the finish. Great beer and style the best example of the style in my opinion.

Pale, cloudy and whiteish yellow color with a huge foamy white head.  I like the look! Aroma is full of wheat dough and citrus and also have hints of coriander/cilantro. Taste has a light sweetness upfront, along with a light, tingling sourness, then it ends dry. The body is light in a very pleasant way which makes this beer refreshing and very drinkable. One of the classics that should be tried by everyone.

Hoegaarden (Belgium) 4.9%
473ml (pint)

A refreshing wheat ale with mild citrus flavour, light body and pleasant aftertaste.

Not a big fan of this style until I tried this beer.  Complex aroma and flavor.  Don’t need to add an orange slice here to get a real nice taste.  Orange, honey, coriander all come through.  Nice clean finish leaves you wanting more.
Nem tudok illatokat, nem tudok színt, nem tudok ízeket mondani, de minden korty után egyre fnomabb volt. Örülök, hogy Esztergombban ilyet is csapolnak.
First beer I really fell in love with, so it obviously holds a special place in my heart.
Bottled @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus peel and spices. Taste is fruity, green apples, yeasts and coriander. Nice summer drink.

Pours hazy straw with a huge, foamy, white head.  Aroma of orange fruit, bready yeast with hints of spices. Light, smooth, sweet body.  Flavor of yeast, sweet malt, fruit and some spices. Finish is medium, sweet in the beginning, finally becomes dry. Just not my type of beverage.
Extremely light.  Color is virtually white... very unique . Cloudy.  Not much in the way of taste, some sweetness. Might work for a warm day, summer beer.  Not one that I plan to go back to.

Still the best of the wheat beers of 5%.
dont taste this beer but drint it....

The pour is pretty cool. The beer is colored a pale, white yellow. It’s cloudy and has an even whiter rolling foam. Nice appearance. Nose is of wheat, lemon, coriander, orange, light sour notes, lightly tangy. Flavor is light and crisp. Very, very good. Nice Surprise from InBev.

Bottle.

A - Cloudy, hazy pale yellow. Large white froathy and foamy head. Slowly decreases with little lacing left.

S - Malted wheat with coriander, clove and pepper spice. Also a good amount of lemon and orange.

T - Wheat and malt base provide a slightly sweet base. There is a good amount of spice (as mentioned above) and citrus, orange and lemon, provide a subtle tart flavor.

M - Pretty light with a bit more than average carbonation. A little creaminess and a little fizzy.

D - Really easy to drink. Wheat and malt sweetness provide the base and go down really easy. The other flavors make you want to drink more, but aren’t heavy.

Notes: Seems like a very good example of the style. Wonderful summer, wheat beer. Would be a wonderful substitute for macros (I know, different style but same concept of easy drinking and refreshing aspects). Not amazing but easy to drink.

Pours golden yellow with white head, aroma is fruity orange with spicy coriander.  Taste up front is fruity with orange and belgian type fruits, goes into some sweet biscuity malt and finishes sweet and fairly smooth.  A good attempt, but fairly weak and lacking much depth and character.

11.2 oz bottle into lager glass (couldn’t find proper glassware). So this is the template for Blue Moon and the rest of the witbier clones currently on shelves everywhere here in the U.S. Aroma is orange peel, wheat. Pours an extremely pale yellow--almost white--with a medium head and good sticky lacing. Excellent flavor. Sweet with very little bitterness. Medium-high carbonation. Nice. I could drink this all night and never get sick of it.

Description is unnecessary for this one, surely. This is everywhere and few attempts at this style come anywhere close to it. [3.5]

Heh. Hazy yellow with a white head. Light bodied, high carbonation. Aroma of tartish oranges, coriander, white pepper. Mild sweetness, not very bready,  little bitterness, zingy citrus with a hint of tartness, spices. Light, refreshing. Hard to go past of its ilk.
Smells fruity with yeast, pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Really easy to drink, tastes like fruit and yeast, aftertaste is mild with a fruit hint. Great summertime beer.
One of the most impressive commonly available tap beers. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a foamy white head. Aromas of citrus peel and spice, taste is yeasty, citrus and coriander.

Bottle 25 cl from La Maladière center in Neuchâtel (CH).
There are beers like meetings, some prove exciting. This white has a yellow color opal, compact foam and sparkling forming delight. All the best some wheat, citrus fruits and spices are conjugent in freshness. The balance is perfect. Sweet, refreshing, just what is needed by acidulity for real and honest freshness.
can 33cl. hazy gold, nice lacing on the glass. aromas of citrus and spice. Taste is honey, mild and simple aftertaste, not complex. Lively carbonation, overated beer

From a 330ml bottle on 7/3/2010. Sets the standard for wheat beers. Lovely spicy aroma, with wheat, citrus, coriander and banana flavours bursting through when it hits the mouth. Fantastic mouth feel and the carbonation is spot on too. To top it off, it can be found on special on  a semi-regular here in Oz  (though at its standard price, it makes for expensive drinking).

Bottle, 330ml. Pours a beautiful, murky liquid, typical witbier colour, but completely unfiltered, thus exhibiting all it’s earthiness. Medium head, quick to disolve. Aroma is of wheat and citric fruits. There’s a nice bitterness to the aftertaste, complemented with a nice acid touch. Excellent.

A disappointment after all the good reviews.   Way too much coriander.

12 bottle into a pilsner glass.  Nice white head, pale yellow cloudy color.

One of my favorite styles of beer has been the Belgian White because most beers of the style tend to be extremely tasty and easy to drink. Of course, my frame of reference was American takes on the style, what would an authentic Belgian White be like? Hoegaarden was the beer I turned to in order to solve that mystery and I’m glad I did, because its authenticity was apparent from the moment I popped the cap to the last swig.

POUR, COLOR AND AROMA

Hoegaarden is one of a handful of beers for which there is a type of glass specifically made for it. Unfortunately, I don’t own that glass so I had to improvise. Poured from a bottle, the beer forms a fairly large layer of bright white foamy head which never dissipates and leaves generous lacing on the glass. Not surprisingly, the body is very cloudy with a white color to the exterior and a pale yellow hue at the center. Clove is immediately evident in the nose, as are other spices and yet the beer has a sweet aroma.

TASTE

I wasn’t sure what to expect out of Hoegaarden. From its outer appearance, it seemed to be very similar to an authentic hefeweizen rather than the American-style “Belgian Whites” I’ve been used to. And after my first sip I knew this beer resembled the former rather than the latter.

My first impression of the taste is that of a watery body with a light amount of spices to the palate. Clove, orange peel and coriander immediately stand out giving the beer a slightly citrusy taste, and yet it is not tart or sour at all. The overall flavor is quite sweet, but the intensity seems to be dialed-down a bit. I was expecting an explosion of taste, but the blow seemed to be cushioned by a watery composition. 

Still, there was definite taste to be had, rather than just “beer,” and the spices give the beer a bit of a bite.

FINISH

Much like stouts, I’ve yet to encounter a wheat beer that is anything less than smooth. Hoegaaden is absolutely no challenge for a serious beer drinker, and Joe and Jane Six Pack will find it reminiscent of a light lager due to its watery complexion and calm palate.

BODY

Considering how easy this beer is to drink, as well as it’s genuine (but not over-powering) taste, combined with a body that is only 4.9% ABV, Hoegaarden would make an excellent session beer. I drank two bottles back-to-back without feeling overwhelmed in the least, and I doubt many other drinkers would be either.

FINAL THOUGHTS

The only thing that bummed me out about Hoegaarden was that its taste wasn’t as strong as I would prefer. My experiences with American takes on the style are absolutely delicious, but this was more of a true crafty brew, rather than anything gimmicky. At $10 a six-pack it’s a bit pricey, but definitely worth trying.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yGu8IOe3liQ

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a very light yellow gold, slightly cloudy, which medium-sized foamy white head.  Aroma of honey, fruit - citric like a tangerine, banana, clove, other spices.  Taste is a crisp bite of spices and wheat, which cleanses the palate somewhat on the finish, carbonation noticeable on the tongue.  This is a classic, maybe one of the most drinkable / refreshing yet good sessions there is.
I have been hooked on Blue Moon for a long time, the clerk at the liquorstore suggested this gem and I have been converted! The taste is similar but seems more unique.
