Bottle.  Pours a pale, sickly yellow, hazy body.  Light yeast particulate.  Average, foamy white head diminishes to a light ring.  Bready yeast aroma with touches of coriander and citrus.  Classic wit aroma.  Thick dough in the flavor along with Belgian spice and some more citrus.  Very pleasant and lightly tangy.  Light body with lively carbonation.  Slight mineral notes, but not unpleasant.  Overall a classic version of the style

I like Hoegaarden, it comes in a nifty bottle, a favorite Belgian brew I often order at The Bar. Pours a yellow color with a thick foamy head. Smells of citrus and floral hops. Tastes more like lime/lemons than oranges. I enjoy this one, have not tried an orange slice with it yet.

330ml bottle. Pours a very nice straw color with a half-finger thick, stark white head. Smells of coriander with some floral and grassy undertones. Tastes of coriander, orange peel, with a very very clean feel. Palate is just right, not too bubbly, not too creamy. Great beer.

Bottle - Pours pale yellow with a two finger white head.  Nose is wheatey and coriander really stands out.  Has a very nice bouquet of flavor, not something i would drink often, but really good for a change.
I hate to give this beer such a low review, but the coriander flavor just kills me.  The spice flavor upfront is great, but the overwhelming aftertaste does me in.

Bottle.

Hazy light yellow with a small white foam. Light aroma of hay, lemon, wheat, spices and yeast. Flavor was mild with wheat, yeast, citrus and coriander. 

Light body and lively carbonation. Refreshing but nothing spectacular.

Bottle.

Vary pale hazy yellow with a big white dense head. 

The aroma is light and "wheaty" with notes of yeast, tangerines and lime peel. Mild spices. 

The flavor os rather sweet with a prominent mildly abrasive wheat character. Lots of yeasty aromas and bubble gum flavors. Sweet and faintly tart tangerine notes. The finish is short and sweet with notes of some spices. 

Light body and lots of carbonation. 

A balanced and refreshing classic, but nothing spectacular.

Bottle. 12oz. Pours a beautiful honey wheat yellow with a delicate, wispy white head. Aroma of hay, hops, sweet earth tones, and nice little touches of lemon and orange. Nice medium, easy-going body with a tart, deliciously sticky mouthfeel. Finish is smooth and soft. Really good macro wit.

12 oz bottle, best before Aug, 2010. 

Hazy extremely pale yellow. Lively carbonation, a thin but lasting head, and excellent lace. 

Aroma is light. banana, pepper, lemon, 

Flavor is tart lemon, balanced by sweet fruit and a light spicy finish.

Nice summer quencher

I LOVE this beer. I wasn’t expecting it to be so good, considering how you can find this beer almost anywhere. The coriander and orange peel make for awesome tones of flavor, and aroma. This beer keeps a balance of drinkable refreshing qualities and still manages to be complex and delicious. Try it if you haven’t already!
Not too concerned with the classic standard, but my standard for Belgium white is banana and clove.  This one’s got ’em.  Not fond of the color, but a nearly perfectly palate-d summer swilling beer.
Bottle - Pale straw color. Has very strong sour citrus flavors with a strong aftertaste. Great summer beer, especially while sitting in the great outdoors.

It’s 1997. I’m in Amsterdam for the first time -- in Europe for the first time. We’re in a hostel and all the other kids there are drinking Hoegaarden.  It’s my first introduction to Belgian beer, and saaaay.... it’s pretty tasty.  A new and refreshing experience, soon to be eclipsed by darker, stronger stuff at Café Belgique.  I really don’t like Witbiers, so I hadn’t had it in years, though I still thought fondly of it.  Finally cracked one to revisit and rate, and saaaay... it’s still pretty tasty.  Pours hazy light pale golden with generous and fluffy white head.  Nose of orange, orange peel, lemons, yeast, and coriander.  Similar taste, though a bit thin and a light but lively palate.  Very drinkable, but nothing exciting.  Watch for it as a gateway drug, though...
For a long time, this one was one of my favorites to drink at the bar. It goes in very smooth, and the little sour taste is something special.

Still the standard by which other wheats are judged .Pale straw in color with a minimal,white head.Citrus and Bubblegum on the nose. Lemony hay that finishes with a sweet pineapple flavor. Still very enjoyable.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. BB 04/10/10. 



App.:  Cloudy bright straw with a decent bright white meringue.
  
Aroma:  Banana esters, lemons, earthy coriander, nice yeast and bread dough, cotton candy or bubblegum esters too, wet hay, a touch of clove and spiciness.
  
Palate:  Medium body, sparse but sharp effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Starts with cardboard unfortunately, earthy and lemony, yeast notes, the esters are there, but subdued, still some wet hay/wheat, the coriander exerts its presence as the beer warms; dry with light bitterness and a pleasant lemony biscuit finish.



As with many ratebeerians, I’ve had this brew often and am finally getting around to rating it.  It is nice stuff, particularly in a bar offering mainly pale lagers from A-B InBev.

A nice witbier, pours a very light and translucent yellow.  Citrus aroma and a refreshing taste.  Have drank many of these beers and have to say they have always been consistently good.  Finishes crisp and clean.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a hazy pale yellow with medium head that stays around a while.  The body is fairly thin, nice lacing, and high carbonation.  The taste is wet wheat, sour citus, and coriander.  Not a bad beer.

12oz bottle, purchased at Bottle Barn. It’s amazing how many times I had this beer in college and grad school without having rated it. Today’s the day! Pours a hazy, dull straw color; fluffy white head with excellent retention and lacing; continuously effervescent; great pour aside from the dullness of the color. Lots of cloves present in the aroma, almost to the degree of seeming peppery (I often thought back on this beer as a biscuity, white pepper thing), but nicely meshed with spicy coriander and citrus notes; nicely balanced, dry, and crisp. Medium mouthfeel: creamy texture in the mouth, lively carbonation, but very smooth texture from the wheat; pleasant amounts of citrus, coriander, and cloves, with (again) that suggestion of a light white pepper contribution; this feels so close to me saying "watery" but it simply isn’t: everything’s filled out, this is just immensely drinkable and well-composed for a witbier; so much more refreshing and textured than that imperial-wit nonsense; simple, highly sessionable, moderate levels of acidity, crisp. Yes, please. Medium finish with plenty of toastiness, light coriander and citrus lingering; well-balanced end of things.

From bottle pours a cloudy yellow, medium size white head that leaves quickly. Looks like lemonade. Odor of citrus and cranberry. Has a sour taste thats not balanced well with some bitter or sweet. Thin mouthfeel. I guess its just not my type of beer

12 oz draft served in an English pint glass.  Pour was a cloudy straw with two fingers of fluffy white head.  Nose was old vegetables and yeast.  Taste was the same, but everything was a bit less intense than the aroma indicated.  Though I am not big on Wit beers, I prefer this one to all others I have tried.
wonderful witbier. pleasent yeasty taste. an overall great white beer for those who love white beers.
Psurs a cloudy yellow colour. Thin white head that does not stick around for long. Beautiful aroma. Creamy texture, lovely in the mouth. Leaves a heavy after taste, but quite pleasant.
This is my favorite beer. It has little aftertaste. It’s pretty spicy, but I love it.
On tap at the Winking Lizard Columbus world tour finisher party. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Banana, clove and wheat nose with a bit of citrus. Flavor is the same. Not my style.

The more I drank, the better I liked it.  Initially, I was concerned because I poured a beer shocked which has slightly more color than my tap water,,,especially since I paid 9 bucks for a six-pack.  This beer is awesome, not sure but it must be near to the top of my highest ranked beers.  Now all I got to do is hit the lotto so I can drink it on a regular basis!!!

330 ML bottle in Pakistan. I really thought this beer was unremarkable with exeption to the corriander. Even then, I didn’t find the corriander to help the beer in the taste department. I might be missing something, this is a fairly highly rater beer but I just didn’t enjoy the taste.

One of my all time favourites! I always get this one at bars if I can. Very good with some salty nuts, Nachos or chips.

Very refreshing and full taste. I prefer it with a slice of lime.

Thumbs up!

Draft. Beautiful glass of milky canary yellow liquid with a bone colored head. Classical aroma is mild, fruity with mostly orange notes. Soft palate. Yeasty and quite thick. Mild flavors are good, with a sweet yeasty, sometimes candylike finish after a mild herbal middle and a fruity entry. Light and refreshing.

Yellow beer with nice, longlasting white head; aroma of citrus, wheat, hints of banana and some spices; mouthfeel is refreshing with quite a low (/some) carbonation, a little thin; flavor of citrus, wheat, it´s slightly acid with a bubblegum-like aftertaste ending quickly.

Solid beer. Aroma is on the sweet side but not fruity. POurs a light golden color with a medium head.  Tastes lemony to the tart side. Nice and even going down with a smooth finish. It is definitely my go to beer if nothing else is interesting. Not filling which i Like.

Bottle at home.  Pour a hazy dark yellow.  Thick two finger head with the scent of banana, vanilla and lemon greeted the drinker.  A smooth medium bodied beer with a slight bitterness.  Tastes of Lemon, sugar and pine. Slight buttery with a finish that lasts.

Very refreshing witbier that i prefer to drink in summerdays or with a light meal. Light to medium body, nice aroma and taste of malts, yeast,citrus, orange (curacao), coriander. Sweet and easy drinkable. Aftertaste is a little bit sour.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy whitish yellow color with a small, foamy white head. Lovely aroma of very sweet citrus, orange and is slightly spicy. Flavor is really well balanced, with a definite sweetness, quite some nice spiciness and a slightly bittersweet finish. My favorite Belgian white.

This beer smells better than it tastes.  12 oz. bottle to pint glass.  Pours golden with a white, short-lived head, some lacing.  Initial impression of anise then citrus.  A little too sour-dry for my tastes.  Palate is refreshing and light, wish it tasted as good as it feels, smells and looks.
Faint aroma of orange and citrus. This beer brings a strong orange cream taste but still maintains it beer integrity with a slightly hoppy finish.

2008-06-01, Göteborg, bottle
 Grumligt, citrus, törstsläckande. Smakar gott på flaska som på tapp. Fick tag på orginal 1/2 l glaset "blommkrukan" i Danmark. Otroligt vad öl smakar gott i orginalglas? Glöm inte att vända upp och ned på flaskan försiktigt innan servering!

Brilliant summer beer. Refreshing and complex enough to keep oneself entertained. Citrus brut flavours with bready yeast. There are better out there, though, when it comes to wheat beer (or beer in general).
Light golden color, medium white head with a lemon bopping in and out of it.  Aromoa of citrus and hay with a light sour taste.  Light body and short finish.  Went well with the flounder I ate.

Beautiful pour: a kind of yellow with a very little amount green tint to it.
 A lot of white foam every time I’ve had it.
 Aroma of some citrus... in fact, a lot of citrus.
 Taste, sweet but not overbearingly so. A touch of bitterness counters the sweetness... the citrus fruit notes are of the fruit’s core: not much rind-like bitter flavoring here. The orange peel the label mentions makes itself known, however.
 The aftertaste is like that of bubblegum, minus the time you spent chewing it "after the flavor is gone."

 Very refreshing. At only about 5 percent alcohol, I can see myself probably picking it up during the summer.

can/bottle. Poured straw coloured and cloudy with a creamy white head. Strong tart citrus, yeasty aroma. Medium body, crisp carbonation, refreshing. Biscuity malts, wheat flavour, notes of corriander and banana peel with some spice.

(draught 0,5l)
Yeast and wheat aroma, also some fruits (citrus). Cloudy light yellow color. Huge white head. Light sweet, medium sour.

Hazy yellow with a lasting white head. Aroma: Coriander is very present, wheat, yeast and a little orange. Taste: Orange and coriander, sugar, and some bitterness in the background. Better than I remembered and really refreshing.
Great, refreshing beer. Nose and flavors mostly on sweet citrus with a good amount of bite. Reminds me of my stay in Holland, where this beer is quite popular. Great summer quaffer.

Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow with white head . Aroma hints of coriander, slight sweetness and whiffs of banana. Taste is a well balanced Witbier with moderate sweetness. Very easy to drink, and quite enjoyable.

Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a thin white head.  Smells of sweet citrus, some wheat, and spices.  The taste follows up on the aroma, but with more of a punch on the tastebuds.  One can taste all the flavors in this beer.  The mouthfeel is crisp and refreshing.  Not too much carbonation, but enough.  Overall an awesome witbier and anytime beer.
One of the most widely available Belgian whites..  Pure clean taste.  Nice light beer.
Pale white, with a thin head.  Tart and sour, with a strong wheat finish.  .
Nope. Not at all a favorite. Even to slam. Just over the top messy bread and yeast flavor. Different but bad.

Bottle.  Pour is very light cloudy yellow with a nice sized bright white head.  Aroma is coriander, chamomile, lemon, lightly herbal, and faint wheat-like aroma.  Flavor is nice and full with coriander, lemon, and a richness that must come from the grain.  It’s so much more full bodied than expected.  I really like this and will buy much more in the summer.

Had this bottled in the US and fresh in Belgium and got more recently.  Pour is a light gold with a thin white head.  Lovely, light aroma that is pungent for a white.  Tastes as though there’s an orange peel in the glass while your drinking it.  Blends the sweet and sour flavors well.  I love sipping on this beer every time I have it.  As far as the white’s go, this is definitely my favorite.  I can’t wait to go back to Belgium for more of this and others.
(draft at Trinity in Colorado Springs). Cloudy yellow color. Small white head. Coriander aroma and flavor. Short duration. Smooth finish. Thin texture. Moderate/fizzy carbonation. Good lacing.

I really liked this beer. Looks turbid in the glass. Great aroma. Very refreshing, fruity, with good acidity and a nice texture. The head is creamy but not very thick. I could drink more than one easily!

12oz.  Citrus nose.  Bright flavor, spice and citrus flavors pop with each bubble.  Banana and wheat linger on the back of the tongue.  There’s a real trub flavor that remains a couple minutes after drinking, probably from the yeast?  Yay beer!
Has an extremely light color, but has a nice aroma of lemon and citrus. The flavor is also fruity with the hint of wheat. It definitely is easy to drink.

Bottle. Can’t believe I haven’t rated this before. Pours hazy pale yellow with a diminishing white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, yeast, banana and clove. Flavour is similar but more doughy and has a little bit more spice. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation and a dry but slightly bitter finish. A very good wit (one of the best), easy drinking and highly sessionable.

Pours cloudy pale yellow color with white head. Aromas of bubblegum, corriander, citrus and wheat. Moderately sweet with flavors similar to the aromas. Light to medium body with tingly carbonation. A very nice Belgian witbier.

Amazing aroma of clove, banana, and coriander. Poured a very light unfiltered yellow color with average lacing & head. Tasted phenomenal with notes of sour citrus, dough, and orange peel. Lively on the palate with the citrus tones lasting after you swallow. Overall this is one of, if not the best, wit beers available today.
Scents of citrus and spices. Appearance is pale cloudy pastel yellow. Taste is of oranges and spices. Palate is citrus, floral, and refreshing. Overall a great one and one of my favorites

0.33 l bottle.
Pale and hazy yellow color with a nice head, which quickly runs down.
Sparkling is lively, the smell is tart, citrus-fruity.
Taste is sour, watery, the flavor’s fruity and sweet, beer’s body is thin.
Finish is dry. It’s ok.

Pours a cloudy off-coloured white. It has a mild aroma of cloves/bananas, but is fairly nondescript. The taste, likewise, is fairly mediocre. It tastes of clove tea and nothing else. The malt and hops are not discernible. The texture, despite the cloudiness, is watery thin. Just too thin/clovey for me

Lots of clove and banana in the aroma...a lot like a great hefe, but with the addition of some citrus. The beer is very light in the palate, but this only lends itself to appreciating the coriander and orange that are very well balanced...the major downfall of most other witbiers. The finish is also very light, but the citrus from the coriander lasts for a bit and all you want to do is have another. Not the biggest man beer on the planet, but a joy to drink.

a floral, grass, livey aroma. appearance is Cloudy and golden like straw., head is white and good lasting. The flavor is with a lot flowers and perfume,
a bit of  bubblegum. a light waterys beer good for summer.
Bottle. Cloudy, wheat beer look. Slight citrus taste with a spicy edge. Pleasant smell. Really refreshing. Recommneded.
Bottle 33cl. Yellow color with a white head. Refreshing and enjoyable. Medium sweetness, light body, average carbonation, long finish.
Pours cloudy light yellow with a grey head that vanishes. Smells and tastes of flowers, cloves and banana. Flavor is sour-sweet and texture is dry. Light to medium body.

I’ll just start by saying that I am biased in favor of this beer. I love Hoegaarden. It is the witbier by which I judge all others. With that in mind, my review follows.

It is a light hazy golden yellow color. Hazy enough to nearly be opaque. It reminds me of a wheat field on a nice summer day. It’s minimal head doesn’t stay around long, at all.

Smells of spicy citrus notes. Little yeasty bread-like notes in there, too. Not much else, just keep it simple.

Taste is very good, indeed. The not quite sweet citrus flavors are so finely balanced by the spiciness of the coriander that this is harmony in a glass. Light yeast notes follow along bringing a delicate banana flavor to round out the end.

Very good creamy mouthfeel, here. This wouldn’t work without the proper carbonation level and fortunately, this has it.

For me, this is a great session beer. Nice and easy to drink with a moderate enough ABV level. It would score a 5.0 for this except that it runs about $10 a 6-pack, so you have to kind of monitor your intake, for financial reasons. (Someday, when I win the lottery, I’ll bathe in this stuff.)
Mmmmm....tasty!
a very, very nice "summertime" beer. fresh taste, orange and coriander flavor, cloudy and a yellow color app. think it´s very (!)  important to drink it cold!
Basically the style’s standard. Cloudy yellow color with a perfume and coriander aroma mixed with a candy sweetness from the yeast. A slight orange zest int he flavor and a light smooth palate.

pours cloudy gold/yellow with dissipating head. taste is citrus (think lemon juice). palate is the same. i don’t get an aroma but that can be a good thing. goes down easy enough. my favorite witbier to date.

Cloudy white yellow color with a big white head that leave some film behind. Spot lacing. Smell is of yeast, bubblegum, and citrus with only mild notes of coriander. Taste is about the same with a medium carbonated creamy mouthfeel. Enjoyable and refreshing beer.
One of my favorite beers. Nice witt beer quite cloudy with a citrus aroma and also sweet, very nice when the wether is hot. Very drinkable beer

Tap. Part of a back log. Hazy yellow with a white head. Lemon and other citrus flavors. Some have noted that there is some vanilla and corriander, but I missed it. Its decent for getting non-beer people into the world of craft brewing, but probably isn’t anything too many people here would go nuts for.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour and yeasty wheat aroma with a touch of lemon fruit. Taste pretty much the same as aroma. One of the best summer beers I’ve had on a hot day but at other times refreshing and enjoyable too. Try with a lemon slice too.

bottle - Pours hazy, pale yellow, medium white, frothy head. Aroma is of spiced orange and coriander and I swear I detected the faintest hint of vanilla. The taste was of coriander and citrus with a nicely balanced finish. Very refreshing.
Pale yellow, cloudy, white head. not terribly impressed by this one.  some citrus but the corriander wasn’t detectable to me.
Pleasantly surprised by this beer. Had a citrus taste, and poured a cloudy, golden color.
A nice light citrus and grassy aroma.  Pours out with a light golden body and a light white head.  A lighter bodied beer with a complex and slightly sour flavor and a light lasting finish.

Bottle. Aroma like rotting citrus. This an is excellent description provided by a non-beer drinker. Having owned several citrus trees myself, this description is dead on. It is not an unpleasant aroma, but distinctive. Appearance similar grapefruit juice. Foamy head that dissipates within two minutes. Taste is typical but watery. Feel is creamy and a little oily. Aftertaste is a flat and unpleasant. I really wanted to like this beer because it is readily available in this area. With each bottle over several sittings I liked it less.

Often enjoyed from an 11.2oz bottle in pub glasses, goblets, and tulip glasses.  The aroma is probably the best part of this beer, and is the benchmark for the style.  Florally notes derived from perhaps coriander and chammomile, along with notes of orange and perhaps a touch of lemon.  The palate is light and estery, but without losing a distinctly refreshing character.  A bit of malt sweetness is evident, but it takes a backseat to the esters.  Overall, a great wit, and clearly the prototype of the style.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold, with a large, long-lasting white head. The aroma has orange and coriander notes prominent. Coriander, orange and light grainy malt flavours are present, with a slight medicinal finish.

Why is this beer suddenly everywhere ? I even ran into it on tap at yankee Stadium. 
Nice fruity smell, comes across a bit sour for me after  a couple.
Bottle - pours a hazy yellow. Yeasty, grainy, citrusy. One of the better macro beers.
Poured hazy golden yellow, smooth,  yeasty, grainy, citrus, little bannana.

25cl brown bottle, different from the one in the picture (taller, thinner). Pours a hazy, pale yellow with a medium, creamy white head with next to no lacing. Aroma is citrus and banana, typical wheatbeer. Lightbodied, but not watery in mouth feel. Taste delivers what the aroma promised: sour citrus grapes, offset by a slight banana sweetness. Dry, wee bit sour finish and after taste. Different from the Bavarian "Hefeweizen" (which is usually much sweeter), but totally characteristic of the Dutch and Belgian "whitbier" style. Very likeable, drank this on tap in England several times. Very sessionable, refreshing. Good light beer.
Very good at first but has a weird sour flavor that did not taste natural,.I do not like it compared to other wit beers.
Bottle, Alko. Hazy color, large white fluffy head. Yeast and citrus aroma, flavour similar, very easy to drink and refreshing.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
Appearance: Slightly hazy, pale yellow with a foamy white head.
Aroma: Yeasty with slight spice notes, a good bit of citrus, and a touch of a metallic note.
Flavor: Tart citrus notes are the first to greet my tongue.  They are followed by smooth malt, yeast, small floral notes, a slight buttery touch, lemon, and a slight metallic note.  The standard for Wits.
Palate: Medium, smooth carbonation with a light mouthfeel and a short finish.
Overall: Fairly straightforward.  This beer has a nice mouthfeel and nice clean finish.  Always reliable if better brew isn’t available.

This beer is my Bud/Miller

When I go out with friends, The place must have this on tap or bottle. 

The pour is very nice and clean. Nice foam head. 
The smell is of pure wheat and citrus. As you take in the beer, you get a slight hint of orange, lemon, lemon grass, and spice. All of these flavors are well hidden among a very clean and refreshing wheat base. Super nice drinking and very pleasing refreshment.

Pours a hazy yellow hue with thin, very white head. Pretty beer. Sweet aroma, some banana and yeast coming through. Interesting taste. Sweet up front with a slightly bitter finish. Some fruit and yeast coming through. Super refreshing, not bad.
A very tasty beer with a citrus smell. It was lighter colored than I thought it would be. It is somewhat expensive here at $9.00 a six pack but a good all-around beer.

330ml bottle. Cloudy, pale yellow colour with white foamy head which fully diminishes. Yeasty aromas with bread, citrus especially lemon, some orange, banana. Flavour yeasty spicy, sweet with a lemon sour touch particularly in the finish. One of my favourites, very thirst quenching on a hot day
Pale yellow pour.  Light and smooth and the orange/coriander is incorporated better here than in Blue Moon, which has been a favorite of mine.  Refreshing and extremely drinkable.
On draft at local pub.  Virtually no head to speak of but a bright, light yellow body.  Citrus notes in the aroma and taste with no bitterness and short finish.

Draft. Aroma is bready and a light yeast, with just hints of spice. Flavor is more hefe- than wit, but still nice, refreshing wheatiness and lemon with a touch of pepper @ the finish. A nice beer, though fairly one-dimensional.
Cloudy golden yellow with a dense fluffy head. Aroma has citrus, bread, yeast, and some spice. Flavor has more spice, pepper, lemon zest and yeast. Simple and yet slightly complex. Easy drinking.
Draft at Odd Bar, Manchester UK. Delicious witbier. Pour hazy yellow, sweet and fruity notes.
Ultimate bar choice, this white marries off the charts orange flavor with just enough spice yet watery enough to be drunk by the litre. Fine beer as down to earth as you can get.
The classic witbier. A cloudy white hued yellow beer with a decent head. Aroma is citrusy. The taste is spicy, some banana, & is a very clean tasting beer & very refreshing.
Sour aroma, pale cloudy yellow with medium head. Taste is grapefruit and banana. Thin, watery body. Finishes sour coriander. Not to my taste.
25cl. bottle, pours pale yellow, medium head, vanishes very fast. Yeasty aroma, with spicy hints. Nice white bear!

12 oz bottle from the Four Firkins.  Pale yellow pour with thick foamy white head.  Fresh, yeasty wheat aroma with some spice coming through.  Clean taste with a hint of citrus and the coriander does make an appearance along with other spices.  Light mouthfeel with a smooth finish.  Great beer.
Very nice when served in original glass. A bit sour-sweet. I like to drink it with lime. 3-5 pints will usually make it.
I’m not really feeling this one.  I know it’s THE beer for the style, but then again I’m not big on the wheats.  Cloudy yellow pour, fruity with a little much banana for me on the smell and taste.

Bottle 330ml. Deliciously aromatic beer. Aroma is citrusy, with banana and fresh grass. Taste is lightly sweet at the beginning, with sourness taking over, and lingering nicely at the end. Cloudy yellow, with a thin head that disappears. Light body, oily texture, good carbonation.
A smooth thirst quencher with a unique flavor. I definitely recommend this one. I’m normally a fan of strong dark beers this was neither and I still really enjoyed it.
&#40bottle 75 cl.&#41  Pours Pale milky-hazy  yellow with a nice lasting white head. Wheat and yeasty fresh aroma and flavour. Nice summer beer
12 oz Bottle. Nice pale yellow color. Slightly cloudy. LIght head.  A pleasant and refreshing Witbier. Recommended.
Nice yellow colour but head was poor when I got it. Spicy flavors. Not bitter at all. Sweet but not overbearing. Very refreshing.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a cloudy, yellow-golden body with a finger-width, creamy, white head that dissipates quickly and leaves a light lacing. Aroma is light wheat malts, slightly sour citrus, sweet yeast, faint banana, and a soft coriander spicing. Flavor is the same. Starts with the wheat and some creamy banana before a soft coriander comes in and a slightly sour citrus finishes this off. Finishes dry and crisp with some zest after a light to medium, smooth body. Medium lingering aftertaste of citrusy wheats and a light spice. Overall, nothing too exciting, but nothing to complain about either. Solid.

Draft at Brownstone Bistro in Toronto.  For some reason, I’ve never had this beer before.  Golden yellow pour, white head, served with orange slice on the rim.  Fruity taste, some citrus fruit, even some banana.  Orange flavor for sure, but I think this was because it was served with an orange slice.  Enjoyable witbier on a warm summer night, but nothing really exciting.  I don’t drink the wits too often, but this one isn’t too bad.  Suprisingly flavorful.

Very light beer with a good and aromatic foam. The aroma is so complicate, it’s absolutely fruity, and is also refreshing.
I like it with a slice of lemon.
Pours a foamy, white, lacing head with a hazy, straw color body.  Smells of yeast, zest, and banana.  Flavor is yeast, zest, and banana.  Nice carbonation.

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is light yellow, a bit hazy, and has a white foamy.

The smell is a bit citrus with hints of orange and lemon. Good ammount of hops as well

The taste is crisp with hints of fruits, oranges and others. Slight hints of hops and is a small bit bitter.

This truely is my favorite white beer. It is one of the few white beers that I have had so far but it is the best. It’s real good with guinnness as well.

I have had this from the bottle and on tap many, many times.  This is THE archetype Belgian Wit with an amazing color and wonderful spices!  Yes, it’s delicious, and the original, but there are some better ones out there.  Seek them out!

Bottle. Pours a hazy, opaque gold.  Thin head with good longevity, leaves a thin delicate lacing.  Light nose, citrus and wheat.  Taste is lemon and oranges, tangy but not overbearing.  Mid-bodied palate and carbonation. A good Belgian white especially for the price and accessibility.
This was a small bottle of delicious beer.  My first witbier and didn’t know what to expect but I love this stuff.  An almost delicate but sweet taste.  How do those Belgians do it?
What a quality beer. The flavor is distinct and extremely pleasing, with full palate and beautiful cloudy appearance. You can literally see the wheat proteins floating around inside. A.

A great introduction to the style because of its accessibility. Still quite good but not great. Orange and lemon carry this beer and it is much better when served in the cool hexagonal glass and poured correctly. Heed the instructions. The body leaves something to be desired but nobody’s perfect. One of the finest widely available brews and one I go back to when nothing piques my curiosity.

(12oz bottle) Pours opaque yellow with 3+ finger head. Nose is coriander, orange peel slightly funky, wheat and yeast. Taste is slightly complex with the orange and spices, as well as lemon. It is well carbonated, crisp and refreshing. Body is a little thin, but still one of my favorites in the style despite its wide availability.

Draft at Cullen’s in Chicago.  Pours cloudy yellow with average white head.  Aroma of citrus.  Citrus controls the flavor as well, with wheat and some spice.  A little sour.  Medium/full body with a little more carbonation than I’d like, but overall very pleasant on the palate.  Just an all-around solid, refreshing, easy-to-find beer.  There are better Belgian whites out there but none I’ve had blow this one away.
Tasty and refreshing. Citrus aroma and flavor. There are better white beers but this one is always readily available.

Great summer thirst quencher and very tasty. A little confused at the high rating though because there are many better beligian whites out there that have superior flavors. I guess for a beer so widely available i’ll take what i can get though,
Cloudy white/pale golden color with white head - smells and tastes citrus, nice and drinkable beer
citrus, pale, cloudy, frothy, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, light body, bit bitter,

Hoegaarden is cloudy and pours a pale yellow color. A delightful foamy head is easily produced when pouring from the bottle. An intense citrus smell greets the senses as a sip is taken. The flavor is also citrusy and sweet with lemon, orange peel and a hint of pineapple. The body is full and creamy. Some fizziness is a welcome element to counter some of the sweetness. Compared to many other commonly available wheat beers, Hoegaarden provides a little extra goodness that is sure to be enjoyed.

I am trying to figure out why this is rated so high.  I know this is supposed to be an original, but it seems average at best.  Tried this twice, both times from local bars that rotate their stock frequently.  Don’t get me wrong it is not a bad beer by any means, but it is not a fantastic beer either.  Pours a cloudy, pale golden yellow.  Orange, malt, wheat and a slight hop smell to the nose.  Initial taste with orange, malt, and plenty of wheat., but there is a strong carbonation that I think takes away from the beer.  It is still very drinkable, but don’t rush out to get a 90+ rated beer.
Very light, cloudy. Spicy aroma. Not what I expected - frankly it’s kind of bland with only a slightly spicy flavor.
12 oz bottle... meh not my style can appreciate it though... the dreaded coriander and oranges.... bleh

Bottle - Overall, pretty meh. Pours hazy white with a white head. Nose is mild spice and orange. Taste is pretty much the same. There’s too much carbonation, which messes with the taste, but while it’s refreshing and crisp, there just isn’t much here. I’d look for something more interesting before I came back here again.

On-tap. Poured with a good-sized, white head with not much lacing. Body is a very pale yellow, and extremely cloudy - completely opaque. Great aroma of citrus, coriander, and spices - especially black pepper. Light to medium-bodied on the palate, with soft carbonation. Nice taste of citrus and pepper, with a medium-lasting finish. Overall, one of the classic whites... very nice, but it may actually be a little TOO spicey.
Not as great as people make it out to be. Quite strong, refreshing but not too much. Good beer and it’s good that you can get it all over the world, but there are better white beers around.

Pint 5620...... Always pours out a stupid sized thick white cap that never disappears regardless of if it’s poured out of a bottle or out of a tap. Cloudy yellow gold brew. Smells fresh! Wheat, yeast, weak banana that changes to more of a over ripe banana when warmer but still mild in strength, some soft malts. There is an unmistakable banana taste but it remains milld throughout, light spices, a bit sour, more wheat, dry and slightly bitter that gives it a bit of punch. Quite carbonated and not as smooth as I assume it is but I still find this very refreshing. Odd plasticy feel shows up often but is not bothersome, slight biscuit in the after taste as well. Countless pints... countless.

Pours cloudy pale gold with a nice white uneaven head.  Nose is bready.  Taste is sweet and spicy, with notes of cinnamon, banana, wheat and bisquit.  Crisp and refreshing, this beer is really delightful.

I’ve had this beer several times in the past but never thought to rate it.  When I actually stopped to think about it (with glass in hand), Hoegaarden is actually quite good.  The nose is much spicier than I recall from the past and the taste has a good blend of crispness with big flavors of wheat, banana, cinamon, and clove.  My past pours seemed to have more corriander than this glass, which is fine with me.  I prefer the softer, sweeter spices in a Witbier and this bottle was just right.

On tap. Beautiful foggy yellow unfiltered beer with a distinct and sweet citrus aroma. Taste is crisp, pleasant and refreshing. Restaurants and bars around town would do well to serve this. By far, my favourite beer mass market available at a local liquor store.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow with considerable haze (as expected; its an unfiltered beer and I swirled the bottom few ounces). Smells of citrus and spices. Taste is very crisp, not much bitterness to it. Smell is a bit stronger than the taste. The aftertaste is a bit too dry for my taste. Makes it taste almost stale.

This is probably my favorite wheat beer that can be found coast-to-coast, year round. An old standby as far as wheat beers are concerned.

on tap.  pours a cloudy yellow, sweet citrus and spice aroma. crisp hop,light malt, orange and coriander taste. dry finish. this , to me, is what i think is standard fine witbier. i am glad to see this one on tap.
Daught: Cloudy, pale yellow.  Malty front with light cinnamon overtones.  Not the best I had in Belgium, but quite good.

Not bad at all, for what it is. Definitely one of the only beers with widespread distribution I’d be caught dead with. Tad lemony bouquet, floral taste without a hint of bitterness. Miles ahead of, say, Allagash White, but I’d still prefer a tumbler of St. Bernardus Blanche.

Draft....in short a hazy straw color with a minimal white head that smelled of lemon zest, price and grass with a similar but slightly less strong flavor. Will work in a pinch not to memorable though.
This is a good white belgeian. Pours a murky hazy yellow, Good taste and very refreshing.

A hazy cloudy pale yellow color is apparent upon pouring with a nice thick pure white head.  This is a very attractive beer.  The head diminishes over the course of several minutes but leaves behind some real nice lacing on the glass.  The aroma is immensely spicey, citrusy and some yeast is also noticeable.  Tastes rather mild, clean, yet light and complex with the coriander coming through accompanied by the tart sweetness of lemons, apples, and pears.  The finish is rather dominated by the strong presence of the spices, but is refreshing and enjoyable.
When poured out in the big glass a nice head shows up (for a white beer). Aromas of citrus and coriander. Great refreshing taste. The best Belgian witbier.
I have waited some time for a new experience in enjoying beer to come along. This is it! Very smooth, great flavor and not sweet like some others I have tried......and I can find it everywhere.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a medium lasting head. It has a pleasant citrus aroma.  This is a very complex and wonderful tasting beer. It tastes of citrus, flowers, bread, coriander and a little pear.

Light yellow hazy pour.  fruity esters and slight funk.  Initial light bite and followed by a thirst quenching body.  Citrus, cherries and floral flavors in the body.  Nice after being outside for a few hours.

At tap in Rimini. Pale yellow colour with white head. Really fresh flavour of plums, citrus and flowers, roses in particular. Spicy, fruity taste with no bitterness. Very refreshing, ideal for roasted fish and summer in general.

on Tap Lis Doon Varna Peoria, AZ:  Smelled fruity, sour and spicy with minimal head. Served with orange slice (I removed).  Taste was spicy (corriander) and citrusy.  Nice medium mouth feel.   Not as sweet as I expeced, but very good.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm, 3 July 2009)  Cloudy yellow colour with frothy, white head. Wheaty, fruity nose with notes of wheat flour, citrus and coriander. Fruity, wheaty taste with white bread, dough and spicy hints of coriander and citrus. Rather light body, not overly sweet. It has lost some character over the years, but it’s still tasy and refreshing.

Very light like hazy white grapefruit, with a nice white head. Presented a very unique flavor combination of orange and zucchini, followed by nothing, no aftertaste. Made for an insanely drinkable beer, out on the deck, talking and soaking in the sun.

Drank from bottle in Luxembourg.

This is pretty good for a widely available beer.  Its light and you can drink a lot, not something i’d start the night with, but definetly have and will finish the night with it.

Bottle, pretty much everywhere.  Never been a fan of wheat beers but have had a Damascene conversion.  Pours a cloudy, pale yellow with an initially frothy head that thins out but stays the distance.  Aroma is lemon, sour apple, yeast and a touch of clove/cinnamon spice.  Bubblegum/banana flavour with pepper and flowery touches.  Pleasantly light palate, ideal for summer.  I wish I’d been able to enjoy this before InBev got their grubby mitts on the brand.
Pours nicely, great visual of hazy yellow. Smell of citrus, tastes of orange and spices. Very refreshing, good witbier for sure.

Light, good carbonation, but funky wheat aroma (still trying to gravitate from IPA to wheat); you can taste both the sweet and sour as the description says.  Excellent with a lemon and some seafood.  I rarely give a 5 for palate, but this deserves it.

Pour was lightly carbonated, and hazy unique straw colored. Citrus and cloves with spices in the nose followed by a lingering floral aroma. Light smooth mouth feel and not what you’d think from the nose on taste. Alot of clove present up front with little to no bitterness to finish it out. A great summer time beer for something different great up front on the taste but lacking in the finish kept it from a higher score. 
P.S. On a side note my friend mentioned "it was like drinking the urine from god’s penis" Awesome

.33l bottle in Belgrade. Pours a spritely lemony-white with a good head. Nose is lemonade, tea, orange zest and lavender. Sharp, fruity taste with sparkling carbonation. A bit sloppy, wet feel with some dry bittering at the end. Sweet and sour is a good description, a very interesting style of beer. Tasty.

Pours a very pale gold with a bright white head.  The head looks as though it should disappear in no time, but it continues to build from the bottom and lasts for quite a while.  The aroma is pleasant; a bit sweet with hints of spices.  Before going into the flavor I have to admit that white beers are usually not my favorite.  However, this beer has enough spice and other flavor to balance out the usual taste of the white beer that I found it quite enjoyable.  The flavor is crisp, a bit sweet, with a variety of spices mixed in.  The beer doesn’t have as much flavor as I would normally like, but it is easy to drink and is pretty refreshing.

House of Brews:  aaaahhhh Witbier!  Love this during the summer!  And while this beer is a good representation of the style, it’s certainly not the best...  The color and head is everythng you’d come to expect from this style: light yellow, white head, lingering, decent lacing.  Aroma is of bitter citrus, taste reveals the same... a bit watery, a bit more on the bitter side as well.  Bad hangover!!!

Bouteille et fût, à plusieurs reprises. Arômes de blé et de citron, légère touche d’épices. Robe blonde très pâle et trouble, belle mousse qui disparaît rapidement. En bouche, le blé est bien présent avec une légère acidité et des notes citronnées. Belle harmonie des saveurs. La référence du style et toujours une très bonne wit.

How is it possible that I’ve been rating beer this long, but I’ve yet to rate this beer?  I know Pierre Celis is some sort of beer luminary who revived the witbier style.  But, now there’s so much more to the story...Pierre Celis’s Texas brewery sort of sucked, now that beer is brewed in Michigan (it still sort of sucks), Pierre is in his mid-80’s, and now the witbier is a style that has been sort of over-done into an entry-level craft beer targeting light beer drinkers and a female palate by the likes of Blue Moon and Spotted Cow.  So where does that leave Hoegaarden?

It’s pretty good!  Definitely not over-done, it is superlative in some pretty subtle ways.  It isn’t overly sweet like some American imitators, it is brightly yellow with a nice meringue head.  Aroma and flavor is slightly sweet with a pleasing amount of Coriander and I dare say offer something that I think is wheatiness.  Pretty good, but probably better a generation ago...the same way the first DIPA must’ve been revolutionary...now that every craft brewer has one, I’m a little less impressed.

Pours cloudy pale yellow with a frothy white head that remains for a while. Aroma is lemon, clove, and wheat. Very crisp and refreshing taste. Easy to drink but very sweet so I wouldn’t drink more than one at a time.

Bottle. Pours a very hazy pale yellow with a creamy snow white head that quickly reduces to a ring, good lacing. Nose is lemon candy, soap, wheat, yeast, coriander. Flavor is bright lemon with soap and a tight, spicy finish. Crisp and clean, a great summer beer.

12oz bottle 6/16/09-Pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, coriander, and orange peel. Taste of the same with a bit of citrus coming through. This light bodied brew is definitely one of the better whites made. Great tasting.

I’ve tasted this gem many times before; the first was actually in Belgium. Hoegaarden is crisp, smooth and delicious. I had a glass yesterday at brunch. The color is very light; the head is quite thick; and the aroma is citrusy and refreshing. The taste is similaly fruity, though to a lesser degree.

This is the beer that started it all for me, so I admit to having a soft spot for it - Thanks to my university roommate for recommending it an having the appropriate glass. Still love sipping it out of that hoegaarden tumbler. Bright golden yellow throughout with a dense, billowing white crown. Aroma is citrus-sweet, yeasty and spicy blending into the tastes of ripe banana, grapefruit and bread with balanced undertones of coriander and orange zest. Mouthfeel is smooth and finish is refreshing with spice and zest lingering. This is truly a classic witbier that continues to entice over the years.
Aroma of fruits, spices, banana and wheat. The flavor is pretty much the same as the aroma but weaker. It’s really a refreshing beer. Perfect lawn mowing beer.

Unfiltered pale-lemon juice like. Fine frothy head.

 Orange & coriander evident, as is sweet/sour aroma.

 Neutral balance, no alcohol evident.
Wife says "flavour? 10/10. ’Cause it is.."

 Watery, fizzy. Super fresh.

 Wifes favorite beer. Great for summer.
  Purchased in SuperBest

Banana, hints of menthol and citrus on the nose, nice and tart.Very aromatic.  So nice and drinkable, smooth and thick.  Buttery and rich but it isn’t too heavy.  Flavour is quite full on, more to the point than some wits.  Delicious.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with some body to the white head. There’s an aroma of grapefruit, passionfruit, orange, and lemon... a big bouquet of citrus. Floral and fruit flavors are predominant with a bit of spice and hops. A great summer beer I’m up for drinking any season.

soft aroma of yeast. appearance is sunny straw colored, quite hazy and cloudy. flavor is of yeast and light tartness/spice. palate is a bit thick but inconsistent, at times seems thin despite the heavy carb.
Pale yellow pour with large white head.  Wheat and spices in aroma, but flavor is a bit watered down, only hint of citrus.  Overrated.

From the 330 ml bottle marked 15/03/10-T-02217-3511.  At first glance the pour looks as clear and thin as water but after a moment the cloudy, pale yellow appearance emerges. A smoky roasted wheat aroma is the first sensation I get. Delicate but typical for a witbier.  The mouthfeel is fairly heavy but the flavor explodes with wheat and coriander. A vague citrusy tartness but more sweet than that.  A fine balanced beer.
Unfiltered, so cloudy yellow color with a think head.  Aroma is quite strong with citrus and wheat.  Much lighter on the taste buds than I was expecting, it’s very easy to drink.  Good beer.

One of my all time favorite brews. You just feel all powerful when you hold that giant chunky thick glass in your hand and all the other sheep in the bar stare at you wishing there pitiful pint of yellow piss would look as good. The beer is a cloudy pail yellow, with a giant thick white head that disappears after a few sips. The refreshing sent of orange, lemon and spices prepares you for the goodness that will soon follow with your first taste. Dam I feel like I’m having sex with my keyboard writing this review. The taste is very smooth with hints of citrus and spice, the after taste is slightly tart making it the perfect choice any time your thirsty. I can’t get enough of this stuff, its like heroin it is..... (homer drewl)
Very light, but good. There is enough sweet spice notes to make the lightness refreshing instead of boring. Great feeling when there is head - not so much without head.

The best white I’ve had.  Mass produced and I haven’t had one that matches it yet. 
Orange flavour that just makes your mouth tingle.  Fantastic.

RateBeer pulled my original rating. Apparently someone thought I had to be kidding. I wasn’t. I really hated this watery beer. Looks, feels and tastes like water with a bit of funky bleh mixed in. Did not finish it, did not want to. And sadly, I bought two... the other will probably go straight from the fridge to the trash. As a side note, RateBeer removing ratings, or not allowing low ratings for popular beers skews the validity of the results.
Great summer beer, very light and refreshing.  Sometimes hits me as a bit sour, other times as a bit sweet.

Location: Have had this one many times.  




Aroma: Citrus, spice, wheat, yeast


Appearance: Hazy whitish golden color


Flavor: Similar to the nose, sweet citrus with a little spice


Palate: Light and drinkable, a nice summer beer palate


Overall Impression: 
This is one of those beers where people say they are bringing over some good beer and then show up with a 6 pack of Hoegaarden.  It’s alright, but I’ve always found it over-hyped.
Pours a hazy yellow with a two fingered white head. Aroma is spicy coriander and citrus. Flavor is citrus, light coriander, spice, and a little banana. Nice on a hot summer day.
Refreshing, with citrusy and spicy aromas and flavors. Good light wheat flavor. Great witbier.

I am not usually a fan of this particular style.  But this is pretty damn good.  Coriander and some banana in the taste.  Very similar in taste to a hefe.  The appearance of beer and milk mixed.  Good balance of flavors.  I would definitely have this one again.
Bottle. Too sweet and cloying, with way too much spice and fruit added. I used to like it, but now I find it very hard to drink a whole one. Give me one with fewer additives.

25 cl, bottle. The beer is served in the typical strong Hoegaarden glass, but than in the best way, or the way Hoegaarden should be served:: in a frozen glass. The beer looks yellow and hazy, troubled, turbid (or how you want to call it). There is a big white creamy head, but the foam disappears to a thin head while drinking. The beer smells fruity - citrus and a bit of orange - and grainy and hoppy, but also spicy (the coriander from the description). The taste is grainy, fruity (lemon) and light bitter, but also a bit wattery (but maybe this is a result of the frozen glass in which I served the beer). A very good and refreshing witbier, rightfully the most popular in Belgium.
50 cl Draft in original giant glass. Pours a hazy golden white color with a very thin white head.  Great WitBier.
This is probably the best Witbier out there. Good coriander and citrus notes on the aroma and nice citrus taste with some wheat. Pours a light hazy yellow.

Pours a hazy golden white color with a very thin white head. Interesting aroma with lots of orange, coriander and yeast. Fresh flavor of citrusfruit, wheat and spices. Finishing with some candy sweetness mixed with a citrus sourness.

Pours pale yellow, a bit hazy. Big head, leaves little lacing. Aroma is pretty big on coriander, a good amount of yeast and citrus. The same returns in the flavour, along with a more bready malt feel and some more spices. Not a lot going on here, but it’s refreshing and enjoyable, well balanced. Could have been smoother in the mouth.

On tap. Ha! Can’t believe I’ve never rated this. Pours a super light almost neon cloudy yellow. Small white cap that leaves smidgens of lacing and has little retention. Aroma is heavy on Belgian yeast, coriander, orange peel, lemon zest. Taste on tap is less soapy than I remember from sampling bottles: tons of spice, yeast, citrus. Higher carbonation but not overpowering.
Creamy on the palate. I think this gets low marks because it is so ubiquitous. But this is an excellent witbier. The best I have had aside from St. Bernardus Blanche.
one of my fav drinking beers, but i gotta say, even though this is from Belgium, my fav white is still alagash, go figure.

The appearance is a very hazy, very light yellow, white head, lots of carbonation.  The aroma is coriander, clove, cereal grains, orange peel.  The flavor is wheaty, spicy, orange peel.  The finish has a decent bittering from hops, spices, clove, orange peel.  Relatively thin mouthfeel.  Nice beer overall.

Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast and some spices. The flavour is orange, yeast, spices and wheat with some sourness. Quite thin bodied, very refreshing. Good summer beer.

Re-rate.... I would call this just watered down lemonade with a pinch of corriander... but that would give lemonade a bad name. 


Draft at Chappy’s.  Tastes like someone spiked my lemonade.   Not horrible, but nothing I’d go out of my way to drink.
 Apparently I just don’t like witbier.

Bottle @ Home

I was quite surprised to find this in the bottle shop I was at, actually; probably the only decent imported beer in there. It pours a very cloudy, pale white/yellow body with a fluffy white head; the head doesn’t last too long though. Leaves very little lacing on the glass. Has a fruity, wheaty aroma and a smooth flavour, similar to the aroma, and a fairly light body without much carbonation. An enjoyable beer.

Simply one of the very best in the world, and tops in its category.  Tried on draft and from bottle.  Citrus and light spice aroma with medium head mostly diminishing.  Very smooth taste and excellent session beer.  "Blue Moon" cannot hold a candle to this world-class brew - cheers to the Belgians once again!

OK this has to be the most beautiful wit i have ever had. pour was a pale yellow and clear almost white hence the name big frohy head aromas of corrinder and citrus and some spice taste is of the same flavors are more intense than other wits i have had but still hate this style
Light pale golden hues, big fluffy white head. Grassy yeast aroma and some hidden citrus tones. Light body and good higher carbonation...it is what it is...

A nice whitbier, but not great. Corriander was the main flavor, some orange as well. Some bars serve it with an orange, but I pass on fruit in my beer. Out of the bottle its a little lemony, otheer citrus flavors.

(Draft) Cloudy lightly grayish yellow body with a finger or so of whitish head. Aroma of lilies, yeast, citrus and light spice with a bit of glue.  Mouthfeel fairly soft and wheaty smooth, refreshing and lightly dryish. Light, weepy rings of lacing. Flavor is lightly citrusy (lemon) and light spice. Wheat malt and yeast. A bit sourish. Nice. Probably sets the standard for all mass-produced witbiers.

Citrus and spice aroma, with a somewhat pale apperance. Flavor is wheat with some spice and with hints of citrus (orange and lemon) throughout. Finish is a little flat and drinks a little thin. Overall, a great beer with a decent price tag.

Bottle, 33cl - Hazy pale yellow colored beer with a nice big head. Aroma is fresh with hints of lemon, and yeast. Flavor is again citrusy lemony with hints of wheat and coriander. Not overly impressed with this Wit, although I do enjoy this beer a lot a hot summers day.

Draught at Viisipenniä, Helsinki, Finland.

Hazy pineapple juice colour with white head. Lemony, citrus, sweet and yeasty aroma. Sweetish, wheaty, fruity flavour with some hoppiness. Excellent witbier.



Oud Hoegaards Bier (Bière Blanche) from 1979 tasted in Kulminator, Antwerpen, Belgium. 



330 ml bottle. 4.9%. Finland.

Parallel tasting with Hoegaarden, St. Bernardus Wit and Wieckse Witte.

Hazy pale yellow colour with small white head.
Wheaty, yeasty, fruity (citrus) and refreshing aroma.
Refreshing crisp fruity wheaty flavour with sourish citrus notes.



330 ml can. 5.0%. From Illkirch, France.

Hazy pineapple yellow colour with small white head. 
Citrus, lemon, wheat, yeast and some sweetness in aroma.
Not much to add but let’s say it again. Deliciously refreshing crisp bitterish wheaty flavour with sour citrus and slightly sweet caramel notes. Smooth. This is the brew I could drink every day and almost die for. Excellent Witbier and it’s quite easily accessible.

Pours a slightly "flourescent" yellow with gorgeously contrasting white head that remains meringue-like and retains well.

Nose is a soft mixture of lemon with other mixed citrus, and faint vanilla.

On the palate is a nice balance of wheaty malt sweetness with citrus, yeasty/estery flavours that are oh so good, and a suggestion of candied sweetness as well.

Finish is pleasingly tart and appetizing. Although Hoegaarden was amazing in previous years compared to this bottling more recently, it is nonetheless an amazing ale.
Pours hazy golden color white head floral hops crisp and light orange/coriander taste and smooth going down with a slight bitterness not overly carbonated its a good mass produced brew

Pours white gold and cloudy with a thick white head. A little lace. Aroma of citrus hops. Taste of orange peel and a lot of yeast. still has a crisp feel. After taste is bitter and a watery. an OK beer.
This is a very smooth, refreshing brew that goes down easy and quenches the thirst. One of my favorites!
Fruity, citrus hops aroma. Cloudy, pale, pineapple color. Light-medium sweet, light bitterness. Fizzy, lemon texture, medium body, finished long and sour.
30cl bottle poured into weizen glass.  Cloudy yellow with ample frothy head.  Smells spicy and sweet.  Tastes like orange peels.  Not bad but tastes very watered down.

Aroma is very nice-lots of banana, light citrus spice, some phenols. Flavor could definitely be more assertive, but I suppose it drinks easier this way. Some clove & coriander. Definitely a bit watery. Surprisingly light carbonation. Slightly sour tartness that draws one back for another sip, but flavorwise is not very impressive.

Colore biondo chiaro con schiuma di buona durata,aroma agrumato e leggermente speziato.Gusto secco e citrino non troppo amaro.Come la Leffe Blonde lo è per le ale belghe,questa Hoegaarden potrebbe essere l’entry-level per le white,in breve non è male,ma c’è di meglio nella categoria.Comunque potabile e dissetante.

Pours a funky pale yellow? Strangest color I’ve ever seen for a beer. Foamy white head hangs around a while. Twirled a bit before I dumped the yeast in. Lots of it in here, can still see some in the bottle. Looks like a nice glass of yuck, but the unusual color is kinda enticing. Aroma is quite inviting, lots of yeast, with clove and banana tones. Pretty lightly malted, but basically what you’d expect for a Belgian white.
12oz bottle. This is a classic benchmark beer. Widely available, always good, and an excellent example of the style. Pours very cloudy pale. Tastes of citrus, coriander and yeast.

[Bottle]  Poured a cloudy and very pale yellow with a large frothy white head.  The head lasted throughout with some loose lacing.  Typical Belgian yeast aroma with some spice.   Taste had a strong yeast note with a lot of corriander and some faint citrus.  Finish was very spicey and long lasting which took away from my overall enjoyment.

Pours a hazy white with yellow highlights and a large white head with good retention. Aroma is unmistakeably wheat. There is some Belgian bready yeast coming through on the nose along with coriander, citrus and a little sourness. Typical and a little weak nose. Soft on the palate. Distinct orange peel and coriander with Belgian yeast flavors. Nice mouth feel, although a little watery. Decent beer, available everywhere.

Pours a cloudy/hazy yellow. Easily distinguished notes of citrus and a little belgian funk, as well as spices. The orange flavor is also probably a byproduct of bartenders insistent nature of "fruiting" it with an orange.  A decent mass produced easily available beer.
nice beer. kinda piney in aroma, and appearance is somewhat cloudy, but normal for this style. great flavor and overall nice palate. try this one for sure.
Bottle 330ml. Hazy yeallow colour, creamy white head. Lemony aroma, lemony and wheaty taste. Smootish mouthfeeling, low carbonation. Slightly sour finish.

Mainstream yes - but also very good. Fresh, fruity (more than most Belgian witbeers) and perfect on a warm summerday. If your tired of the heavier or sour stuff Belgium has to offer, there’s no reason for not turning to one of these.

12 oz bottle, Ottawa, Canada. First witbeir I ever had, and it was a very enjoyable experience. Drank straight from the bottle, so I can’t really note anything of value, but you have 215 pages worth of reviews to go from. Would (and have) drink again.

on tap at the orchard parade hotel in singapore.

pours a cloudy pale yellow/white with a large white head, and good lacing.

smell is of wheat, and citrus.

taste is as it smells, wheat, and lemon.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light straw yellow with nice white white. Aroma of some light citrus, very faint banana, light wheat. Flavor is a light citrus, light wheat, very faint banana. Mouth feel is soft and light, high carbonation. Overall, a great summer beer next to the pool.....

Bottle.  Pours a hazy lemonade yellow with a medium sized clean white foam head which deflates quickly.  Lemon zest, spice, and a touch of sour on the nose. Thin bodied, light and yeasty.  Crisp wheat notes and a nice citrus touch.  Nothing amazing, but always reliable.
a favorite among non beer drinkers... this one is ok.  doesn’t taste much like beer though
Kind of like a soda, I don’t think I would be able to tell this apart from wittekerke. It’s kind of green, too, which is a little weird.
bottle, yellow colour, nice head, light beer, lemon, citrus, water, grainy .. enjoyable and refreshing.
Bottle and Draught. Reasonably tasty thirst quenching beer, some fruit and wheat notes. Great look on draught foamy head with the palest lemon yellow colour.
light yellow with white head.flavour of orange,citrus and coriander.at the end wheat notes.enjoyable and refreshing beer

Hazy lemon lemon yellow pour. There is a beautiful white head on this beer. Some citrus taste as well as aroma but there is a mellow buttery biscuit taste at the finish that was unpleasant on my first bottle.  Now, several nights later, the biscuit butteriness is not as pronounced or I am beginning to like it.

Light and crisp, expect more yeast presence and flavor though.  Well, its about what you would expect, a Belgian made by the people who own Budweiser.  Thin, the citrus comes out a little.  Nothing too special.
Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a nice white head. Smells of a sweet citrus aroma. A good tasing Belgian white beer. Pleasantly surprised.
On tap.  Pours pale, hazy, goledn in colour, with decent slightly off white head.  Slightly citrusy aroma, with slightly sweet flavour.  Nice drinking, especially in the summer.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a decent head (after following the directions on the bottle for pouring). Aroma of orange peel, wheat, and coriander. Flavor pretty much matches the aroma with a little more citrus than the aroma. Very crisp beer that is quite refreshing. A pretty good beer.

330 mL Bottle. Very pale cloudy yellow with a scant but tenacious foamy head that leaves ample lacing on the sides. The aroma is wheat, lemon rind, grapefruit rind, and coriander. Uniquely yummy; wheat and grapefruit rind dominate, there is a note of lemon, and an aftertaste of coriander with a whisper of cloves ending in a clean finish. Exceptionally refreshing. I could drink this any day, any time. H for Hoegaarden, H for Heavenly.
Bottle. Hazy yellow body, with a small white head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, coriander. Flavor is pretty much the same. A nice refreshing beer in the hot summer.

Pours hazy golden/white with a long-lasting medium head. Aroma with a lot of lemon and herbs. Sour-lemony taste, again with some herbs. My ultimate summer beer due to it being widely spread on draft during summer around the Netherlands.
Pours a cloudy, light golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of lemon, coriander, yeast, and some bubblegum.  Flavor is pretty much the same, a pretty standard witbier.

Pours a hazy pale yellow. Light bodied with aroma of lemons, orange, wheat, coriander, no surprises. Mouthwatering taste of lemon, orange, and coriander. This is a very nice summer beer. Goes down smooth and easy.
Bootle. Apperance; yello, hazy with a big white head. A very citrus aroma with a medium sour flavor.
Pours a light cloudy yellow color. Aroma is of wheat and some lemon. Would be good on a hot summer day.
Fresh beer with a complex flavour created with coriander and orange peel, which creates a great sweet & sour taste. Drink chilled on a hot summer day!
Cloudy yellow, big white head. Plesant spicy taste and mouthfeel. Yeasty wheat taste. A good classic witbier.

Cloudy pour, rich head. Tastes similar to a hefeweizen but could have been better. 3.0

RE-RATE 5/1/11 Bottle from Central Market.  This beer pours a slightly hazy/cloudy light yellow color with a fizzy white head. It looks very nice in my official Hoegaarden glass.



The aroma is lots of Belgian yeasty notes and bread with additional scents of orange peel and citrus. There is also a bit of spice which can be attributed to the coriander that was used while brewing. Smells nice.



The flavor holds similar elements to the smell. Orange peel and light grains fill the flavor, with a light touch of spice. The coriander is not overbearing and has a nice balance. I like this beer a lot.

Bottle bought at Copenhagen Central station.
Hazy light yellow with a big white head.
Citrusy and spicy flavour. Refreshing but not very interesting..

Had a few of these in the pantry that I was trying to get rid of.  Finally had an opportunity to ditch them at this month’s beer club meeting. I’m surprised I’ve never rated this one.  Poured it.. looks like lemonade...  Thin head, very light, metallic flavor, strong aroma and flavor of coriander.  Celis refused to let his name be associated with this bastardized version of his recipe, and I’m with him on this one.
Very lemony and yeasty aroma, cloudy pour with a good white head, crisp and refreshing, finishes only slightly dry, great for a summer afternoon.
Bottle. Look: Hazy yellow, big white head. Smell: Citrusy aroma. Taste: Fruity wheat taste. Small hop flavor in the aftertaste.

A cloudy light yellow pour with a nice fluffy white head.  

Really a nice taste and extemely drinkable.

12 oz. bottle
Bottle. Pours a cloudy light golden color. Taste is fantastic. Orange - spice flavor is abundant initially. Then transitions into a nice smooth finish. Delicious. One of my all time favorites.
Draught and bottle. Light almost white body, nice foamy head. Wheat and citrus. Nice and light for after workout refreshment.

2008 Bottle - Pours the oddest color I’ve ever seen in a beer...neon pale off white, 2 for originality but 0 for being utterly unappetizing, but kinda looks like what you would expect from a bladder infection, with a great white head...aroma is pretty weird too, wet dog one minute, spicy tart yeast the next...flavour is light and citrusy, bready...I was really looing forward to this for some reason...I like wit but this was totally unexpected...literally one of the strangest beers from start to finish I’ve ever had...what the fuck?

On draft.  Pours a cloudy pale yellow (almost white) with a thin small bead white head that stays throughout and rings the glass.  Faint aroma of bananas and citrus.  Very thin on flavor, but well balanced and refreshing.  Taste is of fresh bread dough, mild spices and some sweetness.  You could drink this all day.

Cloudy yellow body sets it apart right away from a lager or pilsner. Pleasant intricate mix of fruity, spicy, subtle wheat and very slight nutty/woody aromas - not overkilled nonetheless. Quite alluring. Optimum carbonation but not unqiuely sparkling on the tounge. Refreshing enough though. This brew has character. Light to medium body, the brew is alright on the palate. Despite the spectrums of nice aromas, its taste is not reflective of what you would expect by smell. Hopped on the bitter side and lacking in wheat flavours, the citruses culminate in a somewhat hard sour finish. Its saving grace is its sweet middle and crisppiness - making it an easy brew to enjoy despite its shortcomings. Good for hot days. Opt for draught/tap.

Bottle best by 02/02/10. Poured a hazy light yellow with a tall frothy white head that settles to a ring and left light lace. Aromas of clove, wheat, and a light banana background. The flavor is much the same with hints of lemon. Light body and a clove aftertaste. Nice!

I drink this beer about as much as any because its complex and thirst quenching. Each time I have one I get the impression of many novel characteristics. Certain times the creamy agricultural earthy grains come to the fore, the next its the coriander and rich spices which predominate, then its a crisp lemony finish; but always, everytime, there’s the beautiful warm phosphorescent yellow glow and a white inviting foamy head. A world class beer if there ever was one.
It’ probably that I just don’t like this style. Combines a significant citrus flavor with a wheat/white beer. A little sour, and I really don’t like it much.
On tap.  Pours pale yellow body with a good amount of creamy white head. Aroma: Wheaty, banana, lemon  Flavor: More lemony wheat in taste, with a grassy finish.
Light yellow and cloudy.  Strong white head.  Flavor is a sweet and little sour;citursand wheat, refreshing and very good.
Yellow. Long, creamy head. Aroma: Wheat, Orange peel. Flavor: Wheat, yeast, coriander, orange peel. Clean finish.
Poured a cloudy yellow. Kinda sour taste with a nice finish... I would have to describe it as a watered down hef.
Tap.  Poured cloudy yellow.  Yeasty aroma, faintly fruity.  Nice refreshing, mild body.  Earthy citrus palate.  wheat flavor...overall a very clean, refreshing brew.   Defintely a summer standard.
TAP: pours a pale yellow, with a sour/citrus aroma. Citrus, coriander, grass on taste. Very solid beer.
It pours with a bright yellow color.  The aroma is slightly sour.  It has a strong citrus flavor with crisp and clean finish.

12 oz bottle.  Poured a hazy yellow color with a two finger, foamy white head.  The aroma was fruity, with slight spice present.  The flavor was also fruit, with cloves present.  This is a top notch, widely available beer.

Hoegaarden is more than just the place where a pimp grows his workforce. Along with Guinness Draught, this is one of the best widely available beers out there. Nice whitish-yellow color with a white head.  Light fruits on the aroma.  Smooth and refreshing white beer with banana and clove flavors.  Smooth palate, very refreshing.
Cloudy pale yellow pour, foamy white head.  Smell is clean, grassy and a little fruit.  Taste is decent fruity citrus, wheat and grass, crisp and clean but still quite sweet.  Pleasant enough.

Pours with a lot of head, Lightly coloured but very thick. Many ’floaties’, you can’t even see your hand through the glass! Smells of cloves and banana esters, very very soft on nose. A bit floral too. Nice clean wheat taste, very smooth and creamy in the mouth, lingers for QUITE a while before the flavour totally disapears. The flavour is a bit short next the the complexity of the palate. Could use a bit more darkening up in the flavour department. A smooth classy beer no one else will drink at the party.

Nice white head with lots of tiny bubbles. Citrusy aroma and fruity taste. After swirling the bottle, the beer took on a cloudy appearance. Very tasty beer and not too pricey. Can’t wait to have this beer on a hot summer day after mowing the lawn.
FRom 330ml bottle.Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma of cloves ans citrus. Nice blend of cloves spice and citrus fruit. a respectable weiss.

(bottle from co-op) Cloudy light yellow colour, smelt flowery with hints of soap, herbs and citrus. Tastes really light with more floralness and orange/coriander. Medium bitterness with a little sweetness. Was very refreshing and quite different to other stuff I’ve had, but not something I’d either drink a lot of or often.
Staw yellow and cloudy with a decent sized white head. Aroma is of bananas and citrus with notes of yeast and spice. Taste is of light hops and spice wite some citrus.

Cloudy, very pale yellow, quite fizzy. 
Spicy aromas. Estery - banana and citrus with vinous and floral notes and hints of clove. Some candy (aspartame?) sweetness in the nose.
Nice, crisp flavours. Wheat and malt with a zesty hops. Subtle sweetness of ripe banana. Herb notes with a touch of clove, cinnamon and vanilla. 
Very clean on the palate and quite refreshing. 
Quite awesome.
I had this beer on tap in Melbourne. Very nice poor, with pretty big white head. Flavors of citrus. One of my favorite whites.
Strong coriander and citrus flavors. Hazy, light golden-yellow color. Pours with a nice thick, white head. One of my favorites.

I kept seeing a billboard for this beer everyday on my way home from work so I decided to seek it out.  Nice hazy pour.  Citrus aroma with a white head.  Slightly sour, slightly sweet taste.  Very good brew.  Probably one of my favorite Belgian Whites.

Bottle.  Can’t believe I haven’t rated this yet, given it was one of the first “quality” beers I tried. From old notes:  “great flavor, grainy texture, notes of fruit and spices, notable coriander and clove.”  I would add that this brew finishes smooth, and is a GREAT beer to introduce to newbies that profess a disliking for the “bitterness” of beer.
Citrus and coriander flavours come through very stong. Nice creamy beer witha reasonable body.
Easily my favorite beer. I will have to come back and edit the score more accurately, as I’m really just anxious to get a review up right now.
One of my favorites!!  I need another rack, MrReaves.  Get thee to the beer store.  :)

A decent beer, but I would say, only on tap--too bland from the bottle. Very pale yellow like lemonade, citrus flavors and yeast. Bit of spice. Good if you prefer your beers very light-tasting; maybe one could graduate to Hoegaarden from one of the commercial brands of American beer that start with B or M. I find Hoegaarden overall much too weak for my tastes, but still decent enough. It’s just, there are much nicer Belgian blonds.
citrus, hazy, cloudy, frothy, white foam, lightly sour, medium bitterness, medium body, fizzy, fresh citrus flavour.

330mL Bottle: Cloudy yellow with a large, fluffy white head that leaves a nice curtain of lacing around the glass. Mostly citrus aroma with some spiciness. Citrus, spice (coriander) and a wheat bite show up in the flavor. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. A good Wit that can be found easily, almost anywhere, any time of the year.
a very good one. Beautiful colour, good head, fruity and tasty. Great on a sunny day and fresh night.
Inga kommentarer för tillfället. Inga kommentarer för tillfället. Inga kommentarer för tillfället.

Draft and bottle  Pours a hazy yellow with a quickly leaving thin white head.  Aroma of citrus, coriander, and wheat.  Little touches of spiciness.  A crisp very refreshing taste and great mouthfeel.  Good carbination.  A nice beer that is on tap at golf course for after a round.
Bottle: A great Belgian white. Citrus and spice aroma and taste. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. A great beer.

Pours a hazy straw into the glass, with a fizzy white soda head that dissipates quickly.  Some wheat and sour grains to the nose.  The flavors have some lemony citrus, sour grains, citrus rind, light coriander notes, hay and blanched wheat.  Lively carbonation accompanies a refreshing citrus-sour finish, making for a light-bodied quaff.  Nice Belgian White here, and a great offering to partake during warm weather... perfect for summer.

there is a definite citrus aroma to it with a mild touch of spicyness.  it pours a cloudy honey color with a fabulous foamy and thick white head.  the flavor is slightly less citrusy than the aroma and the coriander and orange peel are evident and tasty.  the mouthfeel is thick and creamy (the main reason why i prefer belgian beers) and the finish lingers on with a subtle citrus hoppiness.
Without question my favorite white beer. More balanced and smooth than a lot of other overwhelmingly citrus flavored whites and wheats. Perfectly refreshing.
A nice belgian ale that really sets the standard for Belgian whites. It is excellent on tap where available and usually can be found at Bevmo.
Another great beer to enjoy in the desert while camping. I love the refreshing taste and the easy drinkability. Very quenching.

Definitely one of my favorite beers of all time (and THE favorite for the white beer category). Unfortunately IMHO it does not taste as good out of the bottle and it’s a little hard to find on spicket.
Aroma de fermento e pão, mas com o paladar pouco expressivo, ligeiramente frutado. Espuma clara e pouco duradoura. Boa carbonatação.

12oz bottle and on tap.  Poured a really hazy dull yellow. Thin white head that fizzles down quickly. Little lace.  Smell is very fruit. Main smell is bananas. Taste is similiar, but there is more of a hoppy taste involved.  Starts out bitter and then eventually ends smooth after a while.  Overall, it is a decent brew for something so popular, even with the slice of orange.
Nice summer wit with very little to no aroma.  Didnt really notice any of the spices but overall very clean beer that quenches your thirst great with brats and burgers.

This is a great witbier beer. The pour appearence is a foggy light gold with a marshmellow like head. There isnt all that much of an aroma aside from the scent of yeast. The palate is so smooth and the taste has hints of citrus and spice.

Pours a hazy pale straw colour with a thin creamy white head.  Nose is faintly spicy and a little bit yeasty.  Taste is pretty sweet and light.  Some citrus, and some wheat.
