A little bit spicy in the finish, but just a little bit, probably due to the wheat.  Feels very light in the mouth, but yet still a little bit creamy.  It would be an easy beer to drink a lot of.
pours a very pale yellow almost white, aroma of citrus, wheat, perhaps nutmeg.  Taste is a bit of yeast and very light
Supposed girls drink that i wasnt at all impressed with, id rather have a pot kettle black!
Bright hazy yellow, aroma of citrus and bananas.  Flavor of bubblegum with slight bitter finish.  Refreshing summer beer.

Extremely pale with little head unless you add the yeast, which the bottle curiously advises you do. The aroma is straightforward, very estery with just a hint of corriander. Has a sweet and sour taste of lemon zest. Not a great beer but a Wit if ever there was one.

Pours a hazy yellow colour, frothy white head with good retention. Fantastic spicy aroma of orange peel, coriander, citrus, yeast and wheat. Spicy flavour balanced with the sweet citrus notes, creamy with a light bitterness in the finish. The summer beer...Cheers!

Pours a cloudy pale hay color, with about a head of stark white, rapidly dissipating head.  Aroma of bananas and orange rind.  Soft flavor with orange and wheat prominent.  Ends with a sweet tang.  Very drinkable, decent witbier.

330ml bottle into eponymous branded tumbler glass. Pours a murky straw yellow liquid with a generous short lasting white head. Aromas of spicy yeasts, wheat, fresh coriander and oranges. Smooth thickish palate with spicy flavours of oranges and wheat. Tingly sweetish citrus finish that lingers in the mouth. Refreshing and drinkable.
Classic Belgian flavors of clove and citrus, nice balance of these two flavors.  Nice golden color with a tall head.  Not much complexity to the aroma or flavor but a solid mid-level wheat beer.

I am not so much all about an InBev product, and I am sure that this is not exactly what Celis brewed. But in keeping an open mind this is pleasant. This has a very hazy color and a white fluffy head. The aroma is spicy and smells of the orange peel and yeast. The flavor is nice, a little sweet but certainly contains some good orange peel bitterness and a nice yeasty and citrusy flavor. The palate is very nice and soft.

Translucent pale straw pour, thick 2 finger head fades quickly. Very cloudy, lots of pieces of yeast floating around. Quite appealing.
Smells yeasty, doughy as well as a strong wheat aroma. A somewhat herbal smell. Hint of citric oils.
Doughy taste, again with a hit of tangy orange, which makes for an interesting experience. For some reason boiled vegetables came to mind while drink this beer, which was a little off-putting.
Flows round the mouth smoothly with notifiable carbonation. After a few sips this gets bit watery, but coming back to it after a minute or so the citrus and coriander refreshes the taste buds.
Could drink many of these fast on a hot day.

Enjoyed at The Stable.  Finally got to taste this classic.  Very nice.  It appears semi filtered with a nice white soapy head.  The aroma is lemon and clove.  Flavor is pretty much the same with a bit of spice.  A nice beer and an excellent representation of its style.

Hazy yellow appearance with a small but delicious head. Aroma of coriander, clove, phenolic banana, citruses. Citrus is in the flavor too with fine spicy tastes of coriander and clove. Nice wheat beer notes, fine lively carbonation. Not a big body but refresh, some bittery finish because orange peels.

Bottle.   Aroma of banana and yeast.   Cloudy pale yellow body, white head.   Not overly sweet in flavor, refreshing, mainly citrus, banana, and some spiciness.   Very pleasant and enjoyable, but not head and shoulders above other quality wits.

pale yellow, slightly cloudy
somewhat highly carbonated
starts with a moderate amount of hoppyness, the mouthful is medium and the finish comes out citrusy and spiced, from the coriander no doubt.  Not really the kind of beer I like to enjoy on its own, but would prob go very well with certain foods.
From tap, pale yellow with an amazing whit head, aroma of yeasy-banana, citrus and spices,flavor is citrusy crisp with clove notes, very drinkable.
Pours a creamy gold with soft creamy head.  Smells of soft citrus friut and spices.  Tastes citrucy and spicy, lots of wheat, sweet and smooth.  Vrey good.

Once you get past the way this beer looks, it’s actually pretty good.

Poured a huge white head. The beer looks like cloudy, watered-down lemonade. The coriander is obvious in the nose. 

Mouthfeel was very refreshing, reminded me of a summer shandy because of the looks and how crisp it felt.

The beer goes down really smoothly and has good lacing as you approach the bottom of the glass. 

The finish is pretty complex. It tries to be sweet, but the wheat is balanced nicely by the various spices. Only in the finish did I notice the orange peel.

Bottle.  Pours hazy, lemonade yellow with thick, pillowy white head that dissipates rather quickly.  Nose of lemon, coriander and wheat, slightly perfumy.  Lemon and coriander taste with a solid malt background.  Refreshing and smooth.  Good wit-tasticness.

Bottle. Pours a witbier :)
Nose is lemon, coriander, perfumed spices. 
Well balanced, very tasteful on the swallow. Light acidity. Good with lots of dishes.
Draught 0.5L glass at Belge. Hazy pale yellow colour. No head. Some lemon and coriander in the taste. Mild hoppiness.

An excellent and reliable Witbier! Crisp, juicy pour rich, creamy head typical cloudy golden color. Intense flavors of wheat mixed with citrus and pear makes for a very satisfying drink. Not too carbonated. Refreshing, great as a summer beer.

Bottle.  Truely honored to be rater #2042, i really feel like i have so much to add.  haha, um im pretty sure it has over 300 calories thats usually how i convince girls to try whatever im drinking instead.  No seriously its the flagship belgian wit and its decent and full bodied wheat beer with citrus flavors.

Draught. Goes down easily and can be very refreshing on a hot summer night. I like the flavour of citrus in my beer, but this one tastes too much like lemonade. Almost like a Corona after you drop a slice of lemon in it.

Aroma of orange,corriander,cloves and yeast.Appearance is cloudy white/ash with good head retention and high carbonation.
Flavour is orange,corriander,clove. Almost no hops and little malt profile,however the yeast fermentation profile makes this beer. Finishes dry with a mild acidity.
Very good example of style.

Bottled. Pours hazy pale yellow almost like lemonade. Effervescent white head that quickly subsides. It does smell like orange peel and coriander, also a little lemon and clove, but the spice and yeast is weak. Palate is highly carbonated but thin. I hope this wasn’t representative of this beer.

Bottle from the LCBO
This is the Beer that got me started on trying different beers i thought i would have hated this beer and it is now one of my favourites

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold color with a white head. Smells of orange and wheat. Complex taste consisting of several spices. You can get orange peel, wheat and coriander right away. Best enjoyed with salads. Very good belgian white.
Pours a very pale hazy gold. Grassy nose. Citrus note from orange peel is detectable, but subtle. Same with the coriander. I’m ambivalent about this one....

Pours palest of pale (hazy) yellows with a small head. Aroma of wheat, pilsener, and spicing, though the spicing doesn’t scream coriander/orange peel like it should. Taste is distinctly of sweet tarts when it is cooler. As it warms up it tastes more pils/wheaty. No real spicing comes through at all. A little Belgian yeastiness. Pretty easy drinking, but definitely not the best wit bier.

This Belgium wheat beer pours a hazy straw color with a creamy white head with long lasting lacing. Nose is citrus and spice. Very creamy and pleasing mouthfeel. Taste is wheat, orange and coriander. Very refreshing beer, best served in summer with light snacks or mild or light foods such as fish or salad.
Very good wheat beer. Smells of citrus and spices. Nice white head, nice Witbier color. The taste is clean with a citrus aftertaste. The sweet and sour taste of the spices and citrus balance nicely.
One of the few wheat beers that I’ve actually enjoyed at all. Big orangey smell with a hint of some spice to it as well. Nice calming feel as it slides down the throat. Enjoyable and affordable.

pour it let it sit then sip. that first pour is quite bossy but it lays low for the rest of the drink and pour. 

im a novice at this so please forgive my ignorance. 

i loved the lasting citrus aromas. it is a beautiful color that is consistant throughout the pour and drink. 

if you know of a better beer please PM me with names. like i said, im new, so i want to learn. 




peace
antonio aka BONG LEACH 

http:/www.myspace.com/bong_leach
http://www.thepier.org
To start this is one of the most impressive beers served. Beautiful chunky glass and very nice colour. Unfortunally here stop all the advantages of this beer that has nothing more to give.

Kinda stings the nostrils, with some limited citrusness.  Color looks aight, and the flavor is crisp, just unremarkable.  Lemony finish makes this one aight, but no comparison to St. Bernardus Blanche.

Bottle 30cl.
Pours a white/yellow murky colour, almost no carbonation and a good size head.
Very sweet and fruity aroma.
Well balanced, but not too complex taste, again very sweet and fruity.
pale yellow colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of yeast, fruits and spices. The taste of fruits like orange with citrus some coriander, malts

No matter how many times I have had it I still enjoy this beer. Nice citrus and ginger notes  with a body that seems to be both light and creamy at the same time. Excellent stuff and becoming much easier to get.

Even though Hoegaarden was my very first Belgian wit, or white wheat, beer, I had no idea was I was drinking. The only thing I knew was that I really enjoyed it. It is still my favorite Belgian wit beer, though there have been others since then which have come pretty close. now, years later, I am once again enjoying a fresh Hoegaarden on draft and it is just as good as I remember it, and maybe even a bit better as my palate can now appreciate the finer details of what so bedazzled me the first quaff around.


Again, on draft at a favorite local hangout and beer bar with good food. A beautiful cloudy white with tinges of yellow peeking through a huge, luxuriously soft and tightly packed head a good 1 inch thick rested comfortably on top while peeking over the edge of my glass at me. Obviously in hurry at all, she took her time fading into a splotchy layer of white puffs floating on top of the brew below while leaving trails of brussels lace behind. Pepper, coriander, clove, and spice in the nose hints of a delectable experience. A quaff, then a second, and I are in Hoegaarden bliss. Their recipe a closely guarded secret, I can see why since no one has yet mastered the spicy wit beer as they have. A light and soft body while at the same time being full of chewy wheat. Her body leaves a soft coating on my tongue and mouth as the pepper, coriander, and spices linger. Creamy bananas add even more softness and a lingering creamy presence to the spiced brew. While it all sounds like a mish-mash conglomeration of flavors, mouthfeel, and palate, Hoegaarden comes together in a perfect harmony of spices which are carried on a gentle body of wheat and smoothed over with a light creamy banana presence. A culminate excellence.


Hoegaarden is as good as and even better them I remember her years ago. Some may argue that her recipe over the years has been tweaked and toned down since its purchase by InBev, a macro giant. While that may be true, or it may be false, having never partaken of an older recipe I can only enjoy the Hoegaarden I have now, and a lovely treat she is.

Sampled on tap at Epcot during their food, wine, and beer festival.  This is pretty good and certainly got the job done on a hot day, like it was.  Hazy yellow color with a thick creamy white head.  The taste is mostly dominated by bananas and lemons with maybe a light spice in there as well.  Light-bodied, refreshing, this is defnitely an easy going beer.

pours cloudy straw-yellow with a thick white head. nose heavy with banana, clove, orangepeel, cardamom and (maybe?) mint. taste is heavy yellow fruit: orange, citrus, lemon, banana, pineapple. Spicy. Finish is clean with subtle spice and wheat.
A hazy pale yellow colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of yeast,  fruits and spices. The taste of fruits like orange with citrus some coriander, malts. The aftertaste is dry and sweet.

Bottle... This was the beer that really got me interested in belgian beers a few years back...  If you’ve never had a nice belgian white you will def be able to taste the hint of orange and a nice sour bite... now that I have tried so many whites this one seems a bit plain, but always will have a special place in my heart...

Poured a frothy off white head that diminished slowly. Beautiful yellow-hinting-at-brown body with tiny particles suspended within the cloudy depths. It just asks to be consumed!Smells of citrus, lemon, and a hint of vinalla. Amazing flavour that starts sweet at the tip of the tounge, offering some orange peel tang as you finish. Palate is heavy for a white, but creamy with a lively zest. A pleasure to drink! Mainstream done right.

On tap while dining out. Served in a pint glass. Pours a pale, cloudy yellow with a thin white head and a bit of lacing. Aroma is grains and lemon grass. Taste is same as nose and slightly spicy. Thin palete. Nice refreshing brew.
Cerveja muito saborosa. Boa formação de espuma, aromas cítricos. Sabor leve e prolongado.
Slightly cloudy lemon yellow with a thick pillowy white head. Aroma of citrus and a little bread. Flavor is smooth, light, and refreshing. Perfect for summer.
Good white beer light and tasty! this is a great beer!! FabioSound
Great summer beer. One of my favourites.....................................

Pours a pale yellow with a decent head.  Smell is lemon, coriander, and orange peel. The taste is a little sour for a belgian white, but all around really enjoyable. The mouthfeel is clean and soft. All around a great beer!
Very easy to drink. A little too thin and watery, but a pretty good beer. Has a nice hint of orange.

As mentioned below, very sweet aroma, but it doesn’t smell "cheaply" sweet. Cloudy light golden appearance, not quite transparent, frothy head. Sweet, but not sugary flavor, nice and refreshing. Definite citrus impact. Soft and creamy on the palate. Nice summer\ fall brew.
Esta cerveja é sensacional!!!! Pode tomar sem erro!
Not my style o’ beer and sweet fruity aroma almost scared me away.  I sucked it in and pressed on to find that this beer is quite enjoyable but too sweet for my tastes.

This a re-rate as I got a bit over excited about it a few years ago when I first started rating, Still one of my favourite session beers. Pours a hzy blonde colour, light and refreshing with some vanilla notes. Perfect on a summers day

Used the "swirl" pour method as described on the bottle. Pours cloudy, opaque yellow w/ a fizzy, white head. Aroma is of orange and malt. Thin mouthfeel; on the watery side. Hints of cinnamon, spice, orange peel, licorice. Easy to drink, though subtle and a bit too thin.
Hazy yellow with thin white head. Very easy to drink and quite refreshing but really very boring in a sense. Much better wits out there but still fairly solid

Bottled. Pours hazy yellow with large cloudy head. Aroma is wheaty, yeasty and has quite sharp spicy coriander and citrus fruit peel. Flavor is a combination of sweet wheat and sourness of yeast. Palate is light bodied and soft, and very easy to drink. Still carbonated enough to be refreshing. Not surprising but certainly tasty and refreshing.
It’s obvious why this beer is so popular. It’s shockingly refreshing and easy to drink. A sweet taste without being too over the top. Can’t go wrong with this one.
Bottle, 330 ml. Poor light yellow with white head. Sweet and refresh. A good beer, but not the best one.

This is the first beer that made me believe in the importance of the glass you drink it out of. The special hexagonal Hoegaarden glass really enhances the experience.

As for the beer, it’s one of my favorites. I tend to prefer darker beers, but this light yellow beer with a touch of spice is really refreshing and enjoyable.

This is a great session beer.  There’s not much more to say for this beer that hasn’t already been said.  I do like the absence of a sour flavor.  I sort of expect sourness when I drink weizens and Belgian whites, but not so in this beer, which makes it easy to drink.

Finally rating this.  Poured a nice soft yellow color.  Nice white head.  Aroma was yeast and soft spice.  Taste was much the same, with a nice balance and crispness.  This beer is very nice for how available it is.

Pours yellowish with a somewhat large head. Aroma is spicy and citrusy with some sweetness evident as well. Flavor is well balanced and full- lots of spice, hops and malt all in great proportions. Body is a bit thin, but given the style it is actually quite nice. Nice one.
Touted to me to be the best of the Belgian Wits, although it is very good, it is not the best. Very nice and smooth.
The color is what suprized me the most, it’s quite yellow, almost to the color of lemonade.  The taste is well balanced, and not too much added citris flavor.  Great beer.  Cheers!
The beer is yellow with a huge head. The aroma is of yeast and banana perhaps also bubblegum. The flavor is of yeast, banana and floral.

Definitely one of the leaders in making a great Belgium white beer. The flavours are great and although I have found a couple of others that rate up there with this one it will definitely reign as the original white beer. Great wheat smell and taste with hints of spice. Not quite as much fruitiness as most of the micros tend to add.
tap, bright yellow with nice white head, aroma of citrus wheat combo that is mouthwatering, wonderful citrus/spice flavor, great lasting wheat notes on palate, excellent beer.

This is the beer by which all other witbiers are judged... It’s a favorite post soccer game or mid afternoon horseshoe beer of ours... As far as witbiers go, it’s a bit thin relative to the quality of the micro wits in its price range... But the thinness goes a long way on those hot summer days...

Very nice Belgian White. The color was very yellow and took me by surprise. Small white head that slowly dissipated with occasional lacing. Nice subtle clean yeasty aroma with a bit of orange and hops. Excellent taste, primarily wheat and orange, with a bit of coriander and other spice. Coriander started to come out more on the palate near the end.

Very pale almost lemonade like pour with lots of bubbles and a nice white head.  Wheaty spice with coriander and banana.  Dry citrus flavor with spice and a bit of malt.  Good easy to drink Sunday afternoon beer.
33cl bottle, very pale and hazy yellow colour, nice white head, wheat, yeast and citrus aroma, spices notes, sweet flavor, light body, amazing finish with orange and florals notes

Bottle - Poured a very pale yellow amber in color with a small bright white head that quickly faded to a thin rim around the glass.  Some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is thick with orange and coriander as well as the classic Belgian yeasts. Flavor is also quite heavy with orange, coriander and Belgian yeast.  Slightly sour.  Slightly over carbonated.  Amazingly light colored.  An excellent Wit...

This is without doubt a classic.  The beer that helped revive the Belgian Wheat Beer genre.  The orange peel and corriander that have become almost universal among Belgian-style Heffs are still quite noticeable and remarkable and it looks, feels and smells just like a White should.  If the day is hot and your in the mood to relax its still hard to choose anything better.
Hazy & bright pale yellow pour with firm white head. Spicy aroma with notes of citrus, perfume and wheat. Spicy flavor with grainy notes. Wheat, mineral and almond notes. Some bitterness in the end.

From bottle.  August Dayton Beer Tasting event - Favorite Summer Brews.  Pours pale yellow with a decent head. Aroma is subdued with citrus and hops. Lots going on in the taste:  citrus, spice, yeast.  Very refreshing.
Not remarkable, the taste isn’’t bad, but it’s not that good either. A typical citrusy witbier that is overrated imho. A bit thin, with a slightly strange chemical taste.
Nice crisp, clean, easy drinking Belgian White.  Serve w/ slice of lemon or orange and enjoy.
I have yet to find a better belgian white.  Just a bright, clean, refreshing, drinkable beer.
I must not have the palate for these beers. I really do not taste whatever they have.
bottle. Lovely egg yolk yellow, hints of cloves and orange on the nose & palette.  I find the quality of this beer outstanding

I’d suggest its the top wheat beer around. A great textured and wheat flavoured beer this one, the white cream on top is nice, followed by some fruits and wheat and yeast. I’m overall though not a big wheat beer fan, thus the lowish rating.

Bottle. Pours light with a good bubbly head. Aroma has citrus and hops.More carbonation than I usually like on the light palate, but the flavor is fun and interesting. Hints of spice, citrus, grain, and strong notes of wheat and yeast. Everything is nice and subtle but there’s a lot there. Finishes quickly. It’s refreshing and relaxing. Perfect for a party.

Average frothy white head. Good lacing. Mostly diminishing. Cloudy light-yellow body. Aroma: moderate malty, citrus lime, banana, coriander, vanilla. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: light sweet acidic bitter; average duration. Palate: medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation, light astringent. Moderate zesty, citrusy-orangey fruitiness. A low spicy-herbal hop aroma is optional. Pleasant malty-sweet grain flavor (often with a honey and/or vanilla character) and a zesty, orange-citrusy fruitiness. Refreshingly crisp with a dry, often tart, finish. Herbal-spicy flavors, which may include coriander and other spices, are common should be subtle and balanced, amargor lembra casca de limão, condimentada, lembrando coentro, refrescante, excelente drinkability, 5.99 canção.90 s

sep.4.2008.pouca espuma e nada diferente em termos de colarinho, apresenta corpo turvo e coloração amarela médio, com partículas grandes e grossas em seu corpo. No tocante ao aroma, apresenta fortíssima presença de lúpulo, fungos, leite azedo e ainda aromas mais ‘diferentes’, como bratwurst e ricota. Apresenta ainda, no corpo e paladar, traços de água com gás e uma certa adstringência de água tônica. Seu sabor é azedo, tanto no início quanto no final do gole, com exceção do azedume acético derradeiro. Seu corpo é leve e aguado; no final, torna-se adstringente.
Bottle. Pale yellow, good head. Citrus and spice, slightly tangy. Dry finish. Refreshing and tasty.

Picked up my 2nd 6 pack at the specialty grocery store here in Austin, Tx.  If poured correctly, it should have a moderate size frothy head.  A quick sniff yields of mildly sweet citrus flavor protrudes through the smooth yet  hoppy aroma.   This unfiltered Belgian white is best poured into a glass.  Take your time and enjoy the complexity.

(bottle) hazy pale yellow colour, frothy white head. aroma is light yeast and wheat with a delicate, citric hop-spiciness. flavour has dominant citric notes, as well as hints of banana, wheat, yeast and hop spices, very subtle. strong carbonation, light body.

(Glass) Unfiltered Belgian white (Witbier), cloudy yellow colour with a nice white head. a hoppy citrus-like aroma with a slightly spiced taste, little dry finish. This is one of my favourite whites on hot summer days, because it’s very refreshing

A great summer choice.  I’m partial to this beer because it’s the one that started it all for me in the world of better beers.  My impression now is not as lofty but it still holds up to other whites very well.  Old pastry, wet straw and light yeastiness come through in the smell.  Pours hazy clear yellow with the lightest of white frothy heads.  Taste is very crisp, clean and slightly spiced with the carbonation adding a dryer finish that compliments the overall character very well.  There will always be a soft spot in my heart for this beer.
Bottled. This hazy pale yellow beer has a sour wheat aroma. The flavour has a juicy fruitiness and perfumed quality with maybe a hint of pine.
A good macro wit beer, nothing extraordinary, but well made and very quaffable,  a small quickly dieing head, flavors of mild dusty yeast effers, some citrus and herbs, and malts... easy to drink.

Bottle.  Poured cloudy yellow with foamy white head.  Faint aroma of citrus, herb and bread.  Light flavour, orange, cilantro, lemon and spice.  Light finish, spice and hop.  What  I would expect of a wit.
Clear yellow with a thick white head. It had a very strong clove taste with other spices in the background. Very tasty beer.

Erupting head forms when poured and the body settled as a ultra-light pale yellow color with a cloudy appearance. Has a bouquet of aromas of yeast, wheat, spice and fruity presence as well. It has a somewhat thick mouth feel that has a citrus tart quality, pleasant drinkability and a great proportion of wheat throughout. Finishes with a subtle
An ugly yellow color with white-as-snow head can’t distract from the excellent fruit notes and fine taste of light vanilla.  Finishes very well, completely refreshing.
Very good beer.  Pours a light yellow with a white head.  Aroma is mellow with a hint of citrus.  Taste is spicy, yeasty, and a hint of passion fruit.  Interesting and good beer.
Color is hazy yellow with creamy white head. Subtle aroma is yeasty, spicy, citric with vanilla. Flavor is dry, spicy, citric and acidic. Acidic and light-bodied, foamy carbonated palate.
0,33 l bottle. A truly excellent beer - light yellow, nice white head. A delicious complex taste made of lemon, orange and floral aromas. Spicy flavor and a dry, bitter aftertaste.
23.08.2008, 0,33l Bottle. The colour is hazy pale yellow, almost white. Very nice citrus aroma.The bitternes and the sweet is very well balanced.
12 oz poors to light yellow body with a nice head.  Smells of oranges or other citrus.  Taste is definitely better than expected.
Pours a cloudy lemony white.  Has a nice fragrant floral aroma.  Very clean citrusy taste, not too much bitterness on the hops side.  Overall, it seems to make a nice smooth easy drinking beer.

Wow. This was extremely surprising to me. As I poured from the bottle, I could smell the citrusy aroma. Nice. Cloudy with a light, thin head. The flavor is perfect and not overpowering at all like I expected. I’m hooked.
This is my go to Wit.  Although Pierre Celis is upset with the direction that InBev took this recipe, it’s a solid wit and an fine example of the style.

Brownish-whitish colors mix with some yeasty floaties and a puffy white head.  Yeast and lemon zest nose, citrusy.  Taste is tart and potent wit taste, spices, coriander help the carbonation bite the tongue with a dryness.  While I still think Blue Moon is severely underrated in this category, this is definitely one of the top contenders.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy light golden yellow with a large, pillowy, white head that fades kind of fast.  Taste is of citrus, wheat and yeast.  Kind of sweet tasting.  Aroma is much the same, but not as profound.  Not a bad beer to have on a hot day, as it is easy to drink and pretty refreshing.  I wish it had a higher alcohol content though.
A very yellow and citrus/sweet beer.  Just not my type of beer.  I’ve heard good things about it, and I’m sure it’s good for it’s style of beer, but not my type.  Nice looking bottle though.
Bottle, nice crispy yellow. Flavor has citrus and wheat, in a small compact package. Nice bitter finish, flavor isnt really my cup of tea.

Bottle - from the Bruno’s grocery store on the corner of Hwy 150 and Shades Crest.
At first taste, I was like, "WHOAH, yum!"
Much better than Natural Ice, but then again, so is dog urine - just kidding - seriously, this is some wonderful stuff!
330ml bottle. Pours cloudy golden in color with white head. Aroma wheat, yeast and citrus. Taste yeasty, wheat and spicey with dry finish.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

Has a slightly fruity, bready aroma and a medium head that dissipated relatively quickly.  An opaque, pale yellow from the fact it is unfiltered.  Had a sweet, bready taste, with just enough of a hint of citrus flavoring.  Finishes very cleanly; it had very little hop bitterness, though I don’t expect this kind of beer to be very hoppy.  Extremely drinkable beer overall.

Pours a pale yellow color with a large white foamy head that is easily aggrevated. Nose is yeasty, clove, corriander, other spices, orange peel/citrus. Initial taste of clove and corriander, moving into wheat and spices. Finishing is crisp and refreshing but too light and flavor qualities fade quick. Palate duration is average. Better than some belgian whits that I have had but this is no prize itself. Above average head retention. Extremely light bodied.

Pours Like a 50/50 mix of milk and lemonade, with a thick head that takes a while to fade and leaves some lacing. Lots of wheaty citrus and cloves in the nose and some Juicy Fruit gum. Lots of citrus and wheat in the flavor with a nice fresh baked chewy, yeasty bread finish. Carbonation is strong but pleasantly refreshing and really helps thin out what may be a sticky mouthfeel otherwise. Nice and refreshing like a good Wit should be.
Refreshing and easy to drink. Very nice taste of citrus, wheat and grass. This beer has a nice natural feeling.
My rating is caused by a lack of delight in this style of beer. I only tried it because someone gave me some to try at my Homebrewers Society meeting. Didn’t like it.

Cloudy light golden color - almost white.  Yeasty and citrus with less of coriander and spice than I was expecting.  Superior to any wits brewed in the United States.  An excellent summer drink if you can afford it.
Nice pour white head cloudy white golden color nice blend of spice and wheat, I got this a supermarket chain in SoCal which surprised me. I would drink it again
Bottle, wonderful white golden color.  Unfiltered, so cloudy.  Smooth, wheat and yeast flavors, with some citrus thrown in to give it some tang.  The quintessential wheat beer.

Probably not the best one to comment on this since I don’t generally drink Wits, but this is nice.  Pours a nice hazy gold with a dense white head.  Clear yeasty aroma and a nice balanced flavor with a creamy, smooth body.  Refreshing.

Such a great standard for Wits.  It’s not too sour, not too sweet, and in my view doesn’t really take a direction as far as yeast/grain vs. spice vs. fruit.  A very solid common ground - one of the few great compromises in any style
Hoegaarden is pretty good, especially if you squeeze a little lemon into the glass. The base is a little different compared to what I am used to but I still think it is good.
Good beer, the truth I drink license, мade in Russia. It would be good to try the original.

Pours a cloudy straw-gold. The aroma is mainly wheat, yeast, and grass. The taste is a nice blend of wheat, yeast, banana, citrus, and grasses. I came into this not expecting much, but I was presently surprised. Not bad at all.

bottle 330ml 5 € at OpusK Lohja
served in own glass
Color:hazy dark yellow
Scent:bit phenols coriander
Taste: nice citrus phenols coriander fruity. Nice aftertaste as well This old and faith full in my beer memories since Oct 1996 first time in Finland with slice of lemon

Pours very cloudy, straw-coloured and milky, with a slick fading white head. Strong wheat twang, yeasty, coriander, spicy phenolics. Tart and prickly, full-bodied and round, slightly citrusy. Mild and smooth, but definitely not boring. Refreshing if a bit watery - best tap selection at a lot of bars.
I am one of the few that perfers this beer in a bottle.  On draft is tastes too light.  In a bottle you taste every spice that it has to offer.
The standard for belgian wit. It is one of the best summer beers. Tasty and refreshing.
Bottle. Pours a very light hazy color. Big foamy white head. Big grainy/yeasty aroma with a hint of lemon. Slightly sweet flavor. Mild flavor of a Hefe. A touch of spice and a slightly bitter finish.

A very tasty, drinkable brew even though it’s not my style at all. Aroma is funky, but the taste is crisp, fruity, and has some qualities of a belgian ale. It has a creamy aftertaste, which makes it a top player in it’s style. Some hoppy flavor would’ve improved this beer.

If you like fruit, than this is the beer for you.  It is mile, crisp, and reliable.  I’d rather drink this than a competitor like Blue Moon, but its still not my favorite by any means.  This was one of the beers that got me into Belgium, but its not like the competition.  Keep the orange slice.

This is a silky, subtle, understated refreshing little beer. It’s what people have been looking for when they drink those industrial beers-a thirst quenching, nourishing burst of relief.
Pours opalescent with a hint of yellow. Clean, citrusy, green apple aroma, light on the palate with a crisp, invigorating finish.
It’s a perfect sushi beer, great with all delicate foods.

delicious in all its cloudy glory.  I was amazed at how refreshing this beer really is.  I mowed the lawn in 100 degree heat then slammed one of these puppies down my gullet.  Nice flavor, smooth body, mellow notes of citrus.  Good summer drink.

Unfiltered/cloudy, pale yellow almost white. Creamy white head. Very fresh aroma from citrus and apple. A little bitter aftertaste. In spite of the appearance it was very easy drinking on a sunny summerday, and much better than I remembered it from earlier.

Great beer, slightly watery at times but with a good creamy white head on it this can be overlooked.  Not sure if I’m keen on slices of fruit being placed in the glass with it, I think it can speak for itself to be honest.  Great classic.

haha, just realized I had yet to rate this beauty.  In Belgium I drank this and loved it.  Here it is good, but just not the same.  Hazy light yellow with a nice white head.  I smell yeast, slight citrus and maybe vanilla?...flavor is tart and thirst quenching.  Finish is carbonated and a tad dry. I do love this beer and very good mixed with Guinness too!
Draught. Hazy, light yellow with white head. Floral and bananas, Quite thin but refreshing in the summertime.

Bottle in the United States.   Wonderful.  Herbal aroma with some vanilla notes.  Hazy pale yellow color with soft white head.  Lot of lacing on the glass.  Subtle wheat and yeast flavors with clove, coriander, a little vanilla, and finishes with an orange peel bitterness.  Really like this.

Draft. served with a slice of lemon :-( Light cloudy amber. Nice notes of fruit, citrus and some yeast.Mainlky sweet and developes little sourness in finish 8 maybe this was due to the lemon?). as well some dryness. Very refreshing beer!

Bottle: Pours a natural cloudy straw color with a frothy white head. Aroma and flavor is initially sweet with hints of orange peel and bananas. Medium body finishes with a refreshing mild sour taste. One of my favorite after work beers during the summertime. Very enjoyable!

Pretty blonde brew with a good-sized head.  The label is all right, and I like the octagonal glasses that it often comes served in.  There is a sweet, saturated aroma on this Dutch treat - perfumey hops, sweet malts, a touch of yeast, and a little vegetal scent too.   (Is this the world’s best-selling witbier?  Was it the first?)  There are tastes of clove, citrus, and wheat - but despite these dessert-like, festive characteristics, the brew is not sugary.  Hoegaarden reminds me of fairgrounds, and laughter, and European cafes.  Its weakness is that it is too light and watery.  They may have begun shipping a more watered-down version to the USA, but that is just a guess.  (I would love to try an imperial version someday!)   There are  better witbiers out there, but this is still deserving of its popularity.
Cloudy looking and very tasty, this beer  is surprisingly sweet.  Better than I expected.

Pours a hazy pale yellow peach flesh color with a thick frothy white head.  Decent lacing.  The aroma is all wheat, with some citrus and coriander.  Decently spicy.  The flavor is yeasty with a lot of lemon and coriander.  Very sweet, yet crisp.  Medium body and very refreshing.  A pretty solid beer for being so widely available and relatively inexpensive.

12oz. bottle. Pours an almost opaque, densely clouded, light yellow/straw with a thick, white head that persists a leaves a spotted sheet of lace all over the glass. The aroma is strong with wheat and citrus (lemon and orange zest is what reminds me of). The flavor starts very wheaty with a touch oatmeal (the presence of flaked oats is surprisingly noticeable and adds to the fresh bread character of the flaked wheat and malts). There is also a very nice, subtle touch of coriander spice. At mid-palate, citrus sensations grow to form a very refreshing and crisp touch of orange along with subtle, earthy, balancing hops and spicy, citrusy coriander seed. The finish is dry and the flavors of wheat and coriander linger lightly in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is very crisp in texture - effervescent and refreshing. The body is medium in fullness and seems somewhat thick and starchy on the sides of the tongue, to which it clings. Overall, a remarkably refreshing, light, wheat ale. And this is one of the best Witbiers around (likely attributable to the fact that it’s the original).
great belgian white! the best I ever tasted. It has a very fruity,sweet taste. The aroma is also very sweet. Hope to drink this beer more often.
25cl, from Hopduvel Gent, very refreshing and easy to drink, cloudy, good head, top-class Belgian White
Was not impressed by this beer. Poured yellow with a faint head. Didn’t have much taste. The taste was wheat and some orange peel. Probably would not buy again.

On tap at the Airliner (they put a lemon slice on top, which was removed immediately, but still will affect my rating somewhat).  Aroma was light, some bread, lemon/citrus.  Butter yellow in color, rather clear, no head as a result of the lemon which killed it, but from memory it has a decent white pillowy head (so i am rating based on memory in this case).  Good amount of carbonation feel, bread dough, light lemon/citrus flavor, zesty.  Definitely not my favorite, but very alright, probably the best I’ve had of a style I don’t really care for.

From bottle. Pale cloudy yellow with a big puffy white head leaving some lacing. Citric aromas with some yeasty banana in the back. Also a hint of coriander hits the nose. Acid orange peel when first taken in mouth, some peppery coriander in the middle with a slight bitterness at the end but well balanced. Crisp carbonation and light bodied makes it highly refreshing and perfect for hot summer nights. An excellent wit which keeps a high standard.
beautiful color! I love this beer! I saw the brewery, but it was a sunday :-(
Beautiful color, white beer.  No bitterness.  Faint taste of orange and corriander.  Massive lacing, nice head.  If this is the orginal wit bier then consider me drunk.

Good beer, but the aroma of it doesn’t make you want to drink it, neither does the appearance.  Tastes much better than it smells and looks.  Easy downer.

So I have to re-rate.  Smell is much better this time around, orange and lemon with hints of wheat and various other citruses.  Appearance isn’t much better, murky orange, small white head, not very appealing but not appalling.  Flavor is orange and wheat with hints of lemon.  Smooth on the palate with no aftertaste.  Better this time around because I think the first one was a bad tap and this was a new tap.

Poured from a 330ml bottle (best by 02/07/09) and served in a tumbler.  This beer poured a very faint straw yellow with an even haze and a lasting two-finger thick head of fizzy white foam.  Excellent retention and really nice lacing.  The aroma of the beer was made up of strong orange peel and clove, lemon, also some fruity banana esthers.  The flavor was very wheaty and esthery.  Lots of orange peel, coriander, and clove.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied and refreshingly crisp.  Way too easy to drink, yet quite flavorful.  I’m not a huge wit fan, and I wasn’t expecting much...but this was a really pleasant surprise.
12oz bottle. cloudly light yellow look. light white head. lemon citrus aroma. tasty light lemon taste, easy drinking on a hot summer evening

hazy pale yellow with little head.  little carbonation but some depth to body.  mild malt component.  best component is complexity of the spices with a nice blend of spice and sourness.  has nothing on the grand cru though

Summer and thirst = drinking a Hoegaarden! Or two.. Cloudy pale yellow with a thick white head. Smell of citrus, some yeast, spices and wheat. Taste is very refreshing, citrus, soft wheat taste, bit coriander. Mouthfeel is prickly and rather thin. From tap somewhat softer and less pronounced spice taste.

Bottle. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a big fizzy white head. Aroma is lemon, hint of coriander. Flavor is citrus zest, crisp wheat body, and a spicy, somewhat bitter and balancing coriander on the finish. Yeast is somewhat understated for the style, and the mouthfeel is a bit watery at times. Refreshing and light, good beer but only average within the style.
white head, pale white yellow cloudy body. nice faint citron smell. Easy drinking, citrus finish. no surprises. I will have no problem buying this again.

Pours cloudy and very pale greenish yellow with a tall, white fizzy head.  Powerful sour aromas with hints of lemon; whatever hops are present are thoroughly occulted.  Meyer lemon flavors dominate the palate.  Light body, clean finish.  A great beer.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellow with stark white head and decent lacing.  Nose is yeast, banana, orange and coriander.   Taste is very much the same with a tingly, dry citrus finish.  Lighter mouth feel.  Ok – a little sweet for me.

Bottle 75cl. Yellow hazy body with large white creamy  head. A fresh yeasty nose. Fresh and carbonated body with lots of different notes - yeast and citrus. A little too lightbodied for my taste but a nice and easy beer to drink.

i’m literally on my knees in front of this beer.  I’d probably fight anyone that said anything bad about it. This is the affinity i share with this amazing witbier.

Nostalgic nights in the boaters (jazz on a sunday) It’s 3.50 a pint mate...no worries. Any lemon? don’t be ridiculous. A herbal sensation with a creamy sourness that basically stands up in a crowd and says im top dog.  Yes, i’ve had better beers since but none of them will ever give me as much pleasure as this once did.  i can only compare it to taking acid for the first time. Parsnip, grass and all the good things i like.

a flavour onslaught as the carbonation dissipates. Not the prettiest of beers but my lord does it taste great. This beer is your friend and won’t let you down.  I’m tempted to give it top marks just out of sheer respect.
Tökéletes "fehér",kitűnő szomjoltó finom,élesztős,édeskés,citrusos ízekkel.A német testvéreit azért jobban kedvelem.Ja,és ne engedjük hogy bele dobjanak egy negyed narancsot amikor csapolják!
i bought this because someone told me to try it and i don’t regret it one bit. One word describes this beer brilliant
light yellow almost white pour, decent head, smell of coriander and lemony citrus. taste to match, decent palate.
From the bottle. Light and pale yellow colour, completely white head. Lots of yeast in aroma and some wheat. Yeast and citrus fruits in flavor. Nothing special but refreshing.

12oz bottle, abundant head that fades downto the surface in a few minutes. Medium clove aroma with coriander/orange tailing behind. A slight acidic smell. The spicy flavor quickly fades to a nice light tongue coating acidity and hop bitterness. Has body presence even though it is so light. Finishes out slightly watery and dry. Very quenching, I could just guzzle this, maybe have it on tap at home- Deserves its rep.

from the bottle.  very good belgian white.  overall the beer is very light and refreshing, but with enough flavor so that it feels very full, not watered-down.  there is a lot of citrus flavor, but some other flavors such as vanilla are also present.  great beer!
On tap. Like good belgian whites there are banana, nutmegy and citrus flavors but this brew brings all of those flavors with a burnt complex, as if the flavors were baked in a vanilla bake.

On tap and served in a shaker glass. Pale lemon yellow in color with a wispy white head that leaves some very nice lace. Smells of citrus, banana, and light spice. Taste is much the same with a bit of wheat flavor. Very refreshing. Pretty good.
Good citrus flavor with a yeast and hop flavor to balance it out.  A good light witbier.
The delicate citrus flavours, with yeast and hops overtones, contribute to a very pleasant and refreshing beer in this witbier. A decent beer.

A very nice Witbier.  Light color, off-white head, and a very smooth flavor that doesn’t overpower the beer like some others of large breweries.  I also like how the beer has specific drinking instructions, I don’t know why, but I like when breweries/ brewers display how they feel the beer should be enjoyed.

A wonderful Belgian witbier in my opinion considering it came from a big multinational brewery. Wonderful orange, coriander, wheat and yeasty flavors. Pours cloudy white with a nice head. To me it would be a good accompanyment to a nice fish or chicken dinner instead of a white wine. A delicious creme brulee for dessert?Ahhh.Life is good.Very drinkable and yet packed full of flavor.How do those Belgians do it time after time? A good beer!
Pours straw and opaque/cloudy. No sedimentation. Spicy orangy taste with sour notes. Good head. Very refreshing and very good for a beer that belongs to a major brewery. Very good witbeer.

Poured from a bottle, a light straw color, thin white head that disipates quickly.  Not much aroma to speak of which is kind of disappointing.  Flavor has the orange peel, a slightly sweet maltiness, balanced quite well with a touch of hops and yeast.

A good brew.  I wonder why it took so long for me to try it.

I must say I was almost not taking this one serious due to the extreme hype that it was made for me about it. Fortunatly, me foolness passed: what a pleasant surprise! Poured opaque light orange with a pretty white foam. The aroma got me with a lot of hop herbs, some yeastiness and even some citrus: pinapple and some orange; some sourness. The flavor came with little sourness coming with little sweetness as well, very well balanced. Some orange peel, little malty and mainly hoppy flavor, refreshing mouthfeel and aftertaste, that lacked a little more taste in it. Quite nice introduction to the witbiers for me! / Devo dizer que tinha algum preconceito com essa cerveja, dado o tanto que falavam pra mim dela. Felizmente, deixei de ser bobo: que surpresa agradável! Derrama laranja claro opaco com uma boa espuma branca. O aroma veio com bastante lúpulo (ervas), algo de levedura e ainda um pouco cítrico: abacaxi e laranja; algum azedume. O sabor trouxe um pouco de azedo e um pouco de doce, muito bem balanceado. Trouxe também algo de raspas de laranja, pouco malte e bastante sabor de lúpulo. A sensação na boca e no retrogosto é bem refrescante, mas faltou um pouco de sabor no final. Uma introdução muito boa das witbiers pra mim!
Bottle. Pours Light straw with a thick fluffy white head. Orange, spices, yeast aroma. Light slightly malty, orange peel taste with a little bit of dryness. Very nice, refreshing wit.

Draft. Very hazy, light straw color with a big soapy white head. Smells of sourdough. Nice refreshing sourness, orange, and spice. A bit of a lemonade flavor. Really refreshing stuff and super easy to drink.
A heavier beer that finishes clean and has astounding drink-ability. Settles well and is able to be enjoyed if drunk quickly as well as slowly.

Appearance: Cloudy white. Later pale brown. Tiny amount of head.
Aroma: Not too wheaty. Orangy? Citrusy.
Taste: A bit of wheat. Hint of fruit. Fresh
Info: 330ml bottle, 23/2-2006, 81/300, 48/500

bottle and tap.  Not much going on with the aroma, but the taste is smooth and consistent from first sip to last.  Citrus flavor with a slight weight to it.. definitely does not need orange or lemon like some wheat beers.
Bottle.  Pours cloudy yellow with a nice head that disappeared quickly.  Smells lightly fruity, and inviting.  Taste is very abrupt with yeast and fades off into fruity undertones.
Bottle.  Cloudy, yellow color.  Medium sized, bubbly white head.  Aroma of bananas and clove.  Big wheaty flavor mixed with yeast and citrus notes.  Finish is flowerlike.
Pours hazy white. Smells of banana and yeast and tastes of it too. Great mouthfeel. A great white.

Tumbler served at The Pub, Crestview Hills, Northern Kentucky. Tried this beer by my waiter’s recommendation that it tasted like Blue Moon; it tastes better than Blue moon. Has a great wheat flavor without the overpowering citrus flavor in Blue Moon. Has a mild malt aroma.

solid frothy head, dissipated in pockets.yellow cloudy pour. classic belgian white aroma- yeast, citrus, and wheat undertones, along with some unique spices. flavor is delicious- the epitome of a really good belgian white. good mouthfeel, really tasty beer.

0,33l bottle. Pours very pale opaque yellow with a light head. Aroma is wheaty, just like in any hefeweizen. Flavor is suitably sour with some wheat and fruit. A perfect beer to drink when you’re really thirsty on a hot day. Just like a few minutes ago.

It’s a good beer. It’s has a very unique sweet fruity taste to it. If you like Blue Moon the taste is along the same line. It would probably go well with an orange or a lemon. A bit too sweet for me to drink more than one or two.
Amazing beer with almost a flowery aftertaste to it. Great to drink on a long hot day or at a BBQ. also an excellent beer on tap

Pale gold, lots of carbonation. Great, refreshing flavor of wheat and hints of spice and citrus to add some tingle. My favorite beers are hefeweizens, and as this is a close derivative, I really embraced it.

Pours hazy/cloudy deep light yellow with a quick fizzy white head. Has a pleasing aroma of spices like coriander and cinnamon, with hints of orange peel. The flavor is somewhat strong of spices like cinnamon and coriander with hints of oranges and wheat. The feel is a little watery with a somewhat sour and a little sweet taste. Kind of refreshing and crisp. Better than blue moons belgian white.

Pours a stable head of pure white.  Color is light golden with a cloudiness that persists through drinking.  Aroma is dominated by notes of citrus which is matched in the tasting.  Very light mouthfeel with pleasant carbonation.  Almost no bitterness at all.  Very pleasant, refreshing beer.  A good witbier.

If poured patiently develops a nice white head that lingers.  Smells of citrus and coriander.  Tastes smooth with mild citrus and banana-like mild sweetness and a short finish.  Great thirst quencher.

Draft-New Orleans. Shallow but stable white head. Nose had some clove and spicy fruit. Poured a cloudy straw yellow. Tasted some banana. Finished a bit tart which was perfect for this sweet beer. Very refereshing.
Very pale yellow pour with thin foamy white head. Aroma is citrus and coriander. Tastes of citrus malt and spices (mild clove and coriander); mildly bitter finish.

12oz bottle:  Pours a pale yellow color with a bright white head.  Faint lemon-grassy smell.  Nice light, thin body.  Very mild initial taste give way to a slight zesty finish.  This is probably a better representation of the style than several others I like better, but definitely one of the most refreshing beers I’ve had.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in San Antonio. Pours a pale yellow with lots of haze and a creamy white head. Not much aroma. Flavor is mildly sweet with a little hops and lots of malt and wheat. Citrus, clove, nicely spiced. Great beer.

12oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy pale straw color with a billowy white head and good carbonation.  Aroma is light and sweet, with notes of citrus, coriander, and earthy grains.  Taste is creamy and medium-bodied, with a mellow flavor of citrus, banana, and coriander giving way to a light, crisp finish of malt and grains.  Nothing complex, but damn refreshing.

Impossibly light body with a striking resemblance to honey. The head is tall and frothy with a mildly sweet and citrusy aroma.
Flavor has prominent notes of clove, coriander, and cinnamon, ending in a light, somewhat tart finish.
Would be a wonderful pair to a ripe and mushroomy brie and thinly sliced pear.
Great witbier...obvious notes of citrus (orange) and coriander.  Light mouthfeel, very subtle tones of wheat malt...finishes a little thin, but a great beer nonetheless.
Pours like milky coconut juice with a thin white head.  Coriander and orange fruit nose.  Peppery and citric notes appear in flavor.  "Soft" but not "thin" mouthfeel.  Semi-bitter finish.

Draft, served with orange slice.  Pale, cloudy yellow in color with a crisp, white head.  Aroma of wheat and grass.  Flavor of citrus, orange and maybe lemon, with a hint of melon.  Smooth, moist, and frothy finish that  is refreshing, with a slight carbonation.   Very pleasing on a warm day.

330ml bottle: pours a cloudy golden brown with one finger white head, aroma of wheat and slighty yeasty, flavor starts out very clean good amount of wheat then the orange peel comes through just throwing in a hint of sourness. decent beer but at 10 bucks a 6 pack will not be buying again

Color, aroma and taste. all match. That’s what makes a beer be named White beer.
Balance between grains and malts are definetely in good equilibrium.

Pale hazy yellow with a nice white head.  Fairly light, but packed with flavor.  Citrus, spices, and yeast all well balanced between citrus sour and sweet.  Crisp and mid range carbonation make it refreshing.  Wheaty finish with a hint of citrus, very pleasant.
Bottle pours a hazy, pale yellow with a thick and foamy white head.  Aroma is mostly wheat and orange peel.  Nice light and refreshing wheat flavor that also includes citrus and coriander.

Bottle. Pours yellow/white, with a thinnish, crisp, white head, specks of lace. Smells big and yeasty, slightly cirtusy. Tastes bready, yeasty and citrusy on the finish. I’m sre there are malt sin there too but I’m not that good. Great beer, I think I had this in Brussels once with a slice of lemon. Thin body, vibrant carbonation.
Great, refreshing beer for drinking after working hard on a hot, humid day. Beautiful balance, light, but still interesting enough.

pours very cloudy almost white color, it is really a very very pale yellow. Smells extremely yeasty with a citrus hint, the flavor really has more to say than the aroma in my opinion, i picked up more spices, yeast and citrus. This is very well rounded, good stuff!
Bottle: Clearish yellow in color, good head. Smell is lemon. Flavor is refreshing lemon, orange & coriander. Medium carbonation but crisp which makes it a good summer brew. I would get it again...

Draught at The Bishop’s Arms, Järntorget, Göteborg, Sweden. Hazy yellow with a large, stable, white head. Hoppy aroma with dominance of citric notes. Slightly sweet and sour taste. Refreshing mouthfeel with light carbonation.

Pale hazy straw, like lemonade with whipped egg whites on top. The coriander hits hard in the aroma over tangy citrus. Flavor matches the aroma with bits of yeast and sweet malt while being light and quaffable. Zippy carbonation, but somewhat thin bodied. Finish is nicely spicy.

Pours hazy lemon yellow. Nice, light, refreshing mouthfeel. Quite carbonated. Yeasty, lemony, spicey, wheaty taste with a hint of orange. Light aromas. Not a very challenging beer which is a sure choice almost all times but on the other hand doesn’t provide adventureous experiences. A very good brew for hot summer days and nice one for other days too.

Pours a hazy pale yellow, with a large frothy head. Medium carbonation. Crisp aroma- coriander is certainly present. Coriander and orange in the taste, not too much hops and very small bitterness. Nice and light
Wheat, spicey, orange in aroma. Flavor is wheat, orange, lemon, spices. Nothing special really, but nice summer beer.

Pours a hazy lemon yellow carbonation visible with a good layer of white frothy head (1.2 inch). Aroma is lemony with spicy hints of clove. Flavor is definitely wheat with twist of lemon. Definite carbonation.
A great light beer.  Cloudy color, nice head, easy to drink and tasty.  This is a refeshing beer to drink on a hot day.
light hazy yellow pour. nice head. spicey, citrus (lemon) aroma. flavor was similar with a bit more of orange. light tartness in the finish. nice and crisp
Pours pale yellow with a thick white head. Yeasty aroma. Flavor is more yeast with a bit of fruit. Very refreshing.
a nice witbier, not really special in my oppinion. good notes of orange and coriander.
Not sure if I can rationalize the 88% that Hoegaarden has on this website, but it is a very smooth light Belgian beer. Very drinkable.

11.2 oz bottle, pours quite clear, my wife noted it looked like "white grape juice".  Foamy white head that dissipated fully.  Aroma of coriander, orange and lemon peel, floral scents.  Taste not very strong, citrusy and spicy, with a crisp, dry mouthfeel.  Thirst-quenching and is a decent beer.
Medium head, very light color, clearer than most ales of its type.  Very dry and less citrus-y/fruity than I was expecting.  Not my favorite, but okay nonetheless.

Bottle 080510. Medium sized head. Very light, grayish green-yellow color. Hazy, almost opaque. Spicy, herbal aroma of coriander, oranges and yeast. The hops comes through perfumy and soapy. Medium to rich palate. Very soapy, herbal and perfumy in a not to natural way. Nice oily creaminess and a very dry aftertaste. THis was a big dissapointment, since I always used to find this beer as the perfect example of a belgian witbier. Now it is really chemical and weird tasting. I guess this is the reason they’re moving production back from Jupille to Leuven. 8/5/4/4/11/3.2

Re-rate 090428. Bottle. Pours hazy white with a creamy head that goes away quick. Aroma is very sweet, like honey, with some herbal notes and typical Saaz-like hop aromas. Also a hint of cooked corn and barely perceptible spicy phenolics. Very soft and orangey mouthfeel, quite sweet and almost oily. Quinine dryness in the finish. Much better than last year, but still not as complex and outstanding as it used to be. 7/4/7/4/13/3.5
On draft at Borgata, Atlantic City.  Poured hazy, straw yellow.  No fruit added.  Spicy, citrusy, with notes of coriander.  Easy drinking, classic summertime beer.

Not the greatest looking beer, pale, light yellow, with a solid white head. The aroma is of mild citrus and spice. The flavor is slightly sour,  nice citrus and spice notes. Light, crisp mouthfeel. Very nice, this might be the most refreshing beer I’ve ever tasted

A cloudy pale straw yellow with a good-sized head that XXXX. The aroma is a tart citrus and other light fruit with strong Belgian yeast notes and spice. The flavor is a tad underwhelming: the citrus is still there, there is a spice that I’m told is coriander. A tad watery on the mouthfeel. All in all, a very refreshing beer with character for a hot day, but nothing I get too excited about.
i had this out of a 12 ounce bottle. it pours a very light yellow color with a huge white head. it as a spicy citrus taste
Draft in Brussels airport. Good fresh beer. Head is really huge. Real good beer in sunny day.
Very refreshing. Light yellow with huge white head. Bonus for the big thick wide glass. Citrus and sour coriander. spicy. good availability. Good on a hot day and thirst.

Pours golden and cloudy with a good sized white head.  Aroma is citrus and spice.  Coriander definately comes through in the flavor but not to overpowering.  The cream of the crop of Belgian Whites in my book.

As a brand new member to this site and even more importantly an amateur beer enthusiast, I can only give a review of this beer from my limited experience.  The aroma was citrusy and the flavor was spicey/cistrusy.  The finish was clean and every sip was enjoyable.  The only bad thing about this beer is the empty bottle at the end.
esta la probe en munich cuando fui a pasear por alla con la bea y estuvimos en todas las cervecerias y pasamos un buen rato super nice de veras men vale la pena super
This is a great beer!  I forgot how much I love it until now!  Strong aroma of banana and some citrus.  Nice yeasty flavor and wonderful murkiness.
Pretty much the definition of the belgian wit.  Nothing says summer like a Hoegaarden while sitting in a beirgarden under the shade of a newly leafed tree.  yum
whats not to like? fantastic fruity nose. poured lemon color with good frothy head. citrus aroma with a little tingle on the palate. crisp finish. one serious contender.

Light golden color......very hazy......almost opaque.  Pillowy, white head.  Mild citrus aroma.  Light malt taste up front......smooth mouthfeel for the style.  Complex citrus back, with a slight tart finish.

Draught. Pale lemony yellow, thick white head. Nose is strongly wheaty with yeast, pineapple, citric fruits and even a little raw banana. Flavor is wheat, soap and little fruitiness. Yeasty finish with mild vanilla. Nice, simple refresher. I’d like a tad more character though.
Pale yellow with a white head that laces nicely. Aroma of sweet malts, orange, citrus. Taste is sweet, crisp, spicy, orange, coriander with a semi dry finish.  Decent witbier.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium sized white fruity head. This beer was tasty all around, the head with smelled of citrus and more distinctively lemons- the body itself was medium with a creamy texture and tropical fruit all around.
One of my favorites. Pours characteristically light yellow, smells like lemons and oranges. Sweet to taste, a perfect thirst quencher.
very drinkable...nice creamy mouthfeel and damn nice spiced character...good but not great...but a damn good lawnmower beer

Pours a very light yellow, almost like a hazy lemonade. Aroma of orange, coriander and some lemon tartness. A lot of carbonation overwhelms the flavor a bit, which is sweet and orange in the start. Finishes with the lemon tartness and a hint of cinnamon flavor in the aftertaste. Pretty good choice, but it isn’t the best in the style.
nice citrus aroma with a hint of orange + other spices. nice white head. with a little bit of an after taste. all around good beer for any day. the orginal belgian white.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with lemon, orange, and spices, almost clove but not quite. Medium body. Flavor is similar to the aroma, more nutmeg is present, still lemon and orange. Very nice, drinkable and refreshing. There’s a reason this is among the top ranking witbiers.
Pours a golden yellow color with thick foamy white head.  Citrus aroma consisiting of lemon and orange peel and spice.  Flavor vbery similar with balance of spice and citrus fruit.
Cloudy yellow color with a medium head. Flavour is really fresh and spicy. Great summerbeer with a really refreshing taste.
Yellow cloudy colour, white head. Aroma has citrus an coriander. Flavour is spicy and fruity. It has some fresh hoppiness. Excellent witbier.
Pretty much the perfect witbier for a hot summer day. This is a legendary standby witbier and although it is not as complex or good as other witbiers it is still awesome.

Rated: 23.04.2008

Bottle brown, 330 ml

Appearance: Pours very bright yellow like water with honey, cloudy, hazy body with storng influence of yeast floating in the body texture, its really the brightest beer I’ve ever tried, head is clean, snowy white, extremely shiny white, frothy, thick, regular in structure, leaves considerable traces of lacing. Its preety good in deed, the longevity of the head is very good, head being quite small initially decreases to its about 50% and than last for a long time, body carbonation is medium. The contrast between body and head is outstanding. The beer in the originall glass makes the great impression.

Aroma: Yeasty, white bread, grainy, wheaty, malty sweet, dough, sweet bun, milk, whipped cream, flovery, sweet aromatic, hoppy nose, powder sugar, very nice and inviting, alcohol is well hidden under the complex fruity- bready, grainy aroma and under a thick head, lemon, lime, banana, orange, orange peal, coriander, somer other interesting spices.

Flavour: Very complex flavuor, at front you can feel mineral nose, yeastyness, accidity and metallic touch, later on its easy to recognise creamy beer texture and on the other hand sour and accidic taste, in the aftertaste there is the explosion of grainy- bready taste, wheat, malted barley, flour, dough, peanuts, coriander, vanilla, banana, orange peal, aromatic and gentle flowery- perfume hoppy nose. On pslste towards sourness, no bitterness, clean and perfectly balanced and very complex flavuor. Finish duration is medium to long.

Palate: Body is light, texture is creamy with accidic notes, carbonation on palate is quite lively but beer is smooth though, finish feel is grainy.

A very light color with a nice smooth flow. A very distinctable taste, nice and hearty with a great taste. I’ve only had this one about a couple of months ago, however, I will be buying this again in the near future, thumbs up!
Unbelievable. great fantastic beer. Yellow straw gold colour. Aroma of flowers, coriander, orange and springtime. Medium to large white head.

Competent go-to beer during the warm months. Cloudy golden brew with a lively head, nice aroma of citrus and yeast. The hops give it some spice and vibrancy, though the mouthfeel is still a bit too thin for my taste.
A crisp refreshing beer, especially during hotter months of the year.  Love the subtle hint of orange peel.  Very nice beer.

I’ve probably consumed close to 100 bottles/glasses of this over the past few years.  It’s a fantastic beer for warmer months, and is so drinkable and refreshing.  One of my favorite beer experiences ever was coming home one july evening after playing tennis for like 2 hours in really humid weather with no water, and just downing one out of the bottle.  It’s yeasty, a little spicy, mild, and really enjoyable.  Fantastic for what it is and what it’s supposed to be.
Pale yellow with a thin head. Aroma of coriander, yeast and orange. Sweet dusty flavour with some mandarin and spice. A classic, but I prefer the speciale.
330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy straw color with a frothy head. Aroma of coriander and lemon. Crisp, lemony taste, clean mouthfeel. One of my favorite summer beers.
Some fruit on the nose.  Cloudy gold with a huge head.  Clean sweetness, with the spices and tart citrus pulling through.  Very fizzy, with a clean finish.  Nice beer.
(on tap @ my last gig.)clean crisp and refreshing.and still full of flavor for a "ligher" brew.

Bottle. 11.2 fl. oz.  Unclear straw color with big, frothy, white head.  Aromas of citrus and yeast.  Medium bodied with a soft, smooth texture.  Flavor is lightly sweet but mostly a tart bitterness. Very good.

Bottle. Pours very hazy yellow with a huge creamy head. Aroma is very spicy with notes of orange, citrus, coriander and clove. Flavour is somewhat sour and bitter but very refreshing. Notes of coriander, grapefruit, clove and orange. Medium to light body.
Pours a cloudy, light yellow; creamy head; orange aroma is very prevalent; slightly fruity with a hint of spice; very smooth and refreshing going down, definitely a good summer beer

Very refreshing beer. One of the best beers when it is very hot outside. Drink it with a slice of lemon. And 5 minutes before drinking, store your glass in the freezer, so the beer is longer cold in summertime.
Bottle in massive glass. (Soup bowl size) Very pale color with white head. A light citrus spicy taste and aroma. Love it. Impressive for a light commercial beer.

Bottle into Tumbler.  Pours a hazy golden glow with a frothy white head.  Aroma is floral, but not like I’m used to.  I didn’t pick up as much of the citrusy scent I expected.  Flavor is lightly spiced, some subdued citrus and lots of acid and sour and weak malts.  Very dry on the palate and still not as refreshing as I’d hoped.  I leave this off wondering if I got a dud because I like witbier, but this underwhelmed me.  I’ll have to try again soon and re-rate.

Pours very pale golden from the bottle to the glass, with a small head that seems to dissipate rather quickly. Perfumy aroma may be a bit much to handle. Overly sweet in the aroma, fairly malty in the flavor department. Lots of citrus and spice. Slides across the palate with a watery mouthfeel, finishes nice and clean despite the low CO2.

Bottle. Very fruity, yeasty, citrus, refreshing smell. The beer has no head and a light orange cloudy body. It is light acidic, later on it gets a little bit sweeter. Light body, dry texture and a lively carbonation.
Nice beer for the summer.
Wow I can’t believe I haven’t rated tis guy yet. Bottled, a cloudy yellow, citrusy aroma, A nice llemony finish. Good for mass marketed..

pours cloudy pale yellow with healthy white head.  aroma of citrus and corriander.  Flavour is what you might expect for this class of beer, mild spice and citrus.  crisp clean finish (not lingering aftertaste)  A good easy drinking summertime beer.  Great while cooking on the bbq

Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a thin, foamy head.  Nice floral, citrusy aroma.  Very smooth, slightly creamy mouthfeel with just the right carbonation.  Nice yeast and citrus flavors.  Crisp, clean finish, almost like a hefeweizen.  A very nice wheat beer.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow (almost white) with a tiny white head.  Heavy aroma of corriander and citrus.  Flavor is similarly spiced, with a bit of the wheat coming through.  Finishes with a slight pilsner taste.  Palate is thin and fizzy.  This isn’t my favorite style, but overall this is a decent Wit.

0.33 l bottle. Hazy pale straw color with small long lasting head. Perfumed nose with lemon, pepper, coriander, wheat and herbs. The flavor is grainy, peppery, lemony and herbal with distinctive coriander note which gives a somewhat soapy and woody edge. Light, slighly watery palate, very refreshing. Pleasant but not one of my favourite wits.
A excellent white wheat beer, usually served a orange slice.  I always drink this without the orange slice.  Very drinkable.
Une très bonne bière blanche comme la mojorité des bière blege, très bon goût
good wheat beer, bitter sweet tasting. not too keen on the slices of lemon etc

Slightly above average wheat beer that I’d get again.  Leaning towards a more flavor than the recent offerings of belgian white that seem to be appearing everywhere.  Pours a dense, cloudy gold accented with a bright white head that receeds quickly.  Taste is very clean finishing and reminds me of a mild hefe-weis ala paulaner, tucher, etc. Good summer beer.
One of my favorite beers.  Goes down easy, never disappoints.  Forget the lemon and orange slices, drink up!

Ghostly lemon body with small fluffy foam.  Not overly aromatic but pleasant citrus and banana.  Flavor is citrus with the coriander mentioned in the description coming through.  A refreshing summer brew that I wouldn’t mind having again.
Tap. Hazy yellow gold with minimal head. Aroma is fruit and yeast. Taste is sweet sour and fruity. Refreshing.

12 ounce bottle-  pours out cloudy pale gold with no head to speak of.  Aroma is light citrus and yeast.  Taste is lightly citrus up front with stong finish and no after taste.  Would be a good hot wheather beer.  Average or a little better.

Seeing the 88 percentile rating this beer has achieved, drives hom the factor of personal preference quite strongly. This brew is a nice and refreshing witbier, with a citrusy nose atop a beautiful cloudy/golden body. It’s quite flavorful, all things considered, with a strong citrus/coriander flavor mixing with the wheat base and banana back notes. However, this is a refreshing--but by no means spectacular--beer in my estimation.

This is one of my favourite witbiers, but it’s a style which I often find tiresome, uninteresting, and not very satisfying.  It’s gold, lightly hazy, with a medium white head steadily dissiptaing to a thin, permanent foamy top.  The aroma is really nice, wheat, grass, banana, hints of citrus zest and flowers, a hint of orange juice; it has less banana and more wheat than many wheat or witbier-types.  The taste is also nice, being dry but not too dry, less fruity-perfumy in the citrus-banana quality than many witbiers, not too soft, with a tingly texture and a light 7-up quality.  It has a good citrus quality without the overly perfumy, almost artificial or clearner-like quality of many citrusy wheat or witbiers and others.  It’s falvourful but refreshing and nicely crips.

Smell is nice and citrusy, not strong enough for me. Gorgeous appearance, nice unflitered look, pale yellow, strong head with good retention and lacing. Great taste, with a citrus kick. Overall, wonderful flavor.

I think there are much better white beers. Having said that, this is one of the beers that started a revolution in my head and made me say NO! I will not drink scania green and zeppelin snakebite in the park while shouting at strangers. This particular pint is not ice cold and it’s obviously been kept in good condition. Yes orange peel and coriander, bit of lemon and vanilla maybe. On it’s day, quite nice.
Encorpada e refrescante. Leve amargor e aroma frutado, uma típica belga. Agradável sensação de solidez e leveza, bela textura. Ótimo preço.

Liquid sun shine, poured into its signature tumbler glass. Color was light yellow and hazy with a foamy white head. It has an inviting aroma of wheat, citrus, and spice. The flavor is much the same with a wonderful balance of wheaty malts, Belgian yeast, dried orange peel and coriander. Nice sweet/tart finish with good carbonation and a medium body. This is a great summer time beer and one of my favorite wheat beers.

Bottle. Pours hazy straw. Nose is very much Belgian yeast with some ester like smell going through. Taste is light and refreshing with some citrus, minor hop tingle at the end. Mouthfeel is surprisingly full. Very nice summer beer.
Pours a cloudy, pale lemon color.  Smells of banana and spice.  Light citrusy taste; yeast is present, but not overwhelming.  Very soft feel in the mouth, but still filling.  Extremely refreshing.

It’s hard not to love the look of this beer in the glass. Slightly cloudy dull golden with nice head. Aroma of citrus, spice and wheat. It’s light. It’s refreshing. Great summer beer. Good base of malt and citrus. A bit thin, but not out of place.

On tap.  A classic white.  THE classic white.  Pours cloudy gold with a large frothy head.  Aroma of bananas, yeast, citrus and spice.  Taste much the same.  Crisp, refreshing finish.  Wasn’t my first.  Won’t be my last.
I really like this beer for what it is. Its light and refreshing, with a prominent citrus flavor that gives it a slightly sour finish. The sweetness is nice too.

Hoegaarden
ABV: 7%
Calories: estimated at 200 C
Volume: 12 oz
Glass: plasticup
Purchased at: Rider Pub
Price per fl oz: $2 / 12 fl oz = $.16 per fl oz
Consumed at: Rider Pub

sensory first impression: Nice, banana infused flavor - more ale than lager, but crisp, tasty, and enjoyable.

Aroma/Olfactory: 8 out of 10
Malt flavor is: caramel, cereal, nuts, roasted
Hop flavor is: floral, citrus
Yeast flavor is: doughy, mold
Other flavors include: alcohol, banana, ginger

Visuals/Appearance: 4 out of 5
Color is: bright, golden, orange
Liquid is: clear
Head and lace are: frothy, off-white

Taste/Flavor: 8 out of 10
Maltiness or Sweetness level is: medium
Hoppiness or Bitterness level is: light
Sour level is: none

Palate/Tactile: 4 out of 5
Body or Mouthfeel is: medium
Texture is: creamy, crisp, thick
Carbonation is: lively
Finish is: longer, nice

Overall experience: 17 out of 20. I liked the idea of a very commonly available beer being so very belgian. I did not like, generally, the commonality of it, but I enjoy it when it’s the best thing available.

Aromas of coriander and anise, as well as a grassy smell.  Very unique smell and taste, the spice dominates but dosn’t go overkill, with the citrus being very mild.  It still has a refreshing belgian white yeasty flavor.
Fairly well-carbonated, palate is no frills crisp-smooth.

nice flavors of lemon, orange and a little bit of corriander.  Light and refreshing.  Palate is perfectly soft and full.  Very slightly tart.  A very well done example of the style, but not a style that really allows for a great beer.
Pours a cloudy lemon yellow color with a moderate head that dissipates quickly.  Nose of lemon and straw.  Taste of lemon and malts.  Sparkly almost champagne like carbonation.

Bottle (330ml). Poured a cloudy pale strawed yellow with a dense foamy, white head which was mostly lasting. Aroma was of bready malts with musky wheat, orange zest, lemon (mild), coriander and some cinnamon. Flavor was also of bready malts with a very light bitterness, wheat, straw, lemon, orange zest (light), cinnamon and some cloves (light). Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation, a watery texture creamy/dry mouthfeel and a ok finish.

Pour is hazy light yellow with very white head. Aroma is rich with fruity  and sweet spice. Taste is light citrusy lemon with Belgian yeast. Real sweet, crisp, smooth, and refreshing. Nice hot summer day beer. Serve very cold.
One of my favorite everyday beers in the summer that’s readily available here in Texas....

33cl bottle from Willow Bend Liquors (Florida). Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Nints of spice and vanilla in the nose. Tastes slightly sweet and citrusy with a quick, slightly sweet, smooth finish. Light, crisp Belgian wheat beer.

Pour is hazy light yellow with very white head..  Aroma is rich with fruity esters and sweet spice.  Taste is light citrus with Belgian yeast.  Real sweet, crisp, smooth, and refreshing.  Great brew.  Would buy again.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a big white fluffy head. Strong aroma of sweet banana some citrus but then a distinct flavor that must be the clove and coriander. Exactly like the description says with a sweet and sour taste. Honestly, I don’t love the sourness at the end but the sweet banana at first sip is good. I’m not crazy about this brew as many are but I’d like to have a few more of these before commiting to a rating. Right now we will leave it as is. Decent but not great. UPDATE: Have really grown to like this beer. I love the light refreshing and crisp taste it has. Great beer for the summer.

Paid $8.99 for a 6 pack of bottles (11.5 oz.). Pours a big, frothy head with a champagne-like appearance ; very citrusy and spicey  on the nose.  Nice yeasty and citrusy flavor; pretty lively on the palate. Finishes crisp and refreshing- quite quaffable.
