Not a bad beer. Great head.  Color and appearance is very white/yellow. This is a good selection to get if you are just in a grocery store with limited selection.

One of the best Wits out there, and the irony is that you can get it most anywhere. Pours a cloudy yellow with a big white head. Awesome wit smell of cloves, spice and coriander and some belgian yeast. Taste is incredibly balanced for the style. Its also incredibly smooth on the finish and the coriander and spice notes linger awhile on the palate. Underated a little in my opinion but that is probably more due to the style. One of the best session beers out there in my opinion.

12 oz. bottle...Poured a murky light yellow color with soapy white head. Clove and yeasty wheat scent. Taste is strange at first and then improved as I drank. A good beer for this style but can’t say I like it, this is not a style beer I prefer. Leaves me with a dry nasty aftertaste!!!

Fredagsbaren på Biologi, Aarhus - bottled
Aarhus - on tap
Unclear
Fresh with spice and citrus
Low bitterness but a balance of sweet and dryness

For me, a very good beer.  I love the aroma, and the flavor reminds me of the way honeysuckle smells.  Every time I smell a honeysuckle bloom, I am reminded of this beer.  Perhaps my judgement is swayed by an amazing night in Brugge, Belgium, hanging out with a mix of Austailians, Irish, Belgian, and Korean folks until the wee hours of the morning, but every time I drink this I fall in love again.  There are no bitter flavors, the clove is super mild, and with the right head, served in the correct glass from the right keg, it is very hard to beat.

What else can I say about this one that hasn’t been said already?  Very pale golden/straw color, fluffy white head.  The sweet and sour taste is what gets you, but since neither the sweet nor the sour is terribly strong, the overall experience is rather mild.  Nothing memorable but a good beer.
Light pale golden hues, big fluffy white head.  Grassy yeast aroma and some hidden citrus tones.  Light body and good higher carbonation.  Soft citrus flavors and a crisp dry finsh.

...one of the best out there, too bad it’s being commercialized.  Nice citrus and clove aroma, as well as taste.  Balanced well with a cloudy, light bodied beer that drinks well, and is not too heavy.  Overall great, and one of my favs.

Poured a slightly cloudy pale yellow with a fizzy white head that sustained for a while and managed to provide some lacing.  The aroma was yeast, spice and mild citrus.  The flavor was heavy on the citrus and light on the spice.  Some yeast came through.  The mouthfeel was thin but this was an easy drinking beer that didn’t offend, it was just kind of there.

Bottle. 25 cl. alc. 4.9%.
Ligth yellow unfiltered pale. Not much head. Delicious fruity flavour. My first encounter with Belgian beer, but not the last!

Great white beer.  Wheat malt, citris and spices readily apparent on the nose and in the flavor.   Pours a light unfiltered pale yellow with plenty of head.  Finish is crisp and sweet, begging me to take another sip.  As the temperature warms up, keep a 6er of these close by.

Merky yellow pour characteristic of white Belgian beer , this bottle has a skunky aroma but tastes fairly fresh based on a skunked bottle has a spicy taste. This bottle actually smells like campfire has a bit of that mellow citrus fruit thing going for it as well. Not bad , I could see myself drinking one of these on the deck in the summer.
Enjoy this lighter yellow pour. Lots of lemon and citrus notes on palate,nice smooth finish. yum

A bright yellow pour, slightly hazy, with a tall light fluffy head. It has  aroma of lemon and spice . The flavor is slightly complex. When taken as a large swallow it starts slightly citrus and finishes  spicy and very clean.  An excellent white beer.
Pale yellow in color with a pretty decent head on there.  Citrus aromas in there.  Light and fluffy beer if that makes sense.  Some spices.  Seemed lacking a little somthing for me.

fluorescent pastel yellow with medium sized dense fluffy head. spicy lemon zest aroma with a light sourdough bread undertone. smooth soft body. spicy citrus grain flavor with hints of banana and a creamy marshmallow quality to it. very well balanced and smooth, clearly the best wit i’ve had
una suave cerveza blanca y belga. Se bebe muy rápido.  Muy buena cerveza. Aroma citrico
Bottle. Pretty light yellow and huge, awesome white head. Yeasty pineapple lemon aroma. Complex and refreshing, lemony and spicy taste. Smooth palate. Great.

Draft at a local bar. Pours a creamy golden color typical of a Belgian White. Delicious sweet citrusy aroma with moderate spicyness. Tastes equally as sweet and spicy and is best enjoyed with an orange or lemon slice. Palate is about as smooth as you can get from a white and overall a very impressive beer. Sam Adams White Ale picked a good one to knock off (they did a good job of it too.)
Bottle at home. hay, floral, pale, cloudy, frothy, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, lively,

Bottle. Pours hazy straw with thin short-lived white head. Pleasant but not terribly distinct aroma - lemony, esters with a hint of maybe chocolate or spice. Light bodied and fizzy. Refreshing lemony taste becoming more complex with esters, bread, yeast and a pleasant just slightly bitter finish. Nice easy to drink beer with enough complexity to make it interesting.

Smells sort of lemony and yeasty (duh).  Has a great cloudy pale gold color to it.  Moderate spice in the flavor, good amount of lemony acidity and a great refreshing wheaty character.  Nice carbonation but nothing overboard.  Perfect hot weather beer.
Pours pale yellow with nice fluffy head. Sweet citrus and candy sugar in aroma. Taste is complex, spicy, citrus, with good wheat malts. Great wit bier.

more of this. Pours a cloudy lemon yellow, and smells of yeast. Fun bubbly head with nice depth. Flavour is full of varying characteristics - from stone fruit to coriander, with a very satisfying wheat undertone. Aftertaste is true to flavour. a fantastic wit bier.

Very bright completely cloudy citrus yellow pour. Small pure white head. Sweet lemon citus aroma. Hearty, wonderful full flavor of fruit pulp, and gum sugars. Wow. this beer is really refreshing. And what’s more, it laces well. It starts watery, but end up bursting so much with flavor and fullness it’s rally good.

Pours a cloudy yellow, like lemonade, with a thin soapy head. Yeasty banana aroma with some lemon zest. The flavor is like biting into a lemon peel, you also get that wit yeast it’s very wall balanced. The palate is so smooth and pleasant. This beer is drinkable.
pours a cloudy yellow color with lasting head.  nice taste of spices.  One of the best Belgian Whites that I have had.
I love this beer and always have.  Nice bilowy white head.  Smell of flowers and banana.  Tastes refreshing with citrus and cream.  This is what I like to drink on a nice summer evening.....

Cloudy straw color with a surprising lasting head.  Aroma is very strong with citrus and banana.  Flavor is clean and crisp with taste continuing long after swallowed.  A little sweet for my personal taste, but would probably make for an excellent drink on a warmer day.

a true white beer in the real sense of the word. Pils bitterness flavoured with citrus and lemon but not too many. Herbed with koriander to take away the beginning bitterness in the mouth. A white beer!

A - sweet bubble gum
A - straw and hazzy
F - Sweet 
P - a bit fizzy
O - Not a huge fan of Belgium, but I like this.
Pours a straw color, amazing blend of spices. Definitely is a solid example of a Belgian White. Would and have bought again. I would love to try on tap

Tap from Midtown in the Chicago Loop.  I apparently got the bottom of the barrel as after two pints they were out.  Served with a lemon in an ale glass.  Pretty middle of the road Belgian White Ale.  Cloudy, but crisp.  I would order it again, but wasn’t overwhelmed by it.

On tap at Ginger Man. Has a clear golden color with a medium frothy white head. The aroma is lemon and floral. The taste is banana and orange with a sweet finish. A good belgain white from Hoegaarden.

This beer is extremely popular now, and no wonder.  It’s amazing.  I first had this in a bottle.  Then on draft.  This Belgian White is super smooth.  Aroma is mild.  The appearnce is as sexy as a key lime pie.  It’s mild and topped with a sud bath.  Flavor is zesty, sweet, sour all at once, while also being smooth.  The feel is not at all bitter.  It’s like having a glass of delicious.
probably only white beer i can tolerate, nice and refreshing, I usually get it in a bar, comes with a slice of lemon. Best for hot summer day.
Bottle:Yellow/white hazy colour, with a creamy/laking head. Aroma of citrus, banana, and organge. Flavors is almost the same. Thin body, thin to medium smouth fruity finish.
bottle.  white ale and slightly cloudy.  tastes of hops slight citrus fruit.  overall i found it to be pretty bland.  I imagine this is much better on tap.

Hoegaarden is a very nice Witbier. A hazy, golden yellow color is topped off with an attractive head. Like all Witbiers, this is a refreshing beer with notes of orange and corriander. Unlike most other Witbiers, this drink is not tarnished by distracting flavors.

33 cl. Pours aever so slightly hazy lemony yellow with a towering fluffy platinum blonde head that looks and behaves like beaten egg whites. As a matter of fact, I am still waiting to take my first sip, and I am amusing myself while I wait by starting in on the review. There’s a lovely crisp lemon and grass business on the nose. There’s also a lot of head between me and my beer. I would like some beer now. Eh. It’s Hoegaarden. You’ve had it a million times. Sweet lemon, grass. Slightly creamy, maybe ever so slightly watery. Not much carb. Grassy notes. Spices are almost non-existent, but, then, coriander and orange peel are probably the next agricultural commodities to shoot through the pricing roof in the beer business. They’ve been done more intenesely by now than Hoegaarden’s been doing them. Still, this is a lovely, refreshing, drinkable little beer. What’s wrong with that? Nothing. If you can wait.

Pale yellow/white beer with huge white head. Good quality yeast aroma with citrus and spices. Very bad palate! It is very watery and flat. Very overrated in my opinion. I’ll take the St. Bernadus wit over this any day! Just nothing here to rave about.

Love this beer.  Poured from a 11.2 oz bottle.  A two finger white head.  Aroma of wheat, orange, and spice.  Delicious crisp taste, the perfect summer beer.  Good hops, not too hoppy but perfect for a belgian white.  Big flavor, not watery, but easy to drink.

The beer that all other white beers should be judged against.  A very refreshing, cloudy beer that just begs a hot summer day.  I love the orange and typical wheat flavors.  This is a beer that I could drink all day long.

Yeasty, slightly spicy, aroma jumps out while pouring.  The color is light gold with cloudiness which should characterize a lighter colored beer.  Foam is white and sticks around long enough to quaff.  The flavor is citrusy as expected, good hops and malt, hint of spice.  The body is smooth, creamy with a spicy aftertaste.  This is a good choice when no good dark beers are available.

Elle possède une arôme alléchante décuplant les odeurs fruitées et épicées d’orange, de coriandre et de citron. S’avale comme de l’eau, goût très frais et corsé à la fois. Une des meilleures bières blanches, selon moi.

Bottle with namesake tumbler.  Milky yellow body under a huge creamy head.  Aromas of yeast, hops, wheat and orange peel with perfumey undertones.  Tastes like it smells...Orange, citrus, corriander, water (but not watery).  Sweet and fresh tasting, extremely quaffable.

Hazy pale golden pour with a finger thick clean white head that settles nicely.  Noticeable carbonation.  Spices on the nose with some malt and light fruit.  Not as much spice as I expected from a witbier.  The spice seems to be dulled somehow.  Some stale or dried apple flavor.  Malty aftertaste.
Hoegaarden is synonymous with summertime.  Wherever indulging in this blond elixir, it’ll put a little sunshine in your day.  This is the hallmark of white beers.
Bottle.  Highly overrated beer.  Bland and boring, might as well be drinking something cheaper with more flavor.
Had this beer from the tap, presented a nice color, foamy head. Tasted great a really nice white beer.
On draft. Clean, fruity (blueberries, I think) taste. Good light finish that lingers without overpowering. I haven’t had many whites but I liked this a lot.

bottle. smelled like a white but also smelled like rotten fruit. very cloudy yellow. little white head. lots of carbonation. the taste is kind of odd. tastes like a white but also something else i can’t figure out. very bitter after taste that i just don’t care for. solid white beer. not great but not bad.
Hazy yellow pour.  Moderate frothy head that recedes quickly leaving tight lacing.  Aroma of spices and malt esp coriander.  Tastes sweet with hints of coriander, nutmeg and allspice.
Loved this beer....Very light in color, nice frothy white head, loved the coriander and orange peel smell and taste, light and refreshing

Aroma is Coriander, orange peel, light perfume hops and somee cinnamon. Pour yields a large, frothy, white head with good lacing and decent retention. Body is a light, cloudy, yellow hue. Taste is spicey, but a bit watery. Finishes sour, salty, and yeasty. Slightly creamy mouthfeel with a bit too fizzy carbonation. Not bad.

Pours a cloudy, white forming a thin foamy head.  Aroma of lemons, yeast, corriander and a bit of honey.  Flavour is of four spice, oranges, lemons.  A classic, creamy white beer.  You can taste the history in the beer.  Thankyou our friends in Belgium.

Pale straw color with a thin white head.  Some decent lacing here.  Smells of lemon and spices such as cinnamon and coriander.  Taste is watery, with some classic witbier ester notes and too much spice.  Mouthfeel is overcarbonated and thin.  Pretty easy to drink if they’re cold, but a far cry from the better witbiers.
Cloudy yellow-white color. Extremely refreshing and enjoyable. Aroma of orange and corriander. One of the better Belgian white’s i’ve had.
Cloudy pale yellow color, almost lemonade like look, but with a white head.  citrus aroma, and a pleasantly bitter citrus taste.  Light and refreshing feel make it rather nice.

On Tap at the Winston in Amsterdam.  Nice Belgian character, sweetish, with some spicy coriander, lemons, mandarin oranges, refreshing none-the-less.  Very refreshing, very enjoyable.  

I have had the bottled InBev version in the U.S. and I must assert, the U.S. bottled version sucks.  The European tap version is very much a true Witbier.
Poured a beautiful frothy head on top of an odd cloudy white beer. Strong yeast smell and an outstanding wheat beer flavor. I am very impressed.
Creamy taste, large creamy head. hint of coriander. a little acidic but nice fruity taste also. beautiful beer.

one of the best Witbiers out there. Very intricate flavors with a nice tart kick in the end. Very drinkable, thirst quenching flavor. In the summertime I would grab one of these over a glass of lemonade in a heart beat.

Poured from bottled into pint glass and poured a big head and very yellow. the smell is great, a lot of citrus. A very good warm day beer and the taste is full for a wheat and sticks around for a good after taste.

Pours a slightly cloudy white-golden color with a thick white head.  Great lacing.  Aromas of grain, yeast, spice, fruit and citrus.  Very easy drinking, with a slighlty sweet flavor and medium body.  Great on a hot day!

A dutch beer that is simple to buy in the Netherlands, in a bottle or blik. 

easy drinking beer. Good nice golden color.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur jaune pâle et légèrement voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (citron, notes de bananes vertes), d’épices (coriandre, léger de clou de girofle), léger de blé avec des traces de gomme balloune et de houblon herbeux. Plutôt mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen (notes croustillantes) ainsi qu’une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées aux petites notes acides (agrumes, surtout citron, notes de bananes vertes) accompagné d’un goût épicé (coriandre, clou de girofle) et de notes de gomme balloune lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût légèrement asséchant de blé ainsi que des traces de pain puis en finale l’on retrouve également des notes amères de houblon herbeux (herbe mouillée) et de levures. Post-goût moyen et aux petites notes sèches, légèrement amer de levures fruitées (zest d’agrumes)avec des notes de houblon herbeux ainsi qu’un léger goût de blé.

The touch of citrus in the background makes this a great staple of a beer.  It pours with a three finger lacey head, an inspiring cloud of a body, satisfying finish, with ample flavor, neither bitter nor sweet.   Well-balanced treat for enjoyment alone or with light fare.  A real fave for me.

Pale yellow cloudy color with a white head. Aroma: Spices, yeast, lemons, wheat and banana. Flavor: Spices, yeast, wheat, lemonade, citrus, banana, white bread and a light sourness. Light bodied. A refreshing and easy to drink summer beer. Re-rated 090425.

Bottle poured into a chalice produced a cloudy light yellow body toped by a good two fingers worth of head that turns to lace 

Aromas of Belgian yeast citrus and spices 

Tastes are a mild sweet citrus and bananas mild spice bitter 

Nice light mouthfeel 

I drank a lot of hops today and wanted a change. I always have a Belgian Witbier around for nights like these. This one is a very respectable Witbier and always easy to find at a good price too. Along with being very drinkable
12 oz bottle, thanks Jared.  Poures a yellow haze.  Decent frothy head and smells of orange.  Decent Belgian White, I enjoyed this much more than Blue Moon.

pours a murky yellow-golden color with a white head.  aroma has a lot of malt, chalky dust, citrus, and a smidge of pine.  taste is malty, spice/clove, with citrus undertones.  interesting.  very good style-wise.  mid-full bodied with a thick mouthfeel.  fizzy carbonation.  finish is pretty quick, with a light malty flavor left on the palate.  would go nicely on a hot summer day, but would also work nicely on a snowy winter day.  nice, would buy again.

A uniquely satisfying beer.  Immediate hints of spice and cloves.  Slight citrus flavor that is both refreshing and substantial.  Crisp finish with a sweet aftertaste.  A beer than needs to be tried multiple times to truly appreciate.

This is my go-to beer on a hot day.  Every bottle has a great vigorous head to begin with, followed by a golden cloudy beer with a distinct citrus/ grass/ coriander flavor.  Well balanced and very tasty.  The  standard by which I judge wheat beers.
Very nice light and refreshing beer. Oranges present on every sip, but no overpowering. If I were to have a beer for breakfast, this would be near the top of the list.
From a bottle.  Pours golden yellow and hazy.  Aroma of sweet citrus.  Flavor is a good balance of citrus and spice.  good belgian white.  Great drinkability.
i am a big fan of the wits and this is a good one. clove, orange yeasty beer with a nice head to it. Very refreshing
Nothing against this beer per se but I happen to find the yeasty, banana wheat flavor of whites to be quite unpleasant

this is the best tasing beer i’ve ever had... the only drawback is i get acid reflux if i drink more than 10 of them.. other than that its fucking perfect... if anyone knows of a better beer please let me know asap...
Light yellow, hazy. Crisp aroma of citrus. Very refreshing flavor, wheat with the fruity crispiness. Classic, model example of it’s type.

SLIGHT ORANGE TASTE WITH A BELGIUM WITBIER STYLE. BLUEMOON BY COORS IS DECENT COPY BUT HOEGAARDEN IN STILL THE BEST. BEST IN A GLASS .FOLLOW THE POURING INSTRUCTIONS ON THE BACK OF THE BOTTLE POUR SHAKE GARNISH WITH AN ORANGE ITS HEAVEN ON A HOT SUMMER DAY.
Botella. comprada en supermercado. Muy buen cuerpo. Muy buena. Para tomar una cada noche.
Citrussy, cloudy.  Light yelllow.  Very light tasting with classic wheat and citrus flavor.  A refreshing drink, quallity brew.  It’s a beer to relax with -rather than a beer to party hard with.

poured from bottle into mug.. cloudy yellow color with nice foamy head.. pleasant citrusy-wheaty scent to it.. very smooth blend of citrus/spices with the subtle wheat flavor.. doesnt linger on the palate too long and overall a very good beer

Poured from a bottle to a weizen glass. Opaque yellow color with an inch of head on it. Nice, sweet smell. Had the typical citrus melange in the taste, along with the wheat. Had a sweet taste to match its smell. Highly carbonated. A decent beer, highly drinkable.
Bottle at home ... hazy yellow ... big foam head ... very wheaty little bubble gum ... overfizzy ... good well balanced banana wheat... this is actually quite a good wheat and better than i expected.

Muito boa essa cerveja de trigo - bem diferenciada das suas co-irmãs. Coloração amarelo esverdeado, muito bonita de se ver. Espuma branca, sem muita consistência. Aroma cítrico, lembrando limões. Uma cerveja aveludada, refrescante e suave. Sabor de frutas cítricas e suave amargor no retrogosto. Vale a pena pelo custo benefício dado pela Ambev.
one of the first good beers i tried.  nice golden/orange color.  it looks like it tastes. oranges. very refreshing. nice beach beer.

Very soft aroma.
Turbid pale golden colour.
Soft and very refreshing flavor with bitter notes in the end.
Very soft beer to drink with soft meals, or to refresh on summer.
(In Spain many people mixes it with lemon).

This is by far my favorite beer of all time, i would suggest this to anyone, regardless of there prefrence on beer styles, of course i am probably biased because witbier is my favorite style. It pours very cloudy with a nice white head. It almost has a lemon lime smell to it along with hint of lemon zest in the flavor, very drinkable beer with a wonderful after taste as well. One of the few beers i’ll drink with breakfast.

Now here’s one I was certain I’d rated previously.  I’ve been to the brewery for cryin’ out loud.  This rated from a draft glass at KClinger’s.  Pale and hazy yellow with a thin veil of bright white foam.  Mellow overall with a vaguely creamy and velvety feel.  Classic, of course.  (#3283, 1/10/2008)
pale yellow pour with a nice white head.  mainly fruits on the nose.  mostly carbonation and a very interesting fruity taste.
Hazy yellow coloured beer, no carbonation, medium white head. Fresh palate ending a little bitter, light some metal taste. This beer drinks easy, very good for a white beer.
Hazy pale golden with medium head. Yeasty and wheaty aroma with coriander notes. Fruity flavor with orange peel and coriander. Refreshing on those hot summer days.
Tap at blend.  Pours hazy gold with a thin white head.  Coriander and wheat strong in the aroma and flavor.  A nice citrus funk as well.  Sourish going down,  decent carbonation.  Not bad.

~Big creamy white head. Decent lacing.
Creamy white colour. Lots of carbonation and some particles floating.
~Strong corriander and orange peel aroma.
~Sweet and cinnamony taste.
~Very light beer. Refeshing.
~Sometimes I like this beer and sometimes I can barely finish it. Might be better when its hot
out.

The quintissential summer beer. Drank it quite often both bottles and tap in Philadelphia. Got a bottle of it in Fes, Morocco, on Christmas eve. Golden color, decent head. Light tasting, without syrupy aftertaste. Vague accents of spices could go unnoticed with food. The thought of beer with fruit in it used to repulse me, but this beer changed my mind; served cold with a piece of lemon, makes any summer night calm and pleasant. I will drink this till the day they dump me in the ground.
12.oz. bottle. Has a cloudy, straw color with a decent head. Reeks of a spiced up polish sausage.Has a tangy, tart, sour lemon and clove-spice flavor to go with the sausage taste.Light bodied.
Uma witbier bastante agradável, com presença de banana. Refrescante. Final longo e levemente azedo.
Pours to a white head that emitted citrousy aromas. The flavor was sweet initially, and I tasted carbonation, with a dry finish. Very pleasant beer.
Very smooth and refreshing with a citrus finish. Good in a bottle but way better on tap.
Cloudy yellow with medium head. Citrus aroma. Medium carbonation, notes of corrainder. Great summer beer, not as much so on a crisp wintery day.

Draught.  Poured to a light yellow with a fully white head.  Low to medium body with allot of fizz.  Wheaty aroma with citrus notes.  Fizzy beginnig, with a citrus & wheaty middle ending with a crisp aftertaste.  Very light and well balanced, not overpowering but maybe a little too watery.  Good summer drink.
Draft. Orange beer served with fruits on top. Smells fruity, tastes fruity, even sounds fruity. Good, but all in all weak. Easy to drink though and flavorful.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL for $1.79 Good!

Bottle. Pours a hazy light yellow with a white head. Weak aroma/nose, slight hints of fruit. Flavour is banana, coriander, yeast. Beer seems watery. Highly rated by most raters here, but I find it a bit boring, to be honest.
bottle. soft foamy head,slowly fading.Nice lacing, cloudy maize body. citrus tang over yeasty body.very refreshing my fave in summer

bottle.  small white fizzy head (mostly dissapating) into cloudy banana yellow body.  aromas of wheat, oraganges, corriander, and yeast.  flavor is a mildly sweetness with a touch of bitterness (bitterness is all that is left in finish).  speaking of finish- lasted a moderate amount of time.  refreshing belgian white.

Poured from a bottle. Nice fizzy head that faded to a ring that lasted throughout. Lots of carbonation. Has a citrus whannnng. Would be better in the summer. Has a very light touch on the tongue. Kind of spicy citrus flavor, a little sour note on the end. Very drinkable.
bottled and on tap in the UK. Cloudy pale yellow, fruity nose. Fruity and wheaty, slightly sweet and hoppy. Hints of coriander, orange peel and fruit.

Looks almost like a lemonade with a huge white billowy head. Smells like a hefeweizen, lightly spiced and citrusy. I really enjoyed the taste: very refreshing with coriander and citrus (orange peel) notes, but much less of a belgian wit than a hefeweizen taste. Really watery, but not in a bad way. Rather, this is a beer I would love to drink by the bucket all summer after working outside. Totally delicious and refreshing.

330ml bottle.

Pours a yellow grey with a very white head. Aroma of yeast, lemon and light fruits. Tastes citrusy with present coriander. Very refreshing as wheats go. Light and spritzy feel. I like it.
Bottle. wheat,bread and citric aroma, nice white head and yellow color. the flavor of citric is not too acid, but a light sweetness. A good witbier.
Very creamy body. Nice and citrus heavy beer and very yeasty but not too bready. Very thin body though. Uncommon for a yeasty beer.
Smells spicy and yeasty with nice citrus wheat aroma. Pours a light milky/cloudy yellow color. Taste is a little watery with a nice bready citrus yeast taste, lemon notes. Nice, just a little watery.
Very white body and head. Very spiced aroma, with yeast, lemon and coriander. Nice citruous taste, with the same spices as the aroma. It seems a little watered, but it’s nice anyway.

12 oz bottle from The Airliner (Iowa City, IA). I’ve had this before, but never rated. Poured into the appropriate glass. Pours an extremely light champagne-esque yellow that is lightly clouded with an extremely prominent bright white head that is inviting. Smells of wheat, coriander, and citrus. Initial taste is light, a nice sweetness that has its moments of flair. Wheat, orange, coriander, and some other mild spiciness make this a very nice, albeit light, selection. A great Wit!
Draft in Brussels. Lovely colour with plenty of spices in the aroma. Plenty of flavour. This beer is better draught than bottle.

(Bottle) Pours hazy yellow. The aroma is spicy, yeasty and citric fruity with tones of coriander, white pepper, ginger, orange, orange peel and mild lemon/lime. The flavour is wheaty, citric and spicy with coriander, white pepper,
oranges and mild lime. Wheat, yeast, fruits and spices lingers a bit. Lively carbonated, light acidic, light sweet and light bitter. Light to medium bodied.

Aromas of spice, especially clove and citrus.  The color is light yellow almost pale with a creamy egg white head.  The taste is that of wheat, clove, & banana, finishing with a citrus tang.  A little bit sweet and tart at the same time.  Nothing too strong.  It might taste better if the spice flavor bit a little harder.  The palate comes off as light body, creamy, slightly spicy, and easy to drink.

This beer style is one of my favorites and Hoegaarden doesn’t disappoint.  It makes for great summer drinking or anytime you want a bit of spice.
Pours almost completley white with a white head.  Smells of banana, and cloves.  tastes spicy with a ncie wheat undertone.

So this is thee wit--Poured a soapy, hazy pale yellow with a dispersing white head.  Nose of lemons, orange peels,  and wheat.  Mild tangy and sour flavor.  Bready and super sessionable. Great summer beer.

Appearance: Pours a lightly hazed, pale yellow body with a fizzy, short-lived white head.

Smell: Fairly reserved aroma of malted wheat, lemon juice, coriander, and a faint, far-off yeastiness.

Taste: Doughy wheat flavor with a subtle sweetness. Sour lemons. Hint of coriander and a pinch of celery salt. There’s a light acidity on the quick finish.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Light, fizzy carbonation.

Drinkability: A suitable witbier, but the flavors are so light as to bypass refreshing and wind up being bland.

Thick yellow pour with a good sized white head.  Sweet orange nose to it.  Flavor is honey dipped oranges that are dusted with coriander.  Finish is slightly sour, yet very refreshing.  Finally I got to try this!

Draught in Hobune & Stoori, Tallinn- Golden and hazy in colour with the typical Witbier appearance.  Lemons and spices in the the fairly floral aroma.  A bit tangy on the tongue with lemons, spices and banana detected in the taste with a pleasant aftertaste. Very refreshing even in Estonia in the winter!

A nice witbier, definitely one of my favourites. A bit spicy, with a distinguishing taste of orange, coriander and clove. Well, now I drank this in the winter, but I’m pretty sure it’s more suitable in the summer.

Poured very pale - nice aromas but muted relative to other wheats I’ve had...smooth taste on tongue, not much going on in terms of carbonation - which is good for this style...sweet aftertaste with a bit of sour lingering - a good summer beer, probably - I just drank it in the winter...

This is really good stuff, I’ve been so focused on big IPA’s and stouts/porters/winter brews I’d forgotten.  Pours with pleasant yellow cloudiness.  Smells sweet, clean and with flowers in the background.  Tastes clean, fresh, crisp with hints of orange and coriander not overpowering.  Ends with a clean sour finish.  Can’t wait for summer.

Served with lemon slice -- ughh.

Refreshing, citrus aroma.  Nicely balanced, delicate flavor.

Hoegaarden is a hazy, pale pearish yellow beer with a small, airy head that quickly dissipates.  It looks quite lively and has nice dense lacing.  The boquet is spicy and citrusy.  It smells a lot like starfruit and coriander.  The sweet fruity tone rings like a bell.  It’s so smooth and solid in the nose.  It’s smooth and foamy in the mouth.  It’s on the light side of medium-bodied.  Refreshing and soothing.  It has a dry finish.  The tart, fruity tone of the yeast hands things off to the sour dough malt and then to the lemony hops.  A sweetness lies beneath  Wow!  It’s smooth, assertive, quenching and clever.  It’s so easy to punish pitchers of this!  This is what a witbier should taste like!
Pours a golden color with a thick white foamy head. Aroma of fruit, yeast, corriander and clove. Tatse is spicy. Very light, kind of watery. A liitle over rated!
I thought I had already rated this one. Definitely reminiscent of most Belgian/North German brews I’ve had. Refreshing and pleasing, though admittedly simple. Worthwhile and non-filling.
Poured a lighter golden with minimal head.  Flavor was very light which made this one go down easily.  Good if your looking for something to quench your thirst.
On tap; thought I already had rated this one a long time ago.  Have had it alot and it is the classic version of the style for me and reminds me of the week I spent in Belgium.  Very enjoyable.
Pale golden cloudy body, good sized head. Aroma is orange coriander and dough. Flavor is much more of the same with a sweet aftertaste. Light bodied, creamy texture. Good summer beer.

Pours a cloudy light yellow, with a thin white head. Aroma of coriander and lemon zest most present. Flavours of wheat, orange, and a touch of spice fromt the coriander. A very drinkable, very thirst quenching beer.
11.2oz.  I drank this bier throughout the summer.  It definitely went well with the bbq’s and heat in SoCal.  I look forward to next summer and another round!!!

Cloudy gold pour with a beautiful head if you pour the bottle right!  Aroma is wheaty and citrusy with some light spice accents.  Super refreshing flavor has the coriander hints along with the bready flavors.  Something about this Wit just rings with me...I could drink these all summer (and winter I guess).  Pleasant on the palate as well, nothing bad to say about this bier.  Oh yeah, pronounce it right, its Who-Gar-Den!
Very refreshing, delicious flavor without being too overwhelming in the coriander/orange peel flavors. Very light yellow color (almost looks white).

On tap. Pours hazy light gold, big foamy head producing intricate lacing.  Aroma of citrus, clove and yeast.  Taste is delicious - hints of banana, clove , coriander and citrus, light hops, woven into an amazing tapestry of full flavored goodness.
Pours a cloudy hazy yellow.  Smells of lemon and wheat.  Very wheat like taste.  I think the best word to describe this beer is zesty.  Very refreshing and yummy.
Bottle. Cloudy pale color. Citrus and wheat aroma. Hints of lemon/orange. Great, refreshing beer.

Can 33 cl. A cloudy pale yellow with a white fastfading head. Tastes fresh with hints of citrus, malt and wheat with a fresh aftertaste. A good white beer, but to "plain" for my taste, I like it a bit more complex
A light golden cloudly beer. On the nose is spice wheat and citrus. The is wheaty slightly spicey with a citrus finish. This has to be one of my favorite belgian white beer.

This is my favorite Belgian white. The appearance is pleasantly golden and cloudy. It tastes fruity with coriander spice and has the most unique finish. It’s almost as if the taste wraps up and disappears after you’ve swallowed, compelling you to take the next sip. This will surely win over beginner beer drinkers.
great beer unique in flavor and appearance even the names awesome  over all very enjoyable . a bit pricey though

33cl bottle at VG.   Very pale cloudy yellow with a medium white head.   Distinct banana and spice aroma, with some wheaty tartness too.   Very refreshing and crisp mouthfeel.   Flavors are not too assertive, but the balance of wheaty sweetness with the spice and orange works well.   Pleasant for a light refresher and very sessionable.

Rated while drinking: Pours a peach-yellow color with a huge, almost overflowing, white head. Lots of wheat and yeast on the nose. Pretty fragrant, but not much more than that. Flavor is a conglomeration of wheat at the beginning, while spices begin to speak up halfway through the middle and ride into the aftertaste. Nice! A tad bit of carbonation gives this beer a bit of a feel, but it’s very crisp and dries out the mouth just a bit so that you need to take another sip. Definitive and appealing, if you reach for a Blue Moon before this, check into a hospital.

bottle.  Excellent Belgian white.  pours a bright hazy golden almost like lemonade... with a half inch white head.  pleasant citrus, light spice, banana and a touch of sour in the aroma... medium body with citrus and sweetness up front.... a bit of Belgian yeast carries over the mouth... smoothes out towards the back with a touch of sour apple on the finish along with a burst of lemon.  nice refreshing summer beer.

I can’t figure out which is my favorite summer beer, this or Paulaner Hefewiezen. But there’s nothing I like better on a warm summer afternoon than to sit outside at a beer garden and work my leisurely way through several of these with lemon. When they don’t have this or Paulaner Hefewiezen, I’m kind of annoyed because it’s all I want. Hanging out and talking to friends, drinking these, it just yields a perma-grin. I imagine the purists scoff at the lemon, but it just came with it the first time I ordered it and it was great. So refreshing. And the lemon seeds rise up and down in it as the bubbles form and pop. This is a thirst-quenching beer with excellent fresh flavor. And yet it’s somehow also just a bit warm in the throat (spice?), inside or simultaneous with the chill. Really this review is fungible with Paulaner Hefewiezen so I’ll post the same thing there. I like the ghostly paleness of this one and it’s lighter. Maybe spicier. Those waitresses need to stop erroneously correcting my correct pronunciation of this word. Get thee to Belgium, woman!

Pours a pale milky golden color. Aroma is a potent sweet, citrus flavor.Tastes amazing. Crisp, but full, sweet, but balanced. Flavorful but balanced. Definitely the one of best witbiers Ive ever had. I recommend to everyone.

Hoegaarden (bottle) is really pale (I drank it on Halloween...should I say it was a ghostly pale?), even for a witbier, with the usual haziness and a sufficient white head. The aroma is pretty tame. The taste has got just about everything a witbier should, and the flavors (citrus, spice, wheat) are really moderate and well-balanced. And, the mouthfeel is incredibly refreshing. I’m pleasantly surprised by this brew.
pours a cloudy golden yellow with a light white head. Nice aroma with a great citrus flavor with a smooth finish. A great summer beer
Quite carbonated. A lemon flavor dominates, followed by the spice. slight nose of banana. I’d prefer something thicker and yeastier.

Very carbonated. Lemon flavours dominate, with bread and slight spice undertones. Very light feel in the mouth, wish it was a bit more solid and a bit less sweet. Seems like a wheat beer for the lager drinker
This is the best wit beer I have tasted.  Nice and refreshing beer.  Just the right spicyness and yeasy breadyness.
On tap at Yard House, Long Beach.  Lemonade looking pour with diminishing white head.  Tastes like a hefeweizen with more citrus/lemon than wheat.  Just ok to my taste.

bottle:  This beer tastes like it looks, pale yellow, cloudy with puffy white head.  I taste more lemon than banana, and the spiciness isn’t as earthy as cloves. I’ve always found this a little on the thin & sour side both in mouthfeel & finish which is why I prefer Erdinger - Hoegaarden is kind of like a watered-down Erdinger.  Even the Hacker-Pschorr are superior German products with similar style but superior execution.

Pours a hazy straw yellow with a puffy and lasting head.  Aroma is bready and yeasty with some nice spicy hints.  Flavor is slightly tart but mild.  Mouthfeel is smooth and refreshing...more so than Bud Light could ever dream of being.  Probably the best witbier I’ve ever had.  Really really nice!

Pours a very pale white with yellow hues. The head is medium creamy and offwhite. The aroma is very citrusy, lemongrass, orange peel, sweet and sour wheat, nice aroma. The flavor was similar. Tastes very citrusy, lemon zest, oranges, sweet and sour wheat, coriander. The palate is mellow with a crisp carbonation. Tasty belgian white.

330mL bottle. Wonderful aroma, very mild yet still leaves an impression. Appearance is wonderful, hazy and enticing. Tastes like lime, bananas, and even a bit of vanilla. Exceptional for a commercial beer, a must have outdoors.

330ml bottle.  Aroma is yeasty.  Large white head that mostly diminished and left little  lace.  Pale yellow with a white haze in the sparkling body.  Flavor is sweet and yeasty with a little citrus.  Palate is light and lively with a short finish.  It’s ok but a lot of yeasty Belgian flavors.  Good example of the style.
[bottle] pale, hazy, bubbly. a little spice. not my favorite example of the style, but not bad. good session.

Striking color when poured.  Looks unfiltered and very cloudy.  The head is white and fluffy.  The taste is sweet but not overpowering.  I don’t taste the banana everyone else talks about, but there is something fruit like about this beer.  It is easy to drink, tastes good and is complex.  This is one of the better beers I’ve had in a while.  Still...nothing that I’ll probably get again.  It just doesn’t hit my right spot.
Bottle: Very good.  White with a small head.  Fruity (citrus) and spicy aroma and flavor.

On tap, from old notes.  Hazy bright yellow with stark white foam.  Fairly flat aroma with a little malt and some coriander.  Too much candied banana in the flavor, little bit of coriander and some tartness.  Always looks refreshing, alway disappoints in the end.
Pale yellow color with good head and foam lacing.  Mildly cloudy in the class it has a clean flavor with spicy undertones.  Refreshing and easy to enjoy.

on tap @House of Brews NY-pours a white head that laces and cloudy, murky straw color.  Aroma is banana, clove, some wheat.  Taste is banana, clove, wheat, secondary spice (saaz?) hops.  Smooth.  OK effervescence.

330ml bottle served chilled, bb 21/09/08. Sweetish orange zest on the nose, some spice, corriander obviously, slight overall sourness to it. Pours a oddly appealing hazy straw body with fluffy white head and lace. Light bodied, creamy carbonation, some tartness on the tongue. Intruigingly complex flavour to it, orange and lemon rind, unripe banana, subtle honey-like sweetness, spice towards the finish, coriander and clove, but nothing overpowering. Finishes relatively dry with a hint of fresh lemonade-like tartness. A nicely flavoured, easy drinking beer and certainly one of the most unique mainstream beers out there. Probably not for everyone but lives up to its name and reputation.

On tap.  Nice sweet coriander aroma.  Light yellow cloudy appearance with a white head.  Very light but somewhat complex with the spices forming a large portion of the flavor profile.  Refreshing and it is hard to drink just one.  One of the best white beers around.
a nice citrus flavor - comparable to blue moon - pours a golden yellow with a white head.

Pours a pale, opaque yellow with a short white head.  Tastes a little citrus-y with a nice sweet yeasty aroma.

12 oz. bottle
On tap at Elysian Brewing Seattle Guest brew, pours out a cloudy white topped with a white head. Great sweet aroma. Very nice spice and belg yeast.
500ml, from tap. Light yellow, mead coloured (not clear). Aromas of mead, citrus and yeast. Taste is sour, very mild and bland. Yeast taste and odd fluor taste. Not my kind of beer.
Bottle. Pours lemon colored with good head, good lacing. Fruity taste and aroma. This is an old standard.

Light malt aroma with hints of graininess. Hazy pale golden color with a medium white head and slightly fizzy. Tastes of lemon and coriander. Starts slightly bitter and become sweet in the finish. Palate is as light as the color of this beer.

Had this beer on 5/5/2004.  Aroma is light and fresh.  Color is a light pale hazy yellow with good carbonation and a tight head.  Taste is light and refreshing.  Starting with a light body it goes down clean and light.  Finish is a genteel sour flavor with a faint hint of spice.  It’s not as good as Ceils but it is a good White.

Bottle Aroma is the classic note of orange and coriander followed by some sweet breadlike notes. Appearance is hazy straw with a moderate white head. Flavor is a very even blend of orange,  coriander and sweet/sour wheat malt. Overall, always easy drinking and the Wit that defines the style

29-May-07 (12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Hoegaarden is what I consider the de facto standard for the style, the beer I compare all other Belgian wits to.  It has all the right flavors -- coriander, orange peel, lemon, yeast, wheat malts, gentle hops -- and all in perfect balance.  Just a hint of sweetness lurks behind the mild bitterness of the spice and orange peel.  The only improvement I’d like to see is a stronger finish: the finish isn’t watery, but most of the flavors trail off considerably, leaving just a mild bitterness to linger on the palate.  Light in body, medium carbonation, wonderfully clean and refreshing.  The nose is mostly spices along with background wheat, though there’s a hint of banana esters from the yeast.  Pale straw in color with a fair amount of haze.  The white head is small on the pour, but takes several minutes to settle to a wide ring.  There aren’t many Belgian whites that are better than Hoegaarden.  It’s a great beer.

Bouteille. Couleur jaune assez foncée, voilée. Belle mousse épaisse et compacte formant de belles traces sur le verre, s’estompe très lentement. Arôme de levure, légèrement épicé, agrumes. Corps plutôt mince, effervescence moyenne. Goût sucré, blé, levures, légèrement coriandre. Arrière goût légèrement surette. Rafraichissant.
Bottle. Very pale hazy yellow with a bright white head. Very, very sour nose. Sour tang with lasting spice finish.

Draft: A nice cloudy pale yellow.  A nice whispy citrus on the nose.  Stringy consistent lacing.  Sweet and tangy with a mellow spicieness that was easily drinkable and refreshing.  Alcohol is not noticable.  After three of these, anyone should have a smile on their face.

Pours a very pale, cloudy yellow. Loads of orange in the aroma. Little effervescence. Very smooth and easy to drink -- the sweetness is not overpowering. Spices begin to show as the beer warms. The wheat flavour seems a little subdued, allowing the citrusy flavours to take hold. Finishes short.
citrus, herbs, earthy, cloudy, pale, white foam, light body, lively. My favorite beer.
Smooth all the way down. This beer is smooth, but filling, altough light at the same time. A well-rounded beer with a subtle, but nice taste. I quite enjoyed it.

9/18/07 On draught.  Aroma is the classic note of resiny orange and coriander followed by some sweet breadlike notes.  Appearance is hazy straw with a moderate white head.  Flavor is a very even blend of orange, peppery coriander and sweet/sour wheat malt.  Mouthfeel is spritzy and light bodied.  Overall, always easy drinking and the Wit that defines the style.

12oz - BB 29/10/08 - Aroma is attractive bready yeast, cotton candy, orange peel and touch of spice.  Pours cloudy pale yellow with a small head and great lacing.  Flavor is mild but refreshing.  Sweet bread with just a touch of orange and spice.  Palate is thin and tart.  Not a bad session brew.
Pleasantly surprised, especially considering it was take-out from a local dive. Love the citrus flavor, can’t wait to get it again.

pours a cloudy yellow with a two finger fluffy white head. aroma is yeast and little of coriander, orange peel and hops. has a light to medium body with descent lacing and carbonation. flavor is the same as aroma. is a little sweet and sour combo on the tougue but yet a little silky as well. it is a little acidic but not to bad of a witbier.
pours hazy yellow with a big white head. this is a classic begian wit. its terrific i dont need to tell you about it you need to go and get one right now. and so do i..........

Bottle. Malts smells of light bread, hops of lemon, and moderate yeast notes of dough and mustiness, with pineapple in the background. White fizzy/creamy head that’s mostly lasting with good lacing, color is hazy pale grayish yellow. Flavor starts moderately acidic and finishes moderately acidic, lightly bitter and a touch acetic. Palate is medium, dry/watery with a lively carbonation and finishes lightly astringent. A very refreshing yet rich witbier.
Hazy yellow beer with with a creamy white lacy head. Fruity aroma. Mainly citrus. . Flavour is dominated by the citrus as well. Notes of oranges. A mild sourness as well. Very refreshing.

Very pale colour, really almost white. A good head that lives long enough.
Aroma is mainly citrus, with coriander and floral notes. Flavour has some acidity, but silky. Taste of citrus, floral notes, coriander, a bit hot.
One of the best anod more refreshing beers, wonderful as an aperitif or just alone in hot days.
2017 edit: Nowadays, this is beer has nothing to do of what it used to be. Website recomends you to drink in a chilled glass, that says everything.

Floral notes with coriander and hops evident. Huge foaming white head. Pours pale yellow, some carbonation. Lightly hopped in the mouth with not much malt present. Wheat and yeast are discernible. Lightly balanced but not really my style of wheatbeer. I think Germans do this sort of thing far better - Paualner Hefeweisse.
Ive got to rerate this one.  Smells of citrus and yeast.  Thick head on the pour. Nice mild flavor, citrus again with moderate carbonation.  Very refreshing beer.

it is chalky and has an essence of root vegetable. it is interesting when poured. sadly for me the intrigue ends there. the sour and citrus combined with that sweetish chalky tang does little to balance that vegetable flavored wheat preparation in there. id rather have  a v8!

33cl bottle. Hoegaarden is a light and refreshing beverage that would nicely suit a warm summer’s afternoon. It is cloudy and pale yellow in colour with a nice white head. Both it’s flavour and aroma are sweet fruity on top but with a citric undertone. Mildy pleasant but little more in my opinion.

(6/3/4/3/8)

Re-rate: 20/11/08 - 75cl bottle. Cloudy, orangey yellow with a huge fluffy white head. Yeasty aroma on top of a citric tone. More yeast in the flavour department with thirst quenching fruity qualities. Light in body with a mild bitterness, but very short finish. The flavours subdue after the first few sips but this is so much better the 2nd time around.
10/16/05 Draft. Provence, FR. Golden with white head. Sweet coriander banana aroma. Light refreshing citrus banana but quick ending and thin body.
Completely true to description of sweet and sour. Less head than many Belgians. Cloudy straw color.
solid white beer.  everything is present- citrus and coriander, good carbonation, refreshing.  i like it, but i’ve had better.  still, it is amongst the better whites.

Light and refreshing for the summer.  Bit of a head, very little smell and if anything a touch of sour citrus at the start.  Balanced out by light bitterness.  Overall thin, but not unexpected for the style.
This immediately jumps to the head of the "how did I not rate this already?" category.  If you have something bad to say about Hoegaarden, get lost.  The best example of a very, very good style.

Pours a hazy golden with nice foamy pure white head.  Nose of hay, some slight fruity esters which grow stronger as the beer warms.  A fizzy mouthfeel but without a body or a bold flavor to match, can be very refreshing on a warm summer day, but really a seasonal beer.  Coriander comes through much stronger than orange peel.
Not a big fan of these white Belgians.  Very fruity and some bars will garnish with a lemon or orange.  The citrus tones are strong and sweet which gives this beer a unique flavor.

0.33l bottle. Pale murk yellow bodywith relatively think foam. Strong aroma of banana, coriander and many other things...Flavor is nice very full, but again more like juice with beer. Some malt is present quite sweet. Palate is simply great, very long following the taste. Very good beer, but a bit too fruity for my taste.

On tap at Benny’s in Waterloo. Taps a nice hazy gold, white a tiny white head. Indistinct aroma. Taste is mostly sweet and sour, orange peel is actually evident, which is pleasant. Finish is fruity and estery with a lingering sweet aftertaste. Nothing out of this World, but a pretty solid beer for sure.

Moderately strong and well balanced aroma of coriander, clove, and banana. Milky yellow color with a thick sudsy head. Clove and coriander flavor. Rather thin mouthfeel. Quiet and clean finish. This is quite good and well made.

Note to AMC, it IS possible to mass produce a quality beer.

On tap in a pitcher. Pours a cloudy golden-yellow with a big, frothy head that sticks around a while. Aroma is strong, with orange notes. The flavor is a bit weaker, with citrus being the strongest characteristic. Not bad for the price, but just an average beer in my opinion.
Wheaty taste with citrus accents. A refreshing summer beer, and a good option compared with a lot of the macros on tap.
I think it is the standard for witbier but as an absolute avid wheat beer loyalist I say go German(Hefewiezen).
16oz can. nose of coriander and wheat, cirtusy. flavor is pleasent, wheaty and ctirus with touch of pepper. refreshing and balanced. still a solid wit.

On tap at Pocono Brewing Co.  Arrived at the table a cloudy pale gold with a thin white head that faded to a ring after a few sips.  Light but pleasant aroma of orange and lemon.  Flavor was also lemon and orange with some wheat also.  Not much bitterness to speak of.  Light-medium bodied.  Very enjoyable.

I cant remember how many times Ive had this brew. Very crisp and refreshing, especially on tap, complemented by some type of citrus on the side of the glass. Lightly fruity but not overpowering. Not much else to say here that has not already been said, but I prefer the bigger beers over these types.
This was an outstanding beer.  Quite expensive  to buy by the 6-pack, but worth every penny.  My wife even liked this one.  You can definately taste the orange.  This is probably one of my favorites.
Simply the best thing about summer is getting to enjoy this great beer. I could easily drink a truckload of these - and usually try....

One of my favorites. Enhanced with a lemon, but unlike Corona, does not require the fruit addition. Its crisp front end is pleasing, but followed by an amazing aftertaste. I love Belgian Ales, and this is one of the best.
bottle. cloudy yellow pour. lingering head.  light body. fizzy. definate coriander.

Name: White

Date: 04/04/1996

Mode: Draft

Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs



cloudy yellow, whispy head fruity aroma, good dose of orange, hint of spicyness, complex fruity flavor, slightly sweet, touch of citrus, just a hint of clove, low bitterness

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: White

Date: 08/17/2005

Mode: bottle



good lemony spicy aroma, light body, good citrus character, touch of spicyness, the benchmark wit



Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20

Rating: 3.4/5.0
Score: ***/4

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

330 ml bottle Pale milky yellow in the glass, billowing head that flatten sout quickly. Generously typical aromas with that wheat base plus the dominant spicy, a touch of lemon and earthy dryness. Give them credit, for a mass worldwide produced beer to be at 89% by style says something - the Guinness of Witbiers

the aroma was a little overwhelming with hoppyness.  this beer was a better starter than finisher, as it went down smooth, but had a bit of a funky aftertaste, as well as depreciation in taste as the more you drank.  not a bad beer, but i would probably never buy it again.

20 oz draught 

5.0% ABV 

I tried this beer on August 30, 2007 at ’Houston’s Steak and Ribs’ in Toronto.  The beer was a hazy yellow colour with a very white head that persisted throughout the experience.  The aroma was a combination of wheat and malt.  The mouthfeel was slightly carbonated with some medium-bodiedness.  The flavour was wheaty with hints of malt.  A good beer, but not a great beer.
Pours a bright yellow.  It smells of wheat, yeast, and posesses a slightly sour note.  The mouthfeel is very creamy and the flavory is light, a bit fruity, with an acidic sourness hidden in between.

Bottle.  Very cloudy yellow - and quite static, doesn’t move at all (it seems paused).  Very long lasting head.  Smells awful, like garbage (banana peel and all). Clovey hell.  Don’t like the flavor - way too much clove and not enough sweetness to balance it out.  Taste isn’t nearly as overpowering as the smell.  Overall, not the worst beer I’ve had, but not quite mediocre.
A good belgian white beer.   A cloudy white appearence when poured, foamy head.  Very citrusy aroma, with a sweety/sour taste.   Prefer  the tap to bottle

A classic, but just tastes similar to every hefeweizen and wit I’ve had before.  Not bad, but nothing unique other than the freakishly long lasting head.  Coriander, clove and lemon tastes, light bodied, wheaty and easy to drink if you like those flavors in beer.  A bit bland, but ok.
Refreshing summer brew.  Light but flavorful.  Smooth & creamy, very refreshing.

Huge fizzy white head with a very pale cloudy yellow pour from the 11.2 oz bottle. 
 What can you say about beer that has been around since 1445 AD?  You have to love any beer that instructs the drinker how to pour it out of the bottle.  If you follow the instructions, you get that satisfying yeast sediment from the bottom of the bottle.
I can appreciate the efforts of my countrymen both from the little micro brews and even the macros who try to produce a Belgian White.  
But the difference between this and, say, a Blue Moon ’Belgian Style White’ is as wide as orange-flavored bubble gum and a ripe Florida orange.
If you like Beligian Wit, you need to drink this.

Bottle. Pours hazy milky yellow. Abundant frothy white head that remains till the last sip, with nice lacing. Aroma of yeast and wheat, with very nice citrus and a hint of spice (coriander, I assume). Flavor starts with well-rounded, smooth citrus that remains through the finish. Spice and just the right amount of hops become noticeable in the finish and linger a while. Mouthfeel is so smooth and creamy, but the body is not that large. Very refreshing.

A great summer beer. Some wheat beers have little bite but lots of citrus flavor.  Not this beer...great body! One of my favoritea and almost available everywhere....thank God especially in Avalon, NJ..

No. 200
Pours a pale hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma of grass, wheat, lemon and coriander. Nice delicate flavor-sweet and bitter.

Hazy golden with nice white head.  Wheaty yeast aromas, with touches of banana, citrus and spice.  Smells great.  Woody, yeasty flavors are well balanced by soft fruity notes and a pleasing citrus sparkle towards the finish.  I really enjoy this beer and it is perfect for a hot summer day.  Well balanced, and quenching a good beer.

Poured from 12oz bottle.  Nose of coriander and other spices, with hints of citrus fruits.  Poured a pale yellow color with a decent white head.  The taste is basically the same as the nose.  Very drinkable beer with a light mouthfeel that is refreshing during a hot day.

Hoegaarden pours out a cloudy lemon drop color with a light fizzy head and a faint aroma that I can’t pinpoint. This white brew is thin, cool and refreshing with a quick swallow with a mild bite on the finish. Nice white. Try one.

This is my favorite brew as of late. Its the original Belgium blanc, or, whitbeir.

Pour: smooth. Has a meringue like head which lasts a few minutes and leaves sticky lacing on the glass.

Smell: zesty and a somewhat floral hop smell some grain sweetness and a slight scent of banana.

Taste: Not as strong as the scent, begins with light wheat, and ends with the smallest hint of lemon. Spices gracefully fade away.

Mouth feel: Light, not much carbonation. Drinkable especially for summer.

I find Hoegaarden very drinkable especially for this time of year. This would be a great beer with halibut or other fresh seafood. Great session beer, as the ABV is just under 5%.

On-tap, served in a Hoegaarden tumbler glass.

A good looking witbier, cloudy orange hued pale yellow, creamy white head that slowly dissipated into a sudsy lacing.

The orange peel and coriander are quite noticeable in the aroma along with a light spiciness, also a distinct mustiness.

Rich, soft, fluffy mouthfeel, sweet tasting, orange peel, coriander, sour lemony in the middle, a light peppery, tingling spiciness, nice and dry wheat maltiness, just a pleasure to drink, the standard for style.

This is a true thirst quencher, one of my longtime summer favorites, a great introductory witbier for those just getting acquainted with the style.

What a terrific beer.  This is one of my favorite beers to drink around the pool in the summer.  Very refreshing.  It’s not as good as the Allagash White but quite good for a beer that’s so widely distributed.

Bottle. Thought I’d give this a more proper review. Pours a cloudy, very light yellow, with a decent, bubbly white head. Heavy citrus nose, with that orange very present. Taste mimics the aroma, citrus, orange, complimented by a crisp finish. Excellent.

On tap at the Muddy Pig in St. Paul.  Very nice appearance and aroma but the taste was maybe a little too citric and sweet.  By no means was it saccharine, but a little less spice would have been nice.  I will tip back a few more of these in my future I’m sure.

Bottle at Oveja Negra pub, San Isidro, Argentina. Wiezen beer, pale yellow colour with good white head. Aroma is citric and a little caramel. Taste is citric as well and yeast. Strong and delicate at the same time.
had at bar as well as bottle from liquor store.   This is a delightful treat. well done.

June 2005 - I have to say, I was a might disappointed in this. Poured pale yellow (wit, go figure), cloudy with little head and lacing. Aroma and taste were very citrusy (maybe too much), but I just didn’t find enough of the wheat backbone there. A tad weak for my likings...not NEARLY as good as Allagash White.
a typical ’weizen’ beer. nice and softy head. fruity aftertaste. nothing special.

Pours a cloudy light yellow body with thin and fizzy head that doesnt last long.
Aroma of citrus and spices, mostly citrus.
Fruity maltines and citrus and spices in the flavor. Palate is thin and fizzy.

Bottle.  Wow this is a light color!  Head is pretty big at first but has died down to a reasonable one finger.  Aromas are of grass, citrus and light spice.  Those spices come through pretty strong in the flavor, however.  I can pick up the coriander very clearly.  An interesting counterpoint to some of the milder spiced wits.

On tap in Belfast. A smooth and heavily carbonated brew. The main taste and aroma is lemon with a bit of orange and some spice. Quite refreshing and well done, though it’s not my favorite. Beware bartenders putting a slice of lemon in the brew!
Nice basic belgium white. Low on the citrus end and higher on the spices. I like bc most beligums tend to overdo citirus. Nice  carbonation on tap. Overall decent mainstream beer
This beer smells like it tastes, like way over-citrused and over-spiced.  This is one witbier I’ll make a point to avoid.
A good change of pace beer, very nice on a summer evening. The coriander and citrus play nicely together.
im somewhat confused as to why people enjoy this beer whatsoever.... it tastes more like a fruit beer than a witbier and is essentially nothing more than flavored poop
A friend picked up one of these just for the hell of it.  Nothing really that crazy on this one, but sometimes its a good thing.  I could easily get 6 of these and have a good night.

This is one of my favorite beers, I love Belgian whites.  The color is a cloudy off yellow with moderate carbonation.  The head is a thick frothy white.  Good example of Belgian white with citrus undertones and smooth finish.  Overall just a great beer.

It appeared a very corn-colored cloudy, like a lemon jellybean, and didn’t look very appetizing at all. The white head looked like spa foam. It was sweet and fruity on the nose, with some citrus sours like weak lemonade. Clean, crisp, and way too carbonated, the beer had the consistency and some of the flavor of champagne (thin, foamy, watery). It also appeared to have some melon-y notes. Overall, it seemed to me like the Belgian version of Miller Genuine Draft. Edit: This beer has a way of growing on you. Although it has too much carbonation for a proper ale, it is nicely spiced and appropriately sweet for a wit.

Bottle at Jupiter’s in Champaign, IL. Pours a hazy pale straw with a white head. Nice classic wit aroma of coriander and orange zest. Medium-light bodied with good carbonation. Flavor pale wheat malts, orange, coriander, yeast and white pepper. Not overly sweet and very refreshing. Very enjoyable and a decent crossover beer.

I had 12 of these the other everning! Nice while listeing to old school 2pac by the pool. I can testify to the jury that Hoegaarden Witbier is one drinkable drink:) You just find yourself refilling the glass over and over and over .Well I do. Very citrus and refreshing.
Cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Low carbonation. Thin to medium body. Wheaty, spicy, citrusy flavours.  Moreish if only tro get your head around what it is you’re tasting.

Cloudy yellow with a thin frothy white head. A small amount of lacing. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Only slightly bitter and it has a bit of a fizzy mouthfeel in the finish. Fruity citrus and spicy aroma and flavours. Rather refreshing with a very smooth palate. Quite nice and quite different.
Not bad.    Better if you like Clove.   Thick full long lasting head. A great dessert beer
Pours a cloudy yellow almost white color. Small fizzy white head. Smells of wheat and yeast. Tastes of wheat and grain. Good easy to drink beer but very mild at the same time.

Absolutely awsome, refreshing and well rounded off beer.  Great for a any occasion.  Perfect for those living in the tropics. :-P~ Enjoy!!!

ASSESSMENT

Head (Initial): average frothy
Color: off-white hazy light yellow
Lacing: Good
Longevity: Mostly lasting

Body: Cloudy haze

Body Particles: tiny
Density: Average
Fermentation occurs inside the bottle.
Unfiltered beer

Body: HUE Light yellow

Initial flavor: Sweet – light

Finish Flavor: Sweet – with fruity aroma
Duration: Average

Body: Medium to Full

Texture: Watery

Carbonation: soft –lively

:-P~ Enjoy!!!
Bottle from Hollingshead Deli and my son-in-law Colin; Nose of citrus, sweetness, spices, and yeastiness; hazy yellow with a big white head; flavor of citrus, spices, and a little fruity melon.
bianca speziata agrumata lievemente acidula rinfrescante da bere per calmare la sete
Pours golden with white head.  Aroma of citrus and fruits, a little hint of banana.  Great flavor, citrus and other fruits.  Very smooth, great hot summer day beer.

Great witbier. Cloudy light color with a lasting head if poured properly. Amazing taste of orange with a hint of honey. Perfect summer beer. Too bad it’s so expensive here in quebec..only comes in 6 as well

Pale hazy yellow with a fine bright white head. Aroma isnt too intense, citrus and some dusty notes. Fresh citrus flavor aswell as some elderberries and some fairly bitter hobs. Used to absolutly love this beer, but that was way back. Still highly drinkable and fresh.

bottle,love this beer defination of the style,very drinkable.love this beer...can I have some more please!!!!citrus, banana, clove, pale, cloudy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively,

Bottle.Cloudy light yellow with a white head.Banana orange and lemon in the aroma.The coriander can also be recognized but only as you drink.Light spice,semi sweet flavor.Light crisp and easy to drink.Nice.

Bottle. Nice clear yellow color with a dense cream. Some citric and fruity aroma also to the taste, very nice beer..

Cerveja clara com boa espuma, aroma e sabor citrico frutado, muito boa.
I don’t like the style much, but this one isn’t bad. (Bottle 25cl aged 3 years)
Flaske. Typisk witbier, der dog er en kende ordinær. For ikke at sige rent ud gennemsnitslig, er langt bedre på fad

Pours a hazy golden color with a fluffy white head with good retention.  Aromas of orange, lemon, spices and hops.  Taste of sour orange and a little bit of lemon with some hop bitterness.  Leaves the typical witbier aftertaste that tastes like gross, wet bread.  A fairly good representation of the style and an overall good beer
Hazy pale yellow body, fair white head. Fruity sweet aroma. Lightly hopped flavor with spicy notes. A little on the watery side. Not bad witbier.

How can I not have rated this yet? I could have sworn... Anyway, not much left to say about this great beer. Pretty much the standard choice for the quality session beer when you’re feeling a little more cashed up. Fruity, spicy, smooth, crisp, lovely finish.

Pours a hazy, cloudy bright yellow with a frothy white head.  Aroma is highly lemon with a hint of spices as well.  Flavor is an interesting balance of citrus, vanilla, coriander, and a slight hop finish.  A nice witbier, not the best, but very solid and a great bet on a hot day.

Bottle, from Duvel tulip, at room temp. Best before end of 05/05/08. Cloudy pale yellow body (almost white, go figure), fading bubbly white head, zero lacing. Aroma is very yeasty and lemony. Light body; thin texture. Carbonation is a bit sharp, but not unnaturally so. Sweet flavor; tangy finish. It reminds me of something -- both in appearance and aroma -- that I’m too embarrassed to write. (I’m not qualified to compare the flavor, but I know many women who are. OK no more hints.) I’d say it was overrated, but I am admittedly biased against the style.

Pours to a really hazy pale yellow straw body with a bubbly white head.  Unfortunately, the color is semi-off-putting.  The aroma is crisp barley, coriander, orange peel, and that signature yeast.  The flavor is a yeast forward wheat that’s clean and refreshing rather than heavy and earthy and light toasted barley with light coriander and lemony orange peel.  At times, the beer seems to be a shandy style.  The palate is refreshing and light.  A great summer beer.

Bottle. Cloudy pale straw color with a large head. Spare lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast, bananas and coriander. All the wit ingredients are there, but it is lighter than most. Summer time brew, for sure.

Just about my favorite session beer.  This is the beer I use to introduce many to Belgian style beers.  Light and fruity, yeasty aromas and flavors, mild coriander and orange on the finish.  Very refreshing.  Crisp and spicy.

Pale cloudy yellow colour. Mild aroma of yeast and spice. Quite flat, just a small fizz on the tongue. Flavour is yeasty with some coriander and has a sharp refreshing citrusy edge. Very refreshing and easy to drink.

Bottle:  Not my favorite style of beer- I prefer more "bite" - but this impresses me as an honest brew.  Yeasty, bready aroma and tastewith nice hints of spiciness.  If only American brewers would use this kind of restraint when adding adjunct flavorings to their brews. P.S.-passes the "empty bottle sniff " test the next day with flying colors.  BUY AGAIN? When I’m in the right mood for one; sure.

il culo della padella della Blanche: assaggiate altre due o tre devo ricredermi sull’intero stile, è proprio questa che non sa di nulla. Un mio amico - che se legge questo commento sappia che è un buliccio - la definisce limonata, e ha più di una ragione per farlo. Tanto più che la prima volta me la servirono con una fetta di limone galleggiante nel bicchiere, che fu imbarazzante e faticoso tirare via senza imbrattare tutto quanto. 
Assaggiata (col mefitico limone) al Bar Berto (non ricordo il prezzo, comunque troppo alto di sicuro) e purtroppo ricomprata più volte da mio padre che la apprezza.
Golden, straw colored.  Lots of white head.  Big spicey nose, clove and coriander dominate.  The flavor is more estery than a lot of wits.  A little watery, but still a damn good beer.

BB 05-08-08.  Pours a sparkling, somewhat cloudy, pale straw color with a moderately full, brilliant white, creamy-rocky head; longevity is decent and lacing is sporatic.  Nose is fragrant and complex for the style; herbal spices and corriander back up a lightly tart, wheaty, yeasty, orangey base.  Flavor is much of the same but with a more spicey character; vanilla and orange make up the sweet and sour notes with pepper and light herbal notes backing throughout.  Grainy wheat notes and light yeast is also apparent with a low bitterness.  Palate is a bit weak, medium-light, lively, and a watery-creamy feel.  Finishes quickly and slightly dry with a touch of tartness to match the lingering pepper and herbal spices.  A very nice wit with lots of character and nice spice notes.  Palate could afford to be better but everything else is solid.

330ml bottle (Mallaskukko, Turku)

Cloudy wheaty yellow. Characteristic blanche aroma - wheat, citrus, coriander. Ditto taste. First taste is delicious, but the lack of details makes it become bland over time. Was much better a few decades back, I’m sure.

Rerate: Bottle. 2010 - took off 1 taste and 2 overall, as it was bland right from the start.

Very light straw, hazy with a moderate head. the aroma has light notes of coriander. The flavour is refreshing, light and quenching with notes of coriander and fruit, mostly citrus. It’s nice, but a bit on the light side.

Essa blanche foi tomada em diversas ocasiões pela Eurupa, e agora aportou no Brasil. Por já ser bem frutada, acho desnecessário que seja servida com rodelas de limão no copo. Ademais, ela poderia ser um pouco mais encorpada. Notas de hortelã.
white cloudy yellow body  with mostly lasting white head a soft fruity aroma a bitter fruity taste with a average light finich
Very good white ale.  Hazy appearance with a soft aroma of fruit.  Good flavor but a light aftertaste.

Banana yellow cloudy poor with a thin off white head.  Aromas of coriander, citrus, lemon and orange zest, sweet bread, pine and verty herbal.  Good bitterness, spicy hoppy mouthfeel with good effervescence.    Long dry finish.  Coriander / Lemon zest start with a orange zesty finish.  Very good Witbier.
one of best tasting beers ive had. Tried both bottle and tap. Better from tap. Quite pricey, but worth it.
great beer! a lil on the pricy side and hard to find. really good to use while cooking food and drinking with dinner.
This is a good white ale.  I like it better on tap.  But in the bottle is just as good.  Nice color, great flavor, overall, good.

Before I give this rating I’d like you to know this is one of my favorite beer styles.  Nice milky head. Great aroma.  Apperance is very honey-like.  Flavor is great for witbier.  Not as fruity as blue moon or lienenkugels’ sunset wheat.  Overall a great beer in it’s  style.

Aroma very typical of this style, perhaps with more of a hint of vanilla-like creaminess.  Taste is not particularly strong.  Tastes wheaty, a bit yeasty.  There is a fair amount of the sourness typical to wheat beers--I think this beer is more sour than most, and this detracts from its enjoyment.  As a plus though, this beer is quite light.  Light, fruity tones emerge.  Bottom line: this beer is drinkable but I think it is not nearly as good as everyone claims.
medium head, grapefruit juice colour body, very nice yeast aroma, quite good taste, yeasty and wheaty, citro, bit watery,
Clear very light yellow with a fizzy white head.  Bready slightly citrus aroma.  Sweet taste without enough citrus or spice character to carry it.  A one dimensional beer.

12/14/2007:  As I have become more fluent in the tasting of whites, I have gained a true appreciation of this special beer.  Now one of my favorite summer beers.  

This is as scored>  Average.  It has a nice drinking quality but one that offers very little substance. It is very clear and lack color and character but makes up for it in taste.  Clean crisp and refreshing.

12 oz bottles. I presume that this beer does not always travel well. I have found it true with some beers--the farther from the brewery the more odd off-flavors are likely to be present. My samples were sweet and syrupy with overtones of cirtus. Color was cloudy yellow.  Mouthfeel was heavy and ponderous. Finish was uneven with chemicals (benzene?) lingering.
Draught at KØ07. Pale milky yellow colour. Chalky white head. The flavour is not overpowering, but nice and very refreshing. Coriander and citrus.

Bottle in Hoegaarden glass.  Pours cloudy pale orange with lasting white head and lace.  Aromas of fresh orange and coriander.  Flavors of light orange honey coriander/mint.   Medium light body and a medium carbonation make this one of the most refreshing beers.   The original white and still the best.  I just hope Bud doesn’t screw it up.  Now, time for another.
delicious wit, pours a cloudy light golden with a large white head, sweet coriander citrus smell, very easy to drink, becomming easier to find which is a plus, great beer.

Nice white head and lacing.  Good coriander aroma. on the first sniff.  Yeast and spice are delicate and well balanced.  Very refreshing with a very nice creamy mouthfeel, and it sits nice and heavy in your stomach like the meal that I skipped to afford this beer.  It’s pretty expensive for a low abv, but a very worthwhile true belgian experience.

Pale and cloudy yellow color.  Aromas and flavors are orange, lemon, coriander, nutmeg, and wheat.  The background is set up to be lightly sweet and refreshing, but it is intensly overspiced in my opinion.  I don’t like the excessive use of corriander and other spices.  Otherwise, a solid beer.

I am of Belgian descent and when I went to visit my relative in 1999 this is the first beer they gave me. Holy Crap, I thought, this is excellent. The lemony/citrus aroma is so heavenly to my nose, I could not wait to indulge in several more of these. A very good Belgian White Beer.

Bottle: Pours light yellow with a thick white head.  Nose is lemony, yeasty but not overpowering. Mouthfeel is medium with little follow-up on the finish. This beer is generally just bland and lifeless. Not the beer I first had in Belgium in 1998. Thank you InBev for ruining this brand.

An average white beer. Not much tast and not much aftertaste. The old version was much better. This beer was the first in a white beer tasting. This one was the most tasteless. But still i had worse whitebears but they still had more taste

when it comes to white, this is the brand.  After a while though, you would need to switch it up so that you wont get bored.  Although, its unfiltered appearance has gotten my attention.  Just leave out the orange, please!

12 oz. Bottle: pours cloudy pale yellow-white, looks like lemonade, has a creamy white head that fades but has a thin persistent covering, sweet and citrus spice fragrances with faint wheat aromas, has faint smokey phenols, wheat malt flavor with lemon, some citrus tartness, light on the palate, pretty dry on the tongue and a clean finish.
