Aroma is sweet orange, wheat, and white grape juice. Pours a white yellow color that is unfiltered. Flavor is mostly straight up smooth wheat with the afformentioned subtle orange  and corriander flavor. Velvetty smooth on the palate. Good. My favorite Belgian Wit beer.

Enjoyed a pint at Calloways. This beer was a light body, thin feel, Belgium white beer. At first taste, a little bitter, but go down so smoothly and after taste is hearty and not over-bearing. A very pale dirty yellow in color, this slice of Belgium is a great summer beer, don’t let ’em serve it to you with the orange or lemon wedge, you don’t need that...

Poured a light yellow color with a nice white head that left behind good lacing in the glass.  The aroma is of sweet citrus fruits and spices.  The taste is of the citrus fruits with a taste of pineapple in there.  The finish is smooth and clean.  A refreshing, sweet beer.
Bottle. Nice refreshing, full bodied, spicy and fruity, a little sweet and a hint of sourness in the aftertaste.

Spicy aroma with hints of banana and cloves. Pale very good head retention. Some lacing. Flavor includes lemon, honey and banana notes with malty intro and carbonated mouthfeel. Finishes softly with pleasant, somewhat bitter finish. Very good beer that is perfect on a hot day.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Cloudy lion yellow, large fluffy white head. Malty, perfumy, and spicy aroma, with notes of grapefruit and coriander. Medium bodied, smooth but with a lively carbonation. Dry and earthy but with a light sweetness, extremely well balanced.

On tap at The Pickle Barrel. 20oz. in an unusually large glass. Smells of sweet spices and green grapes. Taste is of orange peel, grapefruit and yeast. A pretty good pour, although lacking in complexity and flavour. Medium-thin mouthfeel. It seemed like the best option next to all the macros. Not bad for getting into belgians.

Tap...poured in its own special glass...nice banana color and murky...left 2" creamy white head. Mild spice, orange and nut aroma. Can taste the citrus(did not add slice of orange). No real aftertaste and stays mild, not unexciting...just mild. Easy drink, good session beer and a must for summertime. Please drop the Blue Moon and pick this up.
Pours hazy pale yellow with a white head. Nose is orange and yeast. Taste is also fruity and yeast. Very light and refreshing.

Rated 4/6/07:  Light, fruity and refreshing nice Belgian Wit. Aroma is estery with a hint of banana followed by coriander and yeast. Beautiful pale golden pour with a thick snow white head, swirled the bottle and the yeast created a cascading cloudiness. Lively palate very crisp but I found it to be just a touch too light and watery. Taste is really laid back and easy. Fruity with the noticeable coriander and orange zest some lemon and grassy notes as well. Extremely drinkable and very appealing.
Bottle.Hazy pale yellow colour with medium creamy white mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma. Fruity flavor with a lot of citrus.

Bottle.  Pours very light yellow.  Somewhat cloudy with a completely diminishing white head.  Nose is lemon, orange, coriander, and wheat.  Taste is light citrus with sublte spices.  Medium body has a nice chewiness to it.  Crisp mouthfeel and a short finish.  Very refreshing, but I could use a bit more in the flavor.

On tap at Charlie Hoopers, Brookside, KSCOM.  Hazy pour.  Fairly small white head by the time it got to me  Full flavor aroma with fruit and citrus.  Taste is quite light, but refreshing.  Good summer patio beer.
Bottle to a glass, its always very nice, however sometimes hard to find. Its the Gold Standard of Belgian White’s. Best warm weather beer in my opinion. Very easy drinking.
Bottle 0,3ltr: Long time not drinking this one. The standard of Belgian White’s with its hazy cloudy yellow looks.

Re-rate...again. Pours murky yellow with a small foamy white head. Kind of looks like stagnant urine,.... in a good way. Strong aroma of coriander, some peppery notes, and a nice note of orange zest. Flavor is a bit muted with some musty yeast, nice coriander/white pepper overtones, and just a bit of orange/lemon zest mid-palate. Palate is light with some peppery spice and a bit of lemon hanging on through the dry finish. Original rating Tap(6 4 6 3 14) Second Rating straight from bottle (6 4 7 3 15)
This old friend got me started on the witbiers.  Yellow, light, some wheaty and citrus flavors.  Nothing aggressive, a great beer for the summer.
Draft, decent witbier. Very fruity, quite carbonated, the wheat aspect is tamed down, quite light on the palate. A decent summer brew, but that about it. Used to be a bigger fan of it.
Poured a cloudy yellow, medium size head.  Slight citrus aroma.  Medium carbonation when it hits your palate along with a bit of corrainder.  Nice summer beer.
has a nice orange citrus taste to it, mixed with the greatness of a wheat beer. i love wheat beers, so this is definitely one I choose, not to mention it’s great in the summertime!

Bottle-poured a very light yellow color w/a moderate foamy white head. Floral hop arome. Very light wheat flavor w/traces of orange, citrus, colander, & wheat. Not overpowering at all, clean to the point of almost being weak. Very subtle, doesn’t overpower at all (like a Blue Moon). Definite Summer Brew w/a lot of carbination. Long crisp finish.
Cerveza muy clara con sedimentos. Muy agradable , amargor suave, y la cantidad justa de alcohol para lograr un sabor refrescante.

12oz. Bottle

Poured a light straw yellow. I swirled the last couple inches in the bottle and got a yeast cloud as a result. Lots of tiny carbonation bubbles rise from all over. The head when poured was 2 fingers of white creamy chunkiness. The head stays put for awhile. Looks like a white should.

A solid dose of coriander and clove come through first and mingles with the spiciness of the yeast. There is a sprinkling of bitter orange peel in the background. A wheat twang is the base for everything else.

The coriander, clove, and spicy yeast mix together nicely without one overtaking the others. Twangy wheat cools things at mid-palate and there is a mild white pepper spice on the finish. the coriander makes another small appearence on the swallow.

This beer has a nice light body without being watery. It’s smooth going down and the carbonation awakens the taste buds with the tingle making it an enjoyable brew.

Drinkability is good. I’m drinking this the wrong time of year. It’s cold right now but in the summer Hoegaarden is hard to beat when it’s nice and cold.

Hoegaarden, in my opinion, is the base for many white ales. There are better out there but there are many, many worse. A satisfying brew with good consistency. A staple if you’re a white ale fan.

12/12/06
NIce wheat taste. Citrisy flavor.  Great ale to have in the summer time espicially in my back yard.
Cloudy pale yellow. A nice foamy head that laced out. Citrusy coriander aroma.

Appearance: blond turbid. Medium and white head. 
Aroma: To honey, citric-fruty of orange, low presence of hop, sweet smell of butter cookies.
Flavor: hoppy, begin sweet  and  finished in a slight dryness. Notes of herbs of coriander and some citric-fruity touches. End with metallized sensation.
Palate: slight Body of watery texture. Medium carbonation.

Advisable and ligth.

(sorry for my english)

Very cloudy light yellow pour with a small bright white head.  The scent was sweet malt and lemons.  I tasted a crispy, light lemon with a slight hoppiness and milt bitter bite.  A very refreshing light beer for the hot months.  Very enjoyable beer.
Cloudy, ginger beer colour. Light lemony, sweet taste. Very crisp and bubbly. A hint of bitterness. Very strong wheat taste. Pours with a brilliant white head. A top beer!
clear, sparkling, pale, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter,
Has a citrus taste, nice and yellow. An easy beer to drink, refreshing, and no kick at the end.

Had this a million times and just now getting around to rating.  Cloudy, pale yellow color with a big white head.  Aroma is citrus and orange.  Taste is yeast and citrus again.  Crisp, highly carbonated beer.  Summer session beer for sure.

Hoegaarden introduced me to a whole new beer style in the mid 1990s, when from memory it was a pale cloudy yellow with a brilliant white head and great spicing. This rating is based on my last drink of it - on tap. The colour has changed, replaced by a dirty hue which recalls several days old slush. The aroma was a mess of coriander, lemon and indeterminate chemicals. The flavour was subdued with some citrus and a sour aftertaste. A huge disappointment.
Refreshing Belgian white.  Citrus in taste with mild notes of banana.  Great for the summer, but not a top choice of mine.  Still, a well brewed beer.
Pours a pale yellow color with a large foamy head.  Has a fruity taste with  recognizable banana and citrus characters.

Aroma of yeast, citrus, and old fashioned linoleum adhesive (just a hint). Or maybe it’s just more yeast. Hazy light gold color with a large white head that went away, leaving bits of lace. Starts with strong citrus oil, and coriander. Suggestions of banana. Something of clove came next. Medium to full mouthfeel. The long finish is light clove mouthcoat and a little bitter, very little. Good ale. Clean and refreshing.
I love this beer.  It is one of my favorite Belgians.  It has a nice aroma of citrus and spice and the nouthfeel really offers up that chewiness and orange style flavor.

clear straw yellow with a huge white foamy head. Aroma is sweet, bready, malty but not heavy... really fresh. The first impression on mouth is smooth. The second is refreshing... citrus and yeast. Really excellent beer.

There are few things I’d rather drink on a hot day. The beer looks beautiful with a nice bright yellow colour. The flavour is banana and citrus. It’s extremely  refreshing but not hugely moreish. I like it.
Pours a unfiltered light yellow color with a nice white head. Has great lacing. Has hints of sweet fruits, subtle spices, and a citrus taste at the end. Finishes smooth and sticks to your tongue.

Pours beautiful, hazy pale-straw colour with medium, white head. Smells bready and has strong banana and coriander notes, but not very strong citrus for its style. Flavour is mellow and pleasant, though not much new beyond what’s detectable in the aroma, and the mouth-feel is medium. Refreshing..
What an excellent white.  Beautiful hazy yellow appearance and a strong orange citrus aroma.  It tastes more complex than that though.  Lots of fruity goodness here.
This stuff is great! Rich  bready citrus taste with other fruits going on. refreshing with a zesty finish. Pretty sweet and pretty lite. Had this from a six! One of my favorite belgian whites.

Nice foamy head, hazy golden yellow appearance.  Has a pleasant citric/wheat aroma.   Very pleasing taste, nice combination of yeast, wheat and fruit (like pinapple).  Slightly tart, but goes down smoothly, absolutely refreshing on a hot summer’s day.  Tried both the bottle and on tap, you gotta have it on tap to really appreciate this witbier.

Pours a hazy yellow, like lemonade, with a large rocky white head. Aroma is a perfumed citrus/coriander blend with hints of grain. The palate is very thin and watery. A very light and refreshing beer with a smooth citrus and light wheat finish. While I could drink this all day without it ever getting heavy, as a fan of witbiers, I was left wanting more. I think this one is built more for thirst (and to please the masses) than it is for flavor.

Hazy blonde with a nice medium white head.   Pleasant aroma of wheat, spice, yeast, clove, and banana.  Body is a bit thin, but adds to its refreshing charecter.  Flavor is very nice, but a little light.  Orange, yeast, spice, coriander, and a bit of sweet fruit.  Not too much of a finish, but whats there is slightly sour and spicey.  Crisp and refreshing.  Will do again.
Nice aroma with a similar nice taste.  Great beer overall.  A very accessible Belgian.

This beer pours a white-yellow with a white lasting head. Aroma is sweet spices with some banana and light yeast. Taste is much the same with a refreshing light flavor of spice, orange, and yeasty dough. This stuff was great and the best Belgian White I’ve had so far.
Very nice. Very light and crisp. I could drink a million of these. God bless Belgium. Cloudy, almost white pour. Spicy/citrus aroma and taste. The quintessential wit.

A very hazy, light yellow beer, a head is white and medium Aroma is balanced, wheat, fruitness of lemon, spicyness of coriander. Taste has  wheat and lemon, corinader and spicyness that makes tha taste more interesting. A light bodied with medium carbonation makes this beer a very easy to drink. Good witbier with spicyness gives more interesting notes.
bottle from Sams Club Pack - yellow and cloudy head, just like the bottle says orange peel and coriander - I agree with most - not the same beer I tasted 10 years ago in Belgium - my engagement beer.

Bottle. Light yellow hazy colour with a big average lasting bubbly, creamy white head. Aroma of wheat indeed, malts, citrus and yeast. Bubbly fuzzy feeling on the tongue. Refreshing flavour of wheat and yeast, sourness (grape), little sweet touch of banana, some orange and a little coriander too. A very refreshing and tasty witbier indeed!
Very light and refreshing. Cloudy yellow with a nice head. Best ice cold on a hot afternoon after a soccer game.
Pours a light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is light spices and citrus. Flavor is spice, wheat, and malts. Quite nice overall.
Pours hazy yellow.  Yeasty aroma.  Small white head.  Hint of fruitiness.  Very smooth and Refreshing, but overrated.

Light, almost fluffy. The rirst swallow was slightly bitter, followed by.......nothing, except a burp. It was light yellow, gloudy with a fast fading head. If there was a malt in my glass, I couldn’t discern it.
On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  Tasty beer that’s perfect for a sunday afternoon.  Nothing like sitting outside with some friends and having a refreshing Hoegaarden.
A very nice wit. Typical corriander and orange peel flavour, and not to much else. There is also very subdued floral and acidic hops in the flavor. Very refreshing and surprsingly full in body.

served far too cold on draught.  i had to drink something else while it warmed up. warmed, it smelled and tasted like yeasty banana bread. very drinkable and refreshing.  goes really well with the grilled salmon sandwich i am eating.
Draught.  Cloudy yellow orange appearance, some orange notes in the taste but not overwhelming, balanced with the alcohol held in check, smooth and very refreshing. nice but not too complex.
Tap at The Globe, Copenhagen. Hazy yellow color, white head. Citrus/orange, coriander, almost no hops (but that´s ok in this one). Very drinkable, much better than almost any pilsener.
Lingering large head. Yeasty and citrusy flavors combine for a very drinkable beer. Nice creaminess. Complex, full bodied flavor with a light, but not watery mouthfeel.

This is one of my favorite styles so I’m probably a bit biased... The aroma is great, very light, I can sense the coriander. The appearance is hazy yellow with a medium white frothy head. Flavor is fruity and full. Mouth feel is a bit thin but that seems to be common for this style.
Very light hazy yellow, with white head.  Very well balanced flavor compared to other witbiers (Bells & Avery).  Good outdoors summer drink.  Especially around the grill

good belgian white ale.  little fruitty, initially a pineapple banana taste but as it warmed up it was more complex.  the orange peels were there.  couple of these puppies and a mix tape equals a hot summer date at the drive-in.

Highly drinkable - pours thick cloudy pale yellow with huge foamy head, delicious herbal aroma. Pint of this on a summer afternoon would be the shit and no mistake, very refreshing. Palate smooth, tingly and lightly spicy, flavours coriander, citrus and sharp yeast. Finish dry, long, delicious. Definitely lives up to the hype.
Tasted 2007-03-31. Fresh bottle, 75cl. Dense yellow colour with creamy white head. Aroma of citrus and cloves. Taste of a warm summer day!
One of my perennial favorites.  Great citrus aroma and flavor.  Probably one of the few witbiers that are really nearly white.

Bottle -- Bright cloudy yellow with large frothy white head and lots of carbonation. Lots of lacing. too. Aroma is crisp and clean with prominant yeast. Flavour is so much like the aroma it’s remarkable. I can’t really pick out the orange peel, but the coriander is certainly there. There’s a surprising complexity in the aftertaste. This is absolutely positively not a style I enjoy, but this ain’t bad at all.

Tap. Pours a pale unfiltered yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast and coriander. Flavour is dominated by coriander but surely also has the yeast and wheat notes. Overall refreshing. This was my first belgian beer ever, tasted at Hoegaarden brewery in 1994 first time. Didn’t pay much attention to this as I saw it as a womens beer as Verboten Vrucht was also served....
Went through all the moves to serve this correctly...will drink again in the summer heat with a lemon wedge...this is a good Beer to introduce to Pale Lager lovers. You’ll be hooking them up...

Pours a pretty cloudy yellow with snow white head that disipates rather slowly.  Smell is slightly sour wheaty fragrence.  Ahh yes the refreshing flavor is crisp, tart, no discernable malt character (though I’m sure we’d miss it if it weren’t there!).  You do pick up on the coriander and orange peel flavors, but they’re subtle in a way you’d expect from a well balanced brew.  Brew is fairly thin, but not too much so and it doesn’t seem to matter in this style.  Palate is more of the same flavors only this is where you get most of the subtle orange flavor, and a full tarty bite.  Overall a great break from the big malty stuff I tend to enjoy.  Not a malt head or a hop head’s dream, but a truely good brew!

Cloudy straw color. Nice solid white head. Complex aroma yeast, fruitness, corriander. Flavor is extremely light, almost watery, upon first tasting. But a little bit deeper there is orange, slight bitterness,  bright hoppiness some maltiness. I don’t think that this is quite the same beer in the bottle as it is on tap.

Good beer. Lucky thing for monks or we would all be pathetic. Love having to swirl this sucker.pouring this can be like an art. after some time it starts tasting like honey or flowers or sumthing. Like youre in a field full of wildflowers and there are naked monk women dancing all around you. Bet it taste sweetly awsome on tap.

Draught. Extremly pale yellow, cloudy colour. Predominant orange peel elements and spicy flavours. Coriander, tangerine, yeast notes. Fresh taste, beautiful colour, extremly refreshing witbier. I’m looking forward to having the next one...

Had this in 12-oz bottles, on tap, tastes the same as long as it is fresh. Pours a cloudy honey yellow with an average white head. Aroma is of yeast and wheat. Taste is sweet with some citrus. A bit sour aftertaste with some citrus.

12 oz bottle. Cloudy yellow, color of lemon juice.  Smells wheaty, with a little citrus peel.  Taste is extremely light... wheat, yeast, a little citrus.  I remember liking this the first time I tried it, but that was awhile back, before I really started enjoying beer... It’s not bad for the style, but I crave more flavor.
Bottle. Very pale yellow colour with a white head. A brief scent of salami. Aroma is piney & spicy. Flavour is wheat followed by that salami again.
Very disappointing, actually.  Sharp aroma that was promising...but the taste was a bit sour.  Felt oily on the tongue and just an overall unpleasant experience.

Pours a great light yellow color with fairly nice head.  This beer is absolutely perfect.  It is smooth and flavorful.  Slightly sweet but still maintains a beer texture and slightly sour kick.  Very drinkable, one of my favorite beers.  I would recommend this to anyone, a great brew for hot days!

This is my session beer for when I need someone else to make the beer run.  I buy too when there is limited selection at the shop.

Its best on tap, but bottle poured is quite good also.

Ditch the lemon if the bartender gives you one; IMO it ruins the beer!
This is a great example of an original Belgian staple beer. One of the best Belgians available in the US! Great head, with a fruity and balanced body. Crisp coriander finish.

had on tap at the rusty bucket...Very pale, hazy yellow, large white head...Smelled of sweet oranges. Taste was oranges and sourness...I did not care for the sour aftertaste too much, but this was an okay beer.

Generally a drinkable session beer. Light slightly fruit oriented, with a nice light clove finish. The bottles have a tedency to be more fizzy on the tongue than on tap. I’ve had this a number of times and places, and is always a good summer "fall back" beer if there’s nothing else more exotic around at a picnic or barbeque. The head is always something to observe, the thicker and longer lasting, the more entertaining (IMHO).

Poured a cloudy gold color with a fairly thick white head.  Smelled of wheat and citrus.  Typical Belgian wit smell.  The taste is very creamy.  Big wheat taste with citrus backing it up in the aftertaste.  Extremely smooth.  Really easy drinking and quite refreshing.  Great beer to drink while watching a game.

I’ve had this before but never rated it so I picked up a bottle at D’s in Pittsburgh. I drank this beer where it was meant to be drank. On my deck, on a swing with my dog. Not much aroma to speak of. Pour was a hazy gold with a thick white head. Taste was crisp and dry with citrus notes throughout. Not too strong and not too heavy this is a classic witbier. Man I can’t wait till summer!

after receiving the pint I could smell the strong aroma of orange and coriander follow, while noting the change from murky yellow to settle.  definitely a strong and defined citrus flavor that is very refreshing

Beautiful fruity aroma and a fizzy ’tang’ on the palate. Quite a light colour but wicked head on it. As for the flavor... wow, very original. Hard to drink a sixer to yourself but for one or two over dinner its a hard brew to beat.

Damn this was a tasty refreshing wit.  Pour was cloudy straw color with a good withe head.  Aroma of sweet malt, orange peel and coriander.  Flavors of wheat, grains, sweet malt, oranges, spice, and coriander. Quite flavorful and refreshing.  I could down these things.
Great beer.  Pours a great cloudy yellow.  Aroma is one of the high points, great citrus.  I can taste orange. Very refreshing.  Nice head as well.

The first top-fermented beer non-hvidtøl I’ve ever had when I first tasted it back in ’96. I was amazed back then!!! Now I’m quite amazed to find out it’s still ok

Huge foamy head and hazy pale-yellow fuzzy beer. The aroma is of coriander, wheat and a hint of dirty yeast. The taste is dominated by the sweet wheat with citrus and spices creeping up on you in the aftertaste.

A hazy, golden yellow coloured beer with a thick white head. A light, wheaty, tropical fruit aroma, typical of style, but lacking somewhat. The taste is dry and wheaty, biscuity, plus the typical banana and mango tropical fruit flavour as expected. There is also a hint of clove spice in the background. The finish is dry. (Bottle - purchased from Tesco, Fakenham, Norfolk for 85p. a bottle).

Hazy pale straw body, creamy white head. Dusty grain aroma with orange citrus notes. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Gentle pepper, orange, and grain in the flavor. Finishes with sort of a diluted hop bitterness.

Bottle: Pale golden cloudy color.  Nice head and lacing that stayed around.  Banana, wheat, apricot aroma. Goes down smooth, refreshing.  It was gone before I knew it. Will have again, and will share with friends that like wheat beer.
Sets the standards in wheat beers. Pale golden in color, with a fruity, bread, wheat aroma. Great flavours of banana, citrus and yeast. Great beer to relax and kick back.
I am not keen at witbeers, and even the taste of this famous Hoegaarden I can’t really appreciate. But still, it is one of the best witbeers I ever tasted. And the appearance is great.

Bottle. I overlooked this beer for a long time. Had it off and on but never really registered. Had it recently and was surpised how good it was and how much I enjoyed it. For a wit this one is tops. Great flavors of coriander, banana
and yeast, aromas of bread and spices. 
Very refreshing on the palate, a nice summer beer for sure.
this is a fruity wheat beer, has a good aroma. mine was served with lemon, could not drink too many of these.
Hazy yellow pour in the glass. Yeasty, and wheaty fresh aroma. Some spices as well. Golden wheat, tangy yeast flavors. Delicious and perfect palate. Gotta respect the original Wit!

Bottle. Pale yellow and hazy. Aroma of coriander, fruits and spices. Sweet with a slightly sour finish. Light bodied and high carbonation. It’s not bad, just very thin and boring. I was really surprised when I saw the high score here

re-rate: i gave her another go after trying a good selection of belgian whites.  its an extremely drinkable version of the style.  it has all the standard qualities of a witbier, just dialed down a bit.  i think its rating is a bit inflated as there are quite a few others that have better flavor and palate.  however, this its a solid beer in general and would make a good introduction for light lager drinkers.  it would also make a fine session beer. paper napkin.

This is the gold standard of Belgian whites. Woulda given it a solid "5", cept for its ownership which I know is more concerned extra profit versus best quality. Still! The head, lace, nose, flavor, body - all outstanding. I’ve had it all over the world and at least the quality is maintained. This one was at Bodega Brew Pub from a bottle downtown La Crosse, Wisconsin

33cL bottle.  HB Dana.    I have many memories of enjoying this beer.  Sitting in a sidewalk cafe in Paris enjoying a pint comes to mind...                  
This one was enjoyed in a Tumbler Glass.  Hazy yellow-white color.  Definite appearance of being unfiltered.  Thick foamy bright white head.  Aroma of popcorn, coriander, citron zest.  creamy light bodied.  flavors of malted wheat

Always delicious. A good summer beer, with food or by itself. I always recommend to my friends who like Blue Moon, it’s a step above and not overly pricey. Smooth with an excellent finish, but it looks a bit like piss.
Definitive witbier, widely available is a plus as well.  Such a refreshing beer, does well with spicy foods.  Fills a niche no other beers can.
Very easy drinking beer. I would drink this even if it didn’t have any alcohol. Citrusy aroma and not too much carbonation. A really enjoyable beer to drink.

Poured a murky light yellow with medium head and light lacing.  Nose of citrus and spices.  Mouthfeel is creamy but a little cloying.  Flavors of citrus and some hops but mostly sweetness.  Bitter finish.  I think it is the coriander that makes this taste a little odd  Drinkable, but nothing more.
Good old Hoegaarden. Im glad they are starting to sell more of this beer here in Chicago. In most bars and coffee shops in Amsterdam this is their tap beer, kinda like having a bud lite here...

Sweet taste. I possibly smell grapefruit. I know for sure that this beer has a deep citrus smell to it. Light yellow in color, don’t really care for this type of color to tell you the truth. The beer is smooth, and goes down nice. Not much to say about the head, but a great Witbier.
Tap @ Opal Divine’s, Austin. Murky yellow/ gold appearance tons of head.  Dry, spicy(?) flavor. Had it at home with an orange wedge, but tasted better on tap. Pretty easy to find.

On tap. Poured a pale hazzy yellow with a big white head. Nose was yeasty and citrusy. Taste was yeasty and sweet with some bitter undertones. Hops possibly aged to take away bitterness. Palate was medium. Good example of a belgium white.

This is a tough beer to rate because I know there is a faction of beer lover that think InBev is the devil but I have to say I like this beer and it for me to this day the standard that I judge all other wits by. Page 229 of Michael Jackson’s Great Beer Guide only 369 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.

my introduction to belgian wits manyyears ago. kinda like a gateway beer for me. very nice beer to get people off the macro train, whats not to like, very light, but has a nice citrus flavour to it. great stuff

This is a very well recognized beer, however it has never sat well with me. I have friends that love it and friends that hate it. It is very acidic and the flavor is odd. I do like the pour and the shade of it, but I really dont care for it as a drink.

Hazy straw color pour; good thick white head. Some citrus aroma w/spice. Palate was to me a bit weaker than other Belgian whites I’ve tried. Decent tart finish.  May be a better rated beer during the Summer vs the Winter.  Good but not great Witbier.

Bottle poured cloudy straw color with moderate, bright white head. Mild citrus aroma with strong yeast backbone. The flavor is mostly yeast and mild bitter hops with citrus notes. The palate is a bit weak, watery. I’d look for others in this style.

Hazy gold appearance with a large, thick white head and good lacing.  Spicy aroma with tart citrus.  Dry spicy flavor with the orange peel more evident in the aftertaste.  Medium-to-light bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel leading to an average length finish.  Not too bad for such a mass produced, widely distributed beer.
Hazy yellow, cloudy white head. Coriander and flowers in aroma. A weak but fresh flavor. Some citrus, cloves and spices in taste. A nice summerbeer.
Full of clove, floral, and citrus flavors. To me the aroma and color were both very unappeasing. Not one of my favorites.

aroma of floral, resemble a good pefume. The color is a golden, a little bit cloudy (as expected from wheat beer). The flavor follows the aroma - which is good, but the palate is too weak. I expected more body (or at least wanted). The carbonation is adequate.
Luminous, light gold with a beautiful foamy head. Sweet, citrus flavours with a little spice. Great as either a summer thirst quencher, or as a session beer.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow, with a small white head.  The scent is sweet and spicy, leading one to sip.  The taste is a crisp wheat bite, with a finish of spice.  A decent beer, and one that is easy to find.

330ml bottle.  Pours a slighly hazy wheaty , yellow color with a thick, acid white head.  Nose of citrus and slight clove.  A bit watery but a really good flavor and easy to drink.  This could be a good session brew for me.
hazy yellow, fluffy head, so much cloves!!1 some citrus on the nose as well, tart at first, easy drinking, not the best Witbier but good.
12 oz-Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a nice foamy white head. Scents of coriander and orange with flavors of the same. Very refreshing

Draft from Duke of York. How is it possible we’ve yet to rate the ultimate wheat beer? A staple in our diet. It gives us strong bones and shiny hair. Cloudy wheat in colour with bright foamy white head. Nose of lemon and orange. Taste of lemon and orange. Lightly spiced with cloves and coriander. Thin bodied, but creamy. Unfussy and perfect for whenever;  a great lunchtime beer. A favourite even among greats.

Followed instructions on the side of bottle. Poured a cloudy, hazy yellow with a very creamy head. The aroma is wonderfully filled with orange and something else... Mouthfeel is crisp, refreshingly carbonated with sweet notes of ripened banana, clove, and lemon.
The best white beer i have had. Small head but has a nice spicey taste Fruity aroma.Great with food and would buy again.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a standard pint glass cloudy, pale yellow with a fluffy white head. Strong smell of yeast and hops, typical of most blonde Belgians. The taste is very thin with notes of yeast and citrus and a bready finish. Very smooth and not at all complex. Very drinkable, but I could use a little more robust flavor.
Had on tap..little foam...lemoncello color...cloudy,  pretty..very faint cloves...cloves on the tongue, and more cloves...expected more of this wheat...well disguised %, a nice light wheat

This has been my go-to Belgian white for a few years now. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a decent white head and great lace. Nice bready, malty aroma. Milky smooth taste, minimal hops and slight citrus. Thin body, but creamy. A really enjoyable Wit.

This is the good old standby, you can’t go wrong here (unless it is in a bottle).  Draft Hoegaarden is by far one of the best Belgian Witbiers available.  Draws as a pleasant pale hazy yellow with a heavenly stark white fluffy head of goodness.  Slightly hopped with a spiced citrus nose.  The mouthfeel is tender and loving and will have your tounge lapping with ectasy.  Hoegaarden finishes crisp and tart, (did someone else say this?  Right on!), and and will have your tasebuds and olfactory nerves screaming for more.  Make sure you have some time to sit at the bar and enjoy a few of these as a true gift from the heavens.  Thank you Belgium.  Toodles.
Bottle. Blind tasted, it is a corriander, citrus, orange peel taste, with a lot of sweetness to it. is lively, medium body, nice nice wit.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with a big white head that diminishes. Aroma of yeast, corriander, some citrus. Nice wheat beer taste with spice and some citrus flavor. A refreshing, light, drinkable beer.
Light yellow colour almost cloudy.White head ,tast of fruits most citrus like and spaices.A light medium body and fresh finish.Easy to find also in  Denmark.Really good  witbier.

The color is the palest, foggy yellow.  The head is fizzy, white, and thin.  The aroma is yeasty, hoppy, citrisy, and the slightest bit of tart.  The flavor is yeasty, hoppy, citrisy, tart (it was pretty much everything the aroma displayed, only a little more intense).  The palate was very carbonated and the finish clean.

A buddy snuck this one on me, glad he did. Solid brew, and i didn’t recognize the name so might not have tried it. Pours a slightly clowdy yellow color with a simple decent head. Smell and taste are both good but not special. Could have used more alcohol. The drinkability is great.
surprisingly tasty if you are into sweet blonde beers.  i recommend chouffe if you like this.  same kind of flavors, more of them, and more of a bite.

One of my favorites.   Love the cloudiness and large frothy white head.   Great coriander and wheat flavor.  Not overly spiced like some witbiers.  The yeast finish is really wonderful.    Extremely airy and crisp like a soda almost.  Very very drinkable.  Great with fish.

Nice aroma, cloudy white/yellow color. yeasty sour flavor, with strong citrus and subtle spice notes. Very refreshing, but good any time. Nice complex flavors, gives you something new every time you have one. I remember it being excellent on tap (in Belgium) but the bottled version is also quite good.

Had this one alot of times, one of my favorite drafts. Bottles not as good, but still nice. Cloudy off-white, light bodied wheat beer is a summer-only for some folks, but I like it anytime! Typically small-to medium head, sourdough-yeasty and spicy aroma yields to a mostly bubblegum/citrus aroma and taste, with slight hops and acid tartness at the end. Draft is usually pretty special, but have had a few that just didn’t seem right. Not sure what was off, but just a litlle too metallic or citrus in some instances.

Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow in color with a medium white head. Aroma is yeasty, coriander, citrusy and lightly malty. A sweetish flavor with yeast, spices and citrus (mostly orange). A light to medium body. A good thirst quencher.
Bottle.  Light yellow color with a sweet, dry aroma.  Light, refreshing taste that is sweet and dry.  Oranges, citrus, etc.  Great balance and overall one of the best wheat beers I’ve had.
From the bottle. Pours a pale yellow with small white head. Spicy and fruity aroma. Crisp, satisfying flavor accented with orange and a touch of spice. Nicely carbonated. Great example of a witbier.
Had on draft. Poured a dense yellow color. Light tasting with a bit of orange. Seemed to finish with a little spiciness.

Aroma-light, 
Appearance Head/Initial-size small, Head/Color white, 
Initial Flavor-acidic sweet light
Finish Flavor-sweet light 
Palate/Body-light
Good beer

Bottle. Pours light with a thick white head. looks like carbonated lemon juice. Cloudy. Nose is wheat and citrus, slightly sour. Palate is the one downfall of this beer- excessively dry. Flavor is balanced coriander and citrus notes. Clean wheat beer.

Had my first one on tap in an Irish Pub in Paris.  Larger head than typical from a bottle, and much fresher tasting than what is available locally.  Nice balance of citrus and coriander.  I have yet to taste anything close to this.  Probably my favorite beer when I can find it on tap.  From a bottle it just doesn’t seem as fresh and I often get a metal aftertaste.

Poured a hazy opaque yellow.  Aroma was pleasing with citrus notes.  Unfortunately I had burnt taste buds so I couldn’t get a true feeling for what it tasted like.  Temporary neutral ratings for those aspects.

Light yellow with a foamy, white head, this beer has strong citrus qualities that remind me something of lemonade. Light mouth feel with a taste comparable to Blue Moon, only with more yeast qualities than wheat.
Draught at 69 Taps in Akron, OH.  Light cloudy yellow in color with decent head. Strong aroma and very nice citric flavor

From the bottle. Pours a hazy light yellow. White head recedes quickly to a white halo around the glass. Aroma is of citrus and yeast. Crisp, sweet, and tangy flavor. Pretty smooth on the tongue. Very drinkable.

The initial pour is a cloudy straw-yellow, with a 1" white head, tightly packed with tiny bubbles. As stated on the bottle, I pour 2/3 of the bottle into the glass, swirl the remaining beer in the bottle to stir up the yeast, and dump that in as well.

The head quickly recedes to a thin film of foam, with a thicker white ring clinging to the sides of the glass: a full circle of foam stays around for the duration. A decent lace clings to the glass as I sip away.

The aroma is sweet, bready, yeasty, and spicy. Like a good hunk of fresh wheat bread. I detect a light citrus, honey, and spice in the aroma.

The taste is almost exactly like the aroma, but a bit drier, perhaps due to the prevalent carbonation. The pleasant, light spice and yeasty aftertaste stick around for a good long time.

This beer is very drinkable, it is light and refreshing. At the same time, it isn’t thin or lacking.
Bottle. Very approachable witbiere. Pours a frothy white head, and delivers a mild minty betterness. Finishes sweet with pine needles and clove.

Very light with white head, cloudy with a bunch of crap floating in it.  Sweet, hoppy aroma.  A little salty and bitter, with a sweet aftertaste.  A hint of pine in the taste, but not great on the palate.  It’s about average in my book.

My first white ale, it is now my favorite. As soon as the beer tastes bitter, the flavor fades away. I dont know how they do that but I love it. Versitle, can be chugged or savored and can be drank cold or room temp.
on tap @ Coles Buffalo Ny. Pale yellow color, citrus, corinader in taste. Easy drinking & enjoyable wit.

bottle: Light simple color, aroma, and flavor.  Very  nice citrus flavor, but tastes more like lime peel than orange.  Ends with a bit of a coolwhip taste!  Overrated, but not bad tasting at all.  Blue moon white is more enjoyable.
Excellent beer, light clean crisp taste, easy to drink, money well spent. I will definitely be buying more of these babies !

On Tap @ The Imperial House, a strange psuedo hip Piano Bar in San Diego.  This place is usually very good with their beer barware but sadly this brew was served in a Bud Light Pint Glass.  The brew poured pale yellow slightly cloudy with barely any head.  The aroma had a bit of hop to it but really nothing special.  Taste was basically okay nothing to be surprised by.  Eh, ok not bad not stellar in anyway.
Excellent Easy Drinking Summer Beer.  Goes well with a lemon and offers a smooth finish.  Very light and pale in color it is truly a white beer.  Only available in 6 packs by bottle locally.
Wow.  Was I surprised to like this beer.  And what a fancy glass they serve it in.  Easy to drink with a beautiful head on it.  Can’t believe I never tried this before.
Bottle/draft.  Classic witbier that is always easy to drink.  Very refreshing on a hot summer day.  This offering defines the witbier class for me.
Bottle. Light yellow and well carbonated.  Good fresh wheat flavor.  Orange and other spices present.  Very drinkable and refreshing.

33 cl bottle from AJ’s Fine Food (Tucson) - Pours a slightly hazy straw color with a one finger thick white head.  Light spotty lacing.  Aroma is yeast and grain.  Flavor is yeast, light citrus, and light banana.  Dry palate.  Light body.  A decent Wit.

Love this guy.  Had it on draught in Prague, and it was perfect for mid-summer.  It’s unfiltered and they leave the yeast in the brew.  Try and have it in the Hoegaarden glass for authenticity.  Pick this one up if youve never had it before.

Yellow pour with a massvie white head.  Definite sweet aroma and taste, with the orange peel and coriander strong up front.  Some vanilla and wheatiness in the middle, mixed with clove and yeast.  No realy sourness to speak of.  Not bad.
not my favorite but a good option when other (better) begium beers are not available.  light, wheaty, and sweetish.

Clearly there are comments from folks that do not understand or appreciate beer styles and the potential for variation in regional styles from around the world. The Belgian Wit is a very unique beer style with a strong spiced character and varying degrees of yeast flavor. Classic Hoegaarden (things are beginning to shift due to Unibrue ownership and corporate influences) is a world-class beer. The tangy and tart character of the yeast and coriander infusion, combined with a creaminess from heavy carbonation and generous raw wheat and oat adjuncts makes it clear that this is not your ordinary beer. Just as Anheuser-Busch makes a world-class American Premium Lager, Hoegaarden is the exemplar of the Beligan wit style. That does not mean you have to love the beer, but it does a great job of being what it is supposed to be.

Pale, translucent, whitish yellow; I couldn’t fit the entire bottle into my tumbler without pausing to let the big, white, frothy head die down a bit; head diminishes into a creamy, medium-width ring.  Aroma yeast, cloves, and banana.  Very light flavor, with yeast, orange, and not much else.  Thin body.  I have a feeling that if it were as cool to hate Hoegaarden as it is to hate Anheuser-Busch, this beer would have a far lower average rating.
Great quality from the brew center of the world.  No sweet and sour taste, just a great refreshing, light, lively beer.  light body, lasting longevity.
A pale looking beer with an average head. This was a very light beer with a slight hint of a grapefruit flavor.

A pale yellow color, with a slightly dark cloud. Thin white head, rapidly dispersed. I think I have to give this an extra appearance point for the lacing, after seeing my glass emptied I wanted to see it full again. A light aroma that smells just a bit of lemon. The taste is incredible, lemon, orange and coriander are all there, each flavor disguises the next. Swallows very light and creamy.
This is a beer that everyone should try.
Very thin and fizzy.  The taste was very light but enjoyable.  I would consider this a very good beer for a hot day.

Bottled. Tumbler. I’m a long fan of this beer, so fair warning of bias. The aroma of Hoegaarden has always captivated me. Complex scents of yeast, lemon/citrus, wheat malts, floral bouquet that is sweet and inviting. That said, the appearance hasn’t ever taken my breath away being as pale and difficult to have any good head retention. The sweet lemon/wheat flavors are balanced with yeast and spice. A very refreshing beer with a medium-light body. Excellent.
quite delicious. I was very full, so the full effect was not great, but under other circumstances, i bet it is fantastic.

Bottle.  Poured cloudy yellow with white creamy head.  Very thin mouthfeel.  Proper amount of carbonation.  Notes of fruit (lemon and orange), and also spicy.  Pretty good beer, though a bit on the expensive side.  Nice lacing.  Flavor really grows on you.

From tap: small head, bright yellow and cloudy, pretty thin bodied and somewhat watery, very fragrant and pretty aromatic, the flavor is fruity and a bit sweet, cirtus, lemon grass, spicy, a little yeasty, some sour notes, very weak bitterness, overall an ok beer but not one of my favorites.
Light and refreshing.  Fruit like aromas and tastes.  Very good, wish more places had it.  Or I should say heard of it.

11.2 oz bottle to a shaker. Very nice beer. Citrus aroma. Pours a very thick head, about 2 fingers or so in size. Very clean tasting. Not heavy in the mouth or at finish. No bitter aftertaste to speak of. Very clean. This could definitely be my new every day beer.

(Tap) Decided to finally try ’the’ example of the style. Pours a cloudy pale yellow, with a small head. Citrus notes, with grapefruit one of the main flavors. Coriander is also there, but not overpowering. Relatively light, but still tastes pretty full. More sour than I expected, especially after drinking American made witbier. A great beer overall, but not quite what I expected.
This is a nice wheat beer that is easy drinking and a nice change of pace.  Why can’t high class restauraunts at least carry something like this.
Cloudy whittish-yellow - a fine looking beer. Summery refreshing with notes of citrus and herbs. Throw out the bud, and grab this for an everyday beer.

golden-yellowish and hazy, beautiful fluffy foamy head; sweet citrus on the nose that follows onto the palate.  yeast becomes apparent the second time around, but mostly on the nose, as is the slight floral aroma (rose petals, lillies, spring flowers).  there is flavor of creamy banana on the back palate.  also, it’s fuzzy and foamy in the mouth, but still remains very fresh throughout the duration of the glass. clean finish, only slight aftertaste, but very pleasant nonetheless.  drinkability is very high, as it is also a very appetizing witbier as well. one of, if not the best, wheat beers i’ve ever had.
Bottle. Pours a very cloudy white when poured according to directions. Smallish white head. Very light flavors and a subtle yeasty taste. Very nice light beer.

Great white/yellow hazy appearance. Strong citrus aroma with underlying yeast. Nice thick foamy white head. Strong citrus taste, often complicmented by serving with a slice of lemon, which I thought was fairly unique - slight deviation from orange. This beer is great if you like a strong tasting white beer.

Pours a very pale hazy yellow coloured beer with a foamy white head. The nose is very perfumed with notes of orange/citrus with some spice and a hint of yeast. Fruity in the taste and more citrussy notes. Finishes with a thick sweet maltiness. This beer is great.

Fantasitc beer! And as I let it sit in my fridge for a few months, it seemed to have improved quite a bit. Sour and bitter, it leaves you with a lingering after taste, that left me wishing I had more. Try this beer. It’s worth it if you like the style.

This will probably get me kicked off the site, but I really don’t think this is anything special.  Terrible aftertaste, almost soapy.  Nice light color and decent aroma.  Still, I enjoy the taste of beer and this one definatly doesn’t agree with me.
Bottle. Somewhat tart, vinegar tone with noticeable fermented/yeast notes. Not my favorite style of beer but this one drinks easier than most Belgian whites I’ve tried.
I’m not a big fan of weissbier nor flavoured beers, so why even 2.1? It tastes surprisingly good. Still I wouldn’t drink this unless there was nothing else available.

After all of the micro Witbiers I consume, nothing compares to this.  I’ve always been into it’s German counterpart, Wiezens, but after trying this for the first time last fall I’ve always been ordering new Witbiers over Hefe-Wiezens off of the menu.  I’ve had this both bottle and tap... pale, hazy, golden color with a thick, frothy white head.  Aroma of citrus and other spices, almost foral.  Taste is a complicated blend of sweet spices with grainy wheat tastes and other seasoned flavors.
Bottle. Whiteish, very light yellow pour with thin head that lasted a long time. Pretty cloudy. Light sweet lemony aroma. Very smooth. I’m not much into wheat, but this is good.

Pours to that watery piss color that is so famous and that i’ve never cared for.  Aromas of bland citrus and piles of clove.  Flavors of lemon pound cake and candy sugar with a dry, papery finish.  Served too cold it feels and tastes much like lemon-lime soda.  Lacks nuance.

Hazy light beige (almost white) colour with a thin white head with good lacing. Without the head, it would really look very similar to a lemonade. Great aroma full of yeasts and fruits (specially orange and lemon). Great spicy flavour of sweet malts and fruits (again, specially lemon and orange). Not so especial palate. Aftertaste, however, is a very pleasant: good mix of spice, yeasts, orange and malt. Do not drink this beer very cold or you’ll miss basically everything!!! Refreshing and easy to drink. Very good beer.

I had to reevaluate this beer after giving it another try at my brother’s insistence. For whatever reason I enjoyed it more the second time around. Nice white head with spicy aroma and taste. A hint of citrus. Well worth a try.
Had this one from the large 800 ml plus glass. Goes down extremely smooth... a great session beer with a light presence but moreish taste

33cl bottle, 4.9% a/v

Pours a white colour as promised with a very little tinge or yellow colour. Smells of very little, kinda spicy, maybe cloves. Taste is spicy as well, somewhat malty and definite hints of orange. Tastes pretty good! Aftertaste consisting of a nice clove and orange flavour.
Best Belgian White that I’ve got for so far. Also the best known witbier in Holland. Nice taste and aftertaste. I’m not really a fan of the witbier-aroma, but the taste and flavor compensate that.
Really quality Belgian wit. easy drinking for sure.  Features a distinct coriander note.  Highly recommended.

this was part of the samples at my 1st appearance at the forum with HansK....Fresh and very flowery and fruity...looks like a lime grapefruit juice...amazingly good flavour..lichi juice springs to mind.the bottled version sure is a bastard when compared to a delicous tap version.

This is a nice Witbier. The body is hazy golden and the foamy white head looks so tasty. The aroma comes with banana, pineapple, vanilla and marmalade. The flavor is so fresh with a hopy,sweet and wheaty taste.
Delicious...spicey...dry...lots of orange....really easy drinking beer...four green fields...tap

Creamy beige color with thick white frothy head that leaves behind good lacing.  Delicate aroma of yeast and fruit.  Well balanced spice and citrus flavor complements aroma to a tee and yield to an even, dry finish.  What I like here is that these flavors aren’t exagerrated and are easy to enjoy.  Palate falls short of expectations.  With a creamy appearance, one would be inclined to expect a creamy palate...  It’s actually pretty watery but well carbonated.   Refreshing beverage!
Cloudy yellow in appearance with no head. I’m no expert on white beers, but to me this was just like any other pretty much. Bland, gassy and full of cereal malts.

First white beer that I ever tried. Had it again recently and enjoyed the light, but simaltaneously complex taste. I really did not like it the first time, but the beer proved to taste very good the next times I tried it after I had already tried a wider variety of white beers.

[069-20061021] Tap @ Clocktower (Ottawa,ON). Wheat, lemony hints, some exotic spices in the aroma. Lightly cloudy, wheatfield-coloured body with a medium-lasting white head. Flavour is wheaty yeast with astringent citrus notes, all of which are in the aftertaste. Lightly complex with an acidic mouth. Nice beer for a patio (in the Summer, I’d say, though everyone was watching the snowboarder competition outside at the time -- grumbling over CT’s lack of their own beer to offer).
Standard white look and smell, this is nice. Much better than the wittekerke, smooth and uncomplicated. Still, it is a little too wheaty for me.
Light, refreshing, goes well with several foods, from a great steak to a pizza. Excellent choice after a round of golf in the hot sun.
On tap in Pittsburgh, PA.  Very fruity taste.  Nice golden color with little head.  A little sting on the tongue.  Goes down very smoothly.  Try it; you won’t be disappointed.

Extremely light flavor with little to no head.  This is the quintessential light summer beer, that actually has a kick with 4.9% alcohol.  This beer does what most white’s and lights sold in American don’t do, delivery flavor while beening non-filling and easy drinking.  (I do however love Blue Moon).  You could never go wrong with this beer in a crowd, unless you are in a crowd of ho-bo’s or old Irishman.

330 mL bottle.  Translucent white-gold with little to no head.  Strong cloves in the aroma, with a bit of burnt toast.  Tastes like. . . well . . . coriander and orange peel.  Who knew?  A little metallic/bitter on the finish.  Somehow, it works; it’s tasty, crisp, and original.

Great beer for a hot day: If you are currently being obscured by American Belgian Whites such as Blue Moon, please try this beer and you will not be disappointed.
I prefer to drink this on tap but you can`t go wrong with a bottle, you will still taste the fruity flavors either way.

Bottle at home. Hazy light yellow color,   with big white creamy head. Nice white ale. In Belgium recommended by doctors if you have a kidney stone. So if you do this is the best (at least the testiest) medicine!

One of my favorite beers.  I’m a big fan of hoegaarden.  It’s a cloudy beer, full of flavor.  The fruit flavors that you see can be hated by some, but I love it.  it’s light and refreshing, excellent all the time.

This is the Big Daddy of wheat beers.   There has been many copies of this style but this probably still the best.  Great on tap.  Full of fruit flavours that you either love or hate.  Its hard to find a summer beer anywhere that can match this
definately my favorite beer especially in the spring. i normally drink it from the bottle at home but had it on tap in antwerp and couldn’t believe how gorgeous it tasted. so began my love affair.

Ideal for summer especially. Immensely refreshing. Pours cloudy light yellow, with quick dissolving white head. Fruity aroma. Tastes of oranges, banana, spices. Best served cold on draft. My only real complaint about this beer, is that it is a little bit watery.
sampled at Andy’s Corner Bar.  Very hazy straw colored beer.  Aroma is wheat and spices.  Taste is estery, spicy, and  peppery.  Some very light notes of  tangy citrus also.

Surprised by the 11.2 oz bottle.  Above average carbonation with a creamy head.  Hazy, very light colored yellow.  Very enjoyable and a refreshing finish.  I like it.  Could not detect any undesirable bitterness what so ever.
Pours a cloudy light orange with a decent fizzy white head.  The aroma is lightly fruity and the flavor has a spritzy quality throughout with a light orange flavor.

The original white ale, and probably the best.  A sensational appearance and aroma.  The palate and taste are also top notch.  If you can find this beer on draft, you will be hooked!  Not bad from a bottle either...but pour into a pint glass.

Gold pour with a brilliant frothy head.  Citrusy coriander aroma. 
Flavor is original and distinctive light with spice taste. Very nice witbier indeed.
On tap. Cloudy light yellow with a decent white head. A lot of citrus, sweet and sour flavor. It would be better on a warm day.
75cl. bottle. Yellow cloudy colour with a whtie head. Flavour and aroma is fruite, coriander and citrus.

A good representation of what a witbier is, and although not the best of the style, it is widely available. Slightly cloudy, yellow with a small whitish head, light lacing. Flavor notes of wheat and citrus, slightly sweet, and a hint of spice.  Something in the aroma I could not put my finger until I read it in someone’s review - definitely banana, as well as some sort of spice. Very enjoyable and drinkable, as no single flavor note hits you over the head too hard.

Brown bottle of 330 ml, Color yellow with little cloudinness, white head that dissapear rapidly, Smell of coriander and fruit, Taste of coriander, fruit and sweetness, Really refreshing beer

Bouteille brune de 330 ml, Couleur jaune pâle légèrement voilé avec un petit col qui disparaît vite, Odeur de coriandre et de fruit, Goût de coriandre, fruit et sucré, Très rafraîchissante
This is a all time drinkable beer and in large amounts... :-) I really enjoy this beer, light smooth citrus flavor and nice mid range aroma and color.
Always a winner.  I have had this beer on tap and from a bottle many times and never been disappointed.  Great citrus flavor, good aroma and color.

On tap in Århus.  

One of my talk-show beers, showing the sweet weissbeer style with curacao. Also one of my wifes favorites. A true lady-beer.
Refreshing, fine taste of spices and a fine zing in the finish. OK to come from one of the evil giants.
12oz, very distinct flavour of sweet coriander/ clove and slight banana, with similar in nose.  Pours beautiful slight cloudy straw yellow.  LIttle foam, pleasant finish with bit of zest .

12 oz. This beer has a rather unique taste. I was told that this was best with a bit of fruit such as an orange to go with it, but I did not try. If I were to buy it again I would have to try the oranges, to see the change in taste.

Bottled. Pours yellow/orange with quickly dissapatimg foamy head which leaves some lacing. Wheaty, citrus aroma, big lemon. Very  Flavour is super clean generallly but begins a little metallic before mellowing into orangey niceness.  Smooth. I could sink a few of these happily but fairly non-dememo  as Whites go. Nice but nothing to get excited about.
This one pours cloudy with a muted yellow body and a thin white head. It has a hoppy, fruity aroma with a suggestion of strawberries. The flavor is mellow with a slightly spicy finish.

The first time I had this beer was in Boone, NC on tap and it was fabulous. I still can’t get enough of it because it has a great taste and goes down smooth. Don’t drink it at room temp. chill it slightly.
very light cloudy yellow with a fluffy head. Yeasty, lemony aroma. Tastes of citrus fruits, yeast, slight clove as well. Not partial to Belgian whites but this one is really good.

Cloudy light yellow - like limejuice with a little milk. White mostly lasting head. Aroma offers wheat, lime and a little hint of grass. In the taste these are suplemented by a little koriander. High carbonation, less taste. Watery finish.
Made me think of cloudy lemon cordial while pouring, citrus aromas as well.  Definately a special beer, smooth palate and great balance of honey sweetness and floral bitterness

At first tasting, I thought this beer quite exceptional. But after multiple re-trials, I found it flagging in longevity. Diminishing returns came too quickly. It’s a one-shot experience--one beer at a time, and you’re fine--but lacks successive reward. I prefer Chimay’s Cinq Cents or even Duvel within the white spectrum.

On Tap: The first time I tried this beer was from a bottle, tasty, but not overly impressed. Went out to a local eatery, they had your usual American horse piss (Bud, Miller, Coors), I noticed that they had Hoegaarden White on tap, I have a knew found respect for this beer. Clean, crisp, smooth and refreashing. All around good beer.

A colorful yellowish white with a lot of foam and specs of brown flakes seen in the beer. Huge aroma of yeast and banana that made me sigh with relief i had finally found out what all of the hype was all about. Very refreshing and easy going flavor that had me gulping away at this stuff. Perfect in every respect.

Sept. 4, 2006; 12 oz. bottle. Hazy, whitish/yellow pour with respectable head.  Light & citrusy in flavor, lacking the malty balance you’d expect from other styles. The Belgian styles (light or dark) aren’t my cup(s) of tea, but I’d imagine this as a pleasant summertime beer that even a macro devotee might enjoy.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale yellow with a nice frothy white head.
Nose is orange, lemon, coriander and pepper. Taste is light and refreshing with citrus and spice.
This is my reference wit beer. I have loved it ever since I took my first sip of it about 15 years ago from the first batch imported to Norway.  
Smooth and delicious and amazingly easy to drink. A real summer treat.

The authentic, the inventor, the bar that sets all Belgians.  Good on tap or in bottle.  If this has regressed in quality from the old days, I’d damn sure love to taste the vintage.   it’s hard to call anything out on this beer - this beer is what all other wits were styled after.

This beer is not just ’called’ white beer it literally is a WHITE beer. It pours a slightly off white color and has white head with a very short retention. Quite heavy lacing.

Smell: Very potent! Yeast, Lemon, citrus rinds and wheat fill your nose with lots of strong pleasant aromas.

Taste: The taste is similar to the smell. It is very active. There is a significant spicy hop character creating the flavor of cloves lemon peels and pepper. It is not overly bitey though, because the cool watery center carries a light yeasty sweet whit bread character through your mouth washing the tart citrus away as quickly as it developed. Mildly interesting but overall average for the style.

Mouthfeel: Something about the mouthfeel creates a strange stall for me. This beer is somewhat smooth but just before swallowing it stalls for a moment. Basically it does not slide down easily. I am not sure if it is the peppery character of the beer or the hops but it tickles my throat causing me to need to think about swallowing it. Strange.

Drinkability: This beer feels cool and refreshing in the mouth but did not seem to finish smoothly. It may have just been me today so I will try it again. For now I will say it is a fine Witbier and suitable for a hot day.

Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!

HOEGAARDEN! Finally decided to try this one just so I can tell Immy that I’ve had it. Pours like lemonade with a big foamy whipped egg white head. Very light grassy citrus aroma. Light bodied. Taste is kind of sweet and sour grassy with a clove aftertaste. Not too shabby.

I don’t like this Inbev product anymore. Light in color, refreshing, mildy citrussy. The wheat is definitely identifiable. Also a hint of an herbal aroma to it. 
Re-rated after taste @ Hoegaarden Kouterhof, 06.09.09.
In America, you mostly have one choice for a white: Hoegaarden. I’d love to taste this beer in Belgium, though. Nice, crisp taste. Coriander. Very refreshing in the summer.
Bottle - Pours a very light hazy yellow with a white head.. Smell is yeast and cloves.. Typical of a Belgian Wheat... Taste is pretty much how it smells.. not a huge fan but its pretty good

Pours a very pale hazy gold with a 1/2 inch snow white head. Smells strongly of coriander. A hint of orange zest and some sour wheat malt.

Tastes of sour wheat malt, some underpinning of orange rind. Lots of coriander. Mouth is crisp and light. Very tasty, very drinkable. One of my old standbys for summer. A classic example of the style.
Color of gold –white head- nose of bananas, yeast, cobwebs, and ???–taste of yeast, citrus and hints of clove – light body – sweet yeast aftertaste

On tap. I find the colour very unappealing - a bit like weak tea with just a dash of milk - but it would be a shame to let this put you off. The taste is magnificent, a mingling of citrus and spice with the earthiness of the yeast. A truely refreshing summer beer. The only thing I really don’t like about it is the shape of the authentic Hoegaarden tumbler glass - it reminds me of the one my grandmother kept her false teeth in - the stuff of nightmares.
Light in color, refreshing, mildy citrussy. The wheat is definitely identifiable. Also a hint of an herbal aroma to it. Good for a change, and easy to drink for the ladies.

This beer pours such a pale yellow it almost reminds me of white.  Quite fitting.  The nose is both grainy and yeasty - with mingling notes of lemony breads and light banana fruit.  The body starts soft and lush, propeling the wheat malts across the tongue.  Subtle notes of vanilla and caramel sweeten the body as well.  Vanilla, pound cake, honey all add to the subtle complexity. Finishes citrusy and a bit dry and champagne-like.  A good summertime beer for sure and by far my favorite Wit.
mmmmmm very thirst quenching..lemony citrus lovely on hot summers day with barbecue. The spice and zestiness are very refreshing.

Big white fat head, very very smooth beer. Took some getting used to (after drinking a variety of Canuck beers all weekend) Smells like bananas, fruits, and a touch of yeast. Took a whole 6 pack to really get a clear idea what this beer was all about. Pretty awesome stuff, very smooth.
0.33lt Bottle. Cloudy yellow color, thin white head. Spices, banana, citric fruits , malt and yeast aromas and taste. Pretty coimplex beer. Very enjoyable.
Has a unique glow in the dark color.  Kind of like florescent white.  Large white head.

On tap in .5 liter glass. Poured pretty clear for an unfiltered wheat beer with a solid head that stuck around till the last. Aroma of lemon and wheat and some aspects of cloves, but no banana flavor. Lacking in overall mouth flavor due to too cold a pour.
I used not to like white beer, but this is pretty  good. Only drink it when the weather is warm and don’t get sucked in by the people around you putting lemon in it.

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a cloudyyellow with a small lasting white head. Aromas of coriander, wheat and a hint of citrus. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, citrus and light coriander with a crisp sweet finish.

Draught in Hoegaarden glass (great for asthetics!).  Cloudy, very pale yellow, almost white.  Slighly fruity (orange, maybe a little banana too?), spicy, wheaty, and yeasty in both aroma and flavor.  Light on the palate and easy to drink.  Not too sweet, not too sour, not too spicy - Everything is just right for the style.  A great beer that’s widely available.  Flavors become more pronounced and complex as the beer warms.  

16 oz draught, $6.25 (with glass) at the Winking Lizard Tavern (Crossroads).

Bottle. Cloudy yellow, one of the palest beers around, and the head is big and very white. Aroma is mostly coriander in my opinion with a hint of bananas. Flavours start sweet, but are matched by harmonious spiciness. Mild citrus. Light-bodied, slightly grainy mouthfeel. This classic is still a great companion on a hot summer’s day.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow color with a white head. Aroma is citrus, spices, koriander and wheat. Flavor is spicy and sweet. A very nice mixture between the two. Tasting bananas, lemon, wheat, and spicy notes.

On tap.  My friends love to guzzle this stuff at our local pub, but I just can’t get into it. Hoegaarden to me is a thin wheat beer that has a fruity (but not in a pleasant kind of way) aroma to it. The taste is a bit too sharpe for me. But not being a fan of wheat beer, I probably am a little biased.

Draught at Milestone’s. Can’t believe I’ve never rated this till now!? Anyways, it pours a cloudy yellow with a small lasting frothy white head. Aroma’s surprisingly decent: wheat, yeast, fruit and spices (and thankfully, not too much banana). Somewhat watery flavour follows the aroma with a mildly bitter and tart finish. I found the aftertaste only so-so. Light bodied. It’s friggin’ hot out so this was better then usual, otherwise it’s a mediocre Wheat beer at best.

On tap at Tampa Bay Brewing Co. Hazy yellow color with white head. Spicy-yeasty-wheat aroma. The taste was fruity then dry wheat then a bit of tart-sourness. Really refreshing brew for a hot summer day.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow color with a white head. Aroma is citrus, spices, and wheat. Flavor is spicy and sweet. A very nice mixture between the two. Tasting bananas, lemon, wheat, and spicy notes. This is a very enjoyable beer, glad that I have more of this to enjoy!

Perfect opaque dull yellow with a moderate white head. Spicy, yeasty citrus aroma with an earthy undertone. Very light bodied to the point of being watery. Soft and sweet. Somewhat too sweet, in a cloying saccarine way. The citrus and spice character seems not as fresh as previous samples. All in all, this is not the beer I remember.

Pours a standard belgian white cloudy yellow with a thick white head.  Aroma is spice, and maybe some citrus.  Spice is definately the forerunner here.  Flavor is nice and light, with bananas, bubblegum, with some trace of lemon.  Very light and smooth beer - excellent for summer.

Nice hazy bright yellow color... decent foamy head.  Nice wheaty, yeasty flavors with a good amount of sweet citrus/lemon elements.  I’ve had many of these in my time, they’re pretty good.. an old stand-by.  I can’t say it’s exceptional, but it is a solid brew indeed.

This is rapidly becoming my favorite Belgian Witbier.  Aroma is really great.  Lots of citrus, lemon, pepper, and banana, and orange. Cloudy golden apearance with a thin head.  Taste is light, dry, crisp, and thirst quenching and with not as much malt or breadeness.  This is exactly what I like about Witbiers vs hefeweizens.

Tap at Oak Cafe. Served true to style in a tumbler. Cloudy lemon yellow in color with huge white head. Great lacing. Aroma is a combo of yeast and fruity esters up front, and faint spice in the background. Flavor has tons of banana and citrus zest with coriander coming through in the finish. Tad surprised at overall, as this is one of the easiest drinks out there.

Tap.  Aroma:  Light citrus (mostly lemon), coriander spice, and yeast.  Appearance:  Very pale yellow and hazy.  Head was full, bright white and fluffy.  Decent lacing.  Flavor:  Citrus flavor presents first, with notes of Lemon and orange.  Spiciness follows soon after.  Mostly coriander, but some decent pepperiness as well.  Yeast is also prevalent, but masked a little by the citrus/coriander.  Palate:  Light bodied, and a little watery.  Carboantion was lively but appropriate.  Finish was dry and clean.  Overall:  A good starting point for the style, but far from the best witbier  there is.

Bottle. Hazy gold with white head. Aroma is citrus and spicy. Flavor is malt, citrus, and spices. Very well balanced. I consider this beer to be a classic Belgian White, however, I feel that there are other Belgian Whites out there that are comparable, but less expensive.
Hazy pour with a fairly long lasting head. Mild spices and decent citrus nose and taste. Very refreshing. Great summer beer.

12 oz bottle.
Very cloudy yellow beer, with a huge frothy yet tight pure white head. Gorgeous lace.
Very zesty ,spicy aroma but also a sort of lush creamy aroma also. Coriander like spice comes to the fore after a minute of nostril stretching!!
Nice smooth spicyness..i know that seems like a contradiction but its what I get, yeasty, apricots, some hints of papaya..and a nice mellow bitterness at the end.
Very nice mouthfeel, quite thick and smooth yet far from boring.
A very easy going belgian, goes down very well in hot weather.
An all round good beer.
A nice light Belgian beer.  Probably the best Whit beer most people have had.  Nice white head, finishes clean.
bottled 30 cl, 4.9% , murky light yellow colored, with soft white head. Spicey taste, with citric finish. Nice summer eve beer

Poured to a hazy golden color, with snow-white head, that lingered awhile, then dissipated to a thin white lace Aroma was spicy hops, with a hint of fruit. Flavor was very strongly spiced, mostly clove, and the finish was most refreshing. A very god beer for a hot summer night.

one of the best white beers Belgum has to offer. Strong coriander taste,smell is very crisp. This beer compliments almost any food. Color is very pale and cloudy,with a nice foam top. The coriander leaves somewhat of a nice after taste.
One of the best Belgian beers i have ever tasted. Honestly think it taste better from a bottle than the tap.  An orange is a must.  One of the best beers you can buy from your local grocer.
Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow with a white head. Sweet, citrusy, yeasty aroma. Flavour is pretty much the same. Notes of coriander in the finish. Smooth palate. 11-07-06.

I always thought I had already rated this. I used to think this beer was absolutely delicious. Either my taste buds have changed, or the beer has. Somewhat cloudy and yellow. Looks like a good witbier. Little spicy, as it also should be. Except, I find it to be very thin and watery from what I remember. Astringent and very bland on the back end. Used to think this beer was a classic. Now it’s a somewhat sour bore.

The original, had to try it finally after having a few beers that try to be Hoegaarden.  Turns out ones like Allagash white do a pretty good job of emulating this beer.  Pours the normal suspecting white style with a big foamy head.  I taste the coriander notes, but it’s not overwhelming which is good.  I also tasted that citrus tang that is to be expected.  Everyone’s had this, it’s good, but not great.  Glad I’ve had it a little later in my beer tasting adventure since it would have struck me as a little more fascinating at my earlier beer drinking stages.

Kedelig tynd øl.

Minder om en weisbeer balndet op med vand..

Er tisgul i farven.
Very enjoyable summertime beer with a light lemony flavor.Pours a nice yellowish cloudy brew with a good head.I find it a refreshing brew .

Mmmmm.. 4th of July, plenty of BBQ and burgers and a nice cloudy Hoegaarden to wash it all down!! Good beer! Pours a cloudy gold in the tumbler with a two-finger thick white, foamy head. Subtle hops and notes of citrus fruits (orange and lemon). Herbal flavor with notes of coriander and malty sweetness. A great Witbier!

Bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into 16oz tumbler - Pours hazy brown gold with a 1/2 finger white head that goes quickly; Orange, malt, wheat and a slight hop smell to the nose; Fairly full, refreshing initial taste with orange, malt, and plenty of wheat; A sweet backtaste with a hint of the coriander; A very well balanced beer that has enough sweet to be nice, but enough zing to be interesting! I enjoyed this quite a bit and will definitely be drinking it again!

Pouring like the bottle instructs yields a very nice, but short lived foamy head-appears pale yellow and cloudy. aroma is fruity yeasty and wheaty with mild citrus and bread. flavor is light and very carbonated yet has a superb wheaty, fruity punctuation with a slightly tangy sweet finish-nice tangy, yeasty flavor lingers. overall, this is solid and is definitley a summer staple. beyond refreshing and ultra-drinkable. if 30pks of this were 16.99, id be homeless.

Best white beer I’ve had. Strong coriander taste,smell is very crisp and clean. This beer compliments almost any food. Color is very pale and cloudy,with a nice foam top.
The coriander leaves somewhat of an after taste.

From bottle. Strong malt aroma, maybe honey also. Cloudy appearance with foamy white head that soon disappears. Good carbonation, looks like lemon squash. The beer has a sweet citrus flavour followed by a weird flavour of what I think is smokey bacon. Overall not as good as I remembered, I would like to try this beer on tap in Belgium if they drink it in Belgium because I wouldn’t.
A very refreshing and not too sweet white. The strong fruit flavors ( mostly orange and lemon) give it a distinct taste. In a word, this beer is special.

Hazy yellow, small white head.  Citrusy nose with some hops.  Taste is lemony, a bit spicy (coriander and other) and some orange peels.  Stronger hop character than most other witbiers.  The hops do not get in the way of the acidity/astringency, it even complements it nicely and add a level complexity not often seen in other witbiers.  Talk about a classic.  If this beer was a song it would go something like this “…and she’s buying a witbier to heaven….” and beer store owners would put up signs saying “No Hoegaarden tasting allowed”.

Bottle.  Pours a nice off white, yellow tint with an nice lasting head.  Has a spicy/citric aroma.  A smooth body with a somewhat herbal (?) aftertaste.  I nice beer during the hot and humid summer months.

Bottle. Pours an incredible off-white and yellow with a nice 2-finger fluffy head. I can detect a lot of lilac and a slight citrus scent to it. Nice thick mouthfeel, goes down very well. No astringency to it. Banana and more of a herbally/flowery character as an aftertaste. A very enjoyable beer. I’m curious as to how the Speciale and Grand Cru compare.

Hazy straw pour with a persistent, pure white cap of foam. Fresh orange aroma, apple tartness, restrained cloves. The flavor is a bit hard to nail down--it feels so etherial and bright that pulling out individual strands requires significant focus. Hmmm. Dry and toasty, with a lemony-zip. A nice wheat spritzy mouthfeel, without rough carbonation. Light bodied without being insipid. This is what I it seem like those towering white clouds over the sun-drenched fields of wheat in Kansas would taste like.

Hazy yellow-orange color.  Huge white head that dissapated fairly quickly.  Strong wheat aroma with a nice spicy and citrussy smell.  Nice citrus flavor.  Nice level of hoppiness. Medium to high bitterness for a witbier.  Spice an citrus flavors.  Solid finish.  thin mouthfeel, flavor could be stronger.
Moderate hoppy aroma. Large frothy white head. Good lasing. Clear yellow body color. Moderate bitter initial flavor. Light to medium watery palate.

12oz bottle: Great earthy aroma with coriander and undertones of citrus and peaches. A light yellow pour with a clean white head. The flavor was a bit short with just a hint of what the aroma offered. Light bodied and a lightly carbonated mouth feel. A little dull on the tongue. Refreshing and drinkable but not particularly memorable.
Really pale, nice head. Citrus aroma, not hoppy though. Very light in body (in a good way), refreshing. I actually prefer their Grand Cru, but this would be really nice on a hot day.

Hoegaarden Witbier / Bière Blanche. Alc 4.9% vol. 330 ml brown bottle. Cloudy, pale yellow. White medium-sized head, that slowly fades away. Odours of some white bread, a lot of fruit, some alcohol, and a little sugar. Fresh and semi-smooth mouthfeel. Very sweet and fruity taste. Banana-like flavours. Maybe some coriander and some orange peel, I am sure it is there somewhere. A very fine beer, perhaps too sweet in the long run.

12oz. bottle.  Murky pale yellow-gold color with a medium sized foamy white head.  Wheat, mild yeast esters, citrus and coriander in the aroma.
