Clean wheat flavors that become superceded by a mild citric tang and cordiander and estery spiciness.  Mild yeasty must in the finish with residual coriander and banana flavors.  Mouthfeel is a medium light, rather smooth.

Big white head over a hazy pale yellow. LIght spiec and citrus aroma. Clean light body that is refreshing on the palate. Moslty citrus in the flavor, with some faint yeasty notes in the background. Finishes slightly sour without any lingering sweetness to detract from its refreshing cahracter.
Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Pale yellow colour. Powerfull citrus aroma. Deasent flavor, not too sweet. Nice but a little watery palate.
Pours a rather white cloudy color with a nice white head.  Aroma is typical belgian yeasty with hints of wheat.  Flavor is very clean and typical of belgium whites.  This is a very good brew.
I really enjoyed this beer. The orange and corriander flavors really set this beer apart from others I’ve tried. Very summery and refreshing. I would buy this again.

12oz bottle (surprised it isn’t 11.2oz), <!-- Best before end 08/02/07<!-- /i -->.  Pours a  very cloudy light golden with a medium pillowy white head.  Big aroma of Belgian yeasts, ripe bananas, some lemon, coriander, and crisp wheat.  Flavor is very wheaty with some lemon and coriander.  The yeast and bananas are more in the background.  Very refreshing on a muggy night such as this.  As eaglefan said, I would be able to drink a few of these in one sitting, as opposed to some other Belgian Whites that have too much artificial orange or sweetness.  Very nicely done, I see why it is one of the higher rated wits.

Enjoyed this white a lot. Not as flowery and wild tasting as Blue Moon makes theirs, yet it tastes great and has a nice citrusy touch that leaves the wheat prominent with each sip. Could drink a few of these in a row. Makes a great bottom to a black and tan (belgian waffle).

(bottle, Bilka Odense)
A very good white , the alcohol did not steal the picture, and the taste is light, but with substance anyway. Very refreshing, probably one of the very best of its kind (white ) that i have tasted so far.

In one word : refreshing.

floral, citrus, herbs, very faint hint of something not totally dissimilar to banana, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness,
Nice wit. Golden cloudy colour with a medium white mostly lasting head. Aroma and taste of coriander and citrus. nice palate.

Poured from bottle.  Wonderful aroma - banana bread with spice and pepper.  Flavor has same elements, as well as angel cake with orange spice notes.  Kind of an albino look to it - nice.  Good finish as well.

Brown bottle, 33 cl, best before 4/10/7, tasting at Ian’s with Dum and Lubière on September 15, 2006; eye: pale yellow, hazy, slight effervescence, white head; nose: bread, yeast, coriander, light hops; mouth: bitterness, coriander, hops, malt, medium body, thin, quite carbonated, lightly bitter and sweet 

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, meilleure avant 4/10/7, dégustation chez Ian avec Dum et Lubière le 25 septembre 2006; oeil : jaune pâle, voilée, très légère effervescence, mousse blanche; nez : pain, levure, coriandre, léger houblon; bouche : amertume, coriandre, houblon, malt, corps moyen, texture mince, assez carbonatée, légèrement amère et sucrée

Bottle: Pours medium yellow, very hazy, with a thick white persistent head. Smells like rising bread dough with a vague hint of vanilla.
Tastes vaguely like ginger ale without the bite, bit of vanilla, light on the palate, sour, a little spice. I quite enjoyed it with my dinner!
draught: light yellow pastel color.  nose is full of yeast, citrus, and coriander.  flavor is of citrus, sour from yeast, and slightly spicy.  A bit watery.  that’s my only complaint.  Pretty good.

I have fond memories of drinking this all the time at Charlie’s in Harvard Square in the gigantonormous glasses a few years ago. Hoegaarden just made its way to Arizona taps and beer stores, and I’m sad to say it’s either not as good as I remembered it or not the same beer it used to be before Inbev took over. Pours a pretty cloudy pale yellow color and has a slight yeasty, citrusy flavor with a light body - it’s mostly bland and completely inoffensive (which may be why I liked it so much way back when). Not bad on a hot day though.

Bottled. Pours a cloudy pale straw with a significant, lacy white head. Aromas of coriander, citrus and yeast. Light to medium body with lightly fizzy carbonation. Taste of bread, orange and cloves with a crisp corriander finish. Interesting "Yeast-Rousing 101" lesson on the back label.
Pale Yellow White with tight lasting lacy head.  Sour orange aromas.  Med to Light body, orange flavors with a little pine.  Perfect bitterness.  Could drink this all day.

One of my favorites! This beer will always have a special place in my heart. It opened my mind up to the world of beer and pulled me away from the days of Colt45 and Molson Canadian. I love how refreshing it is on a hot summers day.
The beer gods must be pleased with this brew! A great tasting, cloudy white concoction that is delightfully refreshing!

Julios Spring Beer Festival. Light somewhat milky yellow pour, with a head of crisp white. Rich, yet drawn aroma of orange peel and light clove. Flavor is a fine sweet sugars and light touches of tooth wheat. A hint of warmth and yeastiness and general spice. Cloves and lemon glow a little on the back end. Smacks with light grass.
Hoegaarden has a nice cloudy body and an extrememly large frothy head of foam. I enjoied the unike spicy aroma and the crisp finish. Great foam, great taste, great aroma.

The Belgian brew poured bright yellow, like grapefruit juice.  The aroma was citrus and spice.  The flavor was crisp & refreshing.  This was a fantastic white beer that I look forward to drinking again soon!
Very light color reminds me of lemonade with a decent white head.  Smooth to drink with a nice blend of citrus and fruity tones with some hints of coriander.  Nice crisp finish.
very clean refreshing taste, great for when it is warm outside. served from the tap with an orange slice on the rim.
Pours a hazy yellow with a nice head.  Smells of fresh fruit, citrus in particular.  A very nice blend of lemon and banana which comes to a close in a crisp finish.
Pours very bright and ywllowish. Big white top. Kind of thin but not too thin. Tastes of banana and possibly other fruits as well. Some hops and yeast in the taste too. Aroma is fruity and fresh.
A fantastic white beer.  A spicy ale with a yeast note.  I have tried both botttle and on tap.  Very light golden colour with good carbonation and a nice white head.  Very refreshing.

12 oz bottle.  Cloudy straw colored with a big whipped head.  Yeast, wheat, lemon, coriander and yellow squash.  Taste much the same.  I keep thinking perfume.  Expected to be a bit fuller based on how it looked.  Thanks to Pimp Immy for the Ho.
bottle. lemon yellow murkey color. large white head. smells citrusy. silky sweet. very fresh. a real summer beer. dossent linger.

Bottle: Ok, time to re-rate this.  My knowledge of beer and palate have obviously changed drastically since May of 2006 when my beer journey began.  Pours very light yellow, cloudy (I gave it the truffle shuffle to drop in that yeast), a very nice but short-term foamy white head.  Aroma is Meyer lemon, black pepper, cloves, coriander.  It’s still a decent white with lots of citrus, a peppery bite, and a good helping of those usual spice subjects: coriander, clove, pepper.  A good beer, but a bit too carbonated to be a go-to for me.

Original Rating: 9/5/9/4/18/4.5
Bottle: One of the best, for dang sure.  Pours cloudy (it’s supposed to be) with a thick head that won’t run off on you.  Aroma of orange, cloves, and coriander that also come bursting through in the flavour.  This is the single most refreshing beer I’ve ever had, and absolutely perfect on a warm day.  They really don’t come much better, do yourself a favour and try it.  Try a squirt of lemon the second time, it’s like a whole new kind of excellent.

Draft. Huge white head with bubbly, yellow body. Aroma full of orange and coriander. Sweet flavor evoking orange peel on top with a slight sourness in the finish. Notes of coriander throughout. The palate is fizzy and thirst quenching. Short finish. Solid, above average.
From the bottle. Great appearance, not sure what the drink was in ’Ice cold in Alex’, but if it were me, i’d want it to look something like this. Fresh aroma, citrus flavour, crisp carbonation.

Have never recovered from the electric shock of first tasting this in Holland as a young novice. Was it manly to be seen drinking this?? Was it beer?? Was it right?? Did it really look like lemon meringue and taste like Savlon and spiced banana milkshake??Yes it did, and you all know you love it.

(Re-rate, 29/04/08) 2 years and 1376+ beers later, my love of this beer remains undimmed. Still has a certain peppery-milky something about it....

Pint, off tap. Thick, hazy yellow in colour, with a fair white head which disappeared. Aroma of citrus fruits, wheat and straw. Fruity, rich soft taste with definte hints of citrus fruits and wheat. Similar in the finish. Tasty refreshing witbier, though not the best.
Pours milky golden with lasting white foamy head. Aroma of lemon, citrus zest, bananas (faint) and wheat.  Flavor is mild and slightly sour with a predominant elements of citrus wheat and yeast.

On tap at Pickles Steakhouse.  Pours a hazy/milky golden yellow with an average white head.  Aroma of lemon, wheat, banana, coriander and some other citrus.  Flavors of the same with a light sourness.  Unfortunetly this was served with a lemon which was immediately taken out when it got to our table...but that may have contributed to more of the lemon and less of the orange that I was picking up.  Very solid Witbier that more and more bars have these days.
I foud the wheat flavor a bit too overwhelming. Not my favorite wheat, but I wiil gladly drink again.

Still one of my favorite Belgian whites.  Spicy and citrusy aroma, lasting head, and looks exactly like a witbier should.  Although its somewhat of a macrobrew now its still the standard wit against which others are judged.

Yum in a cup.  I can drink this all day long.  Strong banana nose that tastes like bubble gum.  If you put a lemon in this, you deserve to be slapped.  Unless you’re a gal.  In that case, do whatever you want.  You’re driving anyway.
Bottle.  Pours cloudy with fluffy head.  Aroma and taste of citrus.  I’ve been waiting for a pale beer that is just right for the summer time.  I may have found it.
Not crazy about aroma or appearance, but wonderful spicy, orange flavor, slightly sweet.
An early favorite. Perfect beer for a hot day. Sweet citrus and smooth inviting texture.

Yellow stained white in color with a big spritzy white froth. Aroma, well I’m not gonna publicize  what my initial write up said but I will say it smelled like canned, tart flesh. Light nectar weight. Crisp, clean flavors of Jolly Rancher Granny Smith  fruit candy. Goes flat after the froth settles. Dry and flavorfull with a clean finish.
This was my first white beer.  It was love at first sip.  I tried many beers while in Belgium, Netherlands and Germany but I kept coming back to the Hoegaarden White.

6 pack 12oz bottles from Lee’s Liquor: Not as tasty as some belgian whites I have brewed at home, but mine didn’t come all the way from belgium =)  Still very tasty, with a perfect witbier appearance-the pour looks white.  Perfectly balanced wheat beer flavors and spices, but I prefer a bit more tang and aggressiveness than this has.  Definitely the best choice for the summer heat.

a simple beer, with a very light taste of lager with orange and spices. Its refreshing and pours a hazy hay color with a huge heaven white head. The finish is oily-sweet and tangy, not my favorite style so far. Expected it to be more crisp and refreshing. It felt a little chewy with a hint of vinegar on the tongue. It would problably go down really well with salads.

This one pours a very light hazy yellow color. Almost looks like an unfiltered light beer with thick foamy head. The smell is sweet with hints of citrus. Mouthfeel is thin and high in carbonation. The taste is excellent, strong citrus flavor and a sweet lingering aftertaste. One of my favorites so far. Great witbier!

My first Belgian White. Light yellow color, thick creamy head. Apparrent coriander and citrus flavors. Perfumy and spicy in aroma, and a honeyish character. In recent times that I’ve tried this it’s developed lots of bubblegum in the late batches. I guess when you begin to sell at that large of a scale you lose some quality..
Large white head, opaque light yellow appearance.  Citrus and spice fragerance which follows through to the taste.  Excellent all round beer.
A very comforting and relaxed belgian white ale.  Not as strong as other belgian whites, but mixes orange and natural spices with a smooth finish

Bottle. Thick white head, hazy straw color, mild aroma of spice, yeast. A delicate malty and soft wheat taste with hints of citrus and spice, balanced perfectly for a summer day. This is the finest example of white beer.
On Draft at Issac Newtons with Stegosaurus. Pours pale golden with a white head. Aroma of spices, citrus, and yeast. Flavor is smooth and refreshing, spices, citrus, yeast. I like wittikerke better.

This stuff is great.  I see certainly how the Belgians view beer as food and season it accordingly.  It stimulates all senses.  I have found no substitute.  Also, having something that doesn’t lose its best flavor after 60 days in the bottle is a plus.
Bottle. Cloudy, light yellow appearance with a moderate white head which lingered nicely. Natural spice aroma. A very refreshing, citrus taste helps to award this beer with high marks.

Great beer that needs to be a part of your spring / summer beer roster.  It’s full of nice citrusy flavor and a very pleasant aroma, all the while being an exceptionally easy beer to drink.  For those who have not drank it before, make sure to follow the instructions on the back of the bottle and swirl the sediment after 2/3 of the bottle is emptied.  You’ll find a noticeable difference in appareance and taste.
Very pleasant and refreshing.  Yeasty and citrus with a touch of spice.  Great choice for warm Alabama nights.

Bottle, 33cl. Hmmm, what can i say about this beer that hasn’t already been said? This is a wonderful beer! All macrobrews should have a beer as good as this one. Very pale and hazy yellow with a good yet collapsing white head. Very characterist aroma, with notes of citrus and coriander. Flavour is very refreshing, fruity and yeasty and with some bitterness in the end. Perfect balance between the sour notes from the wheat and the sweetness from the fruits. This one is a must!

It pretty much look like lemonade. Hazy yellow with white head. smells a bit spicy but easy drinkable. Of course has a lot of wheat! Live carbonation and easy alrround finish. (Great for starters/beginners)!

Get it while you can!  All right ... you’ve probably not been able to get a "real" Hoegaarden for a long time, but ... soon ... it won’t be brewed at Hoegaarden even, so it will be nothing like the original that Mssr. Celis brought back for all of us to enjoy.  Aromas or orange, sweet malt and coriander.  As "white" as a beer can get with a huge, rocky, lasting head.  Delicious.

(03/2007).  Alas ... what to say?
Draft. Nice straw colored haze, with pure white head.  Yeast, citrus and coriander nose.  Full bodied lemony taste....but very refreshing. Nice beer.

Bottle at Old Chicago.  Aroma is of orange, lemon, and honey.  Incredible white head long lasting and slow to disappate.  Body looks like lemondade.  I found this to be somewhat light in flavor.  The whole witbier style seems a little uninteresting to me, although I think some in this style can be butchered.  That is not the case with this one.  Comparable but IMO slightly worse than the Victory Whirlwind or Bells Winter White.  Still decent.

This beer pours quite hazy with a straw color that almost has a tint of green to it.  The head is initially three-fingers thick and is a pale, almost white color that sticks around for a fair amount of time.  The aroma is almost bready with a yeasty note and there is a tart, green apple note here as well.  As I delve in deeper that characteristic, earthy coriander spice note asserts itself, as well as some soft citrus notes.



The taste has a certain fullness to it, though overall it is quite light and refreshing.  There is lots of spiciness here as well; definite notes of coriander, and citrus peel, as well as other notes of ginger, pepper, and clove.  There is a fair amount of sweetness here as well, it just hides or sort of melds with the spicy notes.  The citrus character, in combination with the light tartness, reminds me most of lemons.  There is a nice, light tartness here that keeps this beer quite light on the palate.  There is a certain, almost chewy grain character here that is only accentuated by the impact on the palate of the slight body fullness from this beer.



I am a sucker for Wits, especially on warm days (it hit 90*F here for the first time this year here), where I find them refreshing and invigorating.  I have not had this in a long time, but I am quite happy to drink this beer, it is certainly much better than quite a few American interpretations of this brew (of course a lot of the American interpretations are better than this), which is a pleasant experience from this once only example of the style.



Purchased: Plaza Liquors, Tucson, AZ

Hazy yellow white color.  Smells spicy of coriander.  Zesty taste of ripe orange peels  with a  generous portion of coriander, and a perfect blend of wheat.  A real unique beer.  This is very complex for a wheat beer.

Bottle, 33cl. Hmmm, what can i say about this beer that hasn’t already been said? This is a wonderful beer! All macrobrews should have a beer as good as this one. Very pale and hazy yellow with a good yet collapsing white head. Very characterist aroma, with notes of citrus and coriander. Flavour is very refreshing, fruity and yeasty and with some bitterness in the end. Perfect balance between the sour notes from the wheat and the sweetness from the fruits. This one is a must!

Bottle. Lemonade colored beer with a thick white head. Absolutely perfect looking. One of the most mouth watering appearances on the face of this earth. Pleasing lemony aroma with slight bready notes. Coriander comes through along with a nice citrus flavor. An enjoyable light and refreshing beer. Good for warm days.
Very good beer, has a distinct taste that you will love or hate.  Worth a try if you like white beers.

Appropriately enough, it’s whitish yellow in color, as name would suggest. Small, thin white head that diminished quickly. Smells of some citrus and wheat and tastes much the same. Not overpowering, but good none the less.

Witbier’s tend to be all the same. But with hoegaarden that is not the case. Seet aroma with a mild spice taste to it. Great appearence with a frosty head. Very drinkable and delightful beer. I don’t know anybody who can’t enjoy this.Cheers!

Pours an appealing pale hazy yellow.  Nice white head.  Nice citrus nose mixed with coriander and a light amount of sweetness - very natural smell.
Nice crisp flavor - lots of spice and citrus.  Pleasant lingering finish.  This is a classic that consistantly lives up to its hype.

Bottled (75 cL - woo!).  Pale yellow pour, like lemonade, hazy and crisp.  Foamy, frothy white head.  Aroma fills the room: dusty, yeasty, fruity, and yes, there’s some coriander there, too.  Controlled sweetness, short-to-no aftertaste, creamy mouthfeel.  Tastes as it smells, it is a wheat beer, after all.  Very very mild sourness.  Slight citrus.  Alcohol perfectly hidden.  Bonus point for subtlety, but I’m not getting worked up over this one - far less challenging than, say, a Leipziger Gose.  Then again, mildness is probably this one’s virtue.

750ml bottle. Perfect, typical light white cloudy wit beer. Gentle, fresh aroma, some fruitiness, citrus and yeast.  Very refreshing flavor, not to sweet and not to much citrus, moderate on the typical banana flavor. Mild, smooth, well balanced wit beer. Not exactly a challenge for the adventure seeking beer drinker, this is just a very pleasant commercial version of a wit. Could have one of these anytime.

Bottle. A light white hazy beer with a medium head which dissapeared quickly. Very little bubbles. The nose was of flowers, vanilla and wheat. The palate was very light, almost no taste, and the flavor was mostly of wheat, and a little of sth i couldn’t put my finger on, but it was sweet. Overall, although i don’t like this style very much, not too good, but not too bad at all.

Above average amber belgian white.  Not destroyed by spices in the way that many belgian whites have been.  Sampled at Room Temperature, pours pale yellow with murky appearance, strong carbonation and a thick white head.  Has a very yeasty taste, mixed with wheat.  Slight fruit hints.
Bottled. Hazy.Light. Yellow. Rich white Head. The aroma appear to be furity and sweet. The flavor is also a kind of sweet and fruity.
Uniquely-flavored witbier, however commercial.  Pale golden, and hazy.  Nose of subtle urine (not off-putting) and yeast.  A distinctive "mild lemonade" flavor.

pours a perfect head which results in plenty of heavy lacing as you drink.  nice flavours - especially on the finish which is extremely fruity - banana and orange tastes which turn into a mildly hoppy aftertaste.  The only problem I have with this beer is it is a little thin and initial tastes are minimal.

bottle - Pours pale yellow and cloudy with a moderate head.  The aroma is of citrus and yeast.  The taste has hints of citrus, moderate sweetness, and is very well balanced.  The finish is mild and smooth.  This is a quality brew.

Bottle, 750ml, 4.9% ABV. Average mostly diminishing head. Aromas of cirtus and corriander. Cloudy yellow appearance. Finely balanced flavour of cirtus, corriander and wheat with a hint of yeast in the finish. One of my favourite beers.
Bottle. Nice big head with medium duration. Pale pale yellow. High carbonation. Taste is fruity with just the right amount of citrus and acidity - which means not too much like many others.

WOW! Never had a beer like this before.  The look wasn’t too appealing to me- I usually enjoy darker beers.  But WOW!  Very sharp, crisp taste.  Very acidy-fruit.  Liked very much, one I would only have a few of at a time.

I must have poured a little too strong because I didnt have to swirl the last third of this bottle to get a descent head. Very light and cloudy color with a white head. This is my first witbier and i love the uniqueness in aroma and taste and would definitly try this again. The orange and citrusy flavor is so refreshing.

First rating
Rating added 3/15/2006
Bottle at Score Sportsbar in Gothenburg, Sweden.
Light yellow shady color, white head. Fruity and spicy "banana" scent. Refreshing fruity taste.
7/2/8/3/15=3.5

Rerate
33 cl bottle from Systembolaget.
On September 10, 2008
Shady yellow color, white head. Spicy phenolic and sweet scent and taste. Smooth mouthfeel, low bitterness.
7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Rerate
Bottled on May 15, 2017.
Cloudy, straw yellow color, white head. Citrus, choriander, malty sweet, very low phenolic scent. Low bitterness. Light sweet, some citrus, a touch of choriander, light phenolic taste. Medium smooth body, high CO2.
Was during a blind tasting judging by style, gave it 42 out of 50, so works really well in style for me. It is indeed really nice, albeit rather tae and laid back, do not make a fuss, well worth remembering to go back to now and then.
7/3/7/4/14=3.5

Pours pale straw into a tumbler.  Nice head retention which subsides with no lacing to a single layer across the glass.  Active dough/yeast aromas. Fizzy, dry and thin with bread, dough and clove notes.  Refreshing.
On tap at Cafe Amsterdam Oslo. Hazy milky yellow colour with a white head.:A hint of banana aroma. Pleasent banana and citrus flavour. citrus and lightly spicy finish.

33 cl bottle: Pours with a pale golden, cloudy body and a medium sized white head. Nose of spices, banana and citrus. Citrus, honey and wheat in the flavour. Light bodied. It´s very enjoyable, this classic witbier.
Great wit bier with a wonderful flavor of wheat and orange-peel.  Hints of coriander spice hit the nose while tasting the brew, which moves into a wheat and small hop finish.

Tap. Pale Yellow and White in color, like the old life-saver flavor, with a white fluffy head. Spicy and citrus aroma, including orange and lemon, wintergreen. Refreshing and light to the palate. Higher carbonation, but not harsh at all. Citrus and spice flavors, such as orange and wintergreen. Slight bitterness, sourness, but brief. A little wheatiness as well. Nice, refreshing whit beer and widely available.
Fine wheat beer, extremely soft on the palate. Orangy flavors, but needs to be served cold. Available on tap in the centre of Helsinki.

1. On Tap ap the Bar Fringe, Manchester 09/03/2001
Lemon aroma and flavour. Cloudy in appearance.
2. On Tap at the Beer House, Manchester 18/11/2001
Yellow coloured and cloudy in appearance. Lemon flavour and aroma. Hop finish.
3. On Tap at Paradise by way of Kensal Green, London 30/03/2003
Golden coloured with a cloudy appearance. Lemon aroma and flavour. Sour hop finish.
4. On Tap at the Old Wellington Inn, Manchester 06/12/2003
Golden amber coloured with a cloudy appearance. Lemon aroma and flavour.
5. On Tap at the Cross Keys, Crewe 26/05/2010
Lemon aroma. Golden coloured and hazy in appearance with a fruity lemon flavour. A hint of dryness in a crisp malt finish.
6. 330ml Bottle 05/06/2010
Fruity aroma. Golden coloured hazy in appearance and fruity lemon flavour with a hint of dryness in a slightly spicy malt finish.

no head, pretty weak aroma.  strong carbonation makes this *refreshing.* originally the flavor surprised me, but now that i’ve had more beers of this type i think this is a pretty good example of the style.  jolly pumpkin’s bam biere is similar but a little more flavorful.

33cl bottle. Poured cloudy pineapple yellow into a shaker glass with a 1-finger creamy white head (rapidly diminishing). Nose is spicy and fruity with a not-unpleasant whisper of DMS. Very crisp. Flavor is lightly bitter with coriander and a hint of DMS. The orange peel comes through in the short finish. Lightly sweet grainy malt flavor. Could be a little sweeter to offset the bitter/sour citrus peel, but this is a minor complaint. Light body with pleasant carbonation. Very refreshing! Better as cold refreshment than any of the bottled hefeweizens I have tried.
Draft.  Cloudy white pour with small white head.  A citrusy, wheat aroma.  A fresh citrusy taste to it also.  I enjoyed this more than I thought I would.

Lovely cloudy yellow color.  Looks like a beer that should be drank on a hot summer day (although right now it is frigid and it tastes fine).  Somewhat fruity, a nice bite on the front of the tongue but a very nice finish.

Nice light yellow color with a great head.  Unfiltered and has a great look.  While this beer is great anytime of year, it is particulary enjoyable on a nice summer day in a glass with a slice of lemon.  Defintily one of my favorite beers!!

Bottle. hazy straw colored beer with a large white frothy head. Citrus and spice aromas are transfered through to the taste and a hint of ginger in there. I accept that others rave about this beer and maybe it is an excellent example of it’s style but I’m afraid I’m not so struck.

Well I have to say that I’m genuinely impressed.  I had this beer from a bottle and drank it from something of a chalice.  The first sip was decieving and as the beer level in my glass dropped my like for it heightened.  You can taste ever so faintly spome wonderful spices that I cannot identify but that give it a marvelous taste.  A SPLENDID finish.  One of the best I’ve had recently.  I can imagine that this beer would go beautifully with a non-spicy simple meal, perhaps a steak and garden salad.

On tap at a local pub.  Nice citrusy aroma with some light spice that included coriander and a bit of clove.  Color is a pale and cloudy, pastel yellow with an inch tall white head.  Nice and simple flavor with some light malt and a nice citrus and spice twist about halfway through a drink.  Nice and refreshing, enjoyable with my food.

Pours a hazy golden straw, with a good amount of particles. A large, frothy white head slowly reduced to a thick, solid white film that left a great lacing.  Strong aroma of straw, cooked corn, and a slight mold – a dry haystack on a warm summer day.  The aroma is clearly one of the foremost aspects of drinking this beer and one gets the feeling you either love it or hate it.  Soft yet clearly present carbonation with a slightly oily palate. A very appealing and substantive taste of corn and muted clove, undercooked bread, long lasting wheat finish.  Almost no bitterness.  An ideal relaxing and refreshing beer for a hot summer day.  Overall a very well made beer.  Can’t go wrong here at all.

Bottle. Hazy pale straw color with creamy white head. Nose of sour citrus, lemon and orange, and some subtle spice. Tart, tangy citrus and yeast flavor, with a nice drying finish, but a little thinner than I had hoped for. Tasty stuff.
Hazy light yellow color with soapy white head.  Aroma of coriander and orange is pervasive.  Taste is mostly of orange peel with a nice coriander background.  This is one of my favorites.
330ml bottle. (BB12/06). Unfiltered. Light yellow, hazy colour. Aroma of banana. Coriander and sweet, light banana flavours. Citric refreshment. Short in aftertaste.

a good head, which stays till the end. really like the taste of the lighly malted drink.
the best belgium beer i’ve tried so far.

(02.18.06) On tap at Firkin’s, Libertyville, IL. Hazy straw-color Belgian wit beer having a large giant head and good lacing.  Soft carbonation. Spicy aroma.  Medium bodied wit beer that starts with moderate malt sweetness and spicy (clove)/citrus flavors.  Finishes dry and clean tasting with light malt fade.  Nice refreshing spicy beer.
White beer with a medium head when poured and bottle swirled.  Very spicy scent, but a sweet flavour.  The scent becomes overbearing toward the end.  Not by favorite Belgian, but still a good beer.
Very drinkable weizen.  Interestingly light color, and wonderful spicy smell of a weizen.  Would be the perfect beer on a hot summer day eating some belgian frittes or with seafood.

Bottle, pours very pale, but cloudy yellow. citrusy/spicy aroma. taste is similar to a tripel but lighter, with nice blend of orange and spices. very good overall beer, not outstanding, but quite good none the less.
fruity head, almost sweet.appearance, very cloudy , unfiltered, taste will linger, body is medium, colour is pale

Fruity aroma with touches of dark chocolate, coffee, cherry and wet dirt. Pours a light yellow body with thin particles that makes it hazy. Its head is white and creamy as it goes slowly down the glass’ walls it leaves an  excellent lacing and a white film covering the beer. Its flavor is sweet and spicey with orange citrus hints near the end. Its light to medium body makes it very refreshing in these hot summer days.
White high head. Light yellow unclear body. Banana aroma. Bitter sweet banana flavor.

12z bottle.  Hazy, cloudy golden dull hue.  Good amount of sediment.  Great head that has since lingered to a spotted ring of bright white.  Very yeasty nose with citrus notes and a slight bubblegum aroma.  Lively and zesty.  Great wheaty and yeasty flavor.  Sweet and honeyish.  Sweet and smooth, which moves into a tart and citrusy finish.  Somewhat dry and peppery.  Slightly corny, from the wheat.  On of my favorites!  Even if it is 20* and the middle of winter in St. Louis.

Pours a cloudy and pale light amber with sediments, showing a medium white head that leaves a fine lacing. Complex aroma with notes of orange, spices, herbs and honey. Good hoppy presence. Flavor is a little less complex, but fine, mainly sweet and spicey as the aroma with hints of coriander and a citrusy feeling with no bitterness noticeable and a medium finish. Light to medium bodied, it’s slightly watery and very refreshing with a soft carbonation. Well done and highly enjoyable.
Take lemon lime Gatorade, water it down some then add seltzer.  That is exactly how this beer tastes.

The Head of this beer is very proheminent, as shown on the photo. The aroma is very complex, spicy, wheat. The appearance is yellow, with bubble and texture is very dense. The palate of this beer is great and flavor of orange is present. Very good beer, but better on tap than bottle...two thumbs up.
This was the worst beer I ever tasted.  I dumped it down the drain..........
Low carbonated, light and good for refreshment, but there is missing special taste...too thin, almost diluted with water!

This is quite a basic Hefe,  but still good for refreshing a warm weekend afternoon or as a chaser after a stronger, more flavorful bier.  Light yellow in color with just a small amount of wheat in the bottom of the bottle (be sure to stir that up or you’ll really miss out on the overall flavor)

A VERY nice beer perfectly made for a Summer day/night. Aroma is very nice with hints of yeast, some ginger, maybe some apple in there too. Appearance is a cloudy, very pale yellow that had some decent foam action going on. Flavor was refreshing with fruits, some coriander and definite pepper. Really, a very satisfying beer here.

On tap. Nice pure white head with some lacing and excellent spicy citrusy aroma. Coriander and curacao obvious and in just the right amount with nice yeasty tones. Very refreshing though I can do without the lemon next time. Finished clean. I’ll have this one again.
Yellowish white with small white head. Very little smell with a happy light beer taste. Smooth to the last drop.
me like this one a whole lot. incredibly refreshing, with justthe right amount of yeast character, and the coriander and orange peel undertones are just so good. delicioso.
Big, fluffy, white head. Pours light yellow, and cloudy. Smells great, like citrus and summer. Yummy!
Bottle 0,33. Light yellow, cloudy. A small white head that soon disappears. Aroma of citrus. Refreshing but not exciting.

Pored a "white" color kind of like watery grapefuit juice.  Big, fluffy, soapy looking head with some stickyness to the glass.  Good aroma with a sort of sour citrus smell.  Flavor seems to be on the sides of the tongue.  It is kind of flowery and lemony at the same time.  The finish ends on the back of the tongue with some spicyness that reminds me of a Christmas spice style.
Real lite and subtle flavor.  Crisp and has a little fruity flavour, sweet to the taste but needs more kick.  I could dink a pint of it but wouldn’t get a sixer.
Nice color and head, decent trickerey on the tongue, just a little bland, not bad on hot day.

Bottle. Hazy yellow body, frothy white head. Sweet of citrus and yeast. Flavors are largely orange and lemon, but wheat, yeast, and lots of orange zest balance it out quite well. Hard to call it overrated, as I’ve had few other Belgian whites, but the flavors were weaker than I remembered. Certainly fuller on tap.

bottle from Food City. This is a super cloudy, very light yellow brew with a massively foamy white head. The aroma is refreshing: lots of orange zest, coriander, and lemons. The palate is light and bubbly. Everything here is subtle, well balanced, and welcomed to my palate on a hot day like this. Lots of citrus is all over the place with lemons, limes and a bit of a spicy finish is apparent in the way of coriander or perhaps clove. The beer is light in the mouth without sacrificing complexity or flavor. Great hot weather beer. Commendable in its sophistication.
12 oz bottle. Big head, very light looking, citrus taste. Not much in the flavor dept. Would be good on a hot summer day.

Tap.  Pours a light yellow with a nice head.  Citrus scents reminiscent of lemonade.  Deliciously light and refreshing on the palate, clean and crisp.  Nice lingering lemon flavors with spice.  Great beer.

On tap.  A very fruity tasting beer.  I normally like malty, hoppy beers, so this one was almost a drain pour for me.   Had good aroma, and medium head.  was a cloudy body, light colored.   It was ok, but just not the kind I like!!  My wife liked it, though, and she’s not a big beer person.
Bottle, big frothy head, really white looking, very slight sour notes, and little yeastiness, other than that, not much going on.

Draught.  Pours a cloudy light yellow/orange with a foamy head.  Aroma is mainly citrus and yeast.  Flavor is crisp, clean, and citrusy, with the yeast and citrus flavors mixing to create a surprising amount of complexity for such a refreshing (and mass-market) beer.  Among my favorite summer beers.

Très bonne bière blanche. C’est sans surprise que cette bière avait plus ou moins la même arome que les autres bières blanches (fruits légers). Le gout de cette blanche mat est le même que l’odeur, par contre l’effet qu’elle laisse sur le palait en fait un gout plus subtil. La pinte de Hoegaarden nous étonne par sa taille "bocal de poisson" que m’a lancé la serveuse en me la tendant. Je soutient que pour un dégusteur, une pinte de cette bière est emplement suffisant pour une soirée.

Broue blanche avec un gouté légèrement sucré, la Hoegaarden se joue de notre humeur et comptabilise les excès.  Cousteau a raison du côté de la tranche d’agrume qui amincit le sucré au profit de l’acidité. Elle coule bien et coute relativement pas cher. Miam

surement la meilleure blonde qui m’aie été permis de boire dans cette contrée qu’est le québec en tant qu’Importée! gout fin qui peut etre rehaussé d’une tranche de citron ou de lime quand on la boit en fût.

Elle est l’une des bonne blanche, c’est surtout un trip de le boire dans son tumble de 20 oz. Par contre, elle est très chère à comparer aux autres blanches au Québec et s’il y a une aussi bonne à moindre prix, Hoegaarden ne cerait pas mon premier choix.
Bottle. Great color with white head. A bit of citrus taste - really refreshing.
Has A nice light cloudyt yellow and a foamy white head which mostly dissappears. The smell is sweet and yeast. Has a citus taste which leaves you with a dry palate. A most delightfu beer..l
Nice summer drink. Cloudy yellow with nice head that disappears quickly. Typical corriander/citrus nose, citrus note in the taste, live yeast taste.
Bottle, thick white head, nice lacing, Cloudy yellow with a few floaties, strong yeasty aroma with some citrus to follow, get a lot of orange peel and carbonation with a hint of malt to follow.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma is of citrus, coriander and yeast.  It was a very light, crisp, and refreshing drink.  A very good beer to keep in stock.

I had this guy poured from a bottle.  The appearance is a cloudy yellow with a nice, thick two-fingered head that took a while to dissipate.  The aroma has a nice citrus tone to it.  Taking a sip, this has a light body and a slight sweetness, with a slightly tart citrus taste.  It left my mouth with a very slight dry, bitter finish.  This is one of the best beers I’ve tried.  Very drinkable and refreshing.

Nice white/ yellow body with a small white head. Smells of citrus and yeast. Taste was also yeasty with a little coriander and the slightest hint of sweet citrus in the finish. I thought it was a bit too thin though. Good, but not something that I would like to keep in regular rotation.
What a treat!  Pours a hazy yellow with a nice.  Sweet flavors and very light.  Very clean and refreshing, glad to try this one!

Pours a hazy pale yellow whit a nive head. Sweet flavors  with nice aromas of banana and yeast. Quite light bodied - too thin. Dry finish. I tried to add twist of lemon as an experiment. Nice enough if you don´t overdo it... but I can imagine that it is better with lime.
12oz. bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with frothy white head.  Nose of Light citrus, lemon, yeasty and coriander.  Flavor follows nose with a light palate and a clean finish.

Bottle.  Lemon yeast aroma, cleaner, fresher.  Cloudy, gold, real precious gold.  My staple while living in Holland, and surprising holds up well to my expanded palate.  Refreshing summer sola-lemony yeast zing.  Great light session beer.
Nice cloudy appearance with a large white frothy head. Citrusy taste, with a little bitter aftertaste. Really enjoyed this beer, even though it’s something I wouldn’t usually drink.

Milky gold in color with a big head. Citrus and yeast aroma. Drier than other whites and in my humble opinion not the best of them, but a fine beer just the same.  if you just drink it from the bottle you are missing out.
Beautiful, cloudy yellow, lemonade color, with a large frothy head. Easy to drink, very citrus, and something you can have on hand for guests who aren’t typically beer drinkers. All around pleasant.

I really thought this beer was unremarkable with exeption to the corriander. Even then, I didn’t find the corriander to help the beer in the taste department. I might be missing something, this is a fairly highly rater beer but I just didn’t enjoy the taste.
Cloudy yellow in color with a frothy white head.  Weak wheaty witbier flavor, rather bland, dry to palate.  Disappointing.  bottle.

Draught. Hazy light yellow with a minior white head. The aroma is fruity with citrus and yeast. The flavour is fresh and fruity with hints of citrus. You can feel the yeast and wheat. Oh well, if you want to test it with a slice of lemon that works out quite nice as well.

By far my favorite tasting beer of my favorite type. Hoegaarden is about as pure of a witbier as can be found. Allagash is somewhat of a hybrid, and Ommegang is not as pure as this beauty. Make sure you drink it out of a glass with a gentle pour, as it will fizz quickly. Sit back and enjoy, garnish with a lemon or an orange if the mood strikes you. A delicious treat that can be enjoyed in quantity as well.

I know I’m not alone in Hoegaarden being the first Belgian import that they sampled.     The beer’s citrus flavor, fluffy head and lemonade body sets the standards for other Belgian Whites.The only change I recognize today in Hoegaarden is the packaging.    I hope nobody just drinks this Witbier straight out of the longneck bottle with the fancy label.  InBev even added a back label to  include directions on how to drink it from a glass.

Poured into my favorite snifter a pee yellow. Foamed quite like a Witbier, but dissapated quickly. Foam held to slight egde clinging to edge of the glass and that’s about all. I am knew to reviewing beer and have not yet been able to pick up on many of the distinct flavors but the back of my tongue definitely tastes banana.The smell is appealing to a newbie like myself. I have to say that tonight I will have only one of these as it is a good beer but the desire for another tonight, is just not there...maybe tomorrow???

no ingrediens on the bottle,mmmm do it says "with spice ingredients) lots of fruit citrus, orange, fresh witbier.
One of the best
"have had this beer in a bottle before, but on tap is soooo much better. Has a hazy yellow color with with an average head. Has a nice sweet light taste to it."

Truly a "white" beer in appearance. Pours with a nice head and plenty of fizz. A bit of lacing on the glass. I always am reminded of banana peel when I open this beer and get the first whiff. A very slight peppery spice on the toungue with a citrus body and a balanced lasting sweet finish. Light bodied and crisp in the mouth. Great refresher.
White-yellow color which I consider rather ugly. Great lasting head. Acidic/sour - watery - slightly lemon - taste. Didn´t like it much

I know that obviously here this beer is considered to be quite good, I guess I just don’t like the style, or maybe it’s the spicy coriander and orange peel, very strong flavour. Had it in the Hoegarrden glass out of a bottle. I hope the next spicy beer I have pans out better.

Draught and bottle both very nice, the once-dead style resurrected by Peter Celis. The world’s first widespread Belgian style exhibits light fruity/estery wheat character and some citrus, with the curaçao and coriander a somewhat forced yet effective counterpoint. Still a fine patio session drinker.

Draught at Tyler’s in Durham, NC. Cloudy yellow color with big bubbly white head that laced the glass. Nose is of coriander, citrus, and yeast. Tart at first with yeast and light malt up front. Aftertaste is slightly sweet with a subtle honey flavor. Very good beer.
Fantastic, my favorite of all the Belgian beers. Fruity taste and just the right amount of body make this a great session beer
On Tap. Wow, when I ordered it, I did not expect to get a glass the size of my head! Big foamy head, semi-opaque (looked like organic apple juice), and serious hoppy flavour. A good patio beer.
Pours a cloudy yellow, a decent foamy white head.  A light citrus aroma mixed with wheat.  A light fruity yeastflavor, with some complexity - but might need something else.

Bottle.  Poured a very cloudy yellow, not gold, but actual yellow with no head.  Fruit and wheat on the nose.  Lemon, banana and wheat flavor dominate.  Thin on the palate, but not disappointing because there is some complexity to it.  Real good for a Belgian white, enjoyed it thoroughly.

A wonderful white. Another example that even though you’re ’big’ doesn’t mean your beer sucks. A powerful fruity aroma with a very nice (white), though fast dissappearing head. The taste is not quite powerful enough, but has a banana flavour and a softness that even few wheat beers are blessed with.

330ml bottle. My first belgium white and hopefully not the last. Pours a nice white colour with a large white head. A hint of Citrus in the flavour of this beer. Very nice. It is available in Newfoundland but you have to buy a gift pack to get it.
looks like lemonade kinda.  It is pretty good, smooth, slightly thin, For being mass produced this is good stuff.
First time trying a Belgian white, I liked it quite a bit. Very crisp, very refreshing. I look forward to more.
Had one on draught at a pub in Hoegaarden right across the street from the brewery.  A really nice refreshing, fruity, white beer.  Probably the standard.
Unclear yellow colour, large white head. Very herby aroma, some citrus in it. Taste is smouth and herby. Finish is just a little bitter, easy drinker, but one of the best white beers!

Pours  cloudy grayish-orange with huge white foamy head.  No Orange wedge for me in my witbiers, EVER, please.  Anyway,  In my opinion this is probably one of the best mass produced Wit’s you can get in the United States.  Tastes of bubble gum, coriander, orange zest and a little lemon.  Nice sweet palate.  Some may not like this style, or think this a average beer at best, but this is nicely brewed to style and is refreshing and enjoyable.  Two thumbs up!

What a great "Witbier".  Did the orange wedge trick after the pour.  Pale color with a light head that doesn’t last too long.  You can smell the citrus in here.  Nice and light..Very refreshing indeed.  One of my regulars in rotation during the summer.. Even the wife likes this one..
Oh my god, this "witbier" is just so nice and tasty. In case you do like Belgian White Beers then this will be considered as a must to try.

On tap @ Fox & Hound, I sqeezed an orange slice over the beer.  Pale cloudy pale yellow traslucent color, big white head head, lasting.  Flora aroma, hops, citrus.  Lively taste, dry, smooth, a little bland, citrus taste-grapefruit, watered down taste.

330 ml bottle. Yellowish white. Lively carbonation, which subsides after a while. Aroma is of coriander seed and citrus. Light and rather thin body, but very refreshing. This is a great example of a Belgian witbier. It’s just too bad they (read: InBev) are letting it go down the drain...

This is one of my fav beers. It has a sweet and sour taste, hints of orange. Has a great white color and head. Brewed by a company that really know what they are doing, and is distributed very well. In NY you can get it at several bars, and stores. A+ beer
Light yellow colour with big head. Nice smell with notes of coriander. Taste citrus. In fact not the right time for white beer, but still a good experience.
Bottle: Poured a cloudy light yellow.  Samll head evaporated quickly.  Zesty. This beer tastes great. Very light but not lacking in flavor. Reminds me of Duvel, sans the alcohol.
Tried this at a University Bar months back.  Had yet to find it until today. bottle.  Pours pleasantly cloudy with a small amount of head.  Hint of corriander.  Tastes great with a bit of lemon.
For a weisse beer, it’s acceptable.  It is nothing to write home about, but if there is nothing better, this will fit the bill.

Re-rated Feb 2, 2008   Bottle. Poured very light and very cloudy with a white head. Pleasant fruity aroma. Sweet, refreshingly light body. My current favorite beer.
11/29/05 Original rating: 3.6 (aroma 6/10, appearance 3/5, flavor 7/10, palate 3/5, overall 17/20)

Old favorite.  When poured properly you get a large, lingering, frothy head over pale yellow ale.  Great nose of yeast, citrus, and grass(?).  Very refreshing, yet spicy aswell.  Complex but still thrist quenching.  Extra points for availability.

Bottle on 04/03/2011 from Once Upon a Vine - South. Hazy pale white color with a medium creamy white head. Sweet citrus, coriander and spice aroma with a light wheat background. Sweet spice flavor, some coriander, spice and dry wheat finish. Light body with moderate carbonation. 7/2/7/3/13 - 3.2

11/28/2005 - Cloudy light yellow color with a fully diminishing thin white head. Spiced apple and a noticable coriander aroma with a light carbonated apple flavor. 7/3/7/3/13 - 3.3
Grapefruit color, almost no visible head. Very sweet smell that has some spice accent. Wheat cottony taste that while good isn’t my flavor. Almost a tea like ending.

This beer poured a cloudy light yellow with a few tiny yeast sea monkeys and a moderate short-lasting off-white head. Aromas included orange peel, coriander, grain. The carbonation is lively and the body is light and refreshing. The flavor is smooth, barely bitter with an average-length lightly spicy finish. Nice and drinkable.
33 cl bottle. Pale yellow colour with a nice off white head. Aroma of bread, wheat and coriander. Also coriander in flavour, very light with a nice taste. A nice witbier.

Having never smelled or tasted coriander before, I would have to say I like the taste better than the smell.  Poured from a bottle with a pretty decent head that faded but lasted for the majority of the time it was in my glass.  Very refreshing and pleasing to look at, coupled with good sensations on the tongue and an aftertaste that begs you to drink more.

Excellent beer.  One of my favorties.  Have tried it both out of the bottle and tap.  Nice color and head.  Very refreshing.  I only wish it was more readily available.  I usually have to go to specialty stores to buy it.
330 ml bottle.  My favorite white beer.  I buy once in a while.  Nice citrus touch, always a really good head.  The coriander is in the after taste.  Excellent beer in the hot summer nights !

Very good and nice and tastefull weissbier.
Bottle and label is perfect designed.

Bottled.
Hazy pale yellow coloured with a huge white head.
Aroma of citrus with spicy notes.
Spicy flavour with notes of citrus and malts.

Poured with medium sized, very creamy white head.  Head was mostly diminishing and exhibited some nice lacing.  Color is light hazy yellow, almost looks like lemonade.  Nose is of wheat, coriander, and citrus.  Initial flavor is lightly sweet and citrusy, with finish being lightly dry and leaving a nice coriander/clove type of spicy taste that hangs around for quite some time.  This is an excellent beer.  I love it.

Bottle. Hazy very pale yellow colour. Thick long lasting head. Aroma of wheat coriander and orange. Has a dry smooth taste of coriander and citrus. In the end you get a little sour taste. Very smooth and a good witbier.

(BJCP Class)  Very light pale gold color beer with a nice frothy head.
Strong wheat malt aroma,  this was a little light struck due to age of the beer.  Which is odd for a Belgian beer.  Has a nice spicy tone to the beer when tasted.  A good sourness at to style and very dry at the end with a tart bite.  Good beer for strong heavy pasta.  Interesting flavor I would give to others for a taster.
I thought I liked Blue Moon until I tried this.  I love a beer for mid-summer that looks like it is filled with snow.  Crisp, tart-wheat, smooth and drinkable, quenching but sophisticated.
This wasn’t too bad, but it wasn’t too special either. I’d say this is a good everyday beer i guess. Aroma and flavor wasn’t too overwhelming, kind of light, but smooth and tasty, not too bad.
I’m not a big fan of whits, but this one is pretty decent. Good on a scorching hot day, but otherwise not my cup of tea.

12 oz. bottle. Hazy yellow pour, looks almost like lemonade with a white head. Nice lacing. Nose is wheat and yeast over citrus. Citrus and wheat flavor, lightly spiced. Super-clean, fresh finish, where the coriander kicks in. One of the best of this style I have tried to date, and the best part is that it seems to be gaining in popularity, becoming more widely available on tap. This is my wife’s new favorite!

The bottled beer is not NEARLY as good at the Hoegaarden on tap.  I first had Hoegaarden in a giraffe at Ballydoyle’s in Downers Grove and it had a smooth, citrus flavor and went down very well :)  However, the bottled version seems to be more bitter and didn’t have the same citrus flavor.  Too bad.

Bottle.  Poured a hazy, very pale yellow with a towering layer of white head.  Quite vibrant aroma of fresh wheat, orange peel, coriander, and cobwebby yeast.  Flavor really follows the aroma well, with orange zest and wheaty notes upfront, sour notes around the side of the tongue, and coriander + some more citrus at the finish.  This was extremely refreshing, just a tad lighter on the mouthfeel than I would prefer.

On Draft.  Pale yellow and hazy color with a large white as snow head.  I remember not smelling much of an aroma - mainly just bread with citrus and spice notes.  Has a refreshing flavor with lots of orange and banana, and the coriander is easily noticeable as well.  Very lively carbonation may take away from the taste a bit, but it had a good mouthfeel.  Slightly sweet and also has an initial sourness that goes away quickly leaving a short and dry aftertaste.

Great witbeer, the best I’ve had so far. Light yellowy color, and wonderfully cloudy as expected. Far more sweetness and hardiness than the American alternatives.  Refreshing and light. Save the orange slices for Blue Moon, this is much better without.

Always enjoyable.  A great Belgian witbeer.  Worth drinking when available.  The flavors of orange and coriander are easily noticeable and excellent.  A favorite when looking for a lighter flavored beer or a witbeer
(Bottle) Pours hazy pale yellow, with white stable head. Notes of citrus (primarily oranges) and coriander. Definately one of the better Belgian Witbeers..

Smells fresh on opening.  Looks great in a glass - pale yellow color, white frothy head, and lightly cloudy.  Light bread smell (yummy).  Somewhat fizzy with very little aftertaste, which wasn’t bad at all - it’s exactly what I was looking for in this type.  I had this one with angel hair nests and vodka-tomato sauce covered in sun-dried tomatos.  It went surprisingly well.  Overall this is a great witbier.
Beautifully cloudy-white with a distinctive refreshing after-taste.  My first Belgian wheat, so I compare it to all others.
Excellent.  Creamy head, yellowish body.  Distant citrus flavor.  A very light, refreshing drink

Sweet, very light tasting, citrusy. 
much better cold  since the flavour changes with temperatiure.

really nice except that its pretty pricey here in the States.

Creamy, white head with a spattering of large darkish bubbles, over opaque dirty yellow body. Aroma is pretty faint, but citrusy and spicy. Taste is light, mouthfeel marked by carbonation hiding most of what is initially going on, leaving a light citrusy taste with notes of something else (probably coriander). Overall, a light, clean, refreshing beer, but ot the greatest of beer experiences, perhaps. It feels strange to criticize such an established world classic, but the fact is that there are better witbiers around (the other Hoegaardens being the prime examples of this).

Sitting with a bottle right now, good aroma and a very very nice taste, can definately taste the coriander, i had a pint in a bar once, but it wasn’t as good as this (i think i was drunk) love how it looks. White beer is good. If it was more commercial like bud and stuff, the world would be a better place.
Nice fluffy pure white head, yellow body and a tad bit sour. I wasn’t expecting a sour taste of the beer, however it quickly goes away. Light and cloudy w/orannge and bananas...good for rainy days?

Grace is a hard skill to acquire.  It needs just enough force to perform, but enough silence to impress.  Hoegaarden, like its personified equivalent the gymnast, accomplishes that task.  It is a graceful beer with a graceful touch, and like an accomplished spy it makes its presence known and leaves before anybody can question its intent.  So, for a simple beer, the Hoegaarden is difficult to touch.  The visual appearance is a straightforward cloudy yellow.  The shade reminds me of faded 1970’s lawn furniture, but don’t let that discourage you from drinking it.  The foam is thin and white and, sadly, unengaging, but I don’t expect a heavy blanket on top of something like a witbier.  The aroma gave me shivers at first, but that may be because my earlier experience with this type of beer was extremely disappointing.  Inside the smell is the obvious wheat, a complement of lemon and a slightly distracting modicum of soap.  If I really stretch it I can smell sour dough bread, but I think that may be my fondness for San Francisco and clam chowder speaking.  Most surprising to me is the duration of Hoegaarden’s taste.  Like I mentioned before, it slips in and out before I can really grasp it and pick it apart.  What I do know about this sly beer, is it’s an excellent drink after some exercise or a hard day of pushing papers or furniture or whatever it is you do.  Also, best served at colder temperatures.  Unlike Belgian Ales the taste does not improve with warmth.  Overall I’d describe this beer as being very mild mannered and ethereal.  There one moment and gone another.  It’s not even missed once it escapes down my esophagus, yet I can’t help but come back for another sip.  Wily brew, this one.

Nice appearance with fluffy pure white head and pale yellow body.  I didn’t really like the sour taste characteristic of the beer, not my style maybe.  First taste is good, but the sour taste quickly develops and dominates the finish.

Palle yellow w/ fluffy head.
Lovely smells: coriander, yeast, and citric, banana.
A bit watery, but very refreshing, 
Frizzy.
Reminds me of Hoegaarden Grand Cru.

Bottle. Hazy, pale yellow with with dense white head. Orange, coriander, banana and yeast in aroma. Light in flavour with a fizzy mouthfeel. Dry, but unhoppy aftertaste. Works well as a thirst-quencher, but tends to be a little too much after some bottles. (050927)

This is a good Belgian White with a clear yellow color and a large white head.  The nose is very lemon-esque and the taste is lemon-pie sweet and citrus bitter.  There’s also an acidic wheatiness and a lot of carbonation.  The mouthfeel is thin and, sadly, the bitterness is neither strong nor complex, but then again that wouldn’t be the goal with this style.  It is probably the best of the popular examples of this style.
Received a bottle of this from my friend JB.  Poured a large thick white head.  Aroma of citrus and yeast.  Slightly sour.  It was alright but I was hoping for more.

An excellent summer beer I enjoyed frequently in the Netherlands this past year. Yeasty aromas and a thick head (when properly poured) combine with a taste evocative of a warm afternoon in the low countries.

Grey and cloudy with a thin, scummy head, this beer really doesn’t appeal visually. The aroma was interesting, with yeast and spices. Flavour was citrus sour and a bit watery. I wanted more sweetness and bitterness. I felt  there was too much carbonation.
Light yellow, cloudy, with nice thick white head. Spicy citrus aroma. Taste of coriander and pommerade. A great beer for a hot summers day.
Nice beer, smooth, nice taste and after taste, enjoy at any occasion. Belgian beers are among my favourites
Light in color. Cloudy. Citrus tatse . A good summer beer. I bit sweet but not overly so.

Botle pours a very light cloudy white/yellow witha midium bright white head.  Thick resiliant lacing.  Aroma is light and spicy. I notice the Belgiun yeasty notes and just a bit of the advertised coriander.  Flavor is very mild and pale. Fairly sweet and papery.  Lively carbonation and a moderate feel in general.  Skunk nailed it.  "Sessionable"

This beer pours an almost clear to pearlish white color with a hint of light yellow color. Small white head, quickly dissipating with a small degree of lacing and noticeable floaties suspended in the beer. Aroma is light with yeasts, hay, barnyard and orange in the nose. Flavor-wise we’re looking at a very light bodied beer. Sessionable, hay and grass with a sweet mid-sip and an orangey finish. Noticeable carbonation mid-sip but generally mild toward the finish. Mildly sticky as it warms. Dry slithgly cardboardy sweet finish. Something acetic and sour about the finish that Im just not quite digging.

Pale beige and cloudy with a thin white head.  Aroma is spicy with notes of citrus and wheat.  Taste is yeasty and bready with orange peel and coriander making things quite interesting.  Body is light and carbonation is high.  Excellent witbier.

I most crave fries when I drink this. Something sublimb about the way the salt and strach cut dry, soft tartness of this extrodinary beer. Beer will alway be a little magical, as long as this one is around. This beer is the remedy for all the bad examples of this difficult style -- and also their inspiration for still trying.

Great summer beer.  The orange and coriander blend well with the unfiltered element, which adds a fuller body to a refreshing and smooth drinking flavorful beer.  It’s good when I feel like a break from the heavier stuff, which isn’t often - but it’s nice to know it’s there.
The beer poured a golden/straw color with a lot of yeast present and had white head.  The taste was very well balanced.
Great big foamy white head...just as things should be.   Fruity/tart/citrusy/spicy/yeasty and orange juicey.  Way better than most German wheats.
This is a very nice, light, refreshing beer. taste of Vanilla and hops. citrusy smell. very drinkable and smooth going down.
Had a decent orange aroma along with vanilla. Pear jucie body color with a white creamy head. Good fruit flavor that is not to sour. Banana taste on the palate. Good refreshing beer on a hot day.
one of the best white beers around. Demonstrates the clear superiority of belgian white beers over german weissbier. Very refreshing though interesting aromas.
As far as wits go I believe that this is the one to compare all others against.  Crisp and citrus filled.
this was the first beer I really liked...  citrusy flavor adds a nice touch...  light crisp, clean beer.

12 oz bottle pours cloudy the palest golden I’ve ever seen.. Almost white with a fluffy white head.  Aroma is citrus, orange and a touch of lemon.  Flavor is yeast, orange, a little corriander.  The palate is quite light and carbonated.  Refreshing and crisp to drink.  A great summer beer..
Very pale yellow, a little cloudy, and a thick white head.  Yeast and bananas in the palate, citrus in the nose.  A nice balance.  Good but not great.

Nice flavors and freshness. Great summer refresher. Looked a bit like a urine sample injected with champagne. Carbonation gave it an ever growing head. I thoroughly enjoyed this beer and wanted another but only bought one to sample. Stupid. Maybe the most refreshing beer I’ve ever had.

This was the first Hoegaarden that i have drink. 

Poured cloudy with a yellowish orange tinge. Citris hoppiness.
Fruity and juicey, this beer has Fantastic flavor.

This beer is very citrusy.  It has a very nice color, and a nice head, but the head goes quickly.  It is usually with a lemon.  But it gets too sour and bitter for me.  The body is thicker than most citrusy beers.  But it spreads good on the palate.  The beer is very refreshing when served very cold.

Had on tap in Belgium. I love this beer! Smooth flavor and nice finish. Hop bitterness is about right for a white. Very refreshing. If it were available at my local market I would definitely get some.

Pours cloudy pale yellow with medium white foamy head that fades quickly.
Aroma is lively and teasing  herbal
Corriander, cloves, citrus orange/lemon zest.
Effervescent tart and refreshing. Flavour is not as deep as the aroma. A well rounded green banana and  sweet grain in the flavour.
Poured cloudy with a yellowish orange tinge.  Citris hoppiness.  Great balance and a wonderful summer beer.

Tap.  Nice banana and lemony yeastiness in the aroma.  Crisp and fresh.  Hazy light blonde color with a white head.  Citrus, lemons, bananas to start with some creaminess following.  Sweet, crisp, and refreshing to finish.  Despite being macro’ed with InBev, this is still a classic beer and should be a benchmark for all witbiers.(7/4/7/4/15)~~~~~~~RE-RATE~~~~~~~~Bottle.  Best by 10/10/13.  The aroma is full of citrus with some lemon and pineapple esters present.  Almost smells like Unibroue.  Lightly spicy.  Pours a slightly hazy straw color with a very rapidly dissipating bubbly white head.  Starts highly carbonated, before some light coriander and gumball esters come through.  A little husky wheat character in the middle.  Finishes with light lemon acidity.  Nice.
On tap.  Cloudy yellow with a thin lacing head.  Aroma was spice and fruit. Flavor was the same.  Heavy carbonation.  Nice beer.

Pourd Cloudy light yellow with small head that stuck around a while, but no lacing. Foretaste was nice light spiciness with cloves and fruit. Light but refreshing.  Carbonation was decent. Nothng significant in the aroma but still in all, this is a nice litte summer beer even though it lacked hops presence.
the perfect witbier, and the highlight of my first night in holland. Light and cloudy with a substanial head. Spicy with a great citrus bite, and sweet amlt flavor.

Great beer for theose hot summer days. 
Fruity, cloudy(as it should be).
Only if I could find a Hoegaarden glass...
It tasts soo much better in the correct glass.

Fruity and juicey, this beer has a nice flavor. Spicey and bold with nice orange peel and nutmeg. A tad too sweet for it’s own good, but just light enough too please the palate, but I wouldn’t get drunk off this.

Pours out a pale yellow like a cloudy grapefruit juice.  Has a full sudsy head that goes at a moderate pace.

The aroma is spiced citrus, with pieces of banana and bubblegum.

The mouthfeel is middle-ground carbonation and light.

The taste is close to the aroma--spiced citrus, banana, bubblegum--but the sweetness is nicely overcome by a spicy finish.  I’m guessing I should thank the coriander [Extends hand].  Nicely done.

Twangy.  Like a ginger beer, but better.
Bottle, in Hoegaarden glass. Looks watery with a yellowish tint and small white head. Aroma of wheat, orange citrus and spices. Dominant flavour of lemon and lime citrus, more sweet than bitter.

Followed directions on bottle on pouring instructions.  Not sure why it is need to create the big head.  Beer has the flavor and taste that it looks and sounds like.  A smooth wheat not very complex but pleasing.

On draft. A tad expensive, but still there is a re-rate coming soon that will be made with a clearer head. Has a good spicy aroma and nice color. Light bodied with a very fizzy and light carbonation. I didn’t take any notes at the pub and will next time. Glad to see it on tap somewhere as it was the best thing they had going at this place, errrr well, except for the hot chicks in short skirts.
fresh fruity and crisp.  pours foamy from the bottle with a nice cloudyness.  yiest is not overpowering and couples well with sweetness.  overall a nice beer for being named HO GARDEN
on tap a a bar in warren nj,it has a pleasant,yet cloudy appearance.The taste is citrusy,yet very tasty.A very refreshing beer.

From the bottle.

Pours light and cloudy with an ample head and an aroma of lemongrass, bread, and spice.

The taste follows: pleasingly sour with lemon peel and field-grass giving way to yeast and soft malts.

This is a pleasing, highly drinkable beer. This was really delicious with a subtle but well-crafted meal at Cafe Flora.

Original rating: On 8/2/05: 3.5 (7/3/7/3/15)
Half-pint on draft in London. Nice thick white head, beer is a light yellow/white color. Easy on the palate and refreshing.

Cloudy pale yellow. Huge, bubbly white head. Cap easily floats on top of the solid head. Malt, corriander, citrus in the aroma. Same flavor. Very refreshing, easy to drink. Light body. Definitely one of the better witbiers.
Bottled, pack with other belguim beers/glasses. Sharp white foamy head. Cloudy and Pale yellow colour. Smells and tastes lemon-lime with spice, nutmeg perhaps? Goes down smooth and cool on a hot day.

Tap.  Very pale yellowish-white in color.  Aroma was pleasant and the flavor was citrusy, as others have said.  This was my first Witbier.  I would say I mostly enjoyed it, but I would probably ask for a good German hefe if it was available before the Witbier.
Cloudy,hazy pale yellow with a musty citrussy aroma. Taste is of crushed coriander seeds (slightly orange) a great readily available Belgian.

Pours a cloudy murky whitish yellow color with a white foamy head.  Smells of lemon spices and citrus seeds.  Taste is lemony with a touch of lime.  A beer that can be drunk in large quantities on a hot summer day.  Very refreshing.
Draught. A very good wit.  Coriander and citrus dominate the taste. Medium bodied, very drinkable and refreshing; great in the summer.

Yellow white beer.  Very murky.  Nice head.   The flavor is a little sweet but not overwhelming.  The flavor of the beer lingers on the palate for awhile.  My only complaint is the beer’s flavor doesn’t really seem to evolve from sip to palate.  Good choice for a beer though.
Great beer at typical BMC establishments.  A good wit, with its cloudy appearance and spicyness.

Not the prettiest beer in the world, a little pale for a belgian white, but maybe some people like it that way.  Taste, however, seems a bit more refined than some other belgians, though a bit lighter too.  A little of that rich yeast flavour, but a little less pungent than others, and the orange and coriander seem more crisp and clear, though not stronger than other belgian whites.  I think it’s a little overrated, or perhaps some other belgian whites are underrated.
nice white beer, maybe better without the lemon in the glass,ask to the barman to taste it without the lemon slice

I was sincerely disappointed with this beer.  I’m a big fan of Blue Moon’s Witbier and since Hoegaarden had a much higher rating, I was looking forward to try it.  It came up so short, that I gave away the other five beers in the pack.  It has a very light aroma that borders on a cross between lemon and medicine.  The taste was somewhat sharp with a very anticeptic aftertaste.  I felt as if I was drinking a Listerine Light.  The color was cloudy which wouldn’t have been a bad thing if the taste was more appealing, but with this bitter, uninviting beer it reminded me more of a beer after it passes through the system.  Not recommended.

By tap or bottle it is constantly fresh and pleasant.  The cloudy appearance is oddly inviting and the effervesence combined with the aroma provide a good setup.  The flavor is not to my taste, but still pleasant verging on interesting.  I find hoegaarden somewhat tinny, perhaps from the lemon, which i could do without.  I’d gladly pick paulaner hefeweizen in place of hoegaarden, but consider them equals.  If you like lemon slices in your water, hoegaarden may be THE beer for you.
Being quite new to tasting specialty beers of the world, I know I’ll run across other great beers, but this one has to be one of the finest of the whites to me right now.

i’ve had celis white just before this one...
aroma: spices, lemon, other spices. taste: lemon, koriander, bit sweet. i liked celis white much better in taste and palate. not bad though!

On tap at County Hotel, JDW, Ashford
Really refreshing especially with half a slice on lemon.  Good wheat beer with just a tang of orange and coriander.  If nothing else is on I am quite happy to have this
Very good witbier. Superb head. Nice taste, surprising to the palate. Recommended.

this beer is fabulous!
clear taste and spicy flavor.
in Japan, the number of the pub where we can get this beer is increasing these days.
Classic belgian wit, for sure.  Cloudy, white appearance.  Aroma of banana and grapefruit.  Flavor is laced with orange and bananas, as well as baking soda.  Drinkable.

Draught on hot patio at Fionn MacCool’s.  Pours with a big, fine, white small rocked head, a thin lacing left behind - in the stupid oversized Hoegaarden glass is a thick-looking opaque, murky bright yellow liquid, resembles pure grapefruit juice.  No bubbling - not appealing at all.  Aroma is heavy on the soapy cilantro/coriander, with sharp yeast, wheat flour, euro-hops, cigarette ash and tart grapefruit-lemon; bit like a wheat beer on steroids.  Taste was actually - initially - quite mild, heavy on the tobacco ash, coriander, sour lemonade - no malt and only a touch of hop.  Weak but clean on the palate with a quick diminsh until the second half of the glass, when the ashy bitterness started to overstay its welcome on my tongue.  Mouthfeel somewhat acidic.  Hate to say it, but a squeeze of lemon helped me finish my pint.  *re-rate November 2006 - really very good, 2.9 was way too low - soft mouth, almost creamy, light acidity, citric, yeasty and lightly spiced - I like Unibroue’s Blanche de Chambly better (more body) but this is good at being what it is ...
Bottle.  A very light yellow pour.  Citrusy smell and a very fruity taste.  A good finish but the taste lasts too long.  Could use a little less spice in it.
This is a good beer but I dont like coriander and for me there is way too much in it.
love this witbier has a citrussy smell and a fruity taste is everywhere now that CUB has taken over the marketing of it which is a good thing for me cause i love it

Draught at the Belgian Cafe in Perth. Lemonade-yellow, very hazy, creamy white head with nice lace. Slightly sweet aroma, light and refreshing palate with some faint zesty citrus and notes of vanilla and cardamom spice. I could drink this aaaallllll night! I think draught is better than bottle (not a surprise).
Bottle and tap. Looks hazy and has almost no head. Smells of citrus and flowers. Very refreshing taste and palette. Perfect in the summer heat. Gimme’ more. :)

On Tap:  My favorite bar decided to switch Blue Moon with this: a very wise (and surprising) decision.  Apperance is relatively pale, with a noticeable cloud.  Thin body, with very little head.  Taste is quite dry, with a mouthwatering and subdued orange and corriander flavor.  As the description suggests, a sour aftertaste.  Good, but in my mind doesn’t quite live up to its reputation.

Very pale, almost green coloring. No head, and no lace on the glass. Aroma is citrus throughout, with orange dominating. Very thin mouthfeel, almost watery. Flavor is also citrus, but melts into a sour finish.

Bottle. This is the first wheatbeer I ever tasted. And now (of course) I find the flavor of it way too mild and discrete. It’s a beer for people who don’t really like beer. But it’s fresh and thirstquenching. And harmless. And since that’s actually all they promise it to be, it’s allright.
Excellente, elle est à la hauteur des blanches du début à la fin.  Un super goût doux en bouche. Aucun goût âcre. Une très bonne blanche!

Ok, so I tried this beer for two reaons 1 - because of the name and 2 - I love whites.  This was the best white beer I?ve sampled since first trying Point White at Summerfest a couple years ago.  Need to find this bottled somewhere, as I really enjoy it.
nice sweet fruity citrus smell,.  cloudy golden look with a head that is kind of frothy. The beer has a fruity orange taste to it. the beer goes down smooth with no bitterness.
Allot of the Belgian styles are very heavy and sweet for my palate.  This one struck me as pleasantly smooth and refreshing, while retaining the Belgian flavor aspects.

This was one of those beers that got me into good beers so i have a slightly weak spot for it. Particularly refreshing anmd citrus, corriander flavour domminates everything. I always like this and today it is probably the best day scotland will ever have so a good day to have such a thing. Rerate: I feel that this has got maltier and has lost something.

Bottle - November 2004

Pour with a white and lastin head. Appareance is cloudy, the beer being opaque but beautifull. The aroma is of citrics ( oranges, lemons) the carbonatation is very lively. Taste is tart and somewhat acid, very thirst quenching. A favourite.
Pours pale with a nice fluffy head, nice sweet aroma, and the taste a relaxing good sweet taste, this was very smooth, and very drinkable a little weak but good.
i love wheat beers and so far this is the best. a light crisp taste and very refreshing. the best on a hot summer day.  not heavy at all on the palate.

Bottled. Poured a brilliant cappucino like head (which I’m sure would have stayed for hours if I could have resisted) that created lovely lacings down the sides of the glass as I polished it off. Not a very strong aroma, but pleasant and spicy. Upon tasting, I realised the spicy aroma came from a deliciously sweet clove flavour. Aftertaste is very doughy, like undercooked pizza base. I could only get this, though, by waiting a while between tastes (got distracted by the stove!!). A fairly metallic finish, but a nice round body. A very tasty beer, but I don’t know if I could drink this as a staple. Next time I might have to follow the instructions on the label LOL.
Pour is a bright yellow like lemon juice.  Aroma is nice and spicy with a bit of pepper in there.  Flavor is peppery and spicy with a lemony backbone.  Very refreshing on a warm summer night.
Not a fan of white’s. This beer is too washed out for me, like a mammossa made with champagne and banana juice.

Review for bottled product, but similar experience with beer on tap.


Pallid yellow with a light, frosty haze and a large, foamy head. Light, dry aroma with a definite floral character... perfumed... sourdough in tow. Bitter, sour flavor with light acidity to follow.
