Bottle: Nice white head that disappears rather quickly with slight lacing.  Very strong orange aroma with hint of spices.  A cloudy pale yellow in appearance.  While orange in smelling more orange peel in taste.  Slighty sweet.  Mild aftertaste.
Surprise:  all barley.  Pale and hazy, big white head.  Some fruit and yeast in nose and on the tongue.
Very large white head which is common. Nice pale hazy appearance. The flavor to me doesn't really jump out, but I could taste some fruit. One of the best whites I've had, white lemon also.

Notable coriander aroma over citrus that to me smells largely of orrange and faintly of grapefruit.  Cloudy pale appearance that is entirely distinctive and very pleasing to look at, with a large frothy white head that dissipates quickly but that leaves heavy lacing. Bready but crisp flavor with a spicy tang that lasts.  Medium-light body that is refreshingly dry.  Overall, a delightful summer beer and equal to, if not greater than,the sum of its parts.
Hoegaarden white is the standard for Belgian wheat beer. Pleasant, delicious, and satisfying.

Now thats a Wit! Large white head, mediocre retention and a nice lace. Big fruity nose, citrusy, pungent. Hazy gold with a classic white background. Light body, excellent carbonation with a neat creamyness. Citrusy, light malty/bready  flavors, vegetal flavors also. Sweet, but not overly. Finish is fairly dry. A joy to drink. Been a while. A classic.

Hoegaarden is in the taditonal style of Belgian Wit Bier's. Served in the appropriate octoganal glass there is a nice shine to the hazy yellow beer. A nice froathy head sits atop the beer leaving a traditional Belgian lace all the way to the bottom of the glass. A zesty corriandor orange peel aroma dance across the sparkling head. Fruity in flavor, very refreshing.

This beer pours a pale cloudy whiteish yellow with a gigantic white head slowly dissolving to a sheet of lace, exactly how a Witbier should. The aroma is orange, spices and wheat. Flavour is wheat, citrus, coriander, and is well malted. It's smooth, clean and refreshing. I think this beer gets a bad rap because it's so readily available and so drinkable. Good beer doesn't have to be undrinkable by your average person. Though I will admit that it doesn't hold up nearly as well out of the bottle.
Good in bottle, better on tap.  Nicely spiced and very refreshing.  Not as substantial as other beers in the category, but a good solid choice nonetheless.
Oh so sweet and tasty! This is actually one of my favorite beers. Incredibly easy to drink with a great combination of fruits and spices.

Had this on tap at Cooter Brown's in New Orleans. A delicious ale to drink with oysters on the half shell. Milky white golden in color. Aroma belies the coriander and curacao flavors. Very very sour and I like it. Perhaps a slight anise detected? Bon Temps Roulet, dude!
Belgian whites arent my thing. The taste is too mild and the fruityness is overpowering in such a light beer.

on tap in a hoegaarden tumbler.  creamy white head that thins quickly with very little lacing.  cloudy yellow color.  I thought it was a grassy note, but after reading up it must have been orange.  lots of fizz and taste starts in very mild.  on the sweet side but very faint.  super mild hop finish.  very drinkable.  went good with the fries at Frjtz in SF.
Pours a light hazy yellow with a thick white head. Notes of banana, apple, citrus, and spice on the tongue. I really nice witbier. Very refreshing.

Very pale in color, almost albino like.  Distinctively different than most of the American whites where the orange and coriander dominate.  This is more complex with a variety of spices coming through.  I've often heard of people describing the taste of bubble gum in a beer and I thought they were crazy.  This has that taste.  overall, I don't like this as much as many of the American immitators.  I like the citrus strength of them better (Avery for example).

33cl brown bottle.First aroma is home-made ginger beer then citrus & coriander. Good white head.I don't know if it lasts cos I always knock straight back as its a great thirst quenchet.Cloudy pale gold.Medicinal flavour at first then like the aroma the coriander, citrus & ginger remain. Sold on tap in yuppee London pubs where its outrageously expensive.A great lunchtime tipple with or without the lemon

Whenever I see this on tap (which isn't often), it's the one I'll grab.  So unique.  Appearance is cloudy bright yellow.  Head is a rich white and decent thickness.  Carbonation is good.  Aroma is of crisp citrus + Chimay like at first (i.e. medicinal / licorice).  Citrus stands out over any spices (clove / coriander?).  Flavor is mildly spicy and citrusy.  Adding a wedge of lemon really works here.  Mouth feel is nice, smooth, and tingly.  I'm not getting the hint of yeast others describe, but I definitely sense the wheat.  Finish is fresh and clean.  No bitterness.  Some tartness in the aftertaste, but very mild.  Yep, I like it big bunches.  Overall, this is one of my favorites and a real winner.  I think it's because of this beer's refreshing nature and unique cloudy yellow appearance.

Nice frothy 2" white head.  Pale yellow cloudy appearance.  Certainly light fresh and floral nose with a hint of boiled Suidae (No kidding).  Maybe apple and some spruce(citrus).  Powdery gum-like mouthfeel quite enjoyable.
My first white, lots of apple in the flavor, nice and refreshing, if not a little on the simple side.

Nice white, long lasting head.  looks like the honey wines from Ethiopia, and tastes like some of the native beers I have experienced in Africa.  It shares the fruit flavor of honey wines.  It is very smooth, and unlike other beers, doesn't mess up my stomach.  I have an ulcer from anti arthritis medicine. Most beers hurt my stomach, this one doesn't.  I recommend it not just for the aroma, Appearance flavor, and Palate. I recommend it because it doesn't hurt my tender stomach.

I'm all mixed up in this review. She's pretty popular, but she's a tramp. Hazy sick straw yellow. Small bead, sticky carb. Nose is very mild of apples, yeast and some citric. The palate is as it should be for the style but really, really, really weak. Everything about this beer is washed out. The flavours have some bubblegum, soap, coriander, and a surprising amount of yeastiness.  I had to look for residuals but hey. It looks like a genuine well crafted beer. It's pretty good for a macro. But you can't fool everyone. I'm upset to say, but it's quite a bit better than average. I also used to hate it. Cheers. Nice work.
A really delightful beer, though one that doesn't mix well with others without some serious palette cleansing in between.
Pale cloudy body with nice creamy white head. Very pleasant citrus nose. Very sweet wheat flavor followed by a short bittersweet final. This is a good and easily available everyday Witbier.

Bottled. A light, lemongrass aroma with a hint of yeast is the first thing to greet you as you draw the glass towards you. The head is fluffy, and if served at the right temperature, it lasts. The beer is a cloudy, pale yellow colour. As for the taste, I find this beer to be extremely smooth and soft for its type, although it does leave a tingle of carbonation on the tongue. Hints of lemon, citrus and a definate hint of corriander stand out in the flavour, with a very slight hint of caramel in the aftertaste. Not bitter at all.

Pale (Coors light color, really) yellow, very clouded with yeast and carbonation and a big, two-finger, pure white head that lasts.  A quite appealing beer to see, and the tasty floral, spice (coriander, clove), and citrus aromas waft off the head and perfume the air around me.  I can't believe how many times I've walked past this stuff thinking it was nothing worth trying just because of nice packaging and good marketing.  Huh.  The body is crisp but the mouthfeel is full and soft, velvety almost.  Nice fresh herbal flavors, crisply lemon-ish, but not much bitterness or tartness.  Really nice, affordable, low ABV, easily quaffed, great with spicy foods, too.  A nice surprise.

Not transparent at all, but its not water were talking about either. An enjoyed Belgian ale, very definitive in taste, this one has your taste buds pulling in every direction that’s possible. But as strange it is to follow up on that statement, its not an overwhelming taste either. Could engulf several of these in a nights time. Bought in the arcade mart, came with a free glass. Cheers!

Definitely an interesting change from your normal lagers.  My second favorite Weissbier (and, actually, my second to try).  Somewhat watered down when compared to Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier, but for the price and availability, not a bad beer***On a second try (this time on tap), I have become somewhat more supportive of this beer.  I still think that Ayinger Brau-Weisse is the best Weissbier out there (at least, that I've had), but this one is very good as well.  Nice hoppy taste and great on tap--seems to have more flavor that way.***On a third go-round, it's still wonderful.

Corriander, orange peel and yeasty aromas very good and fresh aromas, this beer isn't that old. Pale yellow and cloudy as it should be. Thick head and very effervesent, the haed lasted a long time. Yeasty and bread like flavors with a good orange flavor. The corriander flavor was mild at first but got stronger as I drank more. An excellent example of a witbeer, as it should be, it's the original.

good, ive not had many belgian beers, and this is my first from that country.  hazy pour, pours almost white.  has a fruit like taste, and goes down easy.  this is a good beer, that i think i will buy more of when i am in the mood for this style.

Bottled
Very hazy citron yellow with small white head and some carbonation. Aroma is yeast and wheat and some crisp citron fruit. Very fresh aroma indeed. Taste is something similar to German weizen but not so sweet, extremely freshing beer. I have to try this tapped, which I haven't found for a long time.

Very cloudy, not much to look at.  The flavor and aroma make up for the apperance. At first taste it is very refreshing.  The after taste was strong and spicy.  Lots of coriander and orange flavor.  Great beer for everyday drinking.

Re-rate: Pours like a thin lemonade, with all the cloudiness and bits.  Aroma forewarns a strong citrus bite.  Head was a short stack of quickly disappearing bubbles.  Taste was both tangy and spicy with a dry finish.

Cloudy pale yellow with a nice collapsing foamy head. The aroma is lemon, pepper, corainder, and wheat. The flavor has an assertive spiciness up front that consists of pepper and coriander, this then transitions into a sweet orange/lemon flavor, finally a tiny bit of sourness and bitterness develops just about time of the swallow. The body is medium-light the finish has sone slight astringency. Overall a very nice a drinkable witbier.

Lets face it, this beer is not attractive, the cloudiness makes it look murky.  The rest of it though is top stuff.  The aroma is of vanilla ice cream.  The beer is supremly mellow with hints of spice.  Very drinkable and refreshing.  Much better to drink as a quencher than lagers.  Score 3.7
Subsequent rating scored 3.6  Score unaltered

Greenish yellow beer with an apropriate amount of foam for something that's at least half made of wheat. Green apple crispness immediately softens and turns to a pear flavor, then sttling on coriander and oranges. Finishes dry. Great wit I have here....(!)

This naturally fermented, cloudy white beer has a great, light taste that belies its colour.
Spanner.

aromas of coriander orange yeast fresh cooked bread. the head was substantial the slowly fades to a thin layer on the surface. The color is a hazy straw. The flavor is creamy, orange with a slight coriander pepperiness. A little bit of wheat. It becomes thin and watery toward the end. There are better blanche bieres, although this beer is a good drinking beer and you can put away dozens.
This beer is for the loyalists only! Starts enigmatic and finishes the same!
This is a very aromatic, excellent representation of the Belgian Wit style.  Cool and refreshing on a hot day, this will make you forget Hefeweizens and Wheat beers alike.  Try it without the lemon.

This Belgian Wheat pours a cloudy light yellow with a brilliant white foamy head. Hoppy citrus aromas with cheesey yeast notes. Slight wine scent with a small amount of alcohol. Very round body, smooth with a slight carbonation. Flavours of dough, vanilla and ginger to finish. The palate is very smooth almost to the point of watery but it leaves behind a flavour of yeast and vanilla. Very smooth!
Cloudy pale yellow with a frothy white head.  Nose of coriandor and orange zest.  Light fruity taste with hints of spices.

This was the first time that I had this beer from the tap, and it was certainly an improvement on the bottled.  Very tight white head, over a pale yellow cloudy beer.  Aroma of wheat and a citrus-like tang, both of which were evident in the taste also.  Seemed a little thin on the palate, but a very enjoyable, easy drinking beer.

bottled on tap:  this is your classic witbier and probably the most popular in the style. i love the look almost white yellow with a thin head, i also like it in the hoegaarden tumbler that it is appropriately served in.  like a thin hefeweizen or weissebiere.  but more watered down and liter. crisp and snappy. great for hot summer days. easy to drink. me likes..
very pleasant aroma; very unusual color -very pale cloudy yellow with a thin white head; definite citrus taste; a little thin

Presume it was this that brought my former boss in contact w/ Pierre Celis. As if you care. But you wouldn't care about my rating either, would you? This was a real learning experience fro me way back when. Thems was the days before Celis was brewing in Austin. And now they are no longer. And this beer lives on. And I still praise Pierre.
Light, cloudy yellow beer with a very white head. Fruity, slightly smoked aroma, some spice, some lemon. Sweet and easy-to-drink with a hint of tartness.

Damn, I didn't read the instructions on the back of the bottle that state you should swish the last bit around before adding it to the glass.

Pours a very hazy straw color with a very nice head and some lacing.

Scent it typical Wit. Taste is as well; bananas and spices. Mouthfeel is very weak, though, and almost watery. Overall this is okay and nothing special.
Lovely Belgian Witbier. Almost colourless and very cloudy, but a very comprehensive body. The best wheat beer I have ever tasted.
Rare appearence but so caractersistic tasting, a has a great acid flavour but on the other hand has a sweet end if you drink it icy. Great beer, but not to drink it so often beacuse is easy to bore

Bottle pours a pale, hazy yellow with a small head and some lace.  The aroma is yeasty and spicy.  The flavor is clovey, yeasty, sweet, and slightly hopped with a medium palate.  Overall, it sort of leaves me wanting more flavor and body, but it is OK.

citrusy witbier aroma.  yellow in color.  i like it when beer looks like powdered lemonade with a frothy head.  this beer seems perfect for what it is-- much more balanced than the victory whirlwind.  very drinkable, subtle character.  a great session beer.
Light golden colour and very cloudy. Aroma is spicy, and the taste is mainly orange/ citrus flavored. Very good on a warm day.

Cloudy yellow in colour with very little head. Great tasting summer beer with refreshing citrus and spice notes. It tastes a bit soapy too, but I kinda like that (think Thrills gum). A very good accompaniment to hot thai chicken wings.

Cloudy light yellow(wife said it looked like infected urine, I asured her it tasted much better) thin clinging head that lasted for much of the beer. great aroma corriander pepper and faint yeast. the taste is good, light and  refreshing,I pick up the orange peel and corrinader they say they put into it good balance

Hoegaarden is one of the rare beers that's easy to find, yet consistently very good. The appearance is typical of a Belgian witbier...cloudy yellow, not much of a strong point. There is also no head to speak of. However, the beer tastes great, smelling of coriander and lemon mostly, it tastes great (spicy, citrusy) and it has a very good, bracing nose to it as well. What Hoegaarden really has going for it is the tang when it hits your palate, however. The mouthfeel and lingering aftertaste of Hoegaarden are quite unique, and always enjoyable.

Very cloudy straw-coloured beer with a good amount of head.  Smells strongly of banana, clove, orange and other spices.  Feels great in the mouth with a citrus and spice taste.  A very good refreshing beer.  One of my favourites

A pale pour, with the expected haze, and a fluffy white thick head.  Spices were evident, with a almost a lemon and tangerine taste, but with a smell of oranges and yeast.  This drank well, and was smooth enough with a subtle sweetness, and a nice tart finish.  Would be perfect on a nice hot summer day.  My first Belgian White, but not my last.

Pours like hazy lemonade.  Minimal head that leaves quickly.  Served on tap with a slice of lemon at Hurley's Irish Pub.  Obvious lemony aroma, with some banana.  Typically yeast aroma, similar to a hefeweizen.  Smooth with a yeasty bread aftertaste (lemon also).  A good summer brew, decent beer.
Smells and tastes like bumble gum.  Cloudy yellow is kind of unappealing.  Almost no aftertaste.  Worth a taste.

[bottle] Pours a nice cloudy light golden color with a good strong head. Little bit of a spiced nose to it. Initial spicy taste that gives way to a sweetness and then to a nice smooth finish. Very tasty.

This is still something of a classic, although seems to have lost a little character since becoming part of the giant Interbrew empire. Perhaps less spices in the mix? Or it it just psychological. Whatever, it is still a zingy refreshing beer and was to become a great standby in days to come in Belgium when palates were becoming a little jaded with powerful sweeter brews and needed some cleansing (water, of course, being out of the question). Draught, Eurostar Rail Terminal, Waterloo, London, September 2003.
Good for a witbier, but no matter how much I try I just can't get into weizens.

I guess I really should pour a German Hefe in an other glass at the same time as this so I can figure out what the difference between a wit and a hefe is. This tastes like a middling hefe, albeit a little drier and more peppery in the finish. Decent, drinkable beer, especially during the hot time of year.

Cloudy straw color,small white creamy head that lasted for a decent time and left a nice lace behind.Nice wheat aroma with a decent fruit presence,lemon grass,and a nice amount of spice coming through as well.The flavor is wheaty and mildly fruity with a decent spice coming on.The feel is pretty light with a generous amount of carbonation.The finish is mildly sweet and sour with a light spice.I guess IMO this is nothing special,just an oevrly weak brew with little real flavor but,it does have atleast one nice quality which would be that it is fairly drinkable and would make a nice summer brew.

draft. typical hazy pale appearance, blah blah blah not to say it looks bad though. sweet creamy wheat with spice, citrus and floral, dry subtle bitter finish - dies fast though, so there's really no finish... ya know it keeps you from not drinking it ;o)  didn't sense much sour, but otherwise it's smooth and available. not too complex and not too simple. just lovely. i'm glad it's so known and available. the beer is great. had this in a smoky bar, i wish to re-rate so i can tighten up what i remember sensing.

Cloudy pale yellow with a puffy white head that reminded me of meringue. The primary aroma is lemon and coriander, but there are subtle hints of peach, vanilla and bergamot. Taste is a marvelous blend of fruit and spices; lemon, banana, peach, orange, coriander, vanilla and clove-they're all there. Mouthfeel is rich smooth and creamy. The Belgian White all others of the style aspire to.

A refreshing brew for those hot summer days. Color is a cloudy yellow  reminiscent of lemonade, but with a nice white foam. Aroma is mild and fruity without being overbearing. Nice citrus flavorings with good hop balance. Finish is clean with no bitterness. A well rounded beer.
great from the draft, cold in a big glass.  especially in the summer.  cool translucent yellow.  very citrusy with no thick malt or citrus hops.  girls will like it too.

Bottle - Hazy white brew with a nice white foamy head with good retention. Aroma of coriander is strong but pleasant. Body is medium and good have been a bit stronger. Very refreshing beer for those hot summer days.
My favorite Belgian White. Draft version is spectacular. Nice yellow color and oh so refreshing.

Really hazy light yellow color - sort of like LemonHeads with a crystalized sugar look.  Neat little head, and good lacing.  Sweet lemon nose, nothing over the top but pleasant.  Mostly lemon flavors, and really didn't taste any sourness, which is fine.  I find it to be good example of its style.

This beer pours beautifully with a clean white head and a golden white body that is chock full of sediment. Has a nice aroma of fruit, bubble gum, wheat malt, and coriander. Finishes with a slightly sour fruit taste. This is the first White Beer I have tried and I was very pleased. Even at the nine dollars I paid for a six-pack I would buy this again. Overall I think Hoegaarden White is a delicious and refreshing beer that is perfect for summer fare and hits the spot when you want something different.
Pours kind of cloudy with a nice frothy head.Has tastes of fruits.Not too bitter with a nice clean finish

Very pale yellow-white, nice large white head. Some spices in the aroma, some wheat and banana as well. Flavour is well balanced between sweet and bitter, some nice spices, lemon. Creamy palate. Overal not bad. Bottle.

Pours a very pale, murky yellow with a large white head and tremendous lace.  Aroma is yeast and malt, like raw bread dough with orange.  Flavor is sweet, citrus, spicy, with a little acid.  A slightly bitter finish with a dry aftertaste.  Amazingly complex beer for one that is light, refreshing and little watery.  Good carbonation.  An excellent beer.

wheaty aroma with soft citrus and biscuity aromas.
cloudy golden colouration with big rocky head.
biscuity wheat with orange and hint of lime flavours.
medium, smooth body, with light bitterness and slightly drying palate.
nice refreshing subtle complexity, lots of flavours without any one flavour being overpowering.

Nice spicy and orange aroma with the same in the tasting. What I would say detracts somewhat from this beer is that it is slightly to watery for my taste. I prefer this in summer, it's a nice refreshing beer on a hot day.

I tend to buy these on draught only, because they come in a huge and very cool heavy-weight glass..!!
Very small head and a good hazy yellow body. Good citrus and wheat aroma and a nice wheaty taste. Coriander and orange peel. Pretty good wheat beer and better than most German weissen in my opinion!

This is a classic, and is still a revolutionary drink in most run of the mill UK pubs.  The colour is like a hazy sunrise, and the taste is a fresh smack of lemon and wheat.  The thin heads fizzes like an aspirin, and it's lip smackingly addictive too.  The only thing which lets this down is that it tends to be variable depending on the pub and day of the week.

(Bottled) Opaque yellow color with a medium, tight, not very lacy head. Sweetish, yeasty, spicy, orange-pineapple-fruity aroma. Yeasty, lightly acidic, lemony flavor with orange peel and other spices. Soft and refreshing, light to medium-bodied, slicky palate with balanced carbonation. An easily drinkable and refreshing terrace drink, that goes down during winter as well.

Oh wow, what a great first white beer to try!  Followed the directions on the bottle to pour :) ...  what a surprise!  Lovely appearance and aroma, and a great taste to boot.  Went perfect with a summer sausage and cheese plate over thanksgiving... great complement to food.  A tad pricey at 8$ a six pack, but defintely worth the money.  Fantastic!  I could drink this at every meal if I was rich!

Bottle, imported.

Clear bottle with a pale yellow/golden hue--atypical of a Belgian white--I guess there should be hefe in there somewhere, but all of mine is caked to the bottom of the bottle--an old one to be sure.  The head is small, but consists of tiny, frothy white bubbles.  Although it isn't a large head, and subsides fairly soon, a determined layer clings to the top of the beer.

The nose is mildly spicy, with citrus, nutmeg and clove tones to it--maybe a bit of bandaid off flavor--it IS an old bottle.  There is the traditional unmalted wheat wang that you'd expect, but moreso.

The taste is slightly bitter, sour, with a lactic bite.  There are the wheat, and bandaid flavors, but very little spice.

The bandaid aftertaste lingers for a while.

A drinkable beer--but let this be a lesson to those of you out there who pick up beers on vacation when you can't get them where you live--drink the wheats early--they don't cellar well.
On tap.  A cloudy yellow appearance with a white head.  Nice crisp lemon/orange flavor that went down easy.  Beats the ever-living crap out of Blue Moon.
On tap. Citrus and flowery aroma. Cloudy yello with small head. Crisp and dry. Typical Belgian white, but very good.
I just can't wrap my head around these wits.  This was definitely good, and interesting, with interplay between the wheat, carbonation, and the spice (cinnamon?), but it's just not my cup of tea.

An excellent and reliable witbier! Crisp, juicy pour!  (Best served with a lemon slice, or even better, an orange slice!)  Intense flavors of wheat, mixed with citrus, mixed with pear makes for a very satisfying drink.  Not too carbonated.  Rich, creamy head.  Refreshing as a summer beer, but with enough guts to be enjoyed in the colder months as well.  Probably pairs really nicely with food, like a rib-eye steak, pork roast or even spicy Asian foods! Goes down real easy with a crisp, dry finish!

If this is available in a pub on draught its always my choice over the usual town centre pub lagers.  Distinctive in terms of its colour and flavour.  Love it, though it tends to get me drunk very quickly.

Bottled.
Hazy golden with a huge, white head.
Yes, it smells and tastes like a weissbier and it's dry and rather flat.

Very pale yellow, the color of pear. Light head, that subsides quickly, yet leaves a fine silky lacing on the glass. Initial taste is of wheat which belnds smoothly into the fruity finish of orange peel, pear, and mild hops. Quite smooth and interesting, I like this beer. Wish I could have a nice portion of sea bass, and pasta to accompany.
This is a great lawnmower beer with a nice balance of citrus and yeast flavor. Very good example of the style that is really good with shellfish.

Might I start off by saying I'm not a huge fan of Witbiers. Appearance is strange, very light almost like dirty water. A nice lemon and bread nose. Flavor is clean and refreshing with some lemon, apricots, bananas, and grapefruit. Palate is slightly dry and a little thin. This is a pretty good beer.
Draught at the Beer Sellar in Nashville. Pale yellow pour wiht a decent head. A very good Belgian White. Great aroma and taste. Some fruit in the taste. Very nice beer to have.
One of the best beers you´ll ever get your hands on. Great taste, appearance, aroma, you´ll want another one.
Nice plain White beer. But not many special characteristics. Probably a good beer to start with for beer newcomers.

Excuse my language but this is a shit-hot little beer. Tried it on tap in the UK last year and was worth every pence I paid for it. I bought another and another and another...you get the picture. Smooth, yet retains its flavour until the last moutful. Very citrusy with lovely head retention. If it weren't so damn expensive at my local bottlo I'd drink this stuff all the time.

I'm not going to say I was disappointed with this beer because it is a great beer, but I do wish I tried it before reading other reviews so I didn't have such high expectations.  It goes down easy with a great aftertaste.  Nice big white head with a full yellow body.  Try it before you read too many gracious reviews.

A front runner for the best Belgian Wit out there. Strong coriander and breadiness in nose. Tangy and chalky at the same time. The pale yellow body is topped by a huge rocky white head. Finishes dry and definitely leaves you wanting more.

The bar down the street has this on tap.  This is one of the best beers I have ever had.  I am of course a fan of Belgians as you can tell from reading my other ratings but this is a great among greats.  So smooth a silky on the tongue, and a creamy flavor.

I made this rating after drinking it bottled, but I still remember how much better it was on tap in Brussels (where it deserves a higher rating).  A pale yellow, hazy bottle-conditioned beer that pours with a nice white head that is mostly lasting.  Aroma is slightly malty, has a light dough-like yeast smell, and moderately hoppy with citrus hints of lime, orange, maybe slight banana.  Flavor tastes lightly sweet and lightly acidic, with a slightly bitter finish.  It has a light body, watery texture with lively carbonation.  All in all an above average beer instantly recognizable.  Now go drink this on tap in Grand Place!
Very impressed with this beer, nice individual appearance, nice smell (altho at first it smelt like sunscreen), very zesty and refreshing, its a damn treat, i tell you what. cheers

Lemony, limey and zesty. This beer tastes great. Very light but not lacking in flavour. Extremely cloudy and light in colour. At first it would be easy to mistake this beer for a cider or lemonade but has a malty aftertaste that reminds you that its a beer. Ingredients list states that they use coriander and orange peel. Coriander is certainly present as it gives it its unique flavour. Does not taste like 5%. Great beer especially when you are very thirsty. Very individual. Where can i get forbiden fruits?
A great belgian white, slightly cloudy with a good strong flavour.  Quite fruity going down but still plenty tasty.
From the bottle. Pale, hazy, cloudy yellow.  Fruity, but with that sour and strong Belgian style. Not a favorite of mine, but drinkable.

I tasted this one while RateBeer.com was down, so this is by memory. The looks are nice, although I must have messed up pouring it somewhat, since the head was quite moderate. The aroma is good, if not sensational. What I did expect more of was body and taste. It does taste nice, but I was thinking "easy drinking..." It's a nice brew anyway and I might have been more pleased if it had been slightly colder.

Re-rate: This has of lat become my favourite sessionbeer, so a re-rate was warranted. It looks lovely in the correct glass. Only the appearance and OA went up, but I think it deserved more than I had given it before.

A super wit beer, opaque white/lemon in color. Aroma is all yeast. Taste is lightbodied and yeasty,, nie drink for hot weather.
Cheers

Color reminds me of lemonjuice, but the head looks better. White and very creamy. Aroma is typical for a weissbier with notes of citrus.Flavor is a little artifical, maybe a little fruity. Typical weissbier here as well, but not very much to my liking.

Cloudy, light lemon-yellow beer with a tight, white, long lasting head. Wheat spiciness and coriander in the aroma. The taste is light and crisp, with lemon and coriander present supported by a touch of malt sweetness. The good mouthfeel helps support the light flavor. Excellent drinakbility, and one that is high on my list for summer. There's a good reason this is a classic.

I love this beer. It has a great aroma that does not overpower the flavor of the beer. It's has a great flavor that does not linger in the mouth. Over all this is the beer I want to drink when I get home from work.
Based on cask conditioned version:  A good tasting belgian white beer.  Pours cloudy yellow with light white head.
What a beautiful beer!  It's a hazy white beer with a long lasting white head.  Soft taste with notes of orange and spice.  Nice and balanced

Lightly hazy with a nice white cloudy head. Aroma is lightly hinted with banana and clove with a slight coconut background. Flavor has hints of sweet fruit and of coarse whitbier esters (balove). Finishes moist like a belgian wheat but with a little more character.
Pours a cloudy yellow with light white head. Aroma of wheat and spice, some bread. Wheaty citrus, some yeast and spice. Very smooth. Nice witbier.

With a dreamy light cloudy color with a white head, this beer is great in the glass. It has a smooth citrus and wheat taste with a tad of spice that makes it unique. A winsome white beer that's great with a lemon.

Great big head of snow white bubbles.  Nice lacing.  Spicey aroma with a little citrus.  Color is a very pale light gold and is cloudy.  Flavor is very weak with some banana, citrus and cloves.  Noy very strong though.  Finish is light and crisp.  A good version of the style but but has the look and feel of a lite beer.  Worth a try but not a favorite of mine.

Aroma: massive banana with some apple and medicinal notes. Appearance: cloudy pale yellow (lemon juice coloured) with a small head. Flavour mixed spices, banana and a little grain. Palate: thin with loads of carbonation.
Cloudy, Pale yellow - Extremely Pale yellow. Lemon, nutmeg and ginger aroma. familiar wit flavors, but maybe a little more hop presence than I expected.
Pours cloudy yellow-white with a creamy tight white head. Sweet yeasty aroma with a hint of spices. Medium smooth palate. Sweet wheaty flavour with a fruity citrus aftertaste. Very drinkable.

Cloudy, pale yellow, sparkling, thick creamy nice white head that lasts. Fruity, spiced, notes of orange and yeast in aroma. Medium body, smooth and balanced, bit sweet, fresh and easy to drink. Also moderate bitter, fruity and tart. Bit dry and tart finish.

On tap. Without a doubt, this beer takes Blue Moon to school.  Nice golden color, kinda of like lemonade.  It has the taste you can only find in European wheat beers.  Problably a good reccomendation for the ladies.

Like white gold. The cloudy color is beautiful. The white head is a perfect compliment. The beer smells of orange and lemon, even a bit of bubble gum, very much in fact. The taste is very mild. I have had this with a lemon as well which does bring out certain flavors but takes away from others. This should be enjoyed alone. Wonderful refreshing beer.

Wow! Finally got around to trying this one last weekend. Just wonderful! Very light in appearance, truly "White-ish" when held up to the light. VERY easy to drink and enjoy. Update: since I first rated this in 2003, it has become much more widely available. Thank goodness. Cause this is a damn good summer drink!
This was my first wheat beer. I was taken with its orange and spice flavors. As the beer got warmer, the flavors seemed even more promounced. Great wheat!

Consensus seems to smile on Hoegaarden.  Heavier on the coriander and wheat than on citrus, with orangepeel and banana detectable.  The appearance is about as "wit" as they get.  Looks like a fresh lemonade with carbonation.  Fairly light body.  One of the better representations of the style.

Mild but pleasing clove aroma. Beaultiful cloudy straw colour with medium head but little lacing. Spiciness and fruitiness not apparent except for a mild lemon flavour. Too citrus not enough wheat. Body somewhat lacking. Not to be avoided but certainly not a first choice. Bottle.
Pours out w a decent head/some lace.Smells like a white beer/tastes pretty nice but..I like the dirty appearance of this one(very true belgian appearance)
Pleasant floral aromas on the nose,cloudy pale colour with a nice and full white head, the taste was mild spice,clove,coriander and banana. Not a full bodied beer but a very pleasant one.
Pale straw color, cloudy with great white head. Spicy and clovy aroma, malty, sweet and citric flavour. Good but not special.

I just don’t see the excitement unless this was the beer that declared “Belgian White/Wheat Beers”. This Hoegaarden blanche was not an epic beer by my tastes, it was simply citric, wheaty, and yeasty. The appearance was a pail golden/orange with a fluffy white head, and a medium watery palate, lightly oily. A good beer, but I’m not about to loose my mind over it!

Cloudy pale yellow green color. Medium white head. Nose is yeast and spice.  Flavor is lightly sweet, slightly acidic (lemony), a little peppery with hints of clove and coriander. Finish is dry and spicy.

Aroma is very, very clovey. Also has a slight alcohol/CO2 smell similar to putting your head in a fermenter. 
Flavour is lightly sweet, a bit citrusy and peppery with a very faint hint of bitterness at the end. Used to drink a lot of this, and I remember it being slightly more flavoursome. Very nice though.
RR: Geez... I swear this used to be a lot better. So watery - just very little going on at all. This is a great beer style, but this is a very ordinary beer.

Draught: Those big-ass glasses, as independent testing has proved, yield more beer than your average pint, which is a good thing. You all know what it looks like by now, but you gotta love that head, and the bold clove and citrus flavours. The body is a bit watery for my taste though, and I wouldn't add any lemon to it. One of the most refreshing summer patio-beers around.

I'm sorry, I guess I just don't get it with this one... I like this style ok.. Boulevard Zon is a very good beer... but this one seemed to be lacking.  I really couldn't taste the orange flavor that seems to be the trade mark of the style.  A refreshing beer, but a little disappointing :-(
Fuzzy white color with a beautiful head. Very sweet taste with a subtil orange zest. One of the best witbier.
Very spicy and slightly sweet. I didnt like it the first time i rated it but after a refined palate this is a good beer.

(bottle conditioned)Flowery, slightly spicy aroma with clove and orange zest.  Light yellow, moderately hazy if poured properly. Malt and wheat shine through a thinnish body and a sourish, but dry, finish.  Lingering spice.  Awesome!

Oh bliss! Bliss and heaven!
Interesting, frothy, sweet, smooth and delicious beer. So smooth and delicious, it immediately put me in the mood for swimming. I wanted to swim in a lake of this beer.  I wanted to be like Scrooge McDuck in this beer it felt so smooth.

Light and easy, the easiest smoothest beer I have ever tasted. Halfway through I spritzed a little Lemon into it, and it overpowered the flavor a little bit, but even then it was good. 

I want to replace water with this stuff it was so easy to drink.  In a word--superb.


PS...Over one year later after reading this, boy am I absurd.  Enjoy

Yellow body, VERY opaque, with a tall, creamy head. Moderately sweet (orange) and slightly yeasty (cobweb?) aroma, with a spicy touch. Not so impressive tough, it ought to be more intense. Moderate sweetness and acidity, with a dry and bitter finish. Very good.

Draft. This consistently underwhelms me.  Pale yellow, cloudy body. Usually a good sized head on it, this one was less than average. Slightly more watery than usual, but still a very nice mouthfeel. Aroma is of orange and spice (coriander?) I prefer Blanche de Chambly from Unibroue personally. An excellent macro product for sure though, that I tend to order more often than I realise at lesser bars!

I have to be honest - The Belgian Whites just don't do it for me.  Not that I don't enjoy a nice relaxing beer; something to go down easy, I just like a little more character than this.  This one is very pale, definite grain/straw aroma, with a little hoppyness.  Taste is lightly bitter, smooth palate, but I think it just needs something "extra."

By far the best witbier out there!  Cloudy straw color, excellent head retention and good lacing.  Great citrusy and yeasty aroma.  The flavor has citrus (orange, lemon), that classic Belgian yeast character, mild spiciness and phenolics, and some wheat tartness.  Light bodied and effervescent.  Very refreshing.  Great beer for a hot Arizona summer day.

On tap in the Cellar, St. Andrews.  It's like drinking a freakin bail of hay.  That in itself was too overpowering for me to pick up on anything else.  ReRate: I was far too hasty with this.  It takes some time to get used to the straw flavor, but once that sets in a very nice citrus flavor slides in.  Still not my favorite, but far better than I originally found it to be.
Coriander aroma.  Cloudy appeareance with a very nice large head.  Nice coriander taste with some fruity sweetness.  Good brew, but not the best Belgian.

Great light tasting but still spicy, sweet, almost citric flavor.  One of many great beers to come from Belgium.  The palate is smooth, crisp and refreshing.  Only downside is the cloudy nature of the appearance.

Aroma: smells great with ester and citrus overtones characteristic of the style. Appearance: Beautiful, cloudy, heady, and glowing yellow. Palate: smooth, crisp and refreshing. Flavor: nice hints of spice and ester. light and tantilizing. Overall: Really good, but could use a bit more flavor.

on tap-
Had a citusy aroma almost like grapefruit wirh a cloudy orange color.  Had a thin white head which had no longengivity.  A lemony taste with a crisp and refreshing finish.  It was not dry at all
Looks like lemonade with a few floaties.  A mild Belgian spiciness is very pleasant in the hot humid summer.  A citrus crispiness bites the palate. Refreshing.
Crisp, bubbly, lemon and apple flavor, so yeasty I can almost taste the B vitamins, one of the best wits I've had.
Draught. Cloudy and almost flourescent lemon-lime color. Yeasty citrus, aroma. Taste of lemons, wheat, and yeast. Super-smooth palate.

Solid beer with very bold and fruity taste. Nice aroma but not much head. Didn't like the color too much, especially with stuff floating around. Kinda looks like someone backwashed it. Finishes clean but gets a little boring towards the end.
Very light wheat beer, with nice citrus and coriander flavours. A good summer beer.
Murky yellow, big white head, lots of fizz. Half-litre at Falstaff in Brussels. Wheaty aroma, with some citrus and spice. Wheat, spice and citurs in flavor. Very refreshing, world-class beer.

Pale yellow and hazy with white creamy head. Yeasty aroma with citrus and some pepper. Taste is yeasty and sweet with some acidity. Some drieness in the finish. Could have more character but it's still a good summer beer.
A nice wheat beer.  Definatly the thickest light/wheat beer that i've seen.  Could definatly pick out some nice citrus flavors.

7/11/03:  bottle.  
 citrus and yeast to the nose.  light yellow (banana rind) colored body which is both cloudy and full of small particles.  summery and yeasty with a hint of lemon at the finish.  typically i’m not a huge fan of belgian brews-could it be that i’m starting to acquire the taste??

The color approaches that of the underbelly of a Mississippi mudcat, but it has a grand looking head and a pleasant citrus/clove aroma. Tangy and satiny on the tongue, with a subdued spiciness. Fuller bodied than either Blue Moon or the Point version, with a smooth and slightly acidic finish. Excellent.

The quality of this beer had dived in the last couple of years and this insipid version before me is the worst yet. It's all very well deciding that the world only needs one beer of each style, and only one brewery to make them, but they could at least take a little bit of care over the World Domination Wheatbeer. What has the accounts department economised on now? Something in the ingredients or more time cut from the fermentation? They should take more care of this beer.
Cloudy yellow color with a white head that quickly diminished and left an OK head. Citrusy, orange color and I certainly taste the coriander.  Very refreshing and probably my favorite witbier.
awesome fluffy white head. smells and tastes of pear and coriander. drinking this on a hot summer day is one of life's real pleasures.

Very cloudy golden color with a small but dense white head full of tiny bubbles. Fruity and spicy aroma: Orange, lemon, bread, yeast. The taste is classic, very light and refreshing with coriander and what you had smelled, a little tartness joins before it all ends. Pretty good, especially in bottle since it’s a little watery on tap.

On draught at The Claddagh in Columbus, OH. It might be blasphemy to say so, but I like Blue Moon more than this. Pours a light gold color with a thin white head. Bubbly with very thin lacing. Aroma is very bready and yeasty and clean. Light-bodied and slightly sour flavor under the wheat. I could not detect much spice or citrus which usually makes Wits more tolerable to me. The finish is a little watery, with more yeast and a little banana.

Hoegaarden is a nice wheat beer. I really can't say that there's any one thing that stands out about it, I guess it's just not got the character that I would say makes it one of the great beers that I have tried.
This beer deserves more praise than it gets, yes it's interbrew but this beer is a real gem. Easily the top of the style.

Opaque, cloudy yellow with a quickly dissipating white head. Very pleasing to the eye! No lacing.

Sweet and sour comes through in the aroma. Lots of yeast and bread too. Coriander really comes out as the beer approaches room temperature.

Spicy and crisp at the start. Lots of coriander in the middle. With a nice tart and spicy finish. I love Belgian wheats!

Very highly carbonated like a sparkling wine. Could use a bit more in the body and mouthfeel but theflavors more than compensate. Classic beer.
Hoegaarden is (in the UK at least) VERY expensive, and although it is EXCELLENT it doesn't justify the typical price tag of £3 a pint.
The label is true to its  contents: white cloudy color. Head a little to thick to my liking. Very carbonated, very spicy. Left a somewhat bitter aftertaste. Nothing exceptional.
Nice yellow cloudy color with a nice white head. Taste is citrus and spices. Overall a decent wit.

Interesting beer.  First time I had Hoegaarden, was amazed by the glass :)  Thick head, strong citrus and spice aroma.  Had a taste that is fairly polar - either you will really like this beer, or find it revolting.  Fortunately, most like it.  Orange and coriander are the dominant flavors.  Much better draft than bottle, but I may have got a bad bottle.  Avail at LCBO in Ontario.

Cloudy very pale, nice frothy lace. Citrus yeasty aroma. Flavor is smooth, yeasty, citrus, and spicy. The spicey coriander realy comes out as it warms and it is much beter. Finish is dry and spicy, quite nice.

Billowing white cream; hazy, pale lemon hue.  Fried bananas served with vanilla ice cream and cinnamon; oatmeal with stone fruits.  Brief malts give to tangy acids; coating wheat lingers into a bright lemon zest finish.  Well attenuated yet creamy; drying with fluffy carbonation.

Smooth and safe with tangy acids and intriguing spice.

33 cl bottle, best before 20/07/2009.

Pours very cloudy, pale yellow with an average frothy head.  Smells very spicy to the point of exclusion of other smells.  So it’s not much to see or smell.  Tastes like yummy-refreshing wheaty-bananas.  Very light feeling; watery, with very active carbonation.  Finish is short and clean, a little more bitter than the start.
Very pale and very cloudy. Big foamy head. Rings of lace. Citrus/perfumy aroma. Very light and refreshing. Notes of perfume, citrus, and clove. Nice.
Okay re-done and much better. Maybe my palate is getting better these days. Sweet, citrus flavor. Nice head with a clean finish.
If this is coriander and orange why doesn't it taste like Sunshine from New Belgium. I taste banana.

Pouts a nice cloudy blond with a puffy white head. Nose is spicy and seems overwhelming to any other aroma. The body relaxes this a bit and allows a slight fruity note to intrude on the spice. Finishes with a bit of spice and sweetness on the tongue. Not as good as I remember but it is not a bad beer.

Pours a very pale and hazy yellow color with a beautiful tall foamy white head. Unusually pale yellow like a lemonade. The body has hints of sour apple and citrus flavor. Finishes with a sweet candy flavor. Overall, a superb belgian white.

poured out into the glass very hazy yellow straw, lots of mixing of whites and yellows, like watching watery latex paint mix. A huge creamy, thick, foamy head grew over and beyond and was quite a thrill to see. Smells right away of the orange and lemon, extremely citrusy. Nothing out of the ordinary for this Belgian beauty, but good non the less. Tastes of a citrus brew, very citrusy with orange and lemon strongly presented and felt, with a hint of spice, coriander I believe.

(33 ml bottle) Cloudy yellow body, with a dense white head. Banana hints as a backdrop to a citrus aroma. Smooth crisp taste, with an interessting palate that I can't place. A good summer session beer.

A cloudy yellow color with a foamy white head. Nose is quite nice but not very strong.  I taste coriander, orange peels, vanilla, and maybe a little pepper.  Smooth on the palate.  A great Belgian white.
Pale yellow, almost milky looking, snow white head. Plenty of citrus and spice in the aroma and flavor. A very good witbier.
Another nice blanche. Orange and citrus taste. Fizzy and spicy. By now, this is my favorite blanche. Good for any occasion.

12oz bottle-nice clove/spicy aroma-appearance was pale yellow and cloudy, almost white(i wonder why....)flavor was spicy and sweet.  definately one of the better witbier selections out there along with the victory whirlwind.
I loved this beer te first time I tried it, and I still do. It's great with an orange too!
a medium white head, with a milky white appearance.  an interesting texture that seems heavier that it actually is.  a flavor similar to a razz-wheat (strange but true)

The cloudy appearance might make Hoegaarden seem watery, but the cloudiness is intentional. The flavour of the beer is very strong, but surprisingly, it is a very sweet beer, without a hint of bitterness. Not something I'd drink a lot of, because I'm classless, but definitely a very different beer.

Consumed at Cafe Pushkin in Moscow. Faint wheat aroma. Cloudy yellow body with white head and very good lacing. Head is mostly lasting until the end. Flavor is fairly subtle; wheaty, but very, very drinkable. Better as it warms. Good with seafood.

This is the first white beer I ever tried and I was very dissapointed, it was nothing I expected from a belgian beer.  Small head that goes away quickly and an interesting aroma.  Little body and nothing special about it whatso ever.

This Belgian White poured a large invigorating white creamy head with fine-small bubbles. The lacing was sparse on the sides of my glass. The body was a cloudy yellow. The aroma was fruity in my opinion and it had a slight bitter taste to it. I truly enjoyed drinking this brew while it lasted, right thedm?? This brew went down way too smooth!!

This brew poured an envigorated head of creamy fine white bubbles and a carbonated cloudy light yellow body.  It had a mild banana-hop aroma.  It started fizzy and buttery then finshed smoothly in a banana floral flavor.  Indeed, this was another very nice brew.

Did I just have an off bottle?  Did my tastes change?  It hasn't been that long since I had this beer, and I remembered loving it.  This one poured the cloudy pale yellow that I was expecting, but the head died fast and abruptly.  The flavor was close to what I remember, orange followed by coriander, but the wheat field that I recalled was strangely lacking.  Light bodied, as was expected, but a bizarre, biting astringency that lasted throughout the glass.  Coriander came through more as it warmed.  Disappointing, will need to rerate when I know I have a fresh bottle.  RERATE, 6/18/03, just had it last week on draft, that was the beer I remembered.  Beautiful wheat flavor, well balanced spiciness, none of the astringency from the bottle I had recently had, and a pretty lacing head to boot.  Much better.  Original ratings were 8/4/7/2/15.

Bottled. 
Lovely beer. Hazy yellow. Citrusy with a spicy touch of coriander. Yummy and refreshing. This type has become a new favourite.

It produced a thin white head that was short lived, and exhibited the expected pale yellow color with unfiltered yeast.  It had a gread aroma and the spices made it very refreshing for a spring/summer day.  Not a lot of body compared to other beer styles.  I recommend it for warm weather refreshment.
Small white head. Cloudy and pale golden-yellow. Sweet and spicy aroma. Light to medium body. Taste is slightly sweet and spicy (with a little bite!) with a dry finish. Good.

Little carbonation.  Very light colored and almost has 
a beige hue.  I smell some witbier aromas, but they are 
noticeably weak.  So is the flavor.  I can taste the yeastiness
but it is so weak.  I think even Blue Moon blows this 
beer away.  Hell, water blows this beer away.

Ah allwayz thort that one odem ho gardens was them trayler paarks where Jerry Springer's guests came from. You could imagine the show- 'You drank all my brew, so skank we're now through'. 

Conversely this Belgian beauty is the best start to a a day of imbibing beers from this part of the world. A very pale beer with a complex aroma of fruity esters, banana, orange peel and lemon. It starts somewhat fizzy on the palate but that soon subsides. Good lacing in the glass, my only complaint being that I just don't like to drink out of those tumblers. This is fine out of a pilsner or lager glass. Lets have one or two then move on to the next one.

on tap - the cloudy, urine-yellow appearance (and the name of the beer for that matter!) set the tone nicely for this one.  overpowering aroma of something citrusy.  the taste seemed to have hints of banana and clove, oh yeah and a big frickin' wheat field.  given a choice, i'd rather drink MD 20/20.

Found out about this beer when visiting the Flanders countryside while living in Belgium, tasting it always brings me back to a great time in my life...Cloudy yellow and nice head, good lace, and thin-bodied. The citrus/spice combination really hits you head on. The wheat characteristic is more pronounced on th palate with just enough hoppiness to balance it out. Finishes surprising clean with minimum aftertaste. A world class witbier.

For Ratebeers' sake - normally I wouldn't touch this stuff with a nine-foot long pole... Well-known hazy-yellow-with-the-greenish shine. Not huge, but persistent lacey white head. The inevitable coriandre-cum-orangepeel... Perfumed, like a fragrance for a fourteen-year old fan of the Spice girls. Surprisingly bitter for a fleeting moment at first. Then it falls flat. Less spices in the taste, not much citrus , which was the strenght of the original Celis Hoegaarden. Warming up, the coriandre gets through more and more. Light bodied, empty palate; no new aftertaste, just a bit more orange. Whyever this beer became a world classic, I'll never understand. Unless because it's even blander than the usual Pilsener?
Huge white head as poured out of the bottle with a cloudy banana color and a spicey, almost medicinal aroma.  Very clean and dry finish with nice coriander and citrus flavors.  Very quaffable.
Wheaty with a taste of pineapple. Very good witbier, but 1 or 2 does it. Otherwise it gets to boring.
Almost clear in color.  Very wheaty in both the aroma and the flavor.  Almost like a loaf of bread in my glass.  I wouldn't like it all the time, but it was very good.

Frothy white head and an opaque yellow body.  Lemony/spicy aroma.  Somewhat bland lemon flavor, notes of sweetness and spice.  I'm not overly impressed, considering some of the rave reviews on this site.
This is flavored with coriander and orange peel, but I got the impression of a light cinnamon flavor.  Maybe it's just me, but this is a fantastic Belgian brew.  The draft is supreme.

Alas my forced imperial stout day has ended and I am greeted with the sweetest of drinks as it dances on my lips.  So sweet yet crisp.  Yellow with real head-- just like a girl likes.  If the draft is superior take me there!!!
Murky yellow colour, with a big bold head. Citrus and herb aromas don’t sit well with me at all. It’s not a bad beer its just not my cup of tea. Who would have thought to put coriander in beer??
smooth, but not in a light beer kind of way. not as overpowering as blue moon. seems watered down at first, but the more you drink it, the more you realize it isn't

Rating is based on the draught version, which is superior to the bottled. This is a solid textbook example of the style, and easily the best of the ubiquitous Interbrew line of "premium imports". It ain't Celis White, but it's the closest you can currently get in Ontario, so I'll settle for it.

This beer pours a light orange color with a small white head.  The aroma is extremely citrus-filled.  Adding an orange to this beer makes it very good.  The taste is of citrus and some other spices.  Very nice.

Bottle: Mr Kelly loves the fine aromas, but I like that I can swig a whole case on my lunch break. On keg at Epoque: had this waiting for a bus in Cammeray. I dunno, a little less yeasty than the bottled stuff. It's a pretty dumb beer really. Easy to drink but not that exciting and everything.

First off, I have to say that I’m rating a bottle and not a draught Hoegaarden. They’re almost like two different animals. The draught is far superior and I don’t understand why. At any rate, the beer pours nicely and looks beautiful in the glass. The problem is that it doesn’t live up to it’s reputation in my opinion. The flavors that come out in the draught are hardly present. It tastes to me like a pale wheat beer. The draught is far superior for sure. Update 8/05 Just had some fresh bottles and much better than original review. Yeast and wheat flavors are nice and aroma of coriander is detected. A nice brew.
A very refreshing tasting beer. Good to drink in the summer months. Has nice hints of citrus in it.
A good Belgian white, and it went down well with Thanksgiving dinner........
On tap. cloudy yellow/gold. Some citrus, spice, just sweet enough. Not quite as full as some other whites, but very good and refreshing.

March, 2003:  Bottle. Unfiltered. Enjoyable and refreshing. The spice is less noticable in this than other witbiers I’ve tried, and the slight citric edge adds a gentle and juicy tang. I would buy this again.  [3.5]

 April 2003 Keg. Unfiltered. Just had this on tap. O yummy! Fresh and delicately fruity - the orange shines through, perfectly balanced by the gentle warmth of the spice. An absolute joy! [3.9]

 Oct, 2004: Pression. Market bar, Nimes. With lemon slice. Salty froth. The lemon dominates to the extent that it provides most of the interest. The beer itself is simply inoffensive. [2.3]

Oct, 2005: Bottle. One of my local pubs has Celis White on tap. So I had some of that, and then a bottle of this straight after. Hmmm. The Hoegaarden tastes very insipid after the Celis White. It also tastes very clean. It’s pleasant - but lacks character. [2.6]
Cloudy golden color. Pours a decent head, but it doesnt last for long. Nice light aroma, dont taste much orange peel in there though. very drinkable
Oh yum.  You can get this in BUCKETS at Charlie's in Harvard Square, Cambridge MA.  Smooth stuff with a charmingly bright flavor.

Aroma is light and yeasty...Color is signature cloudy, chalky lemon--head is moderate and foamy, with decent lace...Flavor is bright and lightly sharp; coriander rides along neatly, while orange peel makes its statement in the finish, contributing concurrent sweetness and citric bitters...Body is light but not watery--just refreshing...This is a good change of pace selection, especially appropriate on a warm sunny afternoon.
my favourite witbier.very fresh.  drinks really easy and looks very good....
Pale yellow in color and cloudy. A nice frothy head. A sour floral aroma with great spice. Sour flavor...spices. A little bitter and astringent.
I hate Wit beers. Foamy half inch head. Smells like, guess what, rotten wheat. Taste like bug off repelant.
A fine example of a witbier. Coriander, but not much orange. Easy to drink.
Cloudy yellow, small head.  Citrus scent.  Also citrus scent with some spices. Sweeter that all others I have had in this style, heavier than most as well.  Refreshing. Very good.

yeasty and wheaty aroma, cloudy off-yellow appearance, wheaty with tangerine notes, this is quite watery with not very much aftertaste to speak of.  This is a very bland beer which lives of its name rather than its quality.

What a pleasure! Light goldenrod color, little bubbles everywhere. Actually drank it with food and it held up nicely. Great citrus flavor and the yeast is right there as well. For a big brewer, this is very nice. Drinking this is like having a party in your mouth and everyone is invited.

Creamy head with slightly larger bubbles.  Beautiful hazy, golden color.  Quite a bit of carbonation.  A little bit of sediment.  Light, yeasty aroma.  It makes my mouth start to water.  Soft mouthfeel.  A little yeasty and light-bodied.  I think this is something I might keep stocked in my fridge.  Might be tasty with a slice of something citrus.
Nice. I think I prefer Hacker-Pschorr but this is quite good as well. Yellow and cloudy with small particles. First impression was flowery. Somewhat acidic.
Bottle - Long-lasting white head.  Citris aroma. Smooth with a slight lemon coriander taste.  Great Witbier.  It tastes great with most food and is my favorite work day lunch Beer.
A true Belgium wheat beer with a ticklish hint of coriander and curacao. My current treat beer, although you need a pub that has clean pipes or a fresh batch if sampling from the bottle.
I´m not a fan of the Belgian White style so my rating can´t be very high. Too sour compared to the German Wheatbeers.
I found this beer to be rather weak. Light golden color with a stark white head. Light citris aroma. Flavor was very subdued but flowery just the same. Nothing I would look for again.
Draught at Vlissinghe, Brugge. Plenty of flavour still from the trendsetting Whitbeer. The corianer, citrus is a little overwhelming for m taste but nevertheless a decent afternoon sampler
For me, this has always set the standard for the style.  Wonderful in pretty much every respect.  Great macrobrew.
Very pale, crisp white head.  Gleaming yellow in color. Smooth, citrusy, with a nice kick of carbonation.

Nice white head upon pouring. Swirl the last few drops out for that yeast! Then it gives this golden beer its famed "White Beer" apperance. Nice flowery aroma with A natural lemony taste with a good balance of the grains and the aftertaste is nice and bitter almost like an ale. A nice beer if you want to try something diffrent.
a very good wheat beer. Fresh and slightly fruity, excellent with one slice of lemon. [re-rate] Initial Rating Date: 2/26/2003 4.1
On tap: Pretty much the witbeer that the others are measured against.Good stuff.
This wheat beer is one of my favourites .Very good balance of herbs. I like this beer especially with food.
Very citrus flavor, garnish with a lemon for a nice tart bite! Good smooth white beer! Must try it.
Murkey lemon color, good spice, and a bit of citrus acidity, though light on the palate.  Very nice with Crab legs or other shell fish.

Has a light almost white color with moderate carbonation and fruit smell.  Taste is wheat/spice and finishes with a almost sour aftertaste.  Overall, here it comes, I did not like this beer too much as it seemed way too thin and weak for a wheat beer.  Now here comes all the messages just because everyone liked it and I didn't...  You know who you are...
first thoughts: excellent! Great fruity aroma. Cool looking white beer. Tastes fantastic. Wheaty taste, and the spice is a nice touch.
Nice spicy orange aroma.Always fresh and refreshing,even if it is mass produced.I wish Hoegaardens other spin offs like Julius and Grand Cru were more easily available.One of the best Summer beers

So very lively!!  Pale yellow, thin white head, very tiny bubbles, beautiful!  Loaded with spices, cloves and coriander, light and pleasant.  A surprisingly big & full mouthfeel.  Lively palate, Nice toastey notes among the pleasant oranginess.  finishes full of body.

Very yellow pale color, very hazy. Large head. Aroma is fruity and yeasty. Medium bodied wit beer. Fruity flavor, with oranges, coriander and ginger being the primary flavors. It a mildly sweet, lightly malty and slightly bitter beer. Clean, light and refreshing. Nice beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
coriander and orange aroma, light cloudy yellow, yeasty and spicy and oh so good

Admittedly, I am not a huge Belgian White fan. However, to the credit of this beer, I was pleasantly surprised, if not by its flavor, but by its nice palate and aftertaste. This is a very pleasant beer.

Decent, light, spicy: not astonishing but definitely better than the Michigan Brewing Celis stuff. It has citrus and spice, to be sure, but beyond that a faint chemical afterburn and through the whole thing a dramatic inconsistency of texture - skyrocket lemon head but fading to nothing at finish.

[rerate needed] Pour was murky light with medium head, rich taste of coriander and orange peel really show up. Smooth and light on the mouth, avoiding the harshness that other witbiers have. Very enjoyable.
Quite a nice beer.  Cloudy with medium head and slightly sour flavor.  I dunno about the best beer in the world, but I'd drink it again.

Cool bottle nice cloudy beer. Weiss beer is the best and this and Hacker-Pschorre are the best of the genre. I must say I can't make up my mind between the two of which is the worlds best beer. Great w lemon, and it tastes as good as a great meal. Light and smooth.
Pale yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of coriander and a little lemon. Sweet and fruity flavor. Sour finish.

Not too different from the tap version.  Very tasty, although I don't like the look of the new bottle.  They lost the cream colored label and made it more high-tech looking.  Note to Interbrew: that's the wrong aesthetic.
Very harmonious. The orange peel, coriander, and yeast eclipse the malt yet it's still quite good. Light-bodied but not wimpy at all. Smells magnificent.
One word, wow! Quite easy to find on tap now. I prefer the bottled version, simply because of the novelty of it, but a nice pint of this, on a hot English summers day *cough* is heaven!
Rerate: Draught, Eurostar station, London. Cloudy lemon yellow. Spicy, with nutmeg and cloves.  Yeasty, banana like. Very good.
A good aroma, nice murky color. The taste of the corainder is pronounced. Very smooth.

Pale yellow with a hazy appearance. Light bodied with spicy and floral aromas. Light malt flavors with citrus notes as well as a creamy yeasty mouthfeel. Well carbonated, crisp and very refreshing. Outstanding.

Very enjoyable.  Aroma was sweet and yummy.  Flavour had hints of citrus and bread but not overpowering.  I liked the hazy dull yellow colour.  Nice soft white silky head even though poured from bottle.

It might be the fact that i dont drink beer like this, but i thought this "brew" was horrible. It was like i was drinking liquid chap stick! The arome was almost as bad as the taste, the appearance was sickening, but a decent palateIts a sad day when i rather drink Canadian than another beer. Yuck!
Don't drink this beer too cold, I had to wait for it to warm up to get the right palate. Good flavor and aroma. Doesn't need an orange to go with it, it has enough fruity flavor.
Cloudy orange with white head.Lightly spiced citrus nose. Tart spicy citrus flavor israther acidic, but refreshing

I actually had the misfortune of drinking a pitcher of this with a friend one night as it came highly recommended.  It was all I could do to get through the pitcher.  Citrusy and cloudy easy to drink but it just did not get along with my palate.

Maybe this beer came through for me in a pinch, or something, but it kind of knocked my socks off.  I had been traipsing around the hell that is Ikea on Sunday, wandered into an ugly crowded bar and wasn't expecting anything near this good.  So refreshing so perfect.  Quite strong, but isn't that what you need when you just want to forget the furniture with umlots and the screaming children?

Tried another one later in the day and it wasn't quite as good, but then it's refreshment impact would have to be lessened.  Still a crisp, tasty witbier that I will seek out again.
The most popular Belgian white. The taste is refreshing with traces of orange and lemon. Very good beer.
Draught. Pale yellow and hazy with creamy head. Pleasant aroma of curacao and orange. Sweet, light bodied and very refreshing. If only all megabrews were this good.

I was very surprised in how much I like this beer, I am no fan of Belgian witbiers, but this one took me by surprised, and I'm very glad I sucked it up & bought a bottle of this, I was pleasntly surprised, the appearance was oddly similar to grapefruit juice, nice soft white silky head that laced around the glass, the color was a hazed light-golden, hints of a musty nose with a bit of tartness, very well balanced with a medium-drinkable body, the flavors seemed a bit bland, but still a very drinkable beer, definitely the best Beglian Wit I've ever had

Cloudy, cloudy, cloudy, light straw or dark lemonade, with almost no head.  Appearance put me off at first — much lighter and much more cloudy than anything I had seen before.  Taste of clove, hot pepper, wheat, hoppy bitterness, and a great, astringent lemony freshness.  Mouthfeel a little too light.  Great beer to kill a thirst on a hot summer day.
Oranges, spice, malt, bread and flavors I can’t describe. Smooth with zero hops and you will not miss them. Try it!
A nice spicy aroma with spice notes in the palate too, occompanied well with a hint of orange and corriander.

This beeer was served to me with a warning, a great omen..."if you haven't eaten anything yet, you better only have one, and if you have eaten, then don't have more than two"  well, I can't remember much of the aroma, etc...I hadn't eaten and drank about 6...luckily I lived around the corner and stumbled the 100 staggers home, safely, at least un-arrestedly...

A very enticing beer for someone who enjoys a wheat beer, cloudy with a small amount of head and a slight citrus taste.  Goes for around $6 a pint in my area and I find myself being drawn back to it whenever I am in the neighborhood.
On tap.  Cloudy/hazy yellow.  Subtle spice and good aroma...................

Fruity aromas - peaches/apricots/citrus. Yeasty and wheaty, cloves. Cloudy pale straw with a pillowy white lacing head. Low carb, medium watery body. Lemony/citrus at first sip, then the wheat/yeast combo takes over. Watery. Light and refreshing with clean finish and almost no after. Better than in the can. A nice witbier.
On tap: Pours a lightly cloudy golden color with puffy head.  Good citrus and coriander flavor.  The finish is very crisp.  Overall...light, refreshing, and smooth.  High drinkability.
Hmm.. Not your everyday beer but tasty. Cloudy, spicy flavor, good carbonation. Could be good on a hot day I'd think..
Tastes like lotion, and is extraordinarily expensive. Looks nice at least, with a nice, consistent head and beautiful white body.
And to think I used to hate Belgians! Pours with a beautiful white head. It has an amazing fruity aroma. I''ll have to keep some of these in the fridge. Very refreshing!

Sampled from the bottle, Jan. 2, 2003
A very enjoyable beer, this Belgian White features a slight head and a cloudy, yellow appearance.  With the slight lemon flavor and spices, this beer is easy to drink and a nice find this winter - although it would be even better in the summer - not too strong, but with just enough flavor, this White beer does not disappoint.  Drinkable from start to finish with an enjoyable aftertaste of malt and just a hint of orange to go with the lemon.

Pure white head, cloudy natural lemonade color.  Aroma like a mix between and wheat beer and a classic belgian tripel.   Flavor is a little bland and mostly flat, I do not taste the corainder and orange peel that the comercial description says. (try victory golden monkey for that).  It is much smoother and easy drinking that other whitbiers I have had.
I have been told that this is a typical belgian every-day wheat. Very refreshing. Got to try it on tap..
The belgian that is usually on tap around these parts, so can make for an interesting change of pace. The spice and malt flavors blend together very well. However it always seems a bit watery to me.

Fresh citrusy aroma upon opening.  Nice, cloudy appearance with floating sediment - looks like a glass of grapefruit juice. Crisp, refreshing flavor - like the description says - a litle bit sweet and a little bit sour. Citrus flavor is prevalent throughout. Stays stong until the end - with just a tad bit of bitterness.  Good thrist quencher after mowing the lawn -yes it is December -  but it is Florida!
Not very impressive.  I still got some left so I may change my mind but it seemed bland to me.
Sampled draught at Bulldog Pub, Zagreb, Croatia. -I don't like that kind of beers made with coriander and orange peel
very cloudy white colour with nice tight head. Sweet wheat flavour, hint of corriandier. refreshing summer drinking.

The difference between tap and bottle for this beer is not as large as for many other
wheatbeers. Every man, woman and child should try this relaxed and citrusy Belgian White. 
After your first one always through a slice of lemon it. At the moment, this is one of my 
favorite beers. Spicey and gingery. Could be guzzled or suckled. The taste is not 
overwhelming, nor so special that one could not spend an entire night drinking this. 
Nice and cloudy. Smooth from lips to gut. Sweet, rounded and pudgy, yet difficult
to fill up on. I also taste pear in this.

Re-rate: Very cloudy, pale gold colour with a frothy white head. Lots of lemon and coriander aroma. Dry and refreshing palate, but somewhat empty. Flavour is a slight bitterness surrounded by a dull touch of citrus (mostly lemon) and spiciness (coriander, maybe clove).
I like the gingery spiciness, but there really isn't much else going on.....
Nice citrus in this belgium.  Yummy is the best way to describe it..........

An excellent beer. I had it served in a 20 oz glass, which doubled the fun. Has a pale yellow, cloudy appearance. While you can taste the yeast, the flavour is quite complex and very refreshing. Fruity and sweet with no bitterness.
This is an excellent Belgium White. Smells great, is fruity.  A great beer to keep in the fridge for when you are beat.

Rerate: Second bottle and my experience allows me to enjoy it properly.  That and a fresher bottle.  Maybe it was the time of day and the lack of a patio but I much preferred the draft version.  The instructions on the bottle to swirl the last ounce and add the sediment produced the right cloudiness but also some firmer yeast deposits which were a little offputting.  Perhaps the bottle was not as fresh as it should have been.  Still a refreshing summer drink and a great change from standard North American beers.

Oh, how sweet it is to pay a meagre 3 Argentine pesos for such a great change of pace. This beer has body, and a fantasic balance of flavour and sweetness with a refreshing bite. Something I''ve forgotten existed in the past months of swill consumption. I''ve supposedly travelled to the end of the world to find this beer...
I really like this beer,starts out citrus/sweet manderain orange.finish,light and wheatie,very nice.
Not a beer I really like.  A very, dare I say it, female kind of brew. To sweet and citrusy in flavour
A popular and good white beer to drink on a hot summer day..................
Floral in taste and smell. Lightly citrusy, almost peachy/lavenderish(?) interesting flavor does not overshadow delightful grainy wheatiness. I like this stuff and will no doubt drink it again.
I prefer to drink this beer more than any other during the summer. Very refreshing great aroma and taste.
An excellent white beer, slightly cloudy with a lasting fruity flavour. Very fun!
It is a white beer with a bitter tast. It is at the moment one of the best white beers I have tasted.
A very good wheat beer...it''s got an interesting sour taste to it...but it''s good overall and goes down smooth. Great example of a Belgian beer.

Pours a cloudy and very pale yellow color that is about as close to white as a beer can get. It has a large white head that does not linger and a nice spicy, citrusy aroma that is a little weak. Hints of coriander and orange peel are in the flavor, the finish is long, dry and spicy. This is a highly drinkable and very nice Belgian witbier.
It is very interesting. I don''t mind it. Has an odd taste..................
My favorite white beer.  I think the belgians are slightly better at makin white beer than the Germans.  A definite must try.

I am not a big fan of white beers, and this was a different experience for me.  Served with a lemon in most places in France and Belgium, this beer has the distinct flavor of a Belgian White - just a bit too bland for me.

Re-rate: alwasy liked it, and its always solid, but its just not as complex as it used to be when i started beer-huntin'. Nice belgian character, sweetish, with some spicy coriander, and lemony/mandariny citrusy flavour, refreshing none-the-less, and great when the weather is hot etc. Just not the beer it once was when i first had it a couple of years ago. i liked the old bottles better aswell, they were more classically Belgian. None of this wanky curved bottle crap, it smells of wanky marketing dudes at Interbrew.

The aroma is the highlight of this beer.  Flavors are good, the "sweet and sour" as they say, is refreshing and tasty, but the body is so light that the flavors don't have enough time on the palate.  Very refreshing beer, but probably not worth the premium price.

Pale, champagnish appearance.  Interesting to see "coriander and orange peel" described in the commercial description, that''s exactly how the guide at the tasting I just got back from described it.  Dry, wheaty finish, somewhat sweet, could be stronger.

On tap. Very pale yellow with an almost flour-in-suspension look in the body. Very bright white sicky head. Aromas of wheat and lemon with a flavor profile similar to the aroma though I picked up some coriander as well. As the years have passed since I first tried this witbier It seem to me as though this beer has gotten too consistent, almost mechanical and a tad blander.
Try the Grand Cru if you travel Belgium around april (if I well remember)...

Kind of smelled like cologne at first, then I could identify the smells. Now it smells like a bowl of fruit loops. Spicy but not overly so. Golden cloudy yellow with white head. The first white I"ve had, I think I like it. Light-bodied and fruity.
Most refreshing. unlike anythign i have ever had. light and slightly tangy. A definite must try.
