While I suspect my palate is unrefined, I simply couldn''t get much beyond a simple wit here.  Try as I might, I can''t taste more than a tiny hint of spice/orange.  Otherwise good.
Nice refreshing white beer. Not impressive. Quite overestimated, as I see the average. Common supermarketbeer. Only drink in the summer, otherwise it's quite disappointing.
I love this beer.  The best wheat I''ve ever had.  So easy to drink and refreshing.  A great beer for the afternoon.

The first and still the best.  The aroma gives subtle hints of the citrus zest and coriander to come.  It lives up to the name of the style, with a white head over a cloudy pale body.  The flavor is nice, smooth with just a hint of citrus bite.  It feels like any other unfiltered wheat beer in the mouth.  Overall, this is probably one of the best beers around for a nice summer evening.

Bottle: Cloudy pale yellow colour. Has a aroma of citrus and yeast. Flavour is citrus, banana and some notes of coriander. First time I tried this 3-4 years ago, i hated it. This time I find it quite tasty and refreshing. Nice summer beer.
I must have had a bad one because I'm not a fan. Bad aftertaste.............
My first wheatbeer was erdinger and it is still one of my favorites, however Hoegaarden White must be the best wheatbeer around. It fruity taste is just simply great
my first 'alternative' beer 5 years ago - still love it.............

Served cold there is no better beer for staying cool in the summer sun.  Not much to say about the coriander and orange peel that hasn't been said before...a good wit, even though it is mass produced.

Great white beer the Belgian way. The citrus
flavour is very pominent.
A real thirst killer when served quite cold.
Had on tap in europe and was even better than the US bottles.  Excellent Belgian witte.
Not bad for the style, light refreshing with a nice sweetness...............
Frothy head that left quickly.  Sweet coriander and lemon zest on the nose.  Fair amount of spices, yeast and a touch of honey.  Slightly sticky mouthfeel.
Not much to say about this one. A lot of sparkles but not very much taste. Light colour and a great longlasting head.
One of my absolute favorite beers.  I prefer it on draft.  Incredibly complex bouquet.  Even more incredible taste, varying from spice to citrus to malt to subtle vanilla.  Delicious.
This is a great summertime quencher.........................................
My most favorite white beer.  Just enough uglis flavor which compliments the orange/tangerine flavor to become wonderfully significant to the great taste.

Cloudy pale yellow w/ moussy head. Wispy spice and fruit aromas. Light, effervescent mouthfeel. Crisp coriander and citrus flavours combine with a refreshing acidity. Despite its mass-market appeal this beer remains a classic.

Rerate: I first had this before I started seriously rating beers, and I quite liked it.  It has an effervescence and subtle complexity of flavor that makes it a hit--even though in some ways it is a very "normal" beer in the UK, not uncommon in Oxford, at least in the more upscale places.  Citric and spicy, bubbly yet drinkable.  I'd drink this as a "regular" beer if I weren't always trying to drink new beers!
Fantastic Belgian White, a great taste of corainder and citrus..............

Pale yellow, cloudy, thin collar. Strong spicy aroma (coriander) and citrus fruits. Dry taste, spicy (coriander and cloves); light malt and hop. Palate simple, not too bitter, enough spicy. Good example, but Witbiers are not my top ones.

I like this one.  Had it on draft in a local bar here in Melbourne where they pride themselves on the presentation, so that helped.  Lots of flavour and a nice finish. RERATE 26/1/03.  I've toned it down a bit.  That first one I had must have been a goodie - it's still nice, but I've had some less pleasant ones since.  I think the Jamieson Dark Wheat deserves to be my highest ranked wheat beer.

Lemony nose wafts up from a cloudy light yellow-green beer with a pretty head and Brussels lace. Vanilla tones comes through the wit-beer taste. Light body, but great mouth feel and a big taste. Classic. I don&#8217;t do this with a lemon.

Nice at Cafe Belgique in Amsterdam. Citrus-y vanilla aroma. White body with hints of yellow and a rocky head. Refreshing wheat, citrus and vanilla taste. Soft carbonation and fullmouth flavour. Balanced!

Had this one on tap at a local pub... not that bad really; quite spicy and more of a grapefruit rind than orange peel, although you can get hints of that... citrus and spice is the big thing, fairly malty... but sour? I don't think it was that sour... sweet finish... looked good! But still, certainly one of the most overrated beers... not bad though. Refreshing.

Cloudy pale yellowish.  Citrus (a mix of lemon and orange) and coriander make this a delight to smell.  Those are also predominant in taste.  Mouthfeel is perfect for a Belgian witbier, light and crisp.  I did drink this correctly also - Three sips to the bottom!
Perfect everyday beer. Light and smooth and yet so much more sophisticated than any american ale. Has character but is simple. The perfect all around beer
Draft- Very cloudy and light colored. Has a distinct citrusy flavor that is quite refreshing.

A world classic and the beer that revived the style.  It is light, tart and beautifully spiced with bitter orange and coriander.  The bitter orange is a little higher than alot of wits.  The colour is on the darker spectrum of the style guidelines.  Increasingly available on tap in Ontario, this is a good introduction to the wit style and it is served in a beautiful BIG pint glass.
Light yellow color, sonewhat cloudy.  Not much aroma.  Some spices & yeasty flavors.

Cool glass. Almost no aroma, almost no flavour, no palate, no aftertaste. The head is the only thing about this beer which is not bad or missing. I would rather slake my thirst with water than with this. I really don't understand why all you folks rate this pissy stuff so high.
Very refreshing beer. However has no palate at all. Very fruity and cloudy.
Citrus aroma, a little spice.  Nice white color.  Very good.................

Lemony aroma and to be fair it looked like lemonade too.  The flavor was almost 100% citrus.  Just a slight hint of something sour.  It is exactly as advertised and truthfully I could have enjoyed several more but it left me feeling a bit lacking.  To be fair though I had it the same night I sampled the Orval so perhaps it is just being overshadowed.

Pours a very cloudy yellow, huge white head that sticks around and sticks to the glass on the way down.  Aroma is a little malty (bread), some citrus (lemon), and spicy (mainly coriander).  Flavor is a refreshing mix of citrus and spices.  Body is medium, ends acidic and slightly dry.  Perfect beer for the summer.

don't shun it, even though it's made by interbrew.  has the great cloudy witbier appearance, aroma and flavour are standard of the style(coriander, citrus...).  probably the best beer I've had from a major brewing company.
Looks like lemonade.Floral nose. Thin palate. This would be great summer beer.
Cloudy, fizzy white head.  Wheat and lemon custard aroma.  Orange zest, refreshing, a bit soapy (probably from the coriander).
very good beer. sweet and sour flavor with crisp finish.....................

Being a white guy, I thought it appropriate for me to drink a white beer.  A somewhat unique flavor, but I don't know if it's the best kind of unique.  Kind of sour initially, but the aftertaste reminds me of a pacifier that might have been used by Rory Calhoun at sometime or another.

Came into this beer with high expectations, left sobbing loudly and gnashing my teeth.
This beer had absolutely no ghosty qualities whatsoever. The sourness did not improve its taste, and it wasnt a pleasant experience for me. 
I very well couldve had a bad batch, because I rarely deviate from the norm this much.. but, here tis.
a world class wheatbeer!! tried to homebrew this beer many times but it's balance of flavors is just impossible to copy. my all time favorite especially from tap

Has a nice yeasty aroma. It is cloudy from not being filteret. If poured right it has a very nice head - but most often is poured like a pilsener and then it ends up without any head. It has a nice refreshing yeast and fruit flavor. A great beer on a hot summer day for quencing your thirst.

Light crisp fruity taste. Very good belgian white
.........................
I'm not a big witbier fan.  This is pretty good beer, but what else is there to say about it?  I like the Limburgse wit that I am drinking right now just as much, if not more.
The classic Witbier. Coriander and curacao spices added. All other witbiers imitate this one. Must be tried.
An opaque beige color. A good "Wit" with orange peel flavors, needs a touch more spice. Similar to Schniederweiss.
Perfect wheat, very fresh and most enjoyed in the summertimes, when the weather is hot.

Last night I had few of these. I know much more about white beers since my last rating of Hoegaarden I had to re-rate accordingly. This beer is more delicate, less aggressive then many white beers. Still it kept its special character with nice complexity, smooth and so drinkable. In fact is so drinkable that I did not even realized that I had a bit to much last night (Right Doug?).
Sweet n' sour it is; disappointed in depth of spices discernable. Clean tasting beer, but was hoping it would have more flavour. Must try again.

Original rating 26th July 2002. Nose of wheat, citrus fruit and a faint aroma of alcohol. Pours to a large, loose and white head. Flavours of spicy coriander, balanced with citrus, light and slightly watery. The alcohol is well hidden. Pleasant spicy aftertaste. Very Good. Re Rate: It has to have been 2 years since I’ve tried this world classic, and I’m glad I’ve reacquainted myself with this old favourite. More or less as before, I noticed slight malty flavours this time, and a pleasant aftertaste that keeps on the tongue. A very good wit, not the best I’ve tried but up there.

ReRate: This is certainly a nice beer to drink but I think of it more as the definition of an interesting style than anything else. Anyway, citrus is abundant below the wheatiness and the palate is quite crisp. Those of you saying that this is bland should try Malt Shovel Australian White Beer if you want to know what a watered-down wit tastes like. I would like to try Hoegaarden on tap.
Lots of bubble.  Clear gold color.  It is spicy in aroma.  Sweet like honey and some kind of fruit.  I can't really tell what it is.  Great beer.

Best of its style.  I suspect that this beer gets lower marks from other raters than it should because it's so readily available.  If it were only available in some remote Belgian village, we'd all be posting on the forum about how it rates a 4.6 and is 'vinous' with a 'coriander and curacao' note.  But it's readily available, so it merits a 3.7, which is a crime, IMHO.  Having tasted it head-to-head against both Victory's Whirlwind and Boulevard's Zon, I've got a newfound appreciation for this remarkable wit.  The champ!  Isn't there some 60's song that went "I beg your pardon / I never promised you a Hoegaarden" ?
Mmmm good! This is probally the most refreshing beer going(in my opinion), real easy to drink, and a nice fruity flavor. A good BBQ beer!
A good belgian white, but somewhat lacking that alcohol warmth.  Good fruity taste, it just needs more kick.
Nice head and a crisp palate. Good summer beer and widely available. But many better alternatives exist if you can get them.

(BB 30/07/03) Pretty fluffy head with lasting lase. The nose is overflowing with coriander. The palate is not expressive as some American Versions (Victory, Weyerbacher, & Dominion). The beer does seem to have been pasteurized, which is why I feel this beer does not live up to full potential.
A murky colour beer that poured with no head.  Didn't pick up on the spices but noticed the orange peel.
Thanks Pierre for reviving this style. Floral perfume and spice in aroma.  Light fruity tastes.  Dry honey finish. Great summer supernaculum and one of the tops in the upper half wits.

this is a good beer. so expensive, not really worth all the money you pay. one of the strongest examples of a witbier.  very spicy. tons of coriander and lemon. almost makes for a meaty taste. I think it is too strong in lemon and coriander though, and that’s about all you can taste, though it has a nice medium-full body and a grainy, wheat feel to it.  My biggest complaint is that if you try to drink more than 2 of these, the flavor starts getting cloying, as hoegaarden displays plenty of that bubble gum estery sweetness.  One of the better witbiers though overall. 7/4/7/3/15

Rerate  Having had a fair amount of this over the years, mostly at places where this is the only decent thing on the menu, it’s still very drinkable.  That seems in part due to the low abv and light nature of the beer, yet also non-filtration in a wheat beer will mask a lot of problems.  Not implying this is/isn’t brewed poorly just that beers like this have a bigger margin of error than in something like a Pale lager which is going to show every little flaw in brewing.  It’s very light, somewhat watery, though not any more than it should be.  A bit too astringent, however, with too much coriander and orange peel.  The bubble gum flavor is the highlight, as well as the carbonation.  Simple, but passable, yet of course there are many better examples out there.  Still, if this was the house wit bier at a random brewpub, you could do worse.  6/4/6/3/11
Hands down the most bland wheat beer I have had.  Definately NOT the world classic everyone thinks it is.  The massive carbonation looks amazing though.
Good and refreshing, since I've tried it I've found it difficult to find....
A good beer for a hot day. Bitter, coriander, citrus........................

A fenom! The best belgian white in the world.("Period") Amazingly complex from citrus flavors that sparkle on the tongue to the corriander which hits the pallate as a perfect after-thought. Probably the best smelling beer I've ever experienced. re-rate 7/11: Ok, so I exagerated how go this really is. After trying a lot of hefe's I couldn't rate this higher than 3.5.

i realize that this is a "white" beer--still it's not much to look at, unless you admire certain night-time lemon-flavored cold medicines. a small head didn't help much so i dropped a paper parasol in it. at least now it looks festive.  spicy of course, kinda floral (yawn)  lemon peel of course, yeh, now  there's the  coriander, yadda yadda, whatever, (thank god hops replaced coriander in the chronology of beer making),   minimal white bread presence to represent the grain.  okay, whatever, it's great, just not my style.
Great 'patio' beer.  Refreshing scent, citrus/spice.  Light taste with nice light spice finish.  This is a wonderful beer to be tasted in quantity.
I like this beer very much.  It’s light and refreshing (in a good way).  The citrus and spice don’t overwhelm--they seem quite natural. Perfect on a hot summer day.
Not great, not bad. But i will probably re-rate it soon.....................

Bottle.  Cloudy pale yellow.  A nice foamy head that laced out.  Citrusy coriander aroma.  There is a nice carbonated feel, but the flavor was more watery than I expected.  Refreshing but without the substance I wanted.
Very light but extremely flavorsome…Touches of curaçao and coriander, lemon and pepper…Too easy for me though…
It's drinkable, but I won't go after this one again.........................
strong rich aroma, cloudy yellow color with small lace and head. taste is fruit with a most excellent spicy finish. the finish is similiar to that of the chimay products
Bottle... It’s pale, but then again, it’s a wit; Albino beer. Is it good? For the style, I guess. Mostly water and fizz though. ’Nuff said.

re-rate, a few yrs later


This is the definition of a white beer. Nice aroma, beautiful aroma, great flavor
very clear for being a witbier,fresh and fruity in both aroma and taste,spicey aftertaste

my best hoegaarden experince was when touring with the ale street news group to belgium strictly for beer and culture. our flight was late arriving in brussels our beerless leader tony forder phoned ahead to the brewery and tey said being an hour late did not matter but was there anything they could do for us and his reply was have a beer ready. so when we arrived and entered the pub they were immediately pouring us fresh wit beer from the source words could not describe everybodys reaction especially for the first beer of the day.austinpowers inspired me to writ this little bit of a story because this was my first experience with wit while in belgium and why i think it rates a 5.0 especialy under these circumstances

This beer poured a light straw color and was slightly cloudy with some carbonation. It formed a white head which subsided and left very little lace. It had a nice citrus aroma to it. The taste had citrus and some hops, and the carbonation created a slightly tangy finish. A good summer beer.
What an enjoyable beer. Pours out to a very pale, hazy gold in the glass with a cloudlike, puffy, foamy head. Taste is that of wheat, yeast, citrus and very light clove. What a tasty beer!!!
Dull, pale yellow colur. Firm head. Yeasty citrus aroma. Refreshing citrus-flavour. Goes down very easy.

Drunk from a characteristic Hoegaarden White glass. Cloudy pale yellow colour with nice white head. The aroma didn't really impress me, but the very refreshing flavour of citrus and coriander/cloves is classic. The mouthfeel is a bit too watery for me, though. Still, I don't think I'll ever grow tired of this great witbier!

Excellent look with its cloudy golden color and huge head-I wish the taste would have been as positive.  Although its fruity flavor of orange was nice, the sourness was too overpowering to enjoy the flavor.  A decent beer, but overshadowed by the sourness.

An exceptional beer.  The combination of orange & corriander make the Belgian White one of my favorite beer styles, with this being the best.  Just a bit better on tap than in the bottle, but both are exceptional.  I believe this was the model for the Celis White.
I didn't like the smell at first, but it grew on me. Nice and mellow taste, it was okay, but I think i might get bored with it after awhile. Good for a calm down drink.

Surprisingly smooth and palatable fruit flavor (i kept thinking green grape) for an unfiltered beer.  The head was unusually light in weight and color.  Enjoyed it entirely but don't know if I could handle more than one due to its sweetness.
A little TOO mellowed for me. Good quality, but bland.......................

A quality belgian white, ugly apperrance, milky water with a yellow hue, once you past the apperance, try drinking it out of the bottle, this is a good beer. Spicey aroma and flavor very light body, overall refreshing and easy to drink!

Easy going after drinking the draught stuff.




High protein count urine sample looking specimen. (Which is good). Smells like wheat. Odd that really. Piss and come in a bottle. Trouble with mixing your quality Belgium beers is that after a while even the good ones taste normal. This means that we gotta go back and drink it again. Shame.

On tap at chessy-ass mass-marketed brewpub #2, this time in Sarasota. Nice and light and fluffy, the finest touches of spice, good "It's been a long day" type of beer. Mellow. A great introduction to Belgian Wit...but certainly not overly challenging.
A great beer.  Being a fan of Belgium whites i was impressed by this beers bold flavor with a great spicy-orange-hoppy flavor.  A must try.
The Belgian White standard... I'm not a huge fan of the style, but you can't deny that this is a great beer!

Hold the lemon!!! Don't ruin this beer by adding things that cover it's own citric tase as well as great corriander nose(young bottles).Nice refreshing tartness exhibited by the yeast,the witbier all others are judged by.

Good beer, but a little bit of a flat taste. I've allways liked this one, especially when the weather is hot. I guess that this beer should be served very cold, about 5 degrees Celsius, to be enjoyed at its most.
Good taste, especially floating a lemon in it.  Not as harsh as some other wheat beers.
The most standard and available wheat beer, but by no means the best.  Slightly lacking in flavour.  Not bad though.
Nice well balanced flavor.  Not too citrusy like many others but shouldn't be for the price.

The worst thing about this beer was the appearance--lemonade-looking with a filmy head. However, this beer is certainly a quality brew--having a spiced aroma, light body, nicely spiced and refreshing flavor. A good witbier for any occassion.

OK, may not the right sort of beer to rate after a Rochefort but I did clear my palate with a large serve of Belgian fries (and Salad of course). The bottle said "aromaticised with herbs" but I got nothing except a faint yeast. Cloudy passion fruit drink colour, small to tiny head that faded to nothing. The flavour was a bit of sweetness and a faint citrus tang but only to the front and middle of the tongue. Body thin and a bland watery finish - I can't see why this one rates as high as it does. While in Belgium its back to the Rocheforts.
Nice Belgian Wheat.  Flavors a little too sharp for me.  I prefer the Sam Adams Weiss Bier.  Sue me, i'm an American...

01-02 rating:  8/5/8/4/16 4.1
5/05:  bottle.  A snowy, fluffy moderate head tops the 
glowing light cloudy yellow-gold body...dried orange and lemon, coriander and white pepper keep the nostrils tingling...the body is clean a bright, lemony and refreshing, but with little to maintain the hard-core taster’s interest...a solid middle-of-the-road Wit, certainly nothing to sneeze at for the Belgian-deprived but also nothing to get carried away with...
A bit of a dissapointment. I remembered Hoegaarden differently. Have not had one for a while. Flat, very flat. Might be the occassion. It will get plenty of opportunity for a re-rating.
Great beer for the summers. Very bitter, i tasted something of lemon and honey.
Very nice, one of my favourite beers, nice with a slice of lemon, but why is it so damn expensive???
Very refreshing witbier, citrus and yeast aroma, pleasant flavour, subtle aftertaste.

It has got in its aroma and flavour hints of orange and grapefruit.  The beer is almost clear with a slight haze, and a good sized head. For my first wheat beer it was OK but I was expecting something more special than what I got.
A small creamy head and a cloudy gold colour. Soft carbonation and a nice creamy mouthfeel, hints of orange, yeasty and refreshing. I'd go one again.
Nice fresh witbier. Does make a difference whether you have a draugth or bottle. It's quite sweet.
A great wheat flavor however would help if it had more bite. Appearance is great. Nice with a lemon.

Very light cloudy color with a white head, a bitter aroma, another orange-peel beer, like Orval, but I prefer this one, as it’s not as bitter or sour, this is a medium-bodied, light, pale malt, well carbonated, warm, crisp, and uplifting, very refreshing on a hot summer’s day, a little less potent in the bottle, at the Fireside Restaurant in Chicago it’s served with a slice of lemon in the hexagonal glass, in my view, I much prefer the Three Floyds Alpha King Pale Ale, which by the way, happens to be served there as well.

Strong aroma of honey, yeast, banana an d sweet oranges. Sweet, fruity and spicey taste. Slightly bitter and yeasty finish. Still a good beer, but not as good as 15-20 years ago, when teh brewery was still small and was owned by Celis. In those days the beer was only available irregularly in the Locus Publicus pub in Delft. At its peak, the beer was magic. When Interbrew took over, the beer got a more constant quality. But on the whole the quality diminished slightly, i'm afraid.

Maybe I got a bad batch. I was overwhelmed by the coriander and orange of a bottle of Blue Moon, but this was really bland. Picked up as I drank more and the beer warmed up and my palate got used to the subtleness. Still missed the spicy notes.
ab fab in a frozen glass on a hot sunny day, it's easy drinkable, a little to sweet maybe for lager drinkers
My favorite Wit. Its spicy citrus aroma makes it just perfect on a hot day.
An extremely tasty and solid witbeer.  I really enjoy the spiciness created by the yeast, and think that the spicing is done the perfect amount.

A bottle of this after work was my introduction to Belgian White.  This brew pours a hazy
pale gold with a healthy helping of tiny body particles.  The average sized white fizzy head
doesn’t stay around long before it becomes a thin strip of bubbles floating on top of the
brew.  Lacing is virtually non-existent.  The heavy earthy nose is mostly of malt and
suggests cereal and caramel, with hints of flowers, perfume, citrus, and date.  The flavor
though not overwhelming is balanced with moderate levels of sweetness and acidity with a
hint of bitterness.  The finish is quick, and the body is light to medium with a creamy soft
texture and an astringent feel to the finish.  Not very exciting, but good nonetheless.
Had it on draft (with a free glass to boot!). Was served very cold, but could still taste the spicy citrus notes.  no head.  was really nice in the summer heat.
Mild wheat smell, opaque yellow. Tastes nicely bitter, soft spicey flavour. Very good.
has the spiciness of other whites, but more subtle.  Only a very slight skunk aroma.  some citrus flavor.  not a bad beer.  Definitely improves as it warms..
Pleasant Wit.  Sweet but not cloying.  Much better as it warms up...........

Jello lime green under red bar lights . . . definately a deterant.  What a wonderful beer though.  Nice and spicey but not overwhelmingly so.  Good amount of carbonation to balance the wheat.  Highly recomended as an introduction to wheat beers.  Don't take too long drinking it though, tasted slight like a wet dog when warm.

this has been my favorite beer in this style.  I am very appreciative of the lack of banana and the balance of spices.  Very nice beer balances the spices along with the sweetness.  Now this beer appeared green to me, but i was in a room with dark lighting...
Pretty decent white, with a nice spiciness..................................

Cloudy dark yellow, lacey white head that dissapated quickly, sort of a German pils. wheaty aroma. Very smooth brew, with great flavor. My first white beer, and I am impressed. I enjoyed the whole bottle, and I would definitely get it again!
Ugly beer but taste ??? Not to bad at all .Once you get past the appearence . Real smooth I could drink more than one in a row .

It was my first white beer and I could get used to this.  I enjoyed the entire bottle and was very easy to drink.  The real downfall is the colour... kind of looks like someone puked up lemonade.  But the taste was good, a bit sweet and citrusy.
A great white beer. A standard setter in Europe and reason enough never to drink the American imitations...
Smooth finish. I think it is one of the best white beers Belgium produces...
This is truly one of my favorite beers, though I must say I like it best ice cold.  I don't drink it in the winter, though.
Very refreshing Witbier, nice hint of corainder, very nice..................
mmmmmmm.... Smooth tasting beer with a hint of orange.  A perfect after dinner drink.

Hazy pale yellow with firm white head.
Spicy aroma with notes of citrus, perfume and wheat.
Spicy flavor with mineral notes. Wheat, mineral and almond notes. Some bitterness in the end.
Although it looks kinda scary it tastes great. It has a good bready yeast smell to it as well.
Strong clove/coriander. Spicey, but definitely in a good way.  One of my favorites.  Very refreshing. Cloudy appearance.  I know this is a summer beer, but its 25 outside and I"m loving this beer.
When i was living in northern Italy, my buddies and me woud go to our fav pub(Big Ben's in Vecenza) and have litres of this fine brew!
Always a great beer to cheer you up, floral,citrusy,herbacious and smooth, if you can get on tap and served correctly it is one of the best.

Beautiful white lasting head. Cloudy yellow color. Medium bodied. Aroma with flowers and citrus notes. Flavor is sweet, citrusy and a bit acidic ending slightly bitter. One of best beers I've ever had.

Not my favorite style, but the aroma is very good.  Citrusy, sourdoughy, with some floral and lavendar notes.  A tart and yeasty flavor and very light body with low bitterness leave me wanting somthing more, and somthing more might just be another bottle of it.

Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy light yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of coriander, ginger, and orange zest. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Surprisingly, this hasn't been ruined by Interbrew as of yet...retains all the characters essential to classic witbier, and isn't dirty tasting.  Lacks distinction and uniqueness, and I wouldn't buy this regularly based on principle, but it's a decent witbier.

Good Witbier! A cloudy yellow. A little yeasty and citrus-like. A touch of lemon meringue pie. Unibroue's "Blanche De Chambly" is very similar. I like it a little more than Hoegaarden. It has more character. Check it out.

Snow-white foam over hazy blond brew with a steady lazy stream  of bubbles.  That's the correct type for witbier.
Refreshing slightly lemony with some yeasty aromas.
Refreshing nice mouth-foam, slightly yeasty, medium-bodied and quite satisfying.  The standard for the witbeer I know, good but not outstanding, best in summer, drunk cold... Pretty low in alcohol, too, an advantage for "quaffing"
Very nice and thirst quenchingbut I'm yet to find the full corriander & orange complexities others speak of. Will give it a few more tries. Maybe I just prefer German Hefes.

A beer that oozes with class and quality. It has something for everyone from the Bud Lite drinker to the barley wine afficionados. Easy drinking with a mildly citric touch enhanced by coriander and orange peel. A slight hop in the finish does enough to balance things out without imparting much bitterness. I work in a restaurant of 150 draft beers and for anyone who wants to try something different, this one never fails.
Oooooh . . . what a witbier.  Great stuff.  Lovely, thick, fizzy head.  Wonderful citrus and spice flavor.  Smells wondrous.  A classic.

My first white beer(that I know of) that I have ever tasted. The cloudiness almost turned me off, but surprisingly, it was a decent beer! Nice fluffy white head and nice lacing. Pretty fizzy too.. There were alot of different scents emanating from the beer, citrus, banana, dough.  Good show.
I love belian whites, but not as much as the strong ales.  Great fruity taste, could have been a bit stronger though, give me more alcohol!  Nonetheless, a beer everyone should try and will like.

A good one, light comparing to a lot of others.
Special taste, anyway give it a try
One of the best belgian white beers. Best to drink on a hot day, with the bbq

HUGE head...looks like a big cumulus cloud sitting on top of the glass. has a slight aroma of bananas. dont detect the citrus aroma that is oft mentioned, but quite spicy instead. color and cloudiness are beautiful. cant wait to try this on tap.
More discernible flavors than I can write about. It's a carnival in your mouth. Don't give this stuff to an average beer drinker without warning, you will scare them.
Lemon and coriander aroma and taste, nice big fluffy head. Cloudier than a summer in England and much more enjoyable.
Very solid. Light gold, looks like its got a shot of lemon juice.  Tall crystal white head.  Cool label.  Lightly lemony, dry and not as tart as other Belgians that I've had.

Nice heady weiss bier aroma. Cloudy with minor head and lovely Brussels lace.  Weiss bier flavor with appealing delicate finish.  The spices are very perfectly subtle.  A pleasant and refreshing drink.  I bet this would be great with roast chicken and rice pilaf.

I had had every beer (I think) on draft at a place except this beer. I've wanted to try this because it is rated high here. But I've always avoided it because it is a wheat beer, and i don't like wheat beers. I just don't get them. I drank half of it without lemon, half with. Maybe it is a summer beer. Maybe I'm missing something. I think i shall avoid all wheat beers in the future.
the market leader and still one of the best of style........................
Not the best Belgian white around, but it seems to be one of the most readily available.  What's this I hear, Celis White no longer available!  For shame.  What a loss!
Pierre's first white.  Almost as good as the now defunct Celis White........
What a beer. i love belgian whites and i can see why Hoegaarden is leading the pack.  Nice light cloudy color with great orange tase. Got to get me more of this!
A nice surprise here also.  Unique taste, smooth, goes down easy.  Excellent.
A very different Weisse - compared to the Bavarian ones. Clean and fresh, very good after a long bikeride on a warm day!
I like this beer, though not one of my favorites.  Had it on tap with a slice of orange, a la Dos Equis with lime.  it is light and fruity, a good Witbier.

After reading so many comments, I was excited to see this on tap on a recent trip to Atlanta.  Honestly it did not appeal to me -- I had this right before trying Paulaner Hefe on tap -- I wish I stuck with two Paulaners than having this -- but it never hurts to try.
Cheers!
An excellent brew.  I totally enjoyed drinking this and relaxing............
This Belgian White tastes a little bit like a wine cooler to me. You can definitely smell and taste the wonderful orange flavor this beer has to offer, but I'd rather stick to my German Wheats.
cloudy pale orange colour, big head, slightly spicy, cron aroma, smooth, touch of acidity, easy and not very complex

I think you have to have a taste for bottle-conditioned beer.  This has to be fresh, otherwise you get clumps of yeast at the bottom of the bottle and it starts to taste like fermented grape juice.  (No, not wine.)
Citrusy, buttery aroma.  Smooth, mildly yesast sour, parsley, banana flavor.  Very refreshing.
One of the best beers i have ever tasted....................................

OLD RATING: Top beer, delivering the concept of wheat beer to the masses.  Great taste and easier to drink than most wheat beers.

RE-RATE: Pale cloudy appearance with a decent head.  Weak orange and malt nose.  A reasonable white beer but no where near the standard of the finest examples of this type of beer.  Has become quite a trendy beer relying on word of mouth to sell.  What is this I hear, interbrew os about to start a TV advertisments for it, surely not!?
This is the white I always come back to.  Perfect balance.  Celis White was my favorite, but unfortunately their history.  Great beer

Bottled. Aroma is citrus, coriander, sweet wheat malts. Cloudy, white/yellow color, white firm head, good lace. Light sweet, light bitter, coriander, citrus, medium body. Hoegaarden used to set the standard for Belgian white and now it’s just a standard Belgian white.
This is a great white wheat brew that everyone should try. I personally love it.
I'm gonna tell ya, the unfiltered part is weird, but it was damn good. My girlfriend gave it too boobies up..
easier to drink in great quantites than most other wheat beers..............
Unbelievable combination of flavors in this beer make it one of my all time favorites. Try it, you WILL like it!
Gee, i've never tasted anything like this before, it really shocked me the first time a tried it.  unique
Maybe not the best white in the world, but a solid, dependable bottled example.  Coriander and spices are nicely balanced and smooooooth.
Overall, I prefer their Grand Cru.  This is an excellent beer as well though.  I highly recommend it.
The classic Belgian white for me. Cloudy yellow coloured, nice head. Aroma and flavour of citrus, quite spicy. Good, but not the best white.
Take your favorite cheap yellowish beer, dump in a package of Kool-Aid powder and let it sit out in the sun for a day.  Stir, chill, and drink.  Even worse on tap.
What a great classic brew.  Just the looks alone make me want this beer.....

Pierre Celis is a genius, and Interbrew/Artois does a great job in producing his recipe. 
Great, zesty lemony, with banana and orange notes... very refreshing!
Pretty good, not as great as i remembered. Nice and cloudy, very refreshing citrus and spicy tastes.

One of my most lovely beer and one of the best wheat one! Tastes like honey! The herbal palate makes this whhite beer even more beautiful! Fantastic from the barrel, but not so good when it is in bottle.
The benchmark of wits. An incredible oily texture that is quenching. .......
The staid commercial version of the recipe Celis gave back to a Belgian commercial brewery. This definitely cuts corners on the Celis White recipe.

Not a huge fan of the lighter styles, but as Wit beers go this is top shelf. Very yellowish-white and hazy. Spicy nose with lots of coriander. Refreshing carbonation with a citrus spice flavor. Goes down way too easy for $9.99/six pack!!
I am not a huge fan of this style, but this beer was excellent as wheat beers go. Very smooth finish with an enjoyable citrus/wheat flavor.
Intense herbal nose. A little less than balanced but drinkable. Strong corriander infusion. Does not stand up to the top shelf Wit.

This reaffirms my love of wits. Nice cloudy body, light head. Crisp and refreshing, with slight citrus (orange and lemon) taste, spicy undertones that make you want more. Very refreshing, in short, excellent.
Such a refreshing beer during the summer heat. .............................

A very nice belgian wit.  nice mix of light spices(mainly coriander and ) and citrus  flavors.
one of my favorite thirst-quenching beers.
main complaint is the price(can be expensive in some parts ofthe US)
Have to be in the right mood to drink this wit. I always need a lemon to cut the sweetness. Very full pleasing flavor.
Chuti to skoro ako bazova malinovka.........................................
a perfect wit beer...love that orange and spice! original and perfect for a hot smogy day on the patio...best served in 500ml glass, very cold or not at all...sublime!

On draft, at least, it's sort of immediately obvious why this is considered a benchmark of its style. Mellower than Allagash White, without that spicy bite, but this makes it palatable to a broader range of drinkers. A delightful-looking and tasting brew. Make sure you get it in the special glass with the lemon slice.

A nice citrus flavor, crisp and clean, though a bit more spicing than I'd have liked. It struck me as heavily carbonated, but not to the extent that it detracted from the overall impression of the beer.

Try to order one in Milano, Italy... It comes in a huge flowerpot-like glass, 0,4 liter, and has a hilaric coaster with a picture of a native Indian pronouncing it "U-gar-den. "Si scrive Hoegaarden, ma si pronuncia U-gar-den" :-D LOL

This was my first experience with Witbier, and it left quite an impression.  It has a strong ginger, citric aftertaste; this beer looked more like lemonade than a customary beer.  However, it's flavor was quite enticing and its lack of bitterness left me wanting more.
A pimp amoung boys when drinking whites.....................................
Too be honest, I'm not a wit fan at all.  Too sissy for my tastes. This one is so light and fruity, I was surprised the guys at the bar didn't start hitting on me.
just the best white beer in the world!!!!!!.................................
Very good at first but just had a weird sour flavor that wasn't natural, or at least I didn't like it compared to others in the style.

The only Witbeir I've ever tried, so I can't compare it to anything. I find it refreshing and very complex - more complex than it's Hefe cousins from Germany. I'm assuming that is a product of the coriander and curacoa used as spices.

(Draft version rated) Beautiful aroma. How do they do it? It's like swallowing a yeast colony with every gulp (damn tasty yeast I might add). Fungus-Rights Advocates would be pissed. This is a fine brew; fresh, clean and tasty.

Very pale hazy yellow color with a foamy white head.  Nose is very perfumey with notes of orange/citrus with some spice and a hint of yeast.  Fruity and tasty, more citrus notes.  Finishes with a thick sweet maltiness.  Although it is good, there are better Wit"s out there.  This is for the bottled version even though I"ve had both.  I think it"s gay to have two ratings for the same beer.
This is definitely my fall back beer when I want something light to finish off the evening, but,  unfortunately it rates 2nd to Allagash White.  Allagash is just an amazingly beautiful beer.
I love Belgian beers and this is one of the best! Appealing fruity aroma combined with its cloudy, yellow appearance makes it very appetizing, especially in its special glass. Excellent!

The original white beer apparently; what a great style.  Quintessential wit, pale, spicy, lightly sweet, yeasty, cloudy, citric, refreshing and effervescent.  Perhaps not as unique as it once was due to the glut of witbiers on the market over the past deade or so, but better than most to be sure.
